Reviews.Title: “Pretty average services, not very modern”
Reviews.Author: Gabbys79
Reviews.Content: So I am in Orlando on business attending a convention. Accomodation was booked by our head office - obviously the best deal was in the forefront of their mind. Hilton Grand Vactions was booked for about 12 of us. They were nice enough to put us all in the same building. The grounds are huge and there are about 10 or so blocks that are five floors each. We stayed in the Paget. You can no get much further to the lobby than this block! Because of this they have golf buggies that will drive you and pick you up to bring you to main lobby. That is ok but I never used it because I just prefer to leave my room when im ready rather than wait for someone to come every time i needed to go lobby. The rooms are serviced apartments. They have complete kitchen facilities. There is a laundry in every block and our block had a pool (i did not use it though) rather than have to go to the main pool. Quite beautiful property, but not at all for business travellers. There is no desk, all my work was done with computer on my lap. There is a dining table, but no connection points anywhere near it. I dont think there is room service as it does not mention it anywhere, and the fridge in room is empty so no mini bar. The property is full of families and that is exactly what it would be brilliant for. There is a list of daily activities, nightly movies and a gorgeous pool. Gym facitilies are great, and there is a small quarter mile walking track around the lake. It is a 5 minute walk to a 7-11 and a CVS. The Coral Reef bar restaurant is pretty poor food. Breakfast was always so so and coffee is just regular coffee. The cappucinos are upstairs in the deli, but that is not table service. Anyhow i suppose i should end it with it is a geat vacation hotel, not a great business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Management really cares.”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience at this hotel when I rated it the first time. The manager (Nour) made an effort to contact me to make things right. He told me that if I gave the hotel a second chance, he would see to it that I would be satisfied. I did just that and arrived to find a completely different room than the one I stayed in the first time. Nour had also upgrade our room as a way to thank us for trying it again. This hotel has both renovated and non-renovated rooms. I highly recommend requesting a renovated room. I've had several stays here since my bad experience and all of them have been great. The staff is extremely attentive. I had a problem on my last stay and has to switch rooms at midnight. Someone was at my room within 5 minutes of me calling the front desk with new room keys to an upgrade room and they helped me move my things to the new room. I highly recommend staying here and if you have a problem report it because they will make it right.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, beautiful - prime location”
Reviews.Author: mj_chan
Reviews.Content: Rented a single room, my thoughts: General: This property primarily consists of multi room condo's. I stayed in a single room while visiting my daughter at college. Good: Very beautiful property and rooms. I don't know the age of the property but it is well maintained and feels 'new'. Room was clean, well appointed. Main pool was above average, with nice tropical custom theming including a waterfall and a full service bar. Great location to Seaworld (across the street) Universal and Disney. Grocery, convenience and other stores within a few blocks, some in walking distance. Short drive to International drive fun and restaurants. Gated/limited access property. Front desk staff are professional, cautious, helpful. But I had no issues to work through with them! Did I say how close this property is to all the parks? It really is well located. Average: Parking is free and reasonably accessible to rooms, depending on how crowded it is. There is a small secondary pool on the opposite end of the property from the main pool. The walk from that end to the main pool takes a few minutes but is not too onerous. Property stresses 'kid' activities but they are fairly weak considering one is in Orlando. Still, may provide some distraction or needed private time. These are outside entrance condominium towers so you may end up many floors up. Bad: Room was unusually small, I have stayed in many hotel rooms in the area that were larger. That said, it had a full kitchen and was nicely decorated. The multi room condo's on the property appeared to be much larger so keep this in mind. Internet access was poor to bad. I could get a connection as long as I was on or near the patio. I was in a first floor room at far end of property so this may have been a factor. There were two access points I could see, one was slightly better than the other.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations”
Reviews.Author: ccamtravel
Reviews.Content: Great property, brand new - lovely kitchen, granite, stainless stell, huge bathroom with seperate shower clawed tub. Lots of room, huge balcony w/ view of Disney fireworks nitely. Walk path around man made pond - view will be better when construction is complete. Nice pool area with restaurant and bar (good prices). Kids club available - with computers. Close enough to everything but far enough not to be bothered with crowds on International Drive. A short drive to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely come back”
Reviews.Author: HailStonz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days with my wife and 3 1/2 year old on the first leg of a trip. The hotel grounds are striking and CLEAN. I mean SPOTLESS.Check in was quick and easy...only complaint was the lack of an offer of luggage assistance as we were traveling quite heavy (was in the area to play baseball and had equipment to lug on top of the usual travel with child gear). Once in the room....very happy. The screened in porch didn't have a fantastic view, but it was a nice relaxing space in which to read and eat after a day of travel from Vermont. Rooms were spacious and well kept. The proximity to Sea World was great, and as pretty much is the case everywhere in the Disney area, travel to Magic and Animal Kingdoms was quick and easy. We weren't bothered with sales calls that other reviewers have mentioned. It would have been annoying, but I simply would have stopped answering the phone as anyone who needs to get a hold of us has my and my wife's cell. The stay was a pleasure and we would definitely choose this property when visiting the Sea World area.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the signature hotels in the Hilton Grand Vacations portfolio. Rooms are amazing and so well appointed. This is an ideal resort for those traveling with family or preferring a little room while traveling on business

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Falcons023
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at this place. This resort is very close to Seaworld & Universal studio. The resort is very nice and spread out. The staff is very good and helpful. Got upgraded to a suite with a jacuzzi. Check-in & Check-out was a breeze and room was very good. Room service was good as well. They run a free shuttle to seaworld & Universal. Would definitely stay there again if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Save some change!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpo527
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location if you are visiting the SeaWorld parks. We paid $119 a night for a king studio and it was perfect. Clean, quite, well appointed, and the staff was super friendly. If you stay at one of the SeaWorld Hotels like this you get to skip the lines and get 10% off your tickets. We called the front desk and they printed out our etickets for the parks!! How nice is that?? I have a lot of hair and my husbands idea of hanging up the towel after a shower is throwing it on the floor. I asked the front desk when we checked in to send up some towels, by the time I got out of the shower my husband was handing me a warm towel from laundry delivery. They brought us a stack of 5 towels. Every night when we came back to the hotel our room was spick and span. There is a small grocery store in the lobby for snacks, goodies to warm up, and bar. Its also great for kids, we dont have any but they looked like they were having a ball with their family in the pool. There were enough cabanas for everyone, poolside karaoke, tasty treats and plenty of interactive activities provided by the staff. The buildings were pretty spread out and wooded but security at the gate, security on golf carts and on foot. I travel alone quite often so security is a big deal it they were on top of it here. I plan on making trips back to Orlando for work and I will def be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: The Hilton grand was lovely...the grounds are very very clean! I did not see one thing out of order from the lounge chairs to the Towels they offer to the play ground the bar the general store on site! It was truly amazing. The kids play ground is fully covered so the kids can play all day and don't need to be full of sun screen.The Lounge's were always available I did not go to the pool once and have to look for a lounge there was something always available.They have small private sections that you can sit in with flowering trees seperating each area. The onsite food and bar were also very good...such a large amount of food and the price is very reasonable as well. The room were extreemely clean and I was very satisifed with the small kitchen/toaster /fridge/ coffee maker...it was perfect. The bathroom were very big with a vanity with 3 large drawers. Maid service was great...very respectful of your privacy...in room safes...pull out couch...lots of entertainment for kids...not overpowering with the loud speakers ...music all day at the pool but at a very nice volume level not to loud and not to low....just perfect. Kids stay busy all day if they want ... the entertainmet is not forced on you at all...you never feel pressured to join in. 3 pools and a small kids pool with a spray ...such a good kid friendly resort. The only one negative thing I have to offer is BE VERY AWARE OF THE ONSITE CAB'S they park on site and have no meters in there SUV's! you can call any meter cab to go to any destination...I made the mistake of asking them for a cab and had one of the onsite cab's aka Drivers with no meters in there S.U.V.'s take me to Walmart and come back for me and charge me $40.00! A regular cab with a meter in it would have cost me $14.00 both ways. I was very disapointed that the Hilton would offer this service to there guests...and not offer to call you a meter cab.They must get some sort of kick back :( I also noticed that they are not really very helpful onsite to help you take the LYNX bus or provide any details about it.This service is very convenient and the buses run so frequent. They do offer the I Ride /Trolly service that you can buy a pass for but these buses are not always convenient when going everywhere. Cab fair to the Florida mall is about $18.00 in a meter cab and about 2.00 0n the LYNX bus! oh and the onsite cab to the mall is $30.00 each way

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louis O
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel for our Universal Studios "Wizarding World of Harry Potter" family vacation in December 2011. my wife and i enjoy our own space so we prefer 2 bedroom suites. our boys are ages 11, 9, and 7 so those of you with children that age can relate! we were not lucky enough to have been placed in one of the newly remodeled buildings otherwise i am sure this review would have been more positive. our room reminded me of a holiday inn express type room. nothing fancy about; outdated decor, that "old hotel" type smell, not very clean feeling, etc. again they were in the middle of a remodel and i have read from other reviews that those rooms are very nice and updated. we just got it at the wrong time i believe. it is located directly across from sea world and it only took us about 10-15 minutes to get to universal studios. you can hear the fireworks each night from sea world and certain rooms have a direct view of them (ours did not). there is an enclosed outdoor patio (which we did not use) and we had a nice view of the back of a building. it was nice thought to have space to our selves away from the kids after spending full days at universal studios. and it was also nice to be able to sleep in a little bit longer as our boys tend to wake up at 6am no matter how late they stayed up the previous night. service was nice. the front desk was nice and housekeeping was efficient. restaurant was good and they have a little place that sells snacks and sundries. we did accept their offer and listen to a time share sales pitch at their other property. wish we had stayed there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on watching Mad Men!”
Reviews.Author: LTFrench
Reviews.Content: No AMC channel! Can you believe that??!!! Never occurred to us to ask before we reserved, but you can bet your bottom dollar we will on any other Sunday night away! Internet was sketchy, too. 5 bars to no bars erratic. Hard to get any work done, but that's not totally uncommon with Brighthouse...... But still... We got there around 10am on a Sunday and they offered us a room out in building 9, way out or we could wait for a remodeled room, up front. We opted to get a room then and walk it. Not sure what they would remodel about this room, it was fabulous. Wish we could have stayed longer. There was a smaller pool for this building and the kids were having a blast. Loved the screened patio/balcony. The room was huge and the Whirlpool was excellent touch after a day at the park. Oh and as for being way out in #9, we never walked there was always someone with a gold car, out front to take us where we needed to go. Great marketplace. The restaurant is actually a poolside bar/restaurant mostly sandwiches, salads, kids meals, not the menu we saw online. It was good, but not a *restaurant* persay.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Before!”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie S
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my family stayed at this HGVC resort. I have to say, the room was nicer and the amenities more abundant than last visit 2 years ago. The room, grounds, and pool areas were very clean and the staff friendly. I have nothing negative to say about the resort. I would like to point out some bad food experiences. Every other night a flyer for Magical Pizza Express would be slipped under our door. One night we decided just to order pizza as we closed one of the water theme parks and didn't want to stop at a restaurant in our bathing suits. To insure a hot pizza, I was going to pick up the pizza. When we called Magical Pizza Express they would not allow us to order pick-up without putting it on a credit card (we wanted to pay cash). The only way they allow you to pay cash is with delivery! There prices were very high but we figured it was convenient. We had it delivered. It took 10 minutes shy of 2 hours and the pizza was cold. By the time it arrived my kids were sound asleep as well as my wife. To top it off, it was literally the WORST pizza we ever had. No flavor at all! DO NOT order pizza from Magical Pizza Express! Another poor choice of restaurant (swayed by coupon ad) is the Asian Harbor Buffet. Absolutely awful. Two of us actually got sick from their food! If your looking for excellent Sushi / Japanese food don't miss Oishi's. We visit there on every trip to Orlando. Thumbs up for the HGVC Seaworld (perfect for Families with small kids) but beware of some of the eateries in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Tuscany Instead”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: In 2011 we stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations on International Drive (Tuscany) and loved it. The location was perfect and there were restaurants and a Publix across the street. The people were friendly and got us into our room well before check in time. This year we decided to stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations at SeaWorld and were extremely disappointed. We were left to sit by a pool for five and a half hours before we could check in. After my elderly parents went to the front desk and said they were going to leave if they didn't find a room they were able to find not just one room but three for us to choose from. I would never recommend this hotel simply because they didn't care....it's spring break in Orlando and you don't matter. Last year during spring break the front desk people were generous and exceptional. The only difference is the people who work at this resort. The one upside was housekeeping. At the SeaWorld location we received "tidy clean" service every day. There are way too many places to choose from to accept below average service, and Hilton Grand Vacations at SeaWorld is well below average.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Kara C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great time staying at this Hotel. It was his first trip to Florida and the accomodations really made a great impression. Comfortable, clean king size bed. A suprising soaking tub. Full size kitchen, sink, and dishwasher. Along with plates, coffee cups, silverware (everything). Next trip to Orlando, we will for sure stay here every time. Great location. Wonderful service. Only down fall is the "shuttle" service on site could be a little better. We had to walk quite a bit from our room to get to the main building for breakfast/pool etc. On site store is very nice. Great coffee and they have beer for purchase, eggs, ham, OJ, anything you want for breakfast. Very nice and great food!

Reviews.Title: “Almost felt like home! Can't wait to go again!”
Reviews.Author: clints121
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we arrived (both times), we were treated like friends and not guests at a hotel. The folks were so friendly and the resort was beautiful. Our first trip was with our 11 and 12 year old children and the pool with waterfall and outdoor ping-pong tables kept them busy while my wife and I enjoyed some down time by the large pool with a Starbucks latte (on-site). Our second trip was just my wife and I for a concert and once again, we felt truly at home. They are always quick to help with anything from a restaurant request to a lead on some great bargain shopping. The rooms are large, clean, and VERY nice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: AmAstley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights late March, we had a (RENOVATED) room on the 3rd floor, in building Warwick a one bedroom king bed suite. The hotel is pretty, we wanted somewhere near SeaWorld, with a gym, pool, own kitchen, parking and quiet and that is what we got. It really was a nice hotel and the room was very large and spotlessly clean. We had a small pool outside our building which was quieter than the main pool and nice being so close to the room. We walked to the main reception when we needed it and walked to SeaWorld, neither walk seemed very long. We didn’t expect the rooms to have housekeeping and it was nice to be offered it, we only took it up once as we really didn’t need it in our 4 night stay. Parking was very easy, but it could be a problem in busy periods (finding a space close to the building), but in March it was fine for us, when it wasn’t we just parked in the next block and walked a few paces to the block. We didn’t eat at the hotel due to having our own kitchen and we have difficult food intolerances our own well equipped kitchen was perfect. Most of the kitchen equipment seemed new, with a washing machine and dryer. We had two large flat screen TVs in the room, one in the bedroom and one in the living area, a large walk in shower, two bathroom sinks, and a whirlpool bath. They had a nice little shop; expensive but useful if you needed anything, like bread etc. Free quick passes to Seaworld, it was a nice touch to have it for free because we stayed here – we didn’t know but you can ask for them the night before you are due to go to save you time in the morning. A great added bonus was ‘Movie night’ the hotel shows movies in it’s very own theatre or out by the pool (by the Pool on Wednesday and Saturday nights). Their little movie theatre near reception was amazing to see and it was free. We watched ‘Tower heist’ and ‘Moneyball’. They start at either 8pm or 9pm. It meant we didn’t really need to go anywhere else at night – very nice touch. The location of the hotel is great, it’s right by SeaWorld, and its right by the junction to join the I4 – so perfect for our trip to Clearwater. We used Turkey Lake road quite a bit instead of International drive, that was easy to join right near the hotel. Free Wi-Fi was great both in the rooms and by the pool very convenient. It was great having our own balcony, which was screened we ate all our meals on the balcony. We did stay at the Doubletree down the road in May 2011 which cost more than this hotel, the grounds and rooms are much better at the vacation club. We both agree depending on the price we would stay again, it really was a great, clean, convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service and Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: scuba-dreams-2
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from Spring Break at this Resort. It was FANTASTIC!! We were in Warwick House which is far from the main club house BUT...has it's own pool and is VERY quiet. Also, to get to the main clubhouse...pick up the phone and ask for a shuttle. By the time you take the elevator down and walk out to the curb....they are THERE!! But staying in Hamilton House would eliminate that shuttle. The Staff....EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM...are so helpful and friendly! I can't say enough great things about the staff.....VERY WELL TRAINED! If you are staying at this resort....go to SEA WORLD!! It's right across the street and they have free shuttles as well. AND.....they have Quick Que's for FREE while you are at the resort! This is HUGE and a $20 value! This is the equivalent of the Fast Pass only BETTER because it puts you to the front of the line...immediately! You can pick them up the night before and the day of your entrance to SW. The condo unit itself is very nice. I do WISH they had the toilet separate from the main bath...but it is what it is! And the main bath is HUGE! Plenty of room in the 1 bedroom unit for our family of 4..with kids ages 10 and 13. They shared the pull-out no problem and slept GREAT! Everything you need is in the kitchen and towels are by the pool! I would stay here again in a HEART BEAT!! The staff again is SO friendly and knowledgeable and SO willing to go the extra mile for you! On our last day we missed the shuttle to SW and were going to walk--which isn't far--BUT the manager got us a shuttle right over..TO THE GATE!! Without prompting!! He didn't HAVE to do that....but the gesture was very helpful for us! That said....TIP these people!! I know the shuttle is free.....but come on.....TIP TIP TIP!!! Don't hesitate to stay here...you'll LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family place in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: RanleighReview
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. They are condo units in studio, one or two bedroom units. Service from all staff was friendly and courteous. You are in secure gated area where the grounds are kept up and the property is very pretty. 11 buildings are on the property. We were in the farthest - Smith's House from the main lobby and pool area. There is a quiet pool area near Smith's house but the main pool and activity area is about a 10 minute walk away. Not a big deal but they do have a golf cart shuttle service to pick you up and drop you off if you wish. They come in just minutes. Great service! Smith's house is close to the highway - not very noisy but you can hear the traffic in the quiet mornings or evenings. I would recommend one of the buildings that is in the middle of the main pool area and Smith House. My suggestion is Paget or Hamilton House. Quiet yet great location. All condos have good amenities in the kitchen. More supplies then I expected. YOu don't need to pack supplies other than perhaps salt and pepper if you use it often as that's not in the condo if you plan to cook. Beach towels are supplied at the pool so don't pack them. The location is terrific - right off Highway 4 which takes you to all Disney Parks and Legoland. It is right across the street from Seaworld and the Hilton has a free shuttle to take you to the front gate. Go early and there are no lines ups for the rides. The staff at the activity centre at the main pool are wonderful. They make the effort to learn the kids' names and have fun different activities each day. I saw lots of kids play each day with them. We definitely plan to return to this vacation club as the location and quality was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cindyrobinson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here and greatly enjoyed our stay. We had a 1 bedroom, king and found the accommodations very nice. We greatly enjoyed the pool area and the entire property was well-kept and beautifully landscaped. There were always plenty of towels readily available for the pool and we enjoyed the hot tub, game tables and the Saturday evening outdoor movie. Even though we went there as a couple, we found this property very family friendly and the staff exceptionally helpful. My husband played golf twice at nearby courses recommended by the staff and received a discount rate. Another day we rented a boat for half a day and went fishing. Our only disappointment was the airboat ride at Boggy Creek - not really worth the money. All in all it was a good trip and we would definitely recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: RobertEY
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for one night during our recent trip to Orlando. The whole property is very nice, accomodations are generous and clean, and the price was great. It's minutes from Sea World and Downtown Disney, two places we visited during our stay. The staff held our luggage after checkout and we came back and picked it up after a day in the Aquatica Water Park. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: leannek9
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable and a good size. Most comfortable bed we have had in any hotel ever!! Staff was always friendly and very helpful. Pool area was inviting although we didn't actually use it. Only drawback for us was it was located a little further from I Drive and shops than I had anticipated. Great location for Seaworld, no restaurants close by, restaurant at resort had good food and prices were reasonable. We used taxis to get around and had no problems getting them, always on hand at the hotel. Compimentary washers and dryers was an excellent feature. Grounds are impeccably maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CruisingSue
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in a 1 bedroom suite. It was spacious, clean and bright. Two family members spent 2 nights with us on the pullout queen sofa in the livingroom and said it was very comfortable, We had a king sized bed with a jacuzzi in our room. One of the best features is the screened in porch area, which had two entrances, one from the living room and one from the bedroom. How peaceful it was out there. We didn't have a car until our other family members came back, but had no trouble getting around. We were in the building fartheset away from the main pool area, but they have golf cart sized shuttles to pick you up or drop you off. where-ever you wanted to go on the grounds. This was so helpful as my husband was recovering from surgery. All you had to do was to call for it. Also right outside the main gate was the trolley stop, which could take you all up and down International Drive. We took it twice to go to two different restaurants, as there are none with-in walking distance. There is a 7-11 on the corner, though. If you're a senior, it only cost 25 cents one way for the trolley. The drivers are very helpful. We also had a large pizza and salad delivered from the on site deli one night. It was big enough for two meals for the 2 of us. We just relaxed by the pools, took walks, and enjoyed the activities going on. There is a really nice walk around the lake, and a free bus shuttle to SeaWorld, Aquatica, and Universal, which runs quite frequently. It was a wonderful, relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: haleyreneeh
Reviews.Content: This was the best experience we've had at a hotel in a long time. They upgraded our room for very little extra a night b/c we booked through their website. The room was recently renovated and was beautiful, the grounds were exceptional and the service at the pool side restaurant and their small onsite store/deli was really great! The lobby was beautiful and we really enjoyed walking around the lake and our screened in porch overlooking the beautiful landscaping and pathways. Will definitely stay here again! Right across the street from Sea World, Aquatica, and Discovery Cove, and a very short ride to Disney. Overall a calm escape from all the attractions and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: moebird
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely beautiful resort. Check in took some extra time, but after that our stay was hassel free. The room was newly remodeled and beautiful. It was spotless, and the resort provided everything we needed to get started. The Publix was near by for grocery shopping, and the resort provided cart to transport the groceries up. The pools were beautiful and well kept. The grounds had a great walking/jogging trail for exercise. If I had to say one negative thing, it would be that the work out room was a little small. The resort had activities all day long. My husband, cousins and I stayed there and took day trips to spring training baseball games. It was a great trip! we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: richbook
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this resort for one night. We had taken a cruise in Fort Lauderdale but flew in and out of Orlando. This resort was HUGE with 6 story buildings. The resort has multiple pools with many things planned daily for the whole family, including a dive-in movie every night at the main pool. It is also directly across the street from Sea World. They have a free shuttle to Sea World, Discovery Cove, and Aquatica, or you can just walk. They have shuttles to other theme parks, but it is $9 a person and cheaper to park your rental car at the park. Our room was a studio with a king bed. The room had a small kitchenette which included a small fridge, microwave, and sink. The bathroom was quite large, with a tub. The room also had a couch that pulled out into a double bed. Overall the room was extremely clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever stayed in. I paid only $100 for 1 night at this Hilton GV through a 3rd party on kayak. If you're interested in this hotel, look for deals there or other booking sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Rachael491
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 for a week while we visited Disney and Universal. It was conveniently located between the two. The only problem with location we saw was that there wasn't very many off site restaraunts near by. You had to go several exits away to find food offsite. That wasn't a problem because the food on property was delicious. We ate at the Coral Reef restaraunt at least 6 of the 7 days we were there. The resort was right across the street from SeaWorld, and Is now associated with SeaWorld. So there are some advantages when you go to SeaWorld, but I can't speak of that specifically because we did not have time in our busy schedule to go there. The main pool deck has so much to offer for families, and they even have daily programs for young and old. You could easily spend your entire vacation at the Grand Vacations club and skip the pricey theme parks and never get bored. I wish we would have had more time to enjoy the programs they offered. The rooms are nicely appointed, but I was surprised that they hadn't been upgraded. The beds were comfy enough, but I was expecting more. We had stayed at their sister resort, The Hilton Grand Vacations Club on International Drive a few years back and their beds were the most comfortable bed I had ever slept in away from home. And while these were decent, they had some wear to them, and just weren't quite what I was expecting. We had some plumbing problems in our room, and maintenance was there in no time at all. The entire staff on property were so incredibly nice and helpful. All in all it was a wonderful stay and we will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort lots of privacy and activities for all!”
Reviews.Author: RainbowAlbany
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hilton Grand Vacations at Sea World. Our stay lasted alittle less than 7 days. Located right accross from Sea World, it has very easy access to Orlando airport. They keep the resort spotless and updated. You have not been on vacation until you have stayed at the Hilton Grand!

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for all your Orlando needs.”
Reviews.Author: Kikisweets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations SeaWorld Resort on March 17-18, 2012 for 1 night. I can only wish that we could have stayed longer. We will definitely return for a much longer stay in the near future. We had booked a room for 2 adults and 1 child. Upon our arrival we were given a 2 bedroom suite. Our 2 bedroom suite was nicely located and well set up. In the master bedroom we had a comfortable King sized bed with nicely appointed furniture. The key feature in this room was the multi-person Jacuzzi bathtub. The housekeeping staff had made swans from the towels and face clothes and placed them on the ledge that separated the room from the bathing area. There was a large counter in the bathroom, and a nice sized shower. In the 2nd bedroom there were 2 comfy queen sized beds with plenty of drawer space. There was a small wet bar with a fridge. The bathroom was a suitable size with a tub/shower combination. The two bedrooms joined to the living/kitchen area. There was a pull out sofa a large dining table that seated 6 people, and a full kitchen with appliances nicer than most people’s homes. Full size fridge with ice maker, a nice ceramic top stove, blender, toaster and any kitchen utensil or pot/pan you would need to feed your family. This kitchen was as well stocked as a regular family kitchen. Impressive! There were a few comfy chairs that you could curl up in to watch tv on the flat screen tv with a dvd player attached. Off both bedrooms and living room was a screened in balcony. This was great as we could sit out in the evening and not worry about mosquitos while we ate. We used the pool near our room. We were staying in the “Devonshire Building” This was a good walk to the main lobby, but we never walked we always took a car. There was a large pool, hot tub, kiddie paddle pool and many loungers. There was also a ping pong table, and plenty of shaded areas to sit under if you want to avoid the sun. There were 2 beautiful pools located off the main lobby area. They had a water fall and lots of open space. Nicely laid out. We did not have time to use these pool unfortunately. The main lobby was nicely designed and there was a sitting area for one’s enjoyment. It even housed a piano and a guest was playing beautifully when we went in. There is a deli/shop that sold everything from sun block to food and wine. If you needed anything you could surely find it there. The grounds were beautiful, clean and enjoyable. We had previously stayed at Parc Soleil by Hilton Grand Vacation, and had hoped to get back into that resort. Upon booking we were afraid that SeaWorld resort would not measure up. We were pleasantly surprised and have realized that both resorts are fantastic and worth staying at. We will book HGV SeaWorld again for sure. For those of you who are worried about location, this is an ideal location if you have a car. You are walking distance to SeaWorld, and just down the road from Aquatica and Discovery Cove. You are a 7 minute drive to shopping at the Premium Outlets at Vineland. 10 minutes to Downtown Disney and 12 minutes to Magic Kingdom. You are not far from Universal Studios and located near enough to International drive to hop the trolley and tour around the attractions on I-drive. If you are traveling with family, children or extended family and need space to spread out. This is the resort for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: sulphide
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here for 8 nights and loved every one of them. The ladies at the front desk were lively despite my 1030pm check-in time, she even ordered me some food to meet me in my room since it was late! this property is expansive and its not like your typical hotel. i stayed on the 5th floor of the Somerset building. this was nice and far away from the noisy kids and other distractions. the room was huge for a studio, there was microwave, mini-fridge and a small kitchenette area. did i say how clean this place was? and the huge window with a clear view of sea-world. The price is right given the number of amenities. There are golf carts to get you from the lobby area to your building. There is a movie theater showing kiddie movies and all other pg 13 stuff. best of all is the fact that you are in secured neighborhood if you are in to out door jogging/walking/running. The Bad: 1. The gym is only open from 6am -11pm 2. The onsite restaurant lacks a selection for vegetarian save for black beans burger and even that kept on running out 3. This Hotel has no shuttle services 4. The closest Restaurant apart from Coral leaf is about a mile away 5. if you are into swimming forget it, the 3 pools are almost always full of kids and parents playing with their kids 6. The House cleaning people forgot to come to my room one day...not a big deal though

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for an Orlando Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBenevolo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HVC SeaWorld with a party of five (wife and I, kids 4&5, grandmother). We got a lovely huge apartment with two rooms/bathrooms (one king bed and the other with two queen beds) and a spacious living room with kitchen area (a total of 3 TV sets!). Rooms were cleaned very day and very comfortable. Grocery store at the hotel was great and we had breakfast in the room, you can order snacks at night and have them delivered to your room. We had just come from a 6 day stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge. HVC is a great option for SeaWorld and neaby shopping as well. One day we missed the shuttle bus to Seaworld and the valet guy was really nice...took us in the HVC Van to SeaWorld without any charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fun getaway without the grandkids”
Reviews.Author: TampaAbuela
Reviews.Content: We had an opportunity to visit this resort at the very special rate of 100.00 for 3nights in a 1 br suite. Needless to say a great value for us...not sure what rates are off the street. Place was very nice, lots of amenities and not inundated with everything geared to kids visiting the parks. There were lots of families, but plenty of room for the adults too. Our room with a screened porch was great, jacuzzi tub was fantastic, and lunch at the bar poolside was perfect (we lucked out and had ignore from Rumania as our waiter....lots of personality but also lots of respect for his customers). All in all a great stay ... Close to everything from shopping at International Drive to nights at Pleadure island

Reviews.Title: “HGVC Owners Beware!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzie U
Reviews.Content: This HGVC rents out to the public, so although the rooms were nice, the pool / restaurant area feels like a Howard Johnson's.....It is infuriating to know that we paid six figures to buy into this " time share"....and the young lady sitting at the hot tub last night, got her room for $ 59.00 per night! So as an owner, you are used to these resorts being a certain caliber....and this is not that.....The check in process was so unprofessional, this just was a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly hotel managed by staff that dont Care”
Reviews.Author: Scot_in_Dallas
Reviews.Content: There are many good hotels around Seaworld but this is defintely not one of them. We had a distaster with their booking system, rooms not available, not ready and the rooms that wer ready were filthy. When we complained to the staff, the could not care less. We had paid in advance at they had no motivation to resolve the problems. I would advise staying in another hotel, they do not deserve the business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place for extended stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: kjlars2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at this hotel for both business and vacation. My last trip was for 7 days last week and I was very pleased. My room in building seven was freshly renovated, extremely clean, and a great value for our week long stay. We were in a king suite. My child used the pull out sofa-as his bed- and it was amazing- huge mattress with a pillow top. Also- I don't expect great maid service- as this is listed as a limited housecleaning hotel- but my room was cleaned every day- and very early in the day. Thank you for making a good hotel even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: boatguy1
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff Near all attractions Nice pools Great 2 bedroom suite with all amenities , washer dryer big rooms, 3 flat screens,plenty of stuff for kids Only one place to eat in the complex Go to Mangiannos Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ginala
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orlando with another couple for golf and sunbathing in early March. The Hilton was perfect for our needs! We each had a studio and while it was in the furthest building from the main lobby, the walk was quick! The guys golfed each day and my friend and I enjoyed the pool area. We grabbed a light breakfast in the marketplace, then parked for the day right next to the pool. The had a lot of great activities and lunch from the Coral Reef restaurant was delicious. Drinks were a little expensive, but on the second day we brought our own cooler of beer and the bartender even offered to open a bottle of wine for me that I had purchased from the 7-11 across the street. We spent hours lounging poolside, then went out to City Walk and other restaurants at night. Everything was easy to get to from our location. The grounds were clean, the price was right and it was a wonderful visit. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fa;ntastic place”
Reviews.Author: Judy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in March. The staff was so helpful. Even though they did not have a room available when we arrived at 11am they stored our perishables in their fridge and we walked over to Sea World for a wonderful day. Upon our return they had upgraded us to a one bedroom apartment in a very brand new quiet building (SouthHampton). The washing machine and dishwasher even had detergent.. The grounds are beautiful as are the pools. There were some hawkbilled turtles in the lake in front of the pools. When the people came in to clean the rooms, they did the dishes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, great service”
Reviews.Author: JanYoung
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from HGV where we stayed for 5 NIGHTS a huge 3 bed apartment.. Check in was quick and efficient and the staff were morew than helpful at all times. We got a Q pass for our trip to Seaworld and walked across the road to the Park which was a great bonus. All in all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great place, price and location”
Reviews.Author: Leucky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HGV for 4 days while in town for a convention. The king room I had was relatively small compared to a normal King room, but the space is adequate for 2 people. i wouldnt want to stay in this room with any more people. The screen porch and kitchenette are very helpful, as the front lobby can be located quite a distance from your room. The pool areas are very nice. I only have two small issues. The elevator is SLOW, when your on the 6th floor and was even broke one day. Second, the TV is old school Tube TV, most hotels have HD flat screens now. It neither of those issues are a concern to you then this is a great choice for reasons mentioned in my title.

Reviews.Title: “So close to seaworld”
Reviews.Author: rachm7
Reviews.Content: We travelled in May 2010 as a group of 6 and a half... ( Mum n dad, me and a girl friend, brother and partner and 6month old baby). We loved the resort. Loved the sizes of the rooms, loved that the 3 bed apart meant that the 3rd bedroom had a kitchen area and own bathroom and sitting area, we loved how close it was to seaworld.. We walked at least twice. It was always clean. It had a great pizza hut on site which was hand and a lovely pool area, had a inflatable tv screen showing movies of an evening. Great Location !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Nitrox051
Reviews.Content: My 17-year-old daughter and I stayed in a studio at HGV SeaWorld for 4 nights. I felt the room rate via hotwire was a good value given the location, right across the street from SeaWorld. We were placed in a ground floor unit, which turned out to be a bonus. We had a screened-in porch surrounded by banana palms and other tropical vegetation, which offered a lot of privacy. The room was exceptionally quiet and every member of the staff was exceedingly cordial and helpful. I slept on the sleeper sofa, which was more comfortable than expected. The food in the Coral Reef restaurant and the deli was better than most hotel food. In fact, the made-to-order pizza was exceptional. (The filet mignon, not quite as nice.) The only negatives: (1) the room was warm and rather stuffy, especially during the day and early evening. Thankfully, it was unseasonably cool the first couple of days, so we left the sliding glass porch door open. (2) There was an incessant rattle in the air conditioning vent that was a bit difficult to overcome as we attempted to drift off to sleep each night. In the resort's defense, we did not complain about the air conditioning, so they were not provided an opportunity to correct the problem during our stay. Obvioulsy, neither problem was bad enough to warrant a move to another room. All in all, I definitely would stay at this property again ... but probably would reserve a one-bedroom suite vs. the studio.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at the Time Share”
Reviews.Author: atlbeachbum81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were attending a wedding at Renaissance at Sea World, but the rate was still about $200 a night and my parents actually own a timeshare at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club at Sea World and had never seen it. The HGVC was right down the road from the Renaissance so it was great! We got a 1 bedroom since we had a friend staying with us for a night. The one bedroom was perfect size for us - we had a king sized bed and a pull out couch and a full kitchen. We had lunch at the restaurant and had great service and the food was pretty good. The pool was great - large and looked like one that would be a beach resort. We only had a couple of complaints: - I guess most of the guests here stay for a longer period of time, so since we were staying less than a week there was no maid service. - The hotel uses a cab service - which is great because they're always right there - but the service doesn't use meters so we always felt like we were getting ripped off. All in all it was a nice stay. This is definitely a family hotel and if your going for a long period of time would be a great choice since there are full kitchens.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Land”
Reviews.Author: USAbluegirl
Reviews.Content: I am just now getting to the review 8 months later because it was really not such a memorable experience. I forgot I stayed here with my family (husband, 2 sons, daughter and grandbaby) until I began searching for a place to stay for this summer. If you get the chance to stay here because you were able to get a special "timeshare presentation" rate, then it's a good value. If you have to pay full price you may be a little unhappy because in my humble opinion this property is just ok. The best feature is the pool. The most convient aspect is the kitchen. I don't know quite how to explain it but the entire stay felt a little dry and bland. I only remembered to write the review because it popped up as an option for hotels close to Sea World, which is where I wanted to take the family. There is nothing wrong with the hotel it just seems like one big sales pitch of a place (that's the description I was looking for earlier) that has nothing memorable to offer. In all fairness it is a few steps away from Sea World and is pretty clean but the price just seems a bit much for what is offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Cyrene214
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 2 days stay here. Check in was smooth and the one king bedroom suite we stayed in was awesome. Furnitures are modern and updated. Plenty of room for 2 people. Pools are cleaned and gym is ok. The only downside is the service at the restaurant was slow considering it was not crowded when we went there for lunch. The jacuzzi tub is a plus but the cleaning staff should put more effort keeping the tub clean.

Reviews.Title: “Below average place with 2 positives”
Reviews.Author: ldjsue
Reviews.Content: We decided to try to HGV at Sea World with the promotion they offered. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. The place is old and tired. Fabrics are cheap and the decor is sparse and tacky. I do not get the positive reviews.......ugh...... I admit that I generally stay in high end hotels but I knew what I was getting into and looking for a cheap vacation but I found this place to be drab and dreary. Now for the 2 positives - there was loads of space in the 2 bedroom, 2 bath and that is always a bonus and it had a washer/dryer in the unit, which was fabulous not to bring home dirty clothes. If those 2 things are of top importance then this is the place for you. Otherwise, skip it.......

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Roedo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel/condo complex during Christmas vacation. We were able to get reservations a few days before. The pool area, lobby and grounds are beautiful. Far better than staying at a hotel in that area for a reasonable price. We paid $149 per night and could have got it for a lot less if it wasn't a holiday week. Staff very pleasant. Grounds very big and they have golf carts going around that will stop and ask you if you need a ride. My only complaint was the room. It was nicely decorated and clean, just a bit small. I thought it was going to be a 1 bedroom condo, it was just a hotel room with a microwave, ref and some dishes. It was enough for what we needed but we were four people. 3 adults and 1 teenager. It wasn't too bad because we were at parks most of the time or at the pool the other days. I would definitely return to this hotel when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jawds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location as we were in town for a conference. Having been to this conference before we knew the location was close. We were able to hop on the trolley and ride pretty much anywhere. As Canadians, we are also used to walking so we would walk to publix then trolley back. Rooms very spacious and clean. Staff were always pleasant and helpful! No complaints at all! Would stay here again for sure! Pool was fantastic. Never overcrowded and never a problem with chairs. Also did not have problems with the wifi. Having access in all locations was a huge bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: OnMauiTime
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for the 2012 International Builders Show at the Orange County Convention Center. This property is only a 10 min drive from the convention center an only a 5 min drive to the nearest Starbucks. The staff at the property was very polite and attentive to our needs. When we arrived everyone had a smile on there face. Each time that we passed any of the staff we were greeted with a smile and a hello. We would most certainly stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Time-Share is Great”
Reviews.Author: hazel n
Reviews.Content: In reference to " Good but not brilliant" this Hotel is a Time-Share not a hotel. When we stay here it is great. We like it because we just know where to go and get food at Publix, by just hoping on the the trolley bus to go to Publix. If we want to go Disney, we go across the street and hop on the Lynx 50 bus to go to Disney and if we want to go shopping at Target ot Walmart we take the Lynx 50 bus to disney ticket and transportation and get off the bus and transfer to a Lynx 56 bus and ride it to Kissimmee and get off when you see the Target store or the Walmart store. We come down once a year from Winnipeg, MB., Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mkenna999999
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel but I did not fall in love with it. It has so many plus points but also there are a good few negatives. Pool area was brilliant and perfect for a family. The location was spot on, a few mins away from sea world and beside the i-trolley. The food was not the best, and the rooms where nice. The thing that drove me crazy was the timeshare element. You get discounts if you go to the meetings, but advised don't go - it will drive you nuts. I would stay in this hotel if I had kids but not again as a single couple. If they made a few little improvements this could be a GREAT hotel !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Off-Season Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Rikarutsu
Reviews.Content: Normally I would hesitate to get anywhere near International Drive, even in the off-season, but this property seems to have just-the-right location. Despite the difficulty of getting back on the I-4 eastbound, it's still easy enough to get around. For those that enjoy staying in and preparing their own meals, the property is near a couple of national-chain super markets and the in-room, full kitchen allows for plenty leeway in preparing meals. The larger, single bedroom accommodations offers ample room to lounge around. A screened balcony allows for smokers to enjoy the property's facilities without breaking any rules (or paying for them) and keeps the pests away, so anyone can enjoy and have a seat. Inside the bedroom, the whirlpool tub fits two, with much space to spare, is very well kept and cleaned and adequately creates a mountain of bubbles (with the right product). The bathroom is also very well kept and spacious with his and her sinks and a shower, which didn't get much use (GO bubble baths!). The staff at the property were very helpful, although with little to go wrong, there's little need for further assistance beyond check-in. All in all, the property is highly recommended for off-season travel. I couldn't say about peak-season, but I would imagine it to be just as well, with a little more traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great rooms, Stellar service”
Reviews.Author: nj_professional_cpl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel pretty extensively (and only recently in the timeshare game as we've become kids-ified). The truth is our room here at HGVC Seaworld was gorgeous (we had a 3BR at the top of the Hamilton building), well appointed and clean, the property was in perfect, clean, working order in all respects, and the staff as friendly and helpful as I can imagine possible. Perhaps some of that is attributable to the low occupancy during down season, but when the only complaint I can possibly come up with after seven nights with kids, in-laws, and the whole ringamarole of an Orlando/Disney vacation is that I wanted a little more water pressure in the master bath shower, that's pretty good. Specific shoutouts to the staff (all of them, who went out of their way whenever an opportunity presented), the fantastic hot tubs which eased muscles after days of trekking around theme parks, and the activity center staff and facilities which our kids took great advantage of. For context, My wife and I are in our late 30's, our kids are 5 and 3, and our in-laws in their mid sixties. We all hail from the northeast (NJ for us, NY for in-laws) and have pretty high standards. I kind of wish they had more than one restaurant/bar on property, but I understand why they don't given the number of options on I-drive and with people spending much of their time at various parks. So all that said, I should caveat my review by limiting it to those in our situation. If we were a young couple with no kids, we'd probably have been a bit bored here, as there wasn't much nightlife on property (mostly tired parents like us grabbing a beer before bed) but I don't think that's the point of this place -- there's plenty of that elsewhere in Orlando if you're looking.

Reviews.Title: “WOW... WHAT A PLACE... 5*”
Reviews.Author: KBLK
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for 1 night and slept on the sofa bed and even that was comfy... Rooms are huge my uncle had a 2 bed suite with a whirlpool in the bedroom. It was so lovely we have booked to stay here in september this year but we are booked in a 1 bed suite with a whirlpool. The main pool is fab, its huge and is a relaxing place to be. The waterfall is brilliant and the hot baths are HOT!!! Its a lovely relaxing location, it has 24hr security and we was lucky that we stayed in the block next to the pool. Didnt really get to explore the complex but this time ill be exploring it more. The jetty is lovely to walk on and look into the water, we even saw a small gator and some turtles... Really recommend this hotel, i can't wait to go back in september...

Reviews.Title: “4th Times the Charm”
Reviews.Author: Rastro
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time staying here in the last few years. As always the rooms are very well equiped and maintained. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Only drawback is all dining is outside in the Coral Reef so it can get a little hot and muggy in the summer time

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Rick P
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando on business and found a great deal on this hotel. We needed a room for three guys on business and this worked out great. The room was huge with two bathrooms. Our room along with the rest of the hotel is very clean and in excellent condition. Everyone working for the hotel was very friendly and helpful. On our last day we ate breakfast by the beautifully landscaped pool and the food was great. The only drawback to this hotel is that their is nothing outside of the hotel grounds that you can walk to. Almost everything is 1-2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: helene m
Reviews.Content: Resort has every amenity you can think of and more..3 heated pools-- snack/convenience store, poolside restaurant w/ great food, and more. chauffered Golf carts to take you anywhere on the property. We had a 2 bedroom unit (Which would comfortablysleep 8 w/ sleeper sofas) w/whirlpool tub. 2 baths & xtra dressing areas,2 enclosed patios,well stocked w/ kitchen and bath essentials. Everything was immaculate, all personnel were extremely helpful and friendly. Bus to seaworld, which is just across the highway--.walking/ jogging path around the lake...stayed 1 week and everything was great......will definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Richy1708
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a suite in the "Warwick" Block and were delighted with our room. The living area was spacious with a big TV, a dining table that sat 6 (comfortably) and a very well equipped kitchen. The bedroom was a nice size, with another big TV, had a large comfortable bed and a square hot tub for two. The bathroom had twin sinks and a shower cubicle. There was an enclosed balcony. I had to do a bit of work everyday and was very pleased with the reliability and the speed of the free wi-fi in the room. There were numerous pools around the complex, and there was one just behind our room which was nice. Plenty of loungers by the pool (with complimentary pool-side towels), table tennis table, hot tub. The main pool was a good size and the food / drink at the restaurant was reasonable. Great location for Seaworld - within easy walking distance, Aquatica and Discovery Cove were also within a couple of minutes drive. On a couple of occasions, we were exhausted from the Parks and couldn't face going back out for dinner - so went on-line and booked a couple of Domino's pizzas which were delivered directly to the room very promptly. If we ever went back to Florida, I wouldn't hesitate to book a suite this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Room but Great Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: Guy B
Reviews.Content: First the Good The Hilton Grand Vactions at SeaWorld is a clean resort with a friendly staff and beautiful landscaping. The location is just across the street from the SeaWorld Parking lot, maybe a 1/2 mile walk from your room, to the SeaWorld Ticket Gates. The Pool Area is great with two large pools, two Hot Tubs, and a few kiddie pools for the Tots. The pool area also has outdoor Ping Pong and a Pool Table which makes a nice afternoon of recreation. The highlight of the Pool Area was the two waterfalls (one drops into the pool and the other into a hot tub). This gave the pool area a luxury feel which makes you feel like you are at a top notch facility. Now the Bad We stayed in a one bedroom unit that was advertised as a one bedroom unit with kitchen facilities. The unit was smaller then 90% of the standard hotel room around the country. The bathroom was so small that you had to wedge yourself between the toilet and the Sink in order to close the bathroom door when using the shower or toilet. It was not as bad as a cruise ship bathroom but it was close. Simply making the door open outwards would have been a big improvement. The kitchen facility was not a kitchen at all, it was a small bar sink, a microwave, and a coffee machine all placed on a 2 foot section of counter top with a mini fridge under. There was no room to prepare meals, no stove, no dish washer, and most importantly no eating area in the room. We planned to prepare a few meals during our stay but that was completely out of the question. In addition, because this is a vacation club, they do not supply housekeeping during your stay, that means, nobody changes the sheets, refreshes the towels, vacuums the floors, etc.. We were only their for four nights but if you are going to give me a hotel room rather then a traditional timeshare condo/apartment unit, you should at the very least service the unit like a hotel room. The condition of the room was in good repair but getting alittle tired. It may need an update soon but nothing serious. The grout in the bathroom was clean but stained due to massive use and age. The carpet was clean but slightly worn. Overall the Room had the feel of a Fairfield or Hampton Inn without the House Keepting. Small, No Luxury Appointments but Clean. If the Room would have match the Luxury of the pool area, it would have been a homerun.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JMATH m
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 and we all enjoyed our stay. The room was awesome. Plenty of room for us. We had the 2 bedroom suite. The only thing that I wish was better was the elevator. The one we had was slow. It was a nice surprise that the kids meals came with a free seaworld plate. The hotel pool area was very nice. They had staff come pick us up when we needed with golf carts. We stayed at three different hotels while in Florida, and this one was our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: TwoputtandMore
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacation in Orlando and we were very surprised to find this hotel/timeshare resort available and at a great rate through AAA. The check in process was quick and the staff was friendly and efficient. Our room was small but the furnishings and the setup were done very nicely. We had a small bar area with a sink, refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. The site has a marketplace and a full service restaurant. After playing golf all day, it was nice to be able to walk over to the restaurant and have a nice meal and a drink. The restaurant staff were also very friendly and we had fun chatting with them. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Orlando area and it is right across from Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms, price and overall look”
Reviews.Author: KimKuwait
Reviews.Content: Service for breakfast in the restaurant horrendously SLOW. Food tasteless and inedible even tho we were starving due to slow service. Should have eaten at the Deli. Music by the pool way too loud, this is not a frat party people. Sadly, because of these points would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a full-service hotel. it's a timeshare "resort"”
Reviews.Author: bonsai35
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I did not realize that this is not really a full-service hotel. it's timeshare apartments or something, so it wound up being a completely inappropriate venue for a business meeting. It is HUGE and if you are in a buildiing far from the lobby (Like actual driving distance from the lobby) then it's not convenient if you need services of any sort, God help you if you lock yourself out of your room! One restaurant on site for this monster-size resort. Our rooms were a solid 15 minute walk from the lobby. Our internet didnt work, the shower dripped, the clock in our room didnt work, the elevator reeked of diesel fuel. The room itself was large, but that's about all I can say that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: mommyrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a quick trip to Disney. For those wanting to go to Sea World, the entrance is literally directly across the street from the Sea World entrance. Definitely walking distance!! It was about 5 or 6 miles to Disney, very quick drive without getting back on the Interstate. The check in was quick and easy. They had popcorn in the lobby and my son quickly found some children playing Nintendo Wii in the theater on the big screen, he loved it. The room was clean and modern. There were plenty of linens in the room. There is a a safe as well. We had a beautiful view from our balcony. The bed were comfortable. The room we stayed in had a very clean kitchenette with a mini fridge. Perfect for keeping drinks and a few quick snacks. It was much too cold to get into the pool, but the area was beautiful. They offer a free movie every night in the theater but we were too tired after travelling and being at the park for several hours that evening. We will definitely be staying there again in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jjbalck
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a 3 room suite. It was very nice and clean when we walked in. I'm glad we rented a car because we were in the building farthest from the lobby, recreation center, deli, etc. Our room was also the last one down a long hallway. Nonetheless, we enjoyed being away from any crowds and actually got to enjoy the smaller pool and sauna that were near us with great privacy. We didn't love the decor in the rooms (including the old fashioned tv's) since most of it was pretty antiquated, but I hear theyre in the process of updating the rooms. We had 3 separate bedrooms and only one of them was pretty disappointing. Since we were 3 couples, we had to flip a coin. Of course, we get the small room with the two full beds and the bathroom in the hallway. We didn't love that but we dealt with it. I wish we had known ahead of time so we could possibly request one queen sized bed. The kitchen and laundry were very useful. We stayed in Orlando for a week and saved a lot of money making breakfast with the full kitchen and utensils provided. Housekeeping kept an eye on everything most of the time, but it wasn't too hard to keep clean. The dryer took a few times to dry clothes but that wasn't too much of a problem. The couple of times that we did venture to the lobby area, we were amazed by the very cool pond (with fish, huge turtles, and an alligator!) and all of the other amenities. The deli was nice and useful. It had everything you might have forgotten to pack in your bag, Starbucks coffee, and what looked like great food. The best thing was that it wasnt overpriced at all. Overall, the service was very good and we had no major issues here. I wish they provided an airport shuttle, but luckily we did have a car most of the trip. The location was central but it's not like you'd be able to walk to everything. When you check in, they give you lots of information about the area, and directions to every attraction, including the awesome outlet malls. We had a good time and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Skimmer2065
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of Oct. 2011. What an amazing place to stay!! The staff are very helpful in planning out you time in Orlando. They have a desk with a cheery staff! They even book the "event" for you. Wether you want to see the Disney attractions or even reservations at a local resturaunt they can help you! The pool area was huge!! Never a crowd! My daughter really liked the pool with the waterfall! I enjoyed relaxing in one of the many hot tubs after a long day of site seeing! Rooms are spacious and fully equipped, perfect for those "staying in" days to cook meals ourselves. Balconies with screens make the nights comfortable to just relax and get a cooling breeze! Would stay there anytime I go back to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: Happybackpacker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the resort just before Christmas. It is one of the best we've ever stayed in; exactly what you expect from Hilton. We thoroughly enjoyed everything about the place, from the staff at the front desk to checkout. The only suggestion I could make is to upgrade the restaurant. It's a good bar place, but the resort needs a good restaurant, because it is way too far from anyplace decent to eat. The property is surrounded by malls and "fast-food" places.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, some issues in room”
Reviews.Author: NCMom1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location over Christmas, the busiest time in Orlando. The staff was very welcoming and the grounds were beautiful. We had a 1-bedroom suite and the space was exactly what we needed. The kitchen was great and had all the supplies we needed. We used the bell service for rides to the main building and they were always so nice! The few things that I found issue with: all 3 luggage carts in our building had seen better days, not one worked with no problems. The bedding for the pull-out sofa was not sufficient. The mattress pad did not fit and there was not a fitted sheet available. Lastly, the dryer did not work well at all. I ran a medium sized load 3 times on high heat for 90 minutes in order to dry the load. This was probably the biggest pain. Outside of those, it was a great stay and we did enjoy ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new rooms”
Reviews.Author: yama9262
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Dec 2011 Check in was great Check out also great. Room is very good. Buffet Breakfast selection is just Ok for a 5 star hotel nothing special. Limo transfer to Airport Express sucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are going to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Brandonmarcus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while going to all the SeaWorld parks. There's free transportation to the parks at scheduled times but if you want to venture out then you really need a rental car or you'll end up spending a lot on taxi's, I really didn't think the hotel restaurant was very good. Plus it closes at 11pm and for some reason my son would get hungry at 11:01pm. The activities are nice and the room is perfect for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business and vacation property”
Reviews.Author: 17Dec1903
Reviews.Content: I had the one bedroom suite. It was renovated and the rooms are lovely. Excellent service throughout the resort as well. My only complaint was that on my last night, I could clearly hear the people in the next room. Despite that, I highly recommend this property for both vacation and business travelers. This is a very large property so be prepared to walk or drive to get between the room and the front office.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe F
Reviews.Content: Some friends, my wife and I stayed in a three bedroom suite for four nights. Beautiful clean, unit. The entire facility was great and the staff was very friendly. Shuttle to and from Sea World let us keep our car parked. Hilton is actually close enough that you can walk to the front gate. Plus, since the property is affiliated with Sea World we received a Fast Pass to the major rides. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to end the day”
Reviews.Author: ghodecker
Reviews.Content: A nice, comfortable room to stay and unwind in after a long day at a convention. Having decent cooking facilities is a good addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at HGVC Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: GypsyOBRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC Seaworld November 11-18, we traded through RCI & planned this vacation a year in advance to get a 3 bedroom 3 bath condo. We were excited for this trip & were not disappointed with this Hilton. This is the 3rd HGVC we have stayed in, both the other ones being in Vegas, this one was a little older but very nicely appointed & kept up. We stayed in Sandy House which was not remodeled as yet but it was a busy week due to a convention near by & even though we asked for a the remodeled rooms closer to the main pool area, they were not able to accommodate us at check in. It was clean, comfortable & had everything we needed for the week. We stayed on the 5th floor, asking for the top level but were again told that the top of the condo was unavailable to give to us. We had people above us two of the nights & either they were incredibly noisy or the floors have no sound barrier. We stayed with 4 adults & 2 children, had plenty of room with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, 3 full bathrooms, the master had a King, one spare had a queen & the second had two queens. Our master had a jacuzzi tub which we used one night. We had two balconies but they just looked at the other buildings. The TVs were not flat screened or large but we weren't there for that so it didn't bother us. The beds were very comfortable & the kitchen had everything we needed to cook & eat with. The staff was very nice & helpful. The grounds were very well kept. The two main pools were never too crowded, plenty of empty chairs for lounging & both were warm. There were many outdoor jacuzzi tubs that were never crowded either. Nice to relax in after long days at the parks. They had a pool table which we played on one night.. There was a play ground, tennis courts, basketball courts, movie theater & activity center. They had many activities the week we were there but our kids did not participate in any of them because we kept them busy with the amusement parks. We all enjoyed the pools several times during our stay. Our condo was three building away for the pools & we used the gulf carts 3/4 of the time. Out of the numerous times we called during our stay, there were two times that we called & no one showed to pick us up. We ate at the restaurant next to the pool, Coral Reef Bar and Grill, twice during the week & were very impressed with the price & taste of our meals. My mother-in-law has several allergies & the chef came to our table to assure she got the food she could eat. We were most impressed with our waiter both nights, Igor, he was exceptional. We have been on many cruises & although he told us he had never worked for one, he truly knew how to take care of his customers, making us feel like royalty. The location is superb! We used the shuttle for Seaworld. It was always on time & money saving to not have to pay to park. We had a rental car & also drove around as well, there are plenty of places to eat & shop in the area as well. Right off the highway, it made it easy to get almost everywhere we went. We used the free quick pass for Seaworld & it was a nice touch to have it for free because we stayed here. We went the night before we would go *& they would print out passes to had in for our bands at the park. We were asked to have the timeshare breakfast only once when we checked in, we said no & never heard about it again. We would love to stay here again. Would really like to see the remodeled rooms. Highly recommend eating at the pool, Coral Reef Bar and Grill, & asking for Igor!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Fairlypicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a remodeled 2 bedroom, the room was wonderfull. Staff was great. The facilities were great for the family. The bed was comfortable. Being fairly picky--we stayed in a buidling further away from the main pools, we called for a golf cart 3 times and got one 1 time. Also the TV in the bedroom was super loud even when turned all the way down.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: TCSuwGA
Reviews.Content: OK...I know, a lot of folks on here enjoyed there stay. We did as well. I was just less than pleased with (1) the room and (2) hotel management. (NOTE: I am Hilton Diamond and stay at Hilton properties 30+ times a year) We arrived for a 3 night stay with a reservation for a 1 bedroom, 2 beds plus pullout, room. We were given a 1 bedroom with a king instead. Situation was explained as a "misunderstanding".....OK. Room was in good condition. Recent renovations showed well, except for the aging refrigerator. Turns out refrigerator had not been replaced and was operating as loud as refrigerator could without "conking out." Maintenance determined there was nothing they could do but replace the refrigerator (which they acknowledged needed to be replaced). Management then said there was nothing more they could do....OK...let's settle in, cover our ears and enjoy the stay. PS..request a room away from the main drag between the hotel and Sea World. We observed the front desk attempting to place guests in the buildings abutting Sea World. When guests noticed, the front desk happily moved them due to anticipated noise. For Hilton travelers, this particular Hilton could also care less if I was Diamond status or a first time traveler to a Hilton property...if that is of interest to you. Room condition was fine other than the refrigerator and bed mix-up. Property well maintained. Pool amenities nice as well. I did get a chance to catch the Hilton Parc Soleil, which I strongly recommend one consider if this is a choice....good luck and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great as always with Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jeffpags
