Reviews.Content: We've stayed here numerous times and had great experiences, and this was no exception. Great rooms, great property, great rooms, great location... only item worth mentioning on the negative side was the fact that the pool still is not heated, or if heated not at a warm enough temperature. Now they disguise the time share pitch as a special check-in for owners.... aside from that --great stay

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful if you are used to 5 Star Properties”
Reviews.Author: N0dric
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am mightily disappointed in the overall service I have experienced at the resort. We were invited to a timeshare presentation in return for a cheap 4 day break at this location. We paid $250. My wife and I had considered taking an investment in HGVC, but after the experience in Orlando this is firmly on hold.  We attended the presentation on the morning after the day we arrived, so had not had any opportunity to experience the resort, and this was one of the reasons we didn't purchase at the presentation. More on this later! We were give a room in the 'Sandy' block on the 5th floor.  The two bedroom suite was appointed well, albeit tired and in need of some refresh.  The TVs are really showing their age, and the fan didn't function on the balcony.  As Florida had a cold day, by its standards, we chose to switch on the room heat.  On doing so the room filled with a burning smell, and the smoke detectors went off, emitting their high pitch wail for some 10 minutes, even though I immediately switched off the heating.  We notified reception, but no one ever came to examine the system, reception seeming to be content with their question "is it OK now sir?". I guess this means they don’t clean them very often so they are full of dust - wheeze! This room is located directly opposite the elevator, and this gave rise to constant droning from the elevator motor room until late at night, and again from early morning.  I guess someone has to have the room next to the elevator, but if you stay here make sure you check where the allocated room is. The room we had also backed onto another block, and when sitting on the balcony you have the great humming noise of the 6 stories of air conditioning units cooling the opposite block. This is a very poor design, as our 5th floor room had an OK view over the garden and tennis courts, but the din from the airco units ruined any idea of a quiet glass of wine at sunset. The in room WiFi work intermittently, and suffered slow speed and signal loss on a continuos basis.  It’s also one of those systems where every time you want to get online you have to open a browser and agree Ts&Cs before you can surf etc. Get’s tiresome after the first few times. Our check out day was Sunday, but on the Saturday we returned from a day out at 530pm to find the room had not been cleaned, and everything was as we had left it.  I immediately called reception who said they would send someone.  45 minutes elapsed at which time I lost my patience and walked to reception and spoke to the duty manager.  He apologised and said he would attend to it immediately.  Another 30 minutes elapsed before a cleaner showed up.  We left for a drink at the bar while she serviced the room.  This really is exceptionally poor service for a supposedly top end Hilton resort. We took breakfast on the morning of checkout, and this was yet another disappointment to add to the list.  We were served by 'Abby', a rather stern Eastern European young lady, who insisted on wearing very large sunglasses so that her face was partially covered.  We were eating indoors.   Abby seated and attended to two suited Japanese gentleman who had arrived after us, took their drinks orders, and then found the time to bring us menus.  When she eventually came back with our drinks (this location also does not offer sweet tea to the annoyance of my American wife), she took our breakfast order. After 25 minutes of waiting we noticed that the gentleman who had queue jumped with Abby's assistance had been served their food, but then to our astonishment so had a family who arrived some 10 minutes after us, even though two of their party had arrived some time after the first two, and before anyone had placed their orders.   When we eventually managed to attract Abby's attention she brushed it off as they didn't order an omelette, and this is why we had to wait!  Throughout service she appeared uninterested in us, abrupt, and quite frankly annoyed with having to work.  She had her apron stuffed with check folders, and when she gave us our check, she put down a pile of dirty dishes next to us while she went through the stack of check folders to locate ours. After finalising our packing we loaded the car and drove round to reception to obtain a final account folio.  We were told the computer system was down and therefore they could not provide an account at this time, but they would email me one as soon as their systems were working again.  Three days later and I'm still waiting. After 1 week of waiting I had to call HGVC and then go through the hassle of filling in a form sent via email, printing, signing, scanning, and emailing it back to be sent a text file (not formatted at all) of my account charges. I won’t even mention the illiterate way the email was written to me. I have also had to arrange to have my car detailed due to the hotels sprinkler system that sprays water all over parked cars in the parking spaces.  My car is only 4 months old, and after being sprayed was covered in water stains that will not wipe off with simple washing, and has left large spots all over the paint.  It seems the water has a high calcium content.  In any event, those of us who use their own cars don't want to have to clean this mess off everyday.   The Hotel employs a large contingent of Eastern Europeans and Russians, and while I have worked with many during my career, I can say with certainty that those staff members at this location fail to meet the usual American standards of service normally expected and experienced. This is a mid grade resort running on a limited budget, and with limited service standards. I am a Hilton Diamond Elite, and therefore expect a certain level of service from Hilton when I stay. I am not a budget traveller and do not expect a budget service when staying with Hilton. I guess if you want a place to let your kids run wild while you get drunk, this will work out fine. On the timeshare presentation. We had a sales manager who was not pushy or unpleasant in anyway, but he did make one or two comments that were unsavory. When telling us no one could offer us the incentives to purchase again if we didn’t buy there and then, he used an analogy that “if one of our African American friends complained that we got special treatment, Hilton would be in all sorts of trouble, so they had to apply the rules universally”. He also kept referring to Paris Hilton in numerous disparaging remarks. I may not be a fan of hers, but this is not what I expect to be listening to. I have written to Hilton to highlight this unacceptable behaviour, and am awaiting a response. Despite his obviously unacceptable comments we did discover that Hilton can, and will offer similar incentives if we attend another presentation at another location, or at the same location a year later. Also the mathematics they use to convince you to buy are misleading and I’d urge anyone going on one of these timeshare trips to do some Google searches ahead of time and arm yourself with the facts. Especially the charges made to use the points you purchase at other properties, and to exchange them for HIlton Honors points. They don’t represent such good value. The interest rate if you purchase on finance is also 12% at the time of writing for a 10 year finance agreement. Make sure you can finance this yourselves before attending. You don’t much for less than $18K, just in case you were wondering, and the top tier costs $175K.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel and it will absolutely be my last. I was in a king bed suite with full kitchen, jacuzzi tub, and screened patio. I'll begin with the kitchen. The tile floors were FILTHY. I discovered this because I was walking around in the room in my socks and my feet were feeling dirty so I looked at the bottom of my socks and was SHOCKED to see that my white socks were dark brown on the bottom!!!! There is no explanation for this other than the floors had not been cleaned in a very long time. The kitchen cabinets were in disrepair, showed dirt, and were sticky in some places. I cleaned them myself with disinfecting wipes (I should not have to do that!) and the amount of dirt that I removed was appalling. The light fixture in the dining area and the ceiling fan in the bedroom had cob webs all over them. The bathroom was the worst of all. The shower had someone else's hair in it indicating that either it had not been cleaned since the last guest or it was not thoroughly cleaned. The condition of the tile surrounding the exterior bottom of the shower was awful. It was in disrepair, dirty, appeared wet at all times. The light switches were dirty and discolored. The cabinets and drawers were very shabby. The interior of the bathroom drawer had peeling paint and it was dirty and definitely not a place where you'd want to put your things. The hair dryer had a black dirt mark on it. The jacuzzi tub had hair in and around the jets and did not appear clean in general. I wouldn't step a foot in there. The screened patio was so overgrown with trees/plants that you could barely see daylight, I didn't go out there. On the third day of my stay, my room was never cleaned. I have no idea why. Staying in this room was nauseating but I had a very busy schedule and when I attempted to find another hotel to move to, I could not find a room so I cleaned every surface I had to touch using disinfectant wipes and reluctantly stayed. I have requested a refund from Hilton but have not heard back from them yet.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Jkristjanson
Reviews.Content: We spent Halloween week at this Hilton and it was perfect for us. The staff was friendly, the room was beautiful, the grounds were gorgeous... just an unbelievable experience. Not a single complaint. If you are going to SeaWorld it is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay at Hilton Grand Vacation Club Seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: OneInaMillion50
Reviews.Content: We are time-share owners with Hilton Grand Vacation Club, and this is our home resort. We hadn't stayed here for over 4 years, and it is always a pleasure to come back and stay for a week or more when we visit the Orlando area. The resort is close to all area attractions (especially Seaworld, of course), and driving the roads to and from DIsney or Universal is a breeze. Always happy to come back to our favorite home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, lots of room to spread out and great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ShopaholicBex
Reviews.Content: We agonized over our choice of hotel for our 7 night stay with 3 small kids. I read and re-read all the reviews on tripadvisor and compared the photos posted by guests vs. the photos posted on the Hilton web site. I finally settled on this resort and was very pleased with my choice. First, and most important, every staff member with whom I spoke or came into contact was very courteous, professional, efficient, effective and generally performed their duty with cheer. I was shocked by this. Isn't that sad? We have come to expect so little from people in service industry. I was very pleasantly surprised. The location is great. You are literally across the street from Sea World. You can walk there. You are a short drive from the airport and all the Disney attractions are a short drive away. The farthest park, Magic Kingdom, was exactly 12 minutes away. I definitely recommend renting a car if you plan to stay here. The rooms were very clean. I am very, very picky when it comes to cleanliness and I do not have a single complaint about this resort. Ask my husband. I can *always* find something about which to complain and like to lament, "if only" and "next time." No such regrets or complaints this time. We were very well-stocked with towels and additional bed linens, blankets and pillows and felt very comfortable. The kitchen was also very well-stocked with dishes, cookware, utensils, and even had a pitcher. We didn't really cook much, but we did make eggs a couple of times and ate cereal, made coffee and a pitcher of pink lemonade. We had everything we needed. My one suggestion is to buy your own coffee and basket filters, as the complimentary 2-in-1 coffee and filter combo there tasted horrid. Perhaps I used too much water, but I ran to the local Publix and made my own coffee after that. At home we sleep on very firm mattresses. These beds are very soft. I initially worried that we would hate it. I slept so well that I wonder if my next mattress might be a pillow-top. My husband and I both had really great nights of sleep. We had a 2 bedroom suite and had plenty of room to spread out with 3 small boys. The resort has several pools and hot tubs. The boys loved the playground and playing ping pong. We did not eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment on that, but there is a restaurant on site. There is also a small convenience store where I purchased a gallon of water (that FL tap water is the worst!) and some beer. It is very expensive, so I don't recommend buying much there. Rent a car, make a trip to CVS on the corner or Publix for your essentials, but the store is there in case you are in a pinch. It seems that some of the rooms have been updated recently. Ours was not, it was pretty 90s-tastic, but it was still tasteful and clean. No complaints. Clean, lots of room to spread out, proximity to area attractions and great customer service. You can't go wrong. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT GREAT GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ian123456
Reviews.Content: wow as usual this hotel is the best hgvc in orlando you won't beat this.the friendly warm welcome is lovely after a 10hour flight so here is a list of what it has - 3 swimming pools 2 together - 5 hottubs which are a not to hot not to cold - food shop which sells pizza as well - 1,2,3 bedrooms suites (1bedroom very big) - security very high - next to sea world 5 min walk to gate - no building is the wrong building (just what you prefer) - lots of garden around the carpark makes if feel like a village if you are thinking of staying at a hgvc in the orlando area i would go with this one. This might not be the closest to disney but the slip road to the i4 to disney is right near the hotel which i think makes it quicker to get to disney,plus its close to sea world as well BOOK IT YOU WILL NOT GO WRONG AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great bed!”
Reviews.Author: Adam001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Somerset for two weeks at the end of September using our HGV membership. I have to say, from the moment we stopped at security on arrival to the day we left, the staff were superb. Always friendly, always helpful - especially the ones in the poolside bar! Whilst we felt that our room (1403) was probably one of the older ones and could do with a refresh, it was spotless, spacious and well-appointed. It also contained one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! The on-site shop was great for most basics and the poolside bar did excellent cocktails - price not too horrific - and reasonable food. In terms of location, Sea World is walkable (if you can ever get the pedestrian crossing light to go green...) and the I-Ride trolley stops right outside. Overall, a really good stay, and we'd be very happy to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Grand Vacations Suites at SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Janice V
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting Orlando. The rooms were really nice and spacious. The location gives easy access to Disney properties, Sea World properties and Universal Studios properties. The I-Ride-Trolley stops right outside the front gate for access to all the dining and activities (Convention Center) along International Drive for $1.25. Better than driving in traffic and paying to park. The rooms and bathrooms were large and beautiful. Flat screen TVs were located in each living room and bedroom. I had great response from employees when I reported problems such as a burnt out light bulb. Full kitchen was really a full kitchen. Plenty of dishes, and cookware. Balcony was screened in so you could enjoy your meal there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times, but don't fall for the timeshare crap!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonythescorpion
Reviews.Content: I came to Orlando for a conference and some sunny with the wife afterwards. All the staff was great very friendly and helpful from the receptionist to the service people to the people that works at the deli and restaurant. Transportion was a few steps away the rooms was very clean not modern but homie. The only thing to watch is the sales pitches they are a tad bit pushy I just stood my ground I had no time for the nonsense. If you want cheap tickets for something no that there is a cost (your time) learn to play the game. All in all I had a GREAT TIME and I'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Pricey for the Quality”
Reviews.Author: autumn_everlasting
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a decent family-friendly hotel. I do feel that the rates were high given the quality of the rooms. You could spend the same and find nicer accommodations in the area. The pool area is impressive, with outdoor evening movies shown in the main pool area, slightly secluded waterfall grotto areas, and a pool table and bar/snack area. There is also a playground, and a smoking area set back far away from poolside. That, however is where the quality stops- the rooms were on the small side, there were no sheets for the pull-out sofa- just two bare pillows and one blanket. And when my kids went to use the pull-out sofa (right next to the bed), they found a baby cockroach in the sheets. I expect a little more from such a fancy hotel on the outside. Also, although there was a coffee maker, there were no disposable cups provided, just ceramic ones in the cupboard. Maybe that doesn't bother you, but to me it's a little unsanitary, I don't appreciate having to do dishes while on vacation! Overall, it's ok if you can get a super deal or only have to spend a night or two, but I would not want to stay longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jnsatterfield
Reviews.Content: I was contacted by Hilton Grand Vacations and was offered their 4-day/3-night stay at this site with the stipulation that I had to sit through the 1-hour tour of the Parc Soleil resort, which was still being sold. I admit that I was a bit apprehensive about whether or not this was a scam, but after discussing it with my wife, we decided to take them up on their offer. For a total of $150, we were able to stay at this location for 3 nights. We took the opportunity to purchase tickets for Sea World at the same time on our own. Upon arriving at this location, I was absolutely delighted. The service was excellent. The facilities were clean. The rooms were in excellent shape. The bed was comfortable. The amenities were plentiful. But my absolute favorite was the pool. My wife and I made sufficient use of their pool-side restaurant/bar. The hot tubs were a bit on the warm side for my tastes, but otherwise, everything was nearly perfect. I highly recommend visiting this facility. On a side note, we took the opportunity to purchase the Hilton Grand timeshare, and I must admit that I was, again, surprised at how useful it has proven to be. After reading so many negative reviews (after we purchased our deed), I expected to have trouble. The truth is, we haven't had a single problem. I suppose it helps to understand that, as a vacationer, you are responsible for everything except lodging when you take part in one of these deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great, All Balconies, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chris f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January, the weather was beautiful. The hotel staff informed us of all the features. There is free movie night, free golf cart transportation from building to pool, free tennis, walking tours, ping pong and more. Bingo was $5 but the prizes were worth it. They were worth $10-20 per game, and $5 gets you 4 games. The resort has 4 pools and 5 whirlpools, free pool tables, shuffle board, and full size, like life like chess. I did this for free with a time share presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable resort experience”
Reviews.Author: deb s
Reviews.Content: Overall, the facility is very clean and well maintained. The staff is very helpful and courteous. We had our granddaughter along for a Disney vacation and we all enjoyed the movie nights. The pools were very clean and towels were plentiful. The activities center is being renovated so we were not able to use this area. The exercise area was adequate, nothing over the top. The rooms were a little dated and the couch in the living room definitely needed to be replaced (or at least the cushions-we were in St. George's pods room 3115). The beds were comfortable. One thing I would definitely warn everyone about is the shower on/off nozzles. The hot and cold indicators are just the opposite of what is normal and someone could get confused and get burned easily. We loved the enclosed porch area. We enjoyed the facilities and enjoyed our stay there for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: Keeblerelf928
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacation-Sea World is a clean and beautiful place to stay although the room we were in was on the tiny side, it was big enough for the two of us. The pool was sparkling and warm and there were activities offered everyday from bingo to movie nights. Though we didn't participate in any, it was nice that they were there in case there was a rainy day. This hotel is set up more like a resort than a hotel with multiple buildings spread across a large area. This is great in that it makes it a lot quieter in the individual buildings and there was always parking right outside our room. The onsite bar had good food and service, we ate there more than once and the Pizza Hut room service was awesome for a late night movie night in the room. The concierge was more than helpful for getting us our Disney tickets and booking us for a dinner show at Arabian Nights. They were also great with providing us with directions so that we didn't get lost! The only complaint I have is that they don't honor Hilton member rewards. I have Gold status with Hilton and they would not honor early check in/late check out (even though our room was all ready) This left us having to wait for 3 hours to check in even though when I booked the room I informed them I had an earlier flight. Although annoying, nothing that couldn't be brushed of by eating a nice lunch. I would recommend staying at this hotel. It was a nice place with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “great happy place”
Reviews.Author: thedigle
Reviews.Content: what a happy place to stay, nothing was too much trouble and the staff waved as you passed them, they gave us a lift to aquatica, nothing was too much trouble. highly recommended beautiful apartments, and well maintained gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: mdearden
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Hilton Grand through a time share and it was great! October is a great time of year as they are not very busy and the weather was perfect. The hotel grounds are beautifully kept, the rooms very clean and cozy. We loved the pools as well as the nightly entertainment at the main pool, and its a great location if you want to do Disney or any of the other theme parks. The staff is also very friendly and I would recommend this resort for both families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away!”
Reviews.Author: curtapryl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this resort and it was great.. Everyone is so nice and helpful. The pool area is great lots of chairs and the bar and food were great and very well priced. I enjoyed the turtles and alligator at the end of the dock. The rooms are very nice. Plenty of room for a family or a couple. The building are all well kept and if your building is far from the pool all you have to do is call down and a golf cart will pick you up. I will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, rooms and pools”
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, great rooms and beautiful swimming pools. However, there was a really noisy party in our part of the hotel, which ruined our last night as the noise went on until 4am. All the other nights were fine, so we were probably just unlucky on this one night. The golf buggies that drive you around the hotel are an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: blakestravel
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacations at Seaworld not only gives you an amazing hotel stay, but also free QuickQue passes and free transportation to SeaWorld. If you miss the bus to SeaWorld, it is only a short walk down the street and across the parking lot. The hotel rooms are wonderful and have the quality of a Hilton Hotel with the atmosphere of a resort. The buildings of rooms are each six floors tall and there are about 13 buildings. The resort has three very nice pools. The best part of our trip was the extremely nice and helpful activity center staff. The pictures on their website are an understatement and are most definitely not deceiving. This place is a very nice way to spend a week in Orlando! If you are worried about walking all over the property, then worry no more because a phone call to the front desk will have a golf cart with a friendly driver waiting outside your building within minutes. This hotel has thought of all the small things that can make your trip more than you would ever expect. Remember, this resort is a member of the RCI timeshare program.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Crown For Sure!”
Reviews.Author: arlette1953
Reviews.Content: This resort is fabulous...The suites..the service...the property...and most of all the employees! Easy drive to Disney and Universal...restaurants galore...also shopping of all kinds...We stayed in the Somerset building...close to pool and all activities...and this building has been refurbished...quite lovely...Always something going on at the pool....although we didn't have time to enjoy them....If you have the opportunity to stay here by all means do..you wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: CTUSA
Reviews.Content: PROS: Discount SeaWorld tix at concierge! Beautiful pools and lounge area. Close proximity and shuttle to SeaWorld. Easy on-off to I-4. Front desk was very helpful! Sink, toaster, mic, and dishes/silverware are very nice amenities. If you can get this off-season for a low rate and you want to go to SeaWorld, then it is worth a shot. Our issue was with the room service that walked in on me when I was in the bathroom (and you can see right into the bathroom if the door is ajar). I asked her to return in 20 minutes, only she did not, and I had to call later to get service. After that we noticed some bar soap was placed in the toilet that would not go down. Not sure why that was placed there, but clogging the toilet is not something that I would do at home nor somthing that I want to think about on vacation. Additionally, I left a note for a couple of requests that never got answered. So we give them a 2 on room service. Also, take a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor. Not sure why you'd want to put so much vegetation against the building, see the picture, you be the judge. Lastly, the hotel is set up as separate buildings... so arriving at night is a little tricky and so is baggage & parking near your entrance... therefore if it is dark or rainy, get help with your bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice clean rooms! Get a suite for sure though.”
Reviews.Author: AggieGolfer
Reviews.Content: Two families of (4) doing the Disney/Universal stuff. Perfect location as it was between them both. Two bedroom suite with full kitchen and two screened-in patios. The rooms were not huge but worked fine for us. Stayed on the top floor and watched the fireworks from SeaWorld every evening. Concierge is there so USE THEM! They will point you in the right direction and can really help make your stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money - get the suite”
Reviews.Author: meowable
Reviews.Content: i spent the few extra dollars and got the suite - my friends got a standard room. my suite came with a full kitchen with lots of great appliances, full stove, fridge and stocked cabinets. the spa tub was full size, plenty of room for two adults. plus a shower in the next room. the standard room was just standard with small fridge and sink area and a much smaller room. the concierge and check in staff were outstanding on every shift. the pool is nice as well as the outside poolside bar. highly recommend staying here. i was attending a conference at the convention center and once i found the "back" way it was a short 2 mile drive. but it's close to all the parks as well.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer Service at this Resort”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this resort. Unfortunately, I left something in the room and called the resort a few days later to see if I could get this back. I made several calls and left messages on voice mail to call me back - As no one had called me back I then returned to the Resort a few days later to see if I could speak to someone face to face and was advised that nothing had been handed in. I received no customer service from this resort and am very disappointed. I thought staying at a reputable hotel chain like the Hilton Group that I would have received a better level of customer service. Please ensure that you do take every piece of clothing/article with you on your departure date - as you will not get it back - this hotel obviously does not want to know and will probably just dump the left articals in the garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: AMD0323
Reviews.Content: We traded w/RCI (timeshare week) for the 3rd full week of Sept. We were there to 'do' Universal. Side note- I'd recommend (if you're driving) to take Turkey Lake Rd instead of I-Drive to Universal. You'll shave off 4-5 stoplights & a ton of time if you're going during rush hour. It took us less than 15 minutes (there's also a WalMart on TL road if you need to stock up) from car door closing to being parked in Universal. Back to the hotel- we got there around 6pm on Sat. & were 2nd in line to check in and waited about 20 minutes. It took forever & the line piled up behind us!! I didn't stop to pickup my 'free gift' b/c I didn't want to wait anymore!! Then we were told one of our rooms wasn't ready, but when we got up there it appeared to be done. We were in Somerset building & had a 2 bedroom. Now this turned out to be 2 one bedroom units with king beds in each room. I say this b/c we ended up having to sleep on the sofabed!! If you need 3 beds + couch for a two bedroom, I'd be sure & ask for it. The person at the desk was less than helpful about listening to my request for an extra bed- so we made the best of it. The rooms were nice & looked updated- flat screens in each room & the dining room had a large table (more than enough to fit 5 of us) 4 chairs and a large bench. The washer was a good size but the dryer took forever to dry clothes. The kitchen was a little cramped if you wanted more than 1 person in there! The floors were also pretty filthy- not sure if that was the carpets or the tile flooring- we started keeping our shoes on as much as possible. They had a 50 person theatre that had Monday night football & played movies 4 nights (free) & the other 2 nights they had a dive-in movie set up at the pool. The main pools are right next to each other & I counted 4 hottubs- they also played music which was nice. One pool had a fountain in the middle of it the kids liked to play on (5 ft deep in the center) and the other had the waterfall. They also had a kiddie splash area. There's a small nice workout room & the treadmills have TV's on them. Shuffleboard, large chess set, covered playground, ping pong & pool table round out the pool area. We walked around & noticed a basketball court & tennis court. They also have another pool (adult only?) in one of the buildings that's further away from the main area. (If you don't have kids, you may want to request that area?!) It looked like a lot of renovations were going on. Several bldngs were blocked off & had lots of boxes outside of them. A note about the staff: a couple times I called down to the desk for various questions, the person who answered just didn't have a clue & had to keep being corrected on her answers. Perhaps another week of training will cure that? The pool staff seemed nice, but again, clueless. No one stood out in the helpful department. One other (major?) issue was Tuesday when we came back from the parks, our keys wouldn't work in the room door, but we found that just pushing down the handle opened the door! We deduced the cleaning people had come in to do the rooms (you get one cleaning/week) and forgot to lock the door back up. We stopped someone from security & he got it fixed pretty fast. It didn't look like anything had been stolen. All in all, I'm not sure what to rate this place. If you read my other reviews, I'm pretty easy going & forgiving about other places I've stayed. I guess I had high(er) expectations about HGV & walked away feeling kind of 'eh' about the rooms, staff and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “amazing holiday”
Reviews.Author: sivarila
Reviews.Content: for families with 5 or more this is the perfect condo big,has everything you need,great beds and kitchen and is easy to get to and from

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Orlando stay”
Reviews.Author: CathyPA
Reviews.Content: Great place. Rooms are large and nicely equiped. Lots of things for kids to do. Very nice pools. Large complex but a quick call to the front desk and a golf cart will be waiting to take you anywhere on property. Good location,close to all parks. VIP entrance to Seaworld,front of the line on major rides included with every stay. Free transportation to Seaworld. Discount tickets sold on the lobby. Very good restaurant site.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SouthernHospitality2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, so I can't speak to all of the amenities, but overall I was very satisfied with the property and service, especially for the rate I paid. ROOM - I got a recently renovated room for a very competitive rate - not sure what the un-renovated rooms look like, but I was very happy with mine. It was a studio room with a king bed and kitchenette. Bathroom a little on the small side, but still fine. Very clean room/bathroom with new/decent furniture, fairly comfortable bed, free wi-fi. Had a balcony over-looking the tennis courts; no problems with noise. No complaints about the room, really. Only drawback might have been that the family next to me was cooking something one night with a strong odor, and this seemed to make it's way through our double adjoining doors, but it was only temporary. PROPERTY - Location cannot be beat for access to Sea World; you can walk there in just a few minutes. Also very convenient to Universal Studios and I-Drive. Overall the property was in pretty good shape, although some areas (like elevators) could use a bit more cleaning. Keep in mind that this is a vacation-club type property, so some of it may seem a bit impersonal or industrial in nature, but overall it was pleasant. SERVICE - didn't interact with too many employees, but the ones I did encounter were great. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful - check-in was speedy. One of the bellhops gave me a ride in the golf cart back to my building from the restaurant because it was raining. Nice guy. Bartender at pool bar/restaurant was OK - food average at best (and somewhat expensive). Made a decent drink though. AMENITIES - can't say much about this as I was staying there on business, but the pools, fitness room, tennis courts, etc. all looked to be in good shape. There's also a convenience store on site (pricey, but convenient), business center, kids activities, etc. OVERALL - if you are going to Sea World or other nearby parks, and can get a competitive rate for a renovated room, I would definitely stay there (if saving money matters to you). Certainly not the grandest place in all of Orlando, but a terrific value for the money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mapping_Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a sales pitch deal. While we were not interested in purchasing a share in their other property, our stay at HGV Seaworld was excellent. Having a kitchen was crucial, we found it extremely well stocked with cooking items and lacked for nothing. Our vacation was spent mostly on the property, swimming in the pools, using the playground equipment, having the older kid participate in activities and going for walks. We secured a 2 room suite for our family of 4. Our 6 year old son had what amounted to his own hotel room as our suite adjoined another room to make it a "2 room". He was in heaven. The furnishings reminded me of my grandparents condo in Vero Beach, lots of yellow. It was very comfortable, the staff was fantastic and this is a perfect spot for exploring Seaworld. The hotel provided a shuttle to Universal Studios so that was nice as well. We used a van service to get from the airport to the hotel rather than renting a car. It worked extremely well. The van even stopped at the grocery store for us. It was so convenient having a van waiting for us rather than using a waiting for a shuttle or renting a car. The property we toured was far fancier and modern but if we went back, we'd stay at the HGV Seaworld. It embodies our vision of vacationing in Florida, without the ocean. There is a CVS Pharmacy a block or so away which is much less expensive than the on site store for sundries and it is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: carefreecruises
Reviews.Content: This is our family tradition to stay here. We are owners of HGVC and we would have to say that of the 3 properties we like this one the best. Each caters to a specific crowd. When we go to Orlando we usually do one park and then hang out and just enjoy the resort. With that being said the resort is more then just a bed to us. We look at the big picture for activities for all ages. This has a great kids club, bingo, cards, dance lessons, exercise classes, wine and beer tastings, a movie theater and dive in movies. I think for kids and families this is the best Hilton resort, with the International drive second, and Parc Sole third. They are constantly remodeling, cleaning, updating. Staff is helpful. A little too pushy with the sales pitches even if you are an owner. Otherwise we enjoy our stay always!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nay22
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 and we stayed in 3 separate units. HGVC was able to accommodate us in a newer building close to the swimming pools (Hamilton Building) and was also able to put us all on the same floor. We were on the 5th floor and never had to wait very long for the elevator. The resort location was great for SeaWorld & Aquatica (just across the street) although we did not go to either of those. Most of our time was spent at Disney World which was still very close by, approx. a 10 - 15 min. drive. The resort is also near to 2 Premium Outlets. One is a 5 min drive and the other 15 min. Publix & Walmart are a few minutes away as are many restaurants and fast food chains. Our 2 bdrm unit was very spacious and the furnishings were still very new: flat screen TVs, great dining area where all 8 of us gathered a few times for dinner, huge master ensuite, DVD players, wireless internet, jacuzzi tub, etc. Our unit overlooked 2 pools and on a couple afternoons the music & activity down by the pool area was very loud. The windows are not well insulated and you can hear everything. If you have kids that nap then it is a bit tricky. We turned on the bathroom fan for some white noise which helped a little. Overall it wasn't too bad and given the pool is open till 11 p.m. it was never noisy at night. The drapes, however, let in a lot of light at the top (by the curtain rods) which made it hard for our child to nap and the morning light didn't allow any of us to sleep in. All that being said, we had a great stay and would definitely visit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I remember it...which isn't necessarily a good thing”
Reviews.Author: essenceofshe
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from our sunny Florida vacation were we made a return stay at Hilton Grand Vacations Club (HGVC) at SeaWorld. As I was planning this vacation, I decided we'd skip the busy crowds and lines at the amusement parks (besides, we've done them all already) and enjoy the vast amenities and activites offered at this resort style hotel. The resort grounds are immaculate. We could see continual care and upkeep being done throughout our stay so absolutely no complaint there. The resort's three pools were also well maintained. And happily there was always enough seating for all three of us each day. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was definitely enough space for our family of three. It was clean and very comfortable. Housekeeping didn't come everyday but then again our needs were few so the days they did ring the doorbell it was right on time. I was a little sad to see that no updates had been done (at least not in the suite we were in) with respect the the decor. The suite had two rather small tube televisions (Not LCD flat screen) and early 90's "Golden Girls" furniture. Now, I'm not so much of a hotel snob were this is a major deal breaker for me but with so much building, expansion and lodging competition in Florida it would have been cool to see some updates done since my last stay 7 years ago! Remember, I mentioned I decided we'd skip the amusement parks and instead enjoy the vast activites offered at the resort?? Well, there was a daily schedule of events but none were very much fun or very well attended. Please don't misunderstand, the activities staff is FANTASTIC but the activites just weren't as varied or exciting as I remember them being. My children and I loved the movie theatre and dive-in movies (what happened to the popcorn that used to be offered???) but I can see a movie anywhere. My daughter loved being at the pool but day after day of the SAME THING, she was left asking, "Mommy, is this all there is?" My son showed up at the basketball court for activites and was the only one there! This has more to do I think with guests than staff but my guess is if other activities on the schedule were awesome, guest would be excited to attend. This is definitely an area where HGVC needs to be tightened up! Maybe model actitivites after those found on cruise ships. You almost have to be that persistant and perky to get some people amped to participate. So, maybe you're asking yourself, if she didn't love the room decor, if housekeeping didn't show up everday, if the activities weren't all that great and the pools were just ho-hum, why did she score this place a "EXCELLENT?" Two words...THE STAFF!!! Each day I drove onto the resort property I was eagerly greeted by front gate reception with a warm smile and "Welcome Home." Every single staff member we passed on the grounds greeted us with a genuinely friendly "Hello." I can't tell you a time where I've checked in/out of a hotel and didn't feel rushed at the front desk and actually enjoyed speaking to the front desk clerks. The activites staff did their best to engage everyone and encourage them to have fun. Sadly, I guess some people go on vacation prefer to be left alone :-( Mind you, I was visiting Florida at a time where back home was expereincing an unheard of 5.9 earthquake and hurricane Irene so I wasn't able to get home when or as planned. HGVC was able to extend our reservation at the same low, low rate we had originally, staff members checked in on us to see if we were able to make arrangements to get home, activities staff were GREAT with my kids. I think they saw I was growing concerned about not being able to get home and didn't want my children to be concerned. This and reasons I haven't listed is why I stayed and will return to HGVC at SeaWorld!!! Next visit, I may incorporate a Plan B for activities though :-) Happy Lodging!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cmego
Reviews.Content: This resort is large. Only three pools, two pools allow kids. Building 8 has a pool and they call it the quiet pool. Great locatation. One restaurant on property not our favorite but ok in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travelers Wont Like It”
Reviews.Author: Jafo19D
Reviews.Content: I stay here every week for business travel. Compared to other Hilton properties I have stayed at it is the worst, however that does not mean it is horrible. I stay here because I get an extra 2k points/stay for them not having breakfast available even though I have Diamond status Checking In - If you have HH status it will never be acknowledged during check in. If you have perks because you are Diamond you have to remind them. They don't even recognize you as a returning guest like they seem to be able to do in other properties. The clerks are all polite except for one that checked me in last Sunday at around midnight. Staff - The clerks are very polite but not necessarily friendly. The rest of the staff is very friendly and warm. Rooms - I stay in the basic suites which have a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and plates/utensils/glasses for 2 people. The walls are thin and you can hear everything from adjoining rooms. The rooms' decor is ugly, I guess what you would expect from a vacation style place. The elevators are horribly slow and there is only one per building so I learned to get rooms on the 1st floor. Most of the rooms have Cleanliness - I'd say about 80% of the time there is an issue. The worst was checking in and seeing hairs all over the bed (and not from the head). Other times you can see wrappers, food that was not vacuumed from a previous stay. I've had rooms with dirty stained towels. I will say that I now look for bedbugs in all hotels and have never seen evidence of these critters in my rooms. Points: It takes forever to get points posted to your HH account and I've had to contact them to resolve missing stays. Other: The hotel is gated but every night some delivery clown is slipping a flyer under my door. On Tuesday night they called the cops on one guy doing that, a maid told me that they can't seem to stop these guys from trespassing and the next day I got a few more flyers. For people with kids it seems to be a good place, they have activities and the pools seem to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more!”
Reviews.Author: szkut
Reviews.Content: We got this at a great rate, and although reading some mixed reviews just thought we would book it as it was a self catered room. Kitchen, washer, dryer and even the spa bath. Well all those bad reviews were quickly forgotten once we arrived. Great quick check in, free parking and not to mention the massive room with more than what we could have asked for. The resort is massive and can be a good walk if you get a room away from the main lobby (which is what we got). The parking lot did fill up by the weekend but we found no problem getting a spot. Its in a great location to explore all of Orlando. Lots of activities for families especially the children. The only minor issue is the rooms being a little dated, but seems they are renovating a lot of them at the moment. We also got the complimentary fast pass for seaworld and the free shuttle. Staff were very helpful with everything and even printed and faxed some documents i needed done for work. Now that is very rare these days! For somewhere to stay at a great rate with good facilities you could not ask for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Mimoskha
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, Orlando has a lot more to offer than just Disney World (which I do love). But an Orlando vacation can get pricey, between park admission, hotel stays and meals. HGVC Sea World provided a great value for our family (mom, dad, teenage son and pre-teen daughter). Now, if you are the kind of person that expects your bed to be made every day and expects fresh towels daily while on vacation, this is probably not the place for you. As a timeshare resort, you only get one full cleaning during a one week stay. But in exchange you essentially get a "home away from home" complete with a full kitchen, a washer and dryer and plenty of space for a family at a price far below what you'd pay to stay at a comparable Disney resort. The kitchen was nicely appointed with pretty much all the cooking tools, pots and pans and dishes you'd need. They also provided several packets of coffee and coffee filters as well as several packets of dishwasher detergent and liquid dishsoap. All you needed to do was supply whatever food you wanted! There was a small (but pricey) market on site, which was good in a pinch, as well as a large Publix grocery store about a mile away. This really helped us keep our meal costs down. We did have a couple of lunches at the poolside grille, which had a somewhat limited menu but the food was good and the portions were very large. We also appreciated that the kids had their own bedroom (and they each had their own bed) , with their own bathroom, television and balcony. That allowed some "quiet time" for mom and dad, and also meant that if we wanted to stay up but the kids wanted to sleep (or vice versa), it could be done without disrupting the others (which would be a problem if the four of us were staying in a single hotel room). Having laundry facilities in the unit was great -- it allowed us to pack lighter since we could do laundry at any time. They provided one packet of laundry detergent but would provide more upon request. Additionally, there were several pools on site. The two main pools (the waterfall pool and the fountains pool) were clean and had plenty of comfortable chairs to lounge in. There were also some covered areas with tables and chairs where you could eat in the shade. The pools were never crowded and we never had a problem getting chairs no matter what time we arrived at the pool area. They also had several of poolside activities (bingo, dive in movies, hair braiding, water aerobics, occasionally live music) that added to the fun. Additionally, there was a deck that went out over the lake (you could not go in the lake for a reason you will see in a minute), and one of my daughter's favorite things to do was to walk to the end of the dock to see the alligator! Yes, I said alligator. There was an alligator, numerous fairly large turtles, and fish in the lake, and the alligator was quite fun to watch. Also, this property has a partnership with Sea World (which is literally across the street) where you can get a free "Ultimate Quick Queue" pass. This is similar to the Disney Fastpass and allows you a separate, go straight-to-the-front-of-the-line pass for the more popular rides at Sea World. You can also buy these at Sea World but I think they cost $20-25 per person. You just have to ask for these at the concierge desk the day before (we never had problems getting one) and it is so worth it! It was pretty hot when we were there (late August) and it saved us $80-100 per day since we didn't have to buy them. There is also a free shuttle (it is more like a city bus than a small shuttle) that goes between this property, a couple other nearby Hilton properties, and Sea World and Aquatica. We walked to Sea World but did use the shuttle to return to the hotel when it got too hot to walk. You can get the shuttle schedule at the concierge desk and we found that it ran on schedule. We also drove to a couple of the Disney parks a couple of times and found it to be a pretty quick 10 minute drive, and we were always able to find a parking spot close to our building when we returned. My only complaint was that there was one slow and very hot elevator for our building. I wish they would improve the air conditioning for the elevator, and the slow speed would be far more tolerable if it weren't so sweltering inside. Maybe next time we'll ask for a unit closer to the ground level (we were on the fifth floor). Bottom line - this is a great option for a family that wants room to spread out, wants the ability to cook and do laundry to keep costs down, wants to be close to the parks (but doesn't want to pay an arm and a leg for it) and wants to come home at the end of the day to a place where you could relax poolside or join in on some fun activities if you want to. My kids are already asking when we'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Basically good!”
Reviews.Author: AliDUk
Reviews.Content: We basically liked this resort but only really slept there due to our hectic schedule! At check in were disappointed to be told we wouldn’t be receiving the free breakfast we had booked with our room. (We will be taking that up with Hilton directly.) 3 out of our 5 requests had been met, high floor, away from the elevators, newly renovated room. Not a view of Sea world or close to the main hospitality house/pool. But that’s just being picky! Room was ok, we had to use the sofa bed which when out made it very difficult to move around the room and get to the balcony. (Useful for drying things on after using the free laundry.) It was nice to have a fridge. Oh yes, the lift is so slow and hot!

Reviews.Title: “A family friendly destination that even a couple could love...”
Reviews.Author: AdvicePro
Reviews.Content: Thisvhuge sprawling resort has all sorts if amenities to entertain: pools, waterfalls, fitness center, walking path, store, pizza delivery, restaurant/bar, big lobby, and enormous suites. The rooms are large... Especially the suites that have full kitchens. Washer/dryers, dining area, 2 lg flat screen TV's -- one w DVD player, king size bed, double sink vanities and another small vanity sink area, large enclosed shower, and in bedroom spa jacuzzi tub! Wow! I could live here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: winifredScotland
Reviews.Content: We had one week at Daytona Beach at a relatives house and came down to Orlando for 4 nights and then went back for another week to Daytona. We ended up increasing our stay by another night as we liked the hotel so much. It was very central for all attractions. We had only booked a one bedroom and with two teenage girls was not sure if this would be big enough but I neednt have worried, the sitting room is big and they found the sofa bed comfortable. The kitchen for a hotel room was amazing kept spotlessly clean, and I am very fussy, and it had everything,washing machine, dryer dishwasher and huge fridge freezer with ice machine, plenty of wardrobe space and a lovely screened patio to sit out at breakfast. The pool area was very nice, check out the lake behind the pool it had amazing turtles that swam to the surface to feed, very cute. Also there is entertainment at the poolside the best was the guy who sang and made up songs about the children based on where they were from etc I was so upset he wasnt there again as I wanted him to make up a song about me! that would really have embarrassed the girls! My only slight gripe would be they made us wait till 4 o'clock for checking in, I know it states this but usually most places let you in earlier and we felt in a hotel this size it was a wee bit slow, but that was our only negative. I felt housekeeping did such a good job I tipped extra and I'm Scottish so I dont do that lightly ! would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice way to spend our 40th Wedding Anniversary......”
Reviews.Author: Dale T
Reviews.Content: We found our room clean, bright and very enjoyable. Housekeeping was terrific. We enjoyed sandwiches at the pool area and also pizza one night. The outdoor movie for the children, made the pool (the one with the HUGE STONE WATERFALL) practically empty and very quiet. Good thinking, Hilton!! The walk around the lake was very nice. Our only complaint was that the elevator in the Hamilton building was very slow and HOT. The hotel was close to everything we planned on doing........like having our anniversary dinner at Emeril's/City Walk........!! Thank you for a great memory. D&K

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, clean newer accomadations but too much smoking”
Reviews.Author: adoiron
Reviews.Content: we stayed here because of the perks for seaworld (shuttle, quick que) and mostly it was an excellent place to stay. the shuttle wasn't frequent (about 90 mins inbetween) but it was spot on for time. we always got the quick que for seaworld since we followed their advice and got it 1 day ahead. we weren't pressured to do a timeshare tour. the renovated room we were given had a newer kitchen, sofa, bed so it was very nice. this location was so close to seaworld we actually walked back one afternoon as we had missed the shuttle. now the cons: housekeeping was short on staff and our room wasn't cleaned until after 3pm every day which is the time we'd be coming back from the parks to rest. very inconvenient and our room was right outside the housekeeping closet so we know they started early in the day. it is a very big resort and very understaffed i hated that smoking was allowed by the pool area. all the units (in my bldg) were nonsmoking yet i had to inhale second hand smoke by the pool every day. and there was alot of smoking poolside, so much so that we had to move to a different area of the pool complex on several occasions. there is no lifeguard so kids are running and jumping into the pool. sometimes on top of people in the pool. there is a sign "no horseplay" but no one at the pool to enforce it. consequently it was the wild west and very rowdy. and one day i saw a woman take her shirt off and put her bikini top on right in front of the lounge chairs! it was nuts! not what i am used to from staying at the disney vacation clubs. the pool complex is stunning (2 pools, one w/fountain, one w/waterfall) plus 4-5 hot tubs and a kiddy pool but not having reasonable rules of behavior or the staff to enforce any rules is a huge detraction

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Janetporter101
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two weeks at the end of July, overall we were pleased with our stay. Only complaint we had was that we came home after staying a night in Miami to find our door open. Nothing was taken so it was obviously left open by housekeeping but we were very unhappy and we had been away and the rooms were not cleaned everyday so it could have been left open from the day before. We reported it to recption and they sent a security man down who siad he would investigate what happened and let us know, he never reported back though. Air conditioning was good and towels are provided at the pool. Our studio was in block 9 which was about a 7 minute walk from recption, most people got golf carts to bring them up and down. There was a small pool near our block so we didn't have to make the trek to the main pool. Quite a walk to idrive but there is an iride stop near the gate but waiting times could be 20mins and usually full.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and clean........”
Reviews.Author: Manny R
Reviews.Content: One bedroom unit with kitchen was great for our family of 4. Plenty of room. Place was very clean and I am a fanatic about that. Service good. Didn't like restaurant. Menu not great for kids and very limited. Otherwise, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: funtravel3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family of four on May '11. The room was in perfect shape and extremely clean. I booked a one bedroom suite and had plenty space to accommodate the four of us. The size of the sofa bed was perfect for my two kids (ages 5 and 8) and the bed in the main bedroom was very comfortable. My wife appreciated having the Jacuzzi especially for after the long walks through the parks. The staff was very friendly and was always willing to help. Overall it was an excellent stay, and I look forward to stay again the next time I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad...”
Reviews.Author: cpuuri
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is beautiful. The rooms are a bit dated...not terrible, but not great. The King Suite was very spacious--full kitchen, dinette, living room with pullout couch (decent mattress), bedroom has a double whirlpool tub, bathroom has a corner shower and double sinks. Our family of 4 never felt cramped. Best of all, they have a washer and dryer and provide free powdered soap! We could have left half our clothes at home!!! The pool area is great! They have a pool table, ping pong, shuffle board, two pools, 3 whirlpools, decent work out center, an activity center and bar/restaurant right by the pool. They have movie night every night. Sometimes it is at the pool and other times it is in the theater. They have daily activities for young children. My wife was so impressed by the hospitality. One person even bought our daughter swim goggles when she lost hers. They are on a pond with a small alligator, blue gills, and turtles that hang out by the pier waiting for food. As for the bad, I already mentioned the rooms are dated. The TVs are tube and one was having issues. We were on the first floor and one morning we discovered two 2-3 inch palmetto bugs in your room. Management promptly sprayed all entrances to our room. I would recommend requesting a room on an upper floor. No one apologized and some even said "that happens this time of year." Housekeeping was very inconsistent. They didn't replace all towels despite taking all of the dirty ones each day. They neglected to leave behind a roll of toilet paper when we were running low. They forgot to replace the laundry soap a few days, until we wrote a note. All in all, I could live with those annoyances and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: billyboy94
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at HGV at SeaWorld was enjoyable. The staff were very friendly and helpful.We planned to only visit SeaWorld and Aquatica and hang by the pool on this trip and this was a great spot for that.The main pool area had two pools with daily entertainment and activities for kids and adults that made for a fun and upbeat times at one pool and the other was a quieter pool. We were in a one bedroom with a comfy king bed with a jacuzzi tub (kids loved that),full kitchen,queen couch bed (also comfy),flat screens and screened in porch.The room was very clean and had all that we needed. They also give you free Quick Queue pass to SeaWorld which lets skip to the front of the line,used it and walked onto any ride i wanted to,a great time saver.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Family holiday Resort”
Reviews.Author: lanospatel
Reviews.Content: Being joint with Seaworld and under the Hilton name I was definitely under the impression that this hotel would be child friendly as well as luxurious. It may have somewhat met the luxurious assumption but not so much being child friendly, due to the poor layout of the apartment buildings. The room was very spacious: one bedroom with adjoining jacuzzi bath, separate bathroom, big living area including dining table, and a kitchenette. I would recommend this type of room for only two people sharing the main bed; we had a family of four sharing, 2 of which had to sleep on the most uncomfy pull out sofa bed known to man - on the other hand the main bed was extremely comfortable and spacious! The lobby was very grand, leading onto the large pool area, which included several pools/jacuzzis, a children's playground, a tennis/badminton court and pool tables, all within close proximity to eachother. However the majority of pools and the deckchairs surrounding them were completely exposed to the sun, with hardly anything in any sort of shade; in heat like Florida, this was unbearable - my feet were scolded just walking from my deckchair to the nearest pool!!! The layout of the hotel buildings meant that to get to the pool area we needed to cross two car parks, and we were one of the closer buildings to the central lobby area!! If you can, definitely request a building close to the central area! Personally I would not impressed with this hotel at all, and would definitely not pay Hilton prices for it again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: samlydia
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at Hilton Grand International but we took chance on this Hilton Grand because we were taking two 18yrs and needed more space. We were slightly early but had ready room but I asked for renovated room so they said sure would be a little wait and they would call when ready we could go to pool area and walk around. Wait turn out to be only 10mins. We were still in lobby looking around. Check in was a breeze. Get to room and couldn't believe how nice and large room was. We had 2br/2bath suite. Was not disappointed at all. Only flaw was ac in master suite didn't get as cold as we would like when we closed bedroom door but there was ceiling fan so that helped. Loved that both bedrooms had separate patios/balconies. There are 2 very nice pools next to each other and kiddie pool and separate quiet pool couple bulidings over (although they are at most 5ft deep) my son is over 6ft tall so he prefers deeper pools. We ordered chicken nachos at poolside and have to admit it was quite good and it was $12 but it was more than enough for 2 people. Service and security was great. This Hilton does have way more available parking than Hilton at international so if you stay out late still will get parking space pretty close to your building and if you are going to Seaworld or Discovery Cove this is the perfect place to stay because Seaworld is directly across the street and Discovery cove is maybe block and a half from Hilton. Hilton International gets a little higher rating due to location to outlet mall (i love to shop) can walk to almost everything but this Hilton is only down by a few points. We loved our stay and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay ... Great employees and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bocaguy46
Reviews.Content: very clean rooms, I got to see my friend Terry Gallardo there working he is the director of Maintenance, I worked with Terry at Marriott, I want to say the Hotel is great , so great I did not want to leave it was like being at home and the resteraunts where superb 5 star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Have been here with the family twice. Absolutely love it!”
Reviews.Author: jimjenhegs
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous grounds, beautiful rooms and perfect location. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A great place; we will return”
Reviews.Author: rosadekor
Reviews.Content: HGV at SeaWorld Orlando is a top notch resort. The amenities are first class, the units are very spacious and beautifully furnished, the pools (several) are large and accommodate large numbers of guests easiy. There were always adequate lounge chairs, umbrellas, paviilion seating for those seeking shade and tables. fun things for the kids and adults, family movies at nite, live entertainment often, special activities. There was a lot to do or you could just relax. Poolside beverage service was available as well as a lovely cafe on site serving tasty food for lunch, dinner or drinks at reasonable prices with good service. The staff was helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. You can walk to SeaWorld from the resort and Disneyworld and Universal Studios are a short drive away. There is a small grocery store, with counter service food on site but for a large grocery selection, you would need to drive. The same is true for area restaurants which are many and varied but require a car. There is a shuttle to the nearby attractions but it runs only a few times a day and we found driving easier except for SeaWorld. This resort is a great place to return to after a hectic day at the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, wasn't long enough”
Reviews.Author: JimmySue66
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in April in the Orlando area, at three different facilities. My husband attended a conference at a nearby resort, standard hotel room, one bathroom. We then spent four nights at another nearby two bedroom condo. When we arrived for our stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation at Sea World, in a two bedroom unit, we were blown away by the condition and amenities. The decor is light and airy, a perfect fit with color and comfort for Florida. The screened balconies are a dream. The main off the living room and master bedroom. Our adult children in the second bedroom had one of their own! Boy was I surprised when I opened the kitchen cabinet to find Fiesta ware, not in a typical condo kitchen inventory . Our most wonderful surprise where the sofa beds. The most comfortable sofa beds in the world. We would seriously consider staying here again when we have the entire family with us just for the sofa bed alone. The regular beds were quite comfortable also. I noticed that they down comforters in our unit were by Pacific Coast. Due to our schedule we were not able to enjoy the main pool at the resort, however, we did walk around the facility and the pool looked wonderful. The resort was getting ready to host a "dive-in" movie. The building we were in did have a slow elevator which was humorous to us at times. If we didn't want to slow down to enjoy the ride, we took the stairs. We hope to return to Hilton Grand Vacations at Sea World again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and would love to return”
Reviews.Author: mfeehily
Reviews.Content: Just home from a stay at the Hitlon VC at Seaworld. We were in a renovated one bedroom unit close to the main pool and activity centre. Thr kitchen and washer -dryer were very handy as I have little or no washing to do now that I amback home. The location is great, very central and close to Seaworld, Premier Outlets and loads of restaurants. The facilities in the hotel were top notch with our 8 year old preferring to go to the childrens activities at the pool to the theme parks! Would definitely return to HVC at Seaworld if returning to Orlando but would plan to spend more time relaxing at the pool than buying loads of days at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand About this Stay”
Reviews.Author: DC_NOVATraveler
Reviews.Content: There was truly nothing grand about this Hilton Grand Vacations resort. I'm not too picky but this has to be ranked as poor as it certainly did not live up to expectations. The property is split into several buildings. Ours was far away from the main lobby and pool - so the only time we visited that area was during check in. Our building had well over 100 rooms (could give an exact number), all of which relied on one, very slow, very stuffy and old elevator. I'm not exaggerating when I say it could take 3 or 4 minutes for the one elevator to come. There are only exterior entrances and no interior corridors. The room was sub-par. I would put it slightly below Holiday Inn - not what I would expect from the Hilton brand. It was certainly not comfortable and there was nothing special about it (though a few dishes were provided in the 'kitchenette', but maid service didn't clean the few dirty glasses we used - I guess that's fine, but it was unexpected). There was an extremely noisy air unit in the ceiling that would jolt us awake in the night - and we're hard sleepers. We had asked specifically to stay in the recently remodeled section - don't know if this was, but I hope they don't consider that remodeled. So without going on, you get what you pay for. It was a relatively inexpensive stay, but certainly not what we expected from the Hilton brand. I, for one, will look elsewhere since there is such a plethora of available options in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing to great.”
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Nothing special. Pools are nice. Restaurant food (around the pool) is good. Mahi Mahi sandwich was fantastic. Service was nothing special. Salad dressing is in pre-packaged plastic containers. "Studio rooms" are not like studio suites at regular hotels. They are essentially small to average-sized hotel rooms with an empty refrigerator and a microwave oven. They provide dishes and silverware. No shuttle to Disney, but walking distance to Sea World. If you're here on a Disney vacation, stay somewhere else. There are plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and will hopefully come back one day”
Reviews.Author: Stevenley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family and friends - total 4 adults and 4 children (aged from 4 to 7). We couldnt have wished for a better place to base our stay in Orlando. Location is ideally placed for all the attractions (Especially Seaworld which we loved) Atmosphere at the place was great and rooms were perfect for what we required. We had 2 x 2 bedroom units and these had just been recently renovated to a high standard, facilities in the room were great and had all the needed for the stay. Only downside was the lift for our top floor apartment broke for a few days but they had someone waiting at the bottom to give out free water and candy for the kids for the inconvienence. Problem was fixed in a couple of days and we received regular updates on this. Pool area was great and had lots of activities going on. Bar / Restaurant wasn’t anything fancy but you have loads of other restaurants on I-drive if you need something a bit more up market. On the whole delighted we chose this place to stay and would definatley come back if we returned to Florida in the next few years.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mommy48386
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here this past week. It was our first time. It is a great location if you are doing the Sea World parks. It was so nice to get in our car and be back to our hotel in a matter of a few minutes. We stayed in a 3 bedroom. We were on the 6th floor of the Sandy bldg. Would have liked to have been a bit closer to the pool, but we could see Sea World's fireworks from our room. The pool area was very clean. The staff were the most friendliest I have ever encountered. Everyone always said hello and always went out if their way to help you. One complaint...their elevators are not air-conditioned. They were so hot to be in. That is unacceptable in Florida. Hope they get that changed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: janella22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations for three days while visiting Aquatica. We had our children and grandchildren and we stayed in three rooms. We wanted to be in the same building so we could be close to each other. The staff did everything they could to accomodate us, although we had to wait a short time for the rooms to be ready it was well worth it. The rooms were wonderful, roomy and clean. We stayed in building 8 which was a little distance from the lobby and pools, but they had golf carts driving around picking up passengers. It was very convenient and the kids loved riding on the carts. There was another pool right by building 8, which was more quiet and not so crowded. The children enjoyed that pool in the evening and was quite nice. The free shuttle to Aquatica was very timely and saved us from driving our car. The pools were great and there was always something fun for the children to do, like tye dying shirts, hoola hoop contests, music and much more. This was a very memorable stay for all of us. Would definately do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Third time is not the charm!”
Reviews.Author: Djwana
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this resort. The first 2 times were great, but I guess they have lowered their standards. We stayed here from Sunday- Saturday for our Disney Vacation and in the past had no problem with them cleaning the room, but on 2 seperate occasions house keeping came to clean the room and we were not ready to depart and I asked if they could come back at a specific time and when we returned from our days at Disney- the room was not clean. When you have been at Disney or our sightseeing all day, the last thing you want to come back to is a room that is not clean especially when you specifically told them you wanted housekeeping. Well there was a message on the answering serive saying the "privacy sign was on the door" so they did not clean. That was a TOTAL lie! Someone was trying to get out of work! Needless to say someone was cleaning that room that evening. This happened again but on this occasion all I asked was for someone to come and get the soiled towels and trash out off the room and this person proceeded to tell me that there was a place on the floor to put that stuff and use my room key- well I hung up on that person and called for the manger of the hotel. She was very apologetic and sent someone to do it. We just wanted to come back "home" to a clean place after a day a Disney. I was a huge fan of Hilton grand Vacations at SeaWorld but after this experience I think we will find other accommodations that will \clean the room everyday without incident. I guess we outstayed our welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 4th of July week!!!”
Reviews.Author: earth0ne
Reviews.Content: All I will say is that this was a wonderful family vacation!! The hotel is a great place to stay if you have children! The kids enjoyed every bit of the hotel(from the hotel room to the pools) So, with that we will defintely go back next summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: GBFortLauderdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a studio at the HGVC Sea World property. The pro's first... If you are visiting Sea World, it is literally across the street and they provide free transportation to Sea World, saving you the $14 parking fee. The main pool area is great, tons to do for children. We ate one evening at the restaurant and enjoyed our meal and the entertainment they had around the pool area. They even were showing a "Dive-in" movie in the pool area on a big screen. Very fun for kids to swim and watch Shrek. Ok, so the con's... our feet were black from walking on the room carpet (gross!) and who still puts double beds in rooms? My husband and I, plus my toddler were scrunched all night. Even if she had slept in her pack and play, I would have still preferred for them to offer a queen size bed. Also, be aware, their elevators are super slow and we would spend 5 mins waiting for an elevator each day to get down stairs. Overall, I would still stay here again if we were visiting Sea World, but I would request a CLEAN ROOM and make sure the room had a Queen Size bed first. All of the staff we met, were very nice.
