Reviews.Title: “Nice and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: t-luvs2travel
Reviews.Content: My 1st impression of this place was its HUGE. I thought it was going to be more of a "hotel" feel. But this is a resort, with garden style building with suites, rooms etc... The hotel is very nice. Amenities are GREAT! And they have more than one pool. So even if you get a building on the opposite end of the resort, you'll be happy. The food at the main pool area is very good!! The market/deli is on point too, they have pretty much all of the necessities one would need (especially last minute items). They also have a shuttle that takes you to all of the amusement parks, although I didnt use that service (I rented a vehicle). They also have a gym with efficient equipment. The internet access was easily accessible. **2 downside is the housekeeping. They come to your room at different times of the day each day. One day our housekeeper came at 2pm-ish! The next day they came about 11am-ish

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family for base camp for all of Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: jobogie
Reviews.Content: What an unexpected surprise. The front desk, concierge, staff, pool activity staff were so friendly and attentive. We hung out at the pool 2 days because of the great activities(salsa dancing, ice cream floats, and movies in the pool at night). They have a theater inside, which the kids loved ( Yogi Bear), and we rented a new release movie to watch in the room. It is close to all parks and right across the street from Sea World. My kids rated it at the top of any property we have stayed at while on vacation. Staff was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Always great service”
Reviews.Author: JennyBuchan
Reviews.Content: Decided on last minute getaway with family and this property is always my first choice. Room was not ready as the hotel is sold out this weekend, but the front desk and everyone else is so nice it was ok. The property is large but spread out so you don't feel boxed in. We stayed in a queen studio in the Paget building this time although I must mention that this room is too small for a few more $$ if available go for the 1 bedroom well worth the difference. Mirka (sorry if spelled wrong) checked us in and was very helpful and nice despite a very rude gentleman next to us trashing the place because he did not have a reservation confirmation yet demanded they give him a room. EVeryone at the front desk handled this situation professionally to not allow this episode ruin their experience. The room although small is clean, it has a small kitchen area with coffee maker microwave and mini fridge. There is a small sink and it comes equipped with dishes and utensils- a plus with children. There is a small screened balcony over looking the preserves and very nice to sit out and enjoy a cup of coffee if you can handle the heat! I will always come back to this property when visiting Orlando. The location is fabulous right off I-4 and International Drive. There is a restaurant on property but I have never used it so I cannot comment. The swimming pools are large with plenty on clean new lounge chairs and towels. There is good dining and shopping in the area. Thank you for a very nice stay. Keep it up Hilton you are putting out a great product and the folks at this property deserve a high 5 for their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy, poor parking, not good for handicapped”
Reviews.Author: Today123
Reviews.Content: I arrived on crutches to the front desk to check in. The attendants at the front door watched me get out of my car and didn't get off their motorized carts to help. I went inside at 9:30 pm and had to wait in a line to speak to someone. They signed me in as if nothing was different about me and my mobility. No asking me what kind of accomodations I would need. I was sent to a building without offer to assist me with baggage that had a small amount of parking near the building (which was full) and my room was in the farthest portion of the building layout. At least it was on the ground floor. Then I found out that the ground floor was impossible to get any rest on. The doors are not well sound proofed and they are connected to cavernous walkways which echo even quiet conversations but there were little kids tired and crying from being at the park waiting for elevators and people coming back from being out that evening laughing and calling out to each other. It was like they were all in my room and I am normally a sound sleeper. I needed a shuttle to the airport and while they weren't far from the airport the best they could offer me was a contracted cab company that would cost $35-$40. I am a Hilton Honors member and stay at a lot of Hilton's. I did not feel like I had the Hilton experience. The grounds were pretty and they seemed to have a lot of activities to do, but the service and customer focus wasn't present. I wouldn't go back unless I had little kids who needed entertainment and wanted to be near Sea World and I would be on the highest floor and the fartherst from the elevator possible,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: Ahperryman
Reviews.Content: The pools and activities were awesome! The resort is located just across from Sea World, and we walked there two days. The rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable! I would recommend this resort for a family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Family Vacation at the HGVC Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Jocee_Joce
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older Hilton Grand Vacation resorts but forbeing 20 years old it was still very very nice. We had a 3 bed/3 bathroom room. The kitchen was very nicely appointed with service for 8 and some quite nice nonstick cookware. Older digital smooth top rang was great for cooking. We made about 80% of our meals there. It worked well for our family of 7. We really needed the jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom after those long days at the theme park. Setup and Layout of the pool area was quite nice. Adults could hang out in one of the many hot tubs there while watching the kids playing in the pool. We missed most of the events at the resort but we did some things like the beer tastings, the bingo, ice cream floats etc. Yesterday we even grilled out at the resorts BBQ grills. It was great. Beds had a plush pillowtop on what appeared to be a fairly firm mattress underneath. The only complaint I had was that the elevators were painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Jesuslovesme2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week. After requesting to switch rooms, the next was not much better. Furniture needs updated and fixed. Torn and wornout. The SLOWEST elevators ever, they take the garbage out in them so the smell remains. Stay somewhere else and spend your money wisely!!!

Reviews.Title: “My family & I plan to return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alemfam
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect! Resort/suite had everything we needed to ensure a perfect vacation! Great pools, beautiful landscaping, friendly staff, great location if visiting theme parks!!! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Disney adventure!”
Reviews.Author: WeThreeAdventurers
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a quiet side street, but close to all the attractions...we loved staying here. Our room had a full kitchen and two separate bedrooms plus living area. Such comfort after tiring days at Disney! The property is walking distance to Sea World and an easy drive to all of the Disney parks. Very close to International Drive, too, for anything you may need. It is also conveniently located to the airport. The property and rooms were very clean and well done. Since this is a part of Hilton Grand Vacations, there are also many "resort" activities available as well. We were there for Halloween and they had a party for the kids with fun and games that my daughter (4 1/2) enjoyed so much, she did not even realized she was missing trick-or-treating at home with her friends. There were many other kids in attendance, too, all decked out in their costumes. The property is also gated, with security driving around on golf carts on a regular basis. Next time we head back to Disney World...we are staying here. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome home.”
Reviews.Author: caylas24
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival you door is opened for you, and you hear, "Welcome home." From there, we were always greeted with a smile and the staff were very helpful. Rooms are gorgeous. Would love to come again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent, Excelent, Excelent”
Reviews.Author: nuryruz93
Reviews.Content: Great time, well located, clean, very very friendly staff. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you are a cash customer”
Reviews.Author: Crack-O-Noon
Reviews.Content: My wife traveled to Orlando for work recently. I found a great rate here and so we got a one bedroom for less than many places are charging for a plain hotel room. This is a Hilton Timeshare property. While I really like the property, I will warn that the Hilton timeshare product is overpriced. You can buy points on the open market for 20-25 cents on the dollar and get the special "Gold" status (which is nice) through a Hilton credit card. With that said, we were not pressured to take part in any timeshare promotion, except for a brief pitch when my wife checked in. I think the best comparision is to compare our room to ones we've had at the Disney Vacation Club. We were in a recently renovated room, and I found the Hilton room to be much nicer, although I'm not sure how well it will hold up to heavy use over the next several years. The buildings are six stories high, and as a result everyone gets to be near the pool, bar and so forth; unlike SSR and OKW at Disney, where everything is so spread out that makes everything a real chore. There were two pools, side by side, one with a waterfall. There was no slide. There is a wide sidewalk going around a small lake or large pond. The bar/restaurant had pretty good food. We didn't watch a movie in the movie theater, but there are movies every night. And it's an easy drive to lots of restaurants. Overall we were very happy with our stay. I think they failed to credit us our advance deposit on our bill and we didn't realize it until we left, and we have to work that out. Also, our HHonors points have not posted yet and so we are having to go through the hassle of getting them. But the resort was such a value that I am not holding that against them in my rating. Floridays is a very popular condo resort with a much better location in relation to WDW than this property. But location aside, I rate this property as a much nicer resort. I'm just providing this view for those who may have been to Floridays. Choosing which resort to stay at depends on cost and location as well. It is highly likely that we will stay again, either here or at another Hilton Vacation resort. On cash, though, not as members.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Luxury”
Reviews.Author: GWMom
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Orlando. I had listened to the pitch from a Hilton Vacation Club representative but had low expectations. But i was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly, always smiling and helpful. The room was much bigger & nicer than I expected. I thought we were getting a typical 2 room suite but we got a full 2 bedroom condo unit with 2 baths. Perfect for 2 teenage daughters. The concierge got us discount tickets to SeaWorld and we walked the 3 blocks to the park. We sent the girls to Harry Potter/Universal with the free tickets we got at the Vacation Club pitch. Next time we will rent a car. Orlando is very spread out. There is a convenience store on the property but it is expensive. There is a Publix down the road but we didn't know it was there until we were taking the shuttle back to the airport. And yes, we did buy into the Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cliftonduo925
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are going to Sea World. Nice staff, beautiful grounds, and good rooms. Very family friendly! I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A resort beyond my highest expectations...without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: pengwn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ Hilton Grand vacation for 3 days. I chose the hotel via tripadvisor reviews and the fact that it is a Bermuda themed resort. The reviews were pretty much spot on..our experience was amazing...first and foremost, every employee from the valet to the front desk was genuinely pleasant and made sure to ask us if we were enjoying our stay and did we need anything. Any hotel employee we passed here and there greeted us with a hello, or a smile. The grounds were impeccable, I felt as if I was back in Bermuda as I walked around to the awesome pools, or the trails between buildings. There is abundant seating and tables with umbrellas by the 2 beautiful pools, various hot tubs and kiddie pools.... We ate at the Grille by the pool, also good! Beds very comfy, kitchenette helpful with refrig and microwave, room spacious. Nicely located across from Seaworld, but you are unaffected by traffic. The resort is away from the hustle and bustle of Int'l drive, not too far away that you can't hop the free trolley though. Its a family oriented resort, so children are abound...p.s. awesome kids playground, with cushioned floor under an enormous open air tent! Adjoining rooms with kids can be heard , but luckily our neighbors turned in soon after arriving in...wasnt a problem. Overall a luxury resort with many amenities, pools, health club and places to go to besides just your room. Highly recommend this hotel and will return. A completely enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay... would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Zell
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Grand Vacation Club owners and have always found the club properties to be excellent. We were not disappointed with this property as well. The grounds are beautiful, the 2 bedroom condo was nicely decorated, although we would have preferred a better view which had been requested. (I'm not sure the front desk receptionist was all that familiar with the views of the units. Housekeeping did not come on the day expected and we had to call to ensure that the condo was serviced the next day which it was. (If you stay 7 days, you're supposed to get housekeeping service on the 4th day.) Security was present on the grounds at all times. We appreciated the gate keeper automatically opening the gate for us when they saw we had a hang tag for the car. The location is convenient, all though it can be a little confusing to get to... perhaps we just got turned around easily. We spent very little time in the condo as there are so many things to do in the Orlando area in addition to the more popular theme parks. One day we drove to Daytona Beach and tour the race track. Another day we drove to Mt. Dora and spent time in the quaint Victorian town. Still another day we drove south to visit the Bok Tower and to hear the carrillion concert. On another day we drove to St. Petersburg and toured the Salvador Dali Museum and also the new Chuily Collection. So if you're interested in additional options to the theme parks, there are plenty of activities not far from Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort across from Sea World!”
Reviews.Author: dayzeehaze
Reviews.Content: My husband & I & our 2 yr old daughter stayed for 5 nights in this beautiful resort within walking distance across the street from Sea World. We requested a renovated unit when we made the reservation in advance. I requested it again at check in. They really wanted to meet our request, so when we arrived at 4pm to check in, they said that the unit was being approved by the cleaning supervisor & they would call my cell phone when it was ready. We went & looked around the resort for about 30 min w/ our 2 yr old daughter & got a call that the unit was ready. We were glad that we waited because the unit was very clean & nicely renovated. My only complaints about our unit was the toilet was really noisy every time we flushed it, the balcony we had was right next to the air conditioners for all the units in our building, so when we sat on the balcony the noise was not so pleasant & lastly when we were in the living room area, we could hear the people in the unit next to us through the lock off door. But never heard any noises from the bedroom, so we were at least able to get a restful nights sleep. The main pool was always packed & full of people. We only used it once so our daughter could swim in the kiddie pool, which was actually not as crowded. We walked over to the smaller, quiet pool a few buildings away from ours & it was nice & relaxing with less people. We never used the Marketplace or restaurant/bar so I cannot comment on those. But, I would definitely stay there again & would recommend to all to ask for a renovated unit in advance & then remind them when we get there. We would stay there again for the price we paid, it is very reasonable & conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place for family!”
Reviews.Author: kdrollins
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during our first visit to Disney World. It was my husband, my mom, and our 2 kids ages 2 and 4. The rooms here are FABULOUS for families who want some separation. We got the 1 BR suite so we would have a separte bedroom. Our bed was very comfortable, the pull out was a little hard, but was a nice size. The condo and grounds were very clean, our condo was cleaned every day. We also went to all three pools, which were fabulous! It was VERY important to me to have a "kiddie" pool and this place has the perfect kiddie pools for babies! Our building was at the far end of the parking lot so it was a good walk with the kids to get to the clubhouse/pool. However, it was very quiet in our area which was also nice. We got food/icecream from the grocery on site and also ordered pizza from the hotel. The pizza wasn't that great, but the breadsticks were amazing! And it was a little pricey. if you want good pizza I would reccommend calling Flippers. They deliver, but are also super close and the food was GREAT! Oh and we also LOVED the screened in porch! Over all we wouldn't change a thing about our stay and would stay again for sure. It is close to Disney and the Outlet Mall and right across the street from Sea World. Great location, great price for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “We were given the keys to someone elses's room!”
Reviews.Author: MadameBauhaus
Reviews.Content: Imagine our surprise when after dragging our tired bodies, along with all of our luggage, up to "our" room we found it already occupied! We were a little disturbed that when we called the front desk on our way back they at first seemed to NOT BELIEVE us. We had to drive back to the main building to get a new room assignment; we were puzzled that the front desk attendants did not seem particularly concerned and then were hestitant to allow us to check out a couple hours late as a courtesy/way of placating us. The room itself, along with the facilites, were very nice, but we were concerned about security. (Would someone be given the key to OUR room while we were out?) That being said, we are thinking about giving it another try as it seems it would be wonderful for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Kittenfish9
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely thrilled with our stay! We had a superior view from our top floor Hamilton one-bedroom apartment. We could see the entire pool complex-beautiful-and the serene lake-and we could see the higher structures of Seaworld! The screened-in balcony was sublime. We had a great breeze each time we sat out there and ate. The food from the Coral Reef bar and grill was great. The pools were super-never too crowded even on the hottest days. The staff-oh,my,they were all awesome!! They were sooo nice.They just could not do enough for you. Our room was a great size for 3 people! The living/dining area was so comfortable,and the kitchen was supplied so well. I did not need any of the cleaning supplies that I brought from home-all is replenished daily! The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job everyday.I loved that the bedroom opened up right into the generous bathtub/double sink area-it made the bedroom area feel so expansive.The king bed was wonderful-I slept so well.The living room also had its own door to yet another sink area in the bathroom-yes-we had 3 bathroom sinks for 3 people! The stand alone shower was great-super water pressure and plenty of hot water.The kitchen pantry included a full-size stackable washer/dryer which I used daily with the provided detergent. The room was-for us-perfect! I loved the free parking right in front of our building.I loved that we were right next to the pool complex,restaurant,main building,and lake. Our location was perfect. We got breakfast sandwiches each morning from the little deli/store-they were large,hot,and freshly made to order.We ordered food from the bar on 2 nights-delicious wraps,wings,and a superior burger-soo yummy. We ate on the balcony as much as possible. The pools and restaurant stay open until 11:00 P.M.-very convenient! We certainly took advantage of the FREE Seaworld shuttle,and the FREE Quick-Queue access option-worth their weight in gold! All-in-all-for the money I paid-$116 a night,plus a $5 a night great view upgrade charge-we were blown away by the value. I have found my new Orlando home!

Reviews.Title: “Way exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Mandemhamm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-May. Though the hotel looks nice on their website, it way exceeded our expectations! There is so much to do (multiple pools with fountains, hot tubs, covered playground, shuffleboard, nightly movies, activity center for kids, outdoor pool table and ping pong, walking trails and more)! Plus, they offer condo-style rooms. We had a one-bedroom suite with a large jacuzzi tub, which included a full kitchen, living area with pull-out couch, screened-in porch, and our own washer/dryer. We stayed in the Hamilton Building (closest to pool) in a newly renovated room. This hotel is a great value. The parking is free. It's located right across the street from Sea World and close to Interstate 4, making it easy to get to other attractions. There is a free shuttle to Sea World and Aquatica. Plus, the hotel concierge offers free Quick Quene passes to guests (unlimited front-of-the-line access to popular rides). We loved everything about this hotel and would definitely recommend it to other people, especially to families wanting extra space and amenities!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, VERY FRIENDLY STAFF, GREAT AMMENATIES”
Reviews.Author: kins36
Reviews.Content: can't wait to stay here again. Loved the pool, the Coral reef had a good breakfast. Also liked the deli market it has everything you need and is open until 11pm. Really friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticCinderella
Reviews.Content: Just back from Florida vacations. 4 days stayed in Orlando Hilton GV to visit Dislney parks. Perfect value for money choice! Stayed in 82 sq.m. suite with terrase and jacuzzi. Well equiped kitchen let us to have great dinners. Appartment was very clean and quiet. Good location - about 10-15 min to parks and downtown by car. Free parking and wi-fi. Strongly recommend to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Expat11
Reviews.Content: My husband stumbled across this property on a business trip when he was bumped from a conference hotel. He raved about it, and decided to bring the whole family back for vacation in the summer. He and I both travel several times a year for business, so we are critical guests, but this place was terrific -- great value for a family, with lots and lots to do. We visited Sea World and Bush Gardens during our trip, but honestly, we could have stayed at the hotel the entire time and had a great vacation (our children were 5 & 8 at the time). Very clean, close to Orlando attractions (we walked to Sea World) and with great pools and activities for kids and adults. Our children loved the movies at night at the pool, the theater screenings and the fun activities at the pool (contests and games and magic shows). This is a great place to stay with a family (or even a couple) -- you can save by preparing food in your kitchen (close by car to Target and other large grocery stores, CVS within walking distance), or eat at the resort. We really love this place and are considering returning this summer for another stay. Clean, spacious-feeling rooms, lots of activities for children and adults, nice pools, adequate workout room and great staff. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at the Hilton Grand Vacations at SeaWorld!”
Reviews.Author: Tanner2305
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 3-night mini vacation to Orlando from April 8-11, 2011 staying in a studio room at the Hilton Grand Vacations at SeaWorld . We flew out of Toronto at 0630 and ended up at the hotel at approximately noon thinking that there was no way that would be able to check in early. We checked with front desk as we’re promptly advised that we could check in however there were limited rooms to choose from. The front desk staff took out a map and highlighted the rooms available that that point in time. We asked for and received a renovated room on the first floor of the St. Georges building. Off we went to park the car and to drop off our luggage. The room was well appointed and had a new flat screen tv. The furniture was fairly new and comfortable. The room had a iron and ironing board , safe and some cleaning products tucked away in the closet. The little kitchenette had all the necessary items – toaster, microwave, coffee maker, mini-fridge, a couple of dishes, cutlery and glasses (including two wine glasses). The washroom was a good size and offered us Crabtree & Evelyn product on a daily basis. The bed and pillows were comfortable however we were a little surprised to find out that the bed was a rather small for what we were told was a queen size bed. Since we were on the first floor the balcony virtually was surrounded by lush vegetation and trees. If we were ever to book again I would opt for a room on a higher level with a view of the beautiful grounds or pool however at the end of the day it wasn’t a big issue at all since we spent very little time in the room. The room was also located directly across from the elevator. The elevator didn’t bother us rather it was the guests waiting for the elevator that caused a little bit of noise but nothing to really complain about..just something you may way to avoid when you chose your room. Grounds were beautiful and well maintained. Staff were always friendly and offered a smile or a quick chat. Main pool was really nice and offered games and activities and was always busy but we never had an issue getting a chair at anytime of the day or evening. We actually preferred the smaller quieter pool for hanging out during the day but would head over to the main pool to watch all the kids have a blast and either have a snack or a drink. The pool area offered table and chairs so you could actually either order food from the restaurant and take to your table or bring your own. Many people grilled at the bbq stations and set up shop close to the pool for family dinners. We also like the fact that you could bring your own beer or wine in with you instead of being forced to buy them from the restaurant. We ordered food from the restaurant on one night and felt it was the equivalent to half decent pub food. Prices for drinks and food was quite reasonable for a hotel. We saw many people ordering the pizza from the pizza shop on site and it looked good. Gym was well equipped for a hotel and was located right near to pool. Hotel was close to everything and parking wasn’t an issue at all even though they were completely sold out the weekend we were there. All in all we had a great time and would highly recommend this resort for families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!! Perhaps the nicest place we've stayed. Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: thatguy32
Reviews.Content: From the check-in, to the staff, to the cleanliness, to the amount of activities, this place was top notch all the way. We will definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “We are Hilton Grand Timeshare Owners and love this property”
Reviews.Author: gracegarden
Reviews.Content: We bought a timeshare at the International Drive property, but after trying this property once, we stay at this location most often. I looked into the negative comments and wanted to react to them, namely the quality and location issues. The property has recently gnoe through quite a few renoations, so when you call for a reservation, simply request an updated room. Location can be a problem, especially if you plan to spend a lot of time doing activities, going to the pool, going to the deli. To remedy this, ask for a building that overlooks the pool. We like Hamilton. Ask for a room that is away from the elevator or near the stairs. You'll walk only a short distance to everything. For the folks who complained about the on-site store and deli not being stocked with a large array of items. I'm not sure what anyone expects from a hotel store. For those used to staying at Disney locations such as the Polynesian or Animal Kingdom, the store here and the deli is equal to the variety you find at those on-site stores and food locations. We stay at them all. BEcause any hotel will overcharge for the convenience of on-site amenities, simply take a drive down the road upon arrival to CVS and the grocery store to stock your room with groceries, drinks, snacks, toiletries, etc. We have never found the store lacking - except for "odd" items that not everyone need - ie. Lactaid milk, and the prices are comparable for a resort. They make sandwiches on site and if you don't want something behind the counter, ask for it fresh. They are always accommodating. As far as notes about security and maintenance, I have to say that after 5 stays, we have not experienced this. All travelers need to use common sense, buy a laptop lock, put your items in the safe and don't leave jewelry and valuables around. Heck, items can be stolen from our own homes, so if you think you should leave random valuables around a hotel room, even the Ritz, you are asking to be a victim of petty theft. Security has been great to us -we have lost things, had safe malfunctions, etc., and they come up right away and handle our issues with great professionalism. Maintenance - same thing - we have had TVs replaced with new ones, even asked for a 2nd DVD player, no problems. You can't beat the location. If you have kids who want to enjoy Sea World, go to Disney, Downtown Disney or just hang at the pools, then this property is a treat. It's across the street from Discovery Cove and a stone's throw from Sea World. The pools are typically lukewarm, and movie nights are a treat. I hightly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, interesting comparison to International Drive location.”
Reviews.Author: Business_Traveler_MI
Reviews.Content: Last year on spring break, I took my family to the HGCV on International Drive. It was great. This year we thought we'd try the Sea World location. I'll provide some pros/cons comparing the two and general remarks. Pros: 1. Pool atmosphere was great. DJ and parties. We took a day from the parks and stayed at the pool. It was wonderful. The kids had a ball, great music and games. Popsicles and ice cream, hair braiding. Just plain fun. 2. Deli/Store is well stocked and the prices are decent. 3. Theater - only holds 50 seats and we didn't see a movie but they have one just about every night. 4. Time share but never was asked to sit in on a presentation unless I approached the desk. 5. Provides Sea World Quick Queue passes - nice perk. 6. Liked the restaurant better than the International Drive location. Nice covered area. 7. Walking proximity to Sea World. Cons. 1. Room had some outdated features including tube TV's. Otherwise was ok. 2. Noisy air conditioners on the balconies on the next building. Made sitting on our own balcony not so peaceful. 3. One elevator per building is not enough. We were on the 6th floor and waited on the elevator - a lot. Did use the stairs a bit too. 4. There is a path around the lake but it's not nearly as nice as the path at the International Drive location. Liked being able to walk/jog but really didn't do that at the HGVC Sea World. I have one other complaint. Check in time is 4:00pm. We arrived right at 4pm and was told our room was being cleaned. Checked back in 75 minutes and they said they were still cleaning the room. They apologized profusely. Went shopping and came back 75 minutes later again. The front desk said they were just "finishing up" but they would give us the keys. We finally checked in at 6:30pm. I'm disappointed it took so long to have our room available. I do believe this does not happen often. I would consider staying here again but we might try Parc Soleil next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms & welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Devo64
Reviews.Content: Group of co-workers congregated at this hotel for a week of meetings. Rooms are large, comfortable and have all the amenities. Staff always pleasant and helpful. Great little store in main building with very reasonable prices for food basics. Main pool busy/noisy (lots of activities), but 'other' pool quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: rajarpeter
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! We were welcomed with a welcome pack, our apartment was very clean and fully equipped as expected...everything working well from fridge and dish wash to laundry unit! Enough and more towels for all of us - 3 kids and 4 adults. Overall a great and convenient place to access Seaworld (nextdoor) and the other DisneyWorld sights. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice property”
Reviews.Author: Long4Tahoe
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very spacious. As a business trip I was unable to enjoy much of the facilities the property has to offer. I had an issue with my tub fixture and engineering took care of the problem quickly. On site restaurant is nothing to brag about at all, below par. Staff I encountered were all pleasant and professional. Towels and bedding were all of a decent quality.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time- will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: MIF738
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from the Hilton Vacation at Sea World and had a great time!! Check in was super easy and I was able to get a room at 9am. The room was big with a full kitchen, dinning table and couch, a separate room with a wonderful Jacuzzi hot tub and a very comfy king bed. My 6 year old slept in the pull out couch, which was in the other room, and it was perfect for her (my husband even took a nap on it and thought it was fine.) Our room was in one of the farthest from the main pool (building 9) but they can transport you by golf cart back to the main pool (there was one pool by our building which we did not use since it did not have bar/food). You just have to call down and we never waited more than 5 minutes.... coming back was no problem at all either. The pools were heated and we swam a lot, even at night. The pool bar was reasonably priced, as was the food. They have activities by the pool which are free (they had a scavenger hunt and corn hole tournament) but some have a small fee (pottery painting and tie dye t-shirts)- we had ice scream sundays for $3. They also have a little shop were you can buy pretty much everything which I thought was also very reasonably priced. The hotel was also very close to sea world and made it a very easy walk there. We decided to take a taxi back after we left (the times of the shuttle did not seem to work for us) and it cost $6 with tip- very close. The last night we decided to order pizza from the resort and have it delivered to our room. The pizza was very good! Overall it was a wonderful stay for us. Beautiful clean grounds, everyone was very nice and helpful. We will for sure be back!!! My only thing I would have liked to see was an arcade. Most resorts that big have arcades but it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: MomtoCCC
Reviews.Content: My 7yo daughter and I stayed at HGV at Sea World for 4 nights for Spring break. We went to Sea World for 2 days and Aquatica for another day. The hotel was very nice. We had choice at check-in of a higher floor by the pool farthest from main pool area or a bottom floor unit in St George building which was 2nd building from main pool area. Since my daughter loves to swim, we opted to be close to the main pool area. The unit was very nice, no issues at all. Basic kitchen supplies, loved the jacuzzi bath tub, large bathroom and separate bedroom. My daughter slept on the sofa bed and it was just fine for her. The only problem she had was the ice maker that I turned on woke her up the first night (I turned it off after that). A nice bonus was the washer/dryer in the unit. The hotel grounds are very nice, the pool was heated and we swam every day. We had dinner one night at the restaurant by the pool. The service was good and the food was ok - nothing fancy but it beat trying to drive around and find something. We went to the free movie one night which was fun and my daughter loved doing some of the poolside activities. She also liked the playground which was shaded. We did take advantage of the conceirage service to get the free Sea World quick pass bracelets one day. This was nice. We didn't use the shuttle (the times weren't right for us) so I ended up driving to the parks every day. I think we could have walked but it would have been a long walk back to hotel in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sir-Lottabags
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller for both business and pleasure I feel this hotel deserved a praise. I needed somehwere to stay for two days prior to moving to the assigned business hotel later in the week. I would describe myself as quite a critical person, however, if a hotel has a few faults but the staff are great I can overlook these. This hotel I could not fault at all. The hotel staff were much more pleasurable than I expected for a tourist hotel in Orlando. I usually stay in business hotels where you seem to get a higher level of service to predominantly vacation hotels. The greeting on arrival at the bell desk and then at reception was excellent. I immediately knew I had made the right choice. The next pleasant surpise was the accommodation. I have paid much more for alot less in the past. A nice clean well laid out room with a kitchen facility. Most importantly for me the bed was very comfortable too. Next was the hotel pool area and decor. Quite simply beautiful and clean. Staff were continuously checking that all was perfect. I am beginning to sound like I have shares in this place but quite honestly it deserves the credit. I am 45 years of age and have travelled on business and as a tourist since the age of 20. The next best place to this that I have stayed at for a vacation is the Blue Palace hotel in Elounda Greece. At the end of January this year I was crusing in the carribean on celebrity equinox and the quality was the same as this hotel in all aspects. So for the value for money was very good indeed. I also used the gym at the hotel and the bar/restaurant. Both of which were absolutely fine. So back to the staff; Jean-Paul, Pool Manager, Gavin and Ryan at the bar, to mention just a few; well done and keep up the quality service. I moved to the new Hilton at the Orlando convention centre two days later and that was just as perfect but double the price which was also worth it.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: harley433
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well worth the price we paid. We booked through Sunwing Air and would definetely return. Our room was the studio and it was perfedt for 2 people. The pools were beautiful and the grounds were extremely beautiful and well cared for. We arrived early at noon and were given a room immediately. Wonderful service, movie nights were a real pleasure and our room was cleaned everyday. Hotel close to everything, we will certainly return. Heather

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay.....”
Reviews.Author: mom2girls09
Reviews.Content: DH, myself, and 2 teens (13 and 15) stayed at this property for the second time Feb 5-12. We previously visited in 2008. We stayed in an unrenovated 1 bdrm suite in the Devonshire building(5th floor). The room decor was a bit tired but it was spotlessly clean, and I enjoy a room that looks like Florida - i.e. rattan and light colours- when visiting there! I understand they are in the process of renovating all the rooms. The room had a view of the golf course and the quiet (Parrish) pool was next door. PROS: -rooms are spacious for a family with teenagers. Having a separate bedroom for mom & dad is ideal. -our room was cleaned every day with the exception of one day that rained and we stayed in our suite most of the day, even so we were offered a change of towels or anything else we needed -staff was friendly and super helpful without exception. Tickets for all attractions could be obtained from the travel concierge. We used the shuttle to both Sea World and Universal without incident. The Universal shuttle in particular was a good deal, about half the price of taking a taxi. The Sea World shuttle was free but Sea World is easily accessible by either I Trolley or walking across the parking lot. Location could be both a pro or con depending. We have stayed there twice now without a rental vehicle and have determined that if we went back we'd rent a car. There is really nothing but a drugstore in walking distance. the i trolley is handy and runs regularly but infrequently. Several times we saw the trolley leaving which meant at least a 35 minute wait for another one. This meant that dinners out could take 3 hours or more including travel time. However, the plus of the location is that it is secluded and well removed from the noisiness of the rest of I-Drive. CONS The only real negative was the dining options are limited on site. We arrived at almost 11 pm the first night and the restaurant was closed so we had to order in pizza. Because of the previously mentioned travel times, we would have preferred to eat on site more often but the restaurant seemed to have a much more limited menu than we when we were there 3 years ago. The food quality was adequate though. Overall, we had a great stay once again a the Hilton. It's comfortable, reasonable and the staff are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: nissimdabach
Reviews.Content: the hotel was realy great, we realy enjoyed our stay , and i will defenetlly recommed others to stay at the hilton. my only complaint is: we asked for a late checkout (til 15:00) and payed for it, we also asked that the service will clean our room, unfortunately when we came back from the park at 13:00 we found that our keys were deactivated (they called security to open the door) and the room was not cleaned (they left freash towels next to the door) .

Reviews.Title: “Mixed - property is nice, room was not”
Reviews.Author: jdr132
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend in late January 2011. I think it is 3-3.5 star property. Pro's The people were all very nice and friendly. It seems to be a well-managed property. The associates there seem to all be well-trained. The two issues I observed were handled quickly and professionally: 1) Folks smoking in the non-smoking area of the pool, a manager politely reminded them of the rule and directed them to the smoking section and 2) Loud people at 1:30 in the morning, one call to the front desk and they quieted them down. The grounds were meticulously maintained. The main pool area was very nice. It was noisy and busy during the day, so we found a secondary smaller pool towards the back of the property which had a few older folks reading and sunbathing. This is great if you want some peace and quiet. There are several games in the main pool area (ping pong, billiards, shuffleboard) and that was nice. They had a guitar player/singer there during the day, I didn't care for the music but it was a nice thought. The hiking trail around the lake is nice. Folks will come by and take orders for food and drinks, or you can just go to the general store and pick up what you need. The little grocery store in the main building is pretty good. Although the items are priced higher than a regular store, it isn't an all-out gouge that you would expect. If you need a regular store, we found a Wal-Mart supercenter nearby. Maid service was very good, she cleaned out unit and ran the dishwasher each day. The full kitchen in the room was very useful. The screened in patio was nice. I thought the location was great for the tourist-oriented activities we were doing. Con's I read on here to ask for a remodeled room and I did, however either she made an error and put me in an old room or their idea of remodeling is pretty lame. The room was spacious but dumpy and built with poor craftsmanship. If you have seen that program on HGTV "Holmes on Homes", Mike Holmes would have a field day with our room. The front door was misaligned and the door handle was loose. This would really be an issue in the summer with heat and bugs. The tiles on the bathroom floor were loose and moved when we walked on them. The toilet PVC supply line went from the toilet into the wall which is not to code. The ceiling fan was wired up backwards. The bed gave my wife and I the worst four days sleep in recent memory. The elevator to our building had a taped cardboard box on the floor (why I have no idea). There was no internet in our room (wired or wireless). I did pick up a wireless signal in the main building. The area has noticeable traffic noise. Summary For the rate I paid for a two-room suite ($149), I thought it was reasonable. I didn't spend much time in the room so it was not too big a deal. I suppose I would not be against staying here again in the future, but we would probably try a different property next time instead.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ground, inside could be updated, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: KAS9469
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from January 22-29 in a 2 bedroom unit after trading in a time share week. The grounds are stunning. The employees were all incredibly friendly. Check in took a little bit even though there were only one couple in front of us. Our room was in the Paget building which clearly has not been updated. The children's studio was very nice. The one bedroom attached to it could use updating...burnt out light bulbs, mold in the shower, rip in the couch. It was fantastic to have a washer and dryer in the unit though. We did find the water there had an awful smell to it and had to go out and buy scented fabric softener when the unscented laundry soap we had didn't get rid of the yucky water smell. All in all, a nice place to stay but I'd prefer to find somewhere else next time or stay in an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property! Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: mickie052605
Reviews.Content: The service was amazing! In the first minute we were on the property, we were greeted by 4 employees. All were very professional, asking how our day was and welcoming us. The check-in process was seamless and they offered suggestions for where to get groceries, without me asking. We got to the room and wow! It was very spacious and clean. We had a 1 BR with a pull out couch, balcony with table/chairs and huge bath and jacuzzi. Grocery was only a couple miles away. Kitchen was plenty big and well equipped, even a diswasher. Daily room service came and made the bed every day, brought new towels and even started the Dishwasher (that we had loaded). Laundry in the room was awesome also! The property was gated with 24 hr security. The location was perfect. Not too close to the crazy life, but just close enough that you didn't have to drive for hours to get somewhere. Pools were clean, towels provided, even a bar/restaurant pool-side. They also had a market with grocery items, fresh sandwiches and Starbucks coffee... Every-day they had activities planned for all ages and each night there was a movie in the theater (free). They also had bingo, karaoke. the activities room for the kids was cool, you could rent movies to take to your room along with board games, etc... If you're looking for a great value with unbelieveable service and beautiful rooms, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with other HGVC locations”
Reviews.Author: Grammybear285
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for a week. We were given a room in the Smith Building. The room is located in the very rear of the resort. We asked for a room in the 'refurnished units' but was told that they were full. Here are just a few things that we noticed: 1) outdated, cheap furniture 2) televisions should be updated to flat screen 3) spotty,erratic Internet service 4) kitchen not stocked with basic cookware 5) old kitchen appliances with broken ice makers We have stayed at other HGVC's in the area which were much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: mbcher07
Reviews.Content: This was our first time not staying in a Disney resort and we had a blast! For around $100 a night we had a full kitchen, wonderful patio, and large jacuzzi tub! We picked the location so we could walk to Seaworld and that worked out perfectly. We even enjoyed the fireworks one night from our patio. The small provisions shop on site came in handy for coffee, pizza, and light snacks at a great price. I have no clue how anyone could complain about this place???

Reviews.Title: “Hilton continues to exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: jeffpags
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week before thanksgiving with our three children ages 7/9/11 in a 3 bedroom unit. Its awesome having enough room to spread out. We walked to Seaworld--took about 10 mins, and wasn't any longer then a walk in the parking lot at any Disney resort. Food and drinks were reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: soxpatsdave
Reviews.Content: I would not go back here, too many other choices in the area. Location ok if you want to walk to SeaWorld, pool(s) are ok, and pool bar was adequate one time we ate there, but otherwise, service was fair to poor, location is near a highway (noisy), rooms not very clean. If you are a Hilton Honors member, do NOT expect any special treatment. They are Hilton in name only and they don't recognize your loyalty to Hilton chain. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ideal for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: LolovesZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations November 8-10 - I was in town for business at another hotel. The hotel grounds and reception area were very nice and clean; this would be a fantastic place to vacation with family or friends! There seemed to be a lot of family centric amenities. There are several (I think 10) different hotel buildings; the one we stayed in was quite a ways away from the main reception area. There was no lobby (thus no business center) in the building we stayed in; it is "courtyard style" so the exterior door to your room opened to the outdoors. One evening, I woke up about 3:30am to very loud hammering and sawing noises outside my door. As a female traveling by myself, I was quite startled. I called to the front desk who seemed annoyed that their building maintenance man woke me up and said "I guess I can ask him to continue his routine maintenance in the morning". ? Very odd - not sure why they were doing that type of exterior work in the middle of the night. Regardless, it was a nice hotel - the rooms were a bit dated but clean. I would definitely recommend this to family and friends for a leisure vacation (literally it is across the street from SeaWorld) but for other business travelers, I wouldn't recommend a resort style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor housekeeping, poor value for money - would recommend other hotels instead!”
Reviews.Author: Mister_Djerus
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is not a bad hotel, it is just offering little value for money compared to other nearby hotels. We have spent our holidays in the Orlando area every year for the last 5 years, either staying at the nearby Sheraton or at the Marriott, which is right next door to the Hilton. Both hotels offer nicer rooms, a nicer hotel site and leisure area, and for less money too! We would recommend both hotels to friends and family. Why did we book the Hilton then? Considering the name Hilton is more prestigious than Marriott or Sheraton, and the rates for the rooms were a lot higher, we expected to get high value for money, we wanted to offer ourselves a little bit of extra-luxury. Bad mistake, the Hilton turned out to be a complete let-down, for these reasons: - the rooms are bigger, but quite spartan in furniture and decoration - housekeeping is terrible, they don't clean anything at all. In 2 weeks stay, they only vacuumed the rooms once, after we complained to the front desk. That was the only time. They don't clean the kitchen, the bathrooms, no vacuum-cleaning, no cleaning of glass surfaces (and there are plenty of those). - the hotel buildings are crammed next to each other, whereas both other hotels offer some nice green space between the much smaller buildings (calmer atmosphere, more relaxation) - due to so many rooms being squeezed into the small site of the hotel, there was more of a spring-break-hotel atmosphere than a family-friendly hotel resort There are many more minor details that simply are better at both other hotels, like staff friendliness when you encounter them on site, or even security (anyone can enter the Hilton hotel area - they don't check anything at front gate), which contribute to the Hilton turning out to be a huge disappointment and making us regret not having booked one of our usual hotels. Actually the only positive experience at the Hilton was the moment between getting out of the car and being greeted by the only friendly staff member we ever met, and getting to the check-in desk (which was manned by a very unfriendly lady): the smiling greeter welcomed us to the Hilton, and told us to go to the ticket desk after checking in, we would receive a welcoming gift from Hilton. Turns out this gift was one of these free coupon magazines you get at every gas stations. That was the first disappointment in what would turn out to be symptomatic for the whole stay at the Hilton. On the day of our checkout we told all of this to the frontdesk manager, and sadly she didn't even look surprised at any of our comments, she was not even upset by the dirty rooms. Is that a tell-tale sign that things are always like this at the Hilton? To sum up, is the Hilton a bad hotel? No, but there sure is a LOT of room for improvement, and there are much better hotels out there for less money. We would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Orlando Location”
Reviews.Author: hollymike1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort in April 2010 with my husband, 5-year-old daughter and my parents. The location is great for Sea World, only minutes away. The Disney parks were a bit farther but still no more than a 15 to 20 minute drive to any of the major Orlando parks. The resort was very nice. We all liked the unit and the grounds were beautiful. We took several pictures in front of our building's courtyard. We were on the top floor and had a wonderful view from our spacious balcony which is great for a cool April evening after a long day of park-hopping. We did have lunch and dinner at the on-site restaurant and the food was good but the service was VERY slow so go somewhere else if you're in a hurry. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this resort and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CurtisinTexas
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here for a business conference and had an awesome experience. Friendly and assiting people from the minute we arrived until the minute we left. It was very crowded so the beautiful pools had plenty of lounges available. The grounds are well kept. The junior suite was awesome with a balcony and jacuzzi tub and separate shower and full kitchen. Housekeeping was excellent. the pool restaurant and bar was great. Good food, great drinks and awesome service. Our stay here couldnt have been any better. Great location if you are going to Seaworld or the convention center. Trolly stop right outside the property. Thanks to ALL of the staff who made are stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “great value, activities, great for family”
Reviews.Author: ohana_kauai
Reviews.Content: great place for family. There is an activities center for kids, multiple pools, walking trail and a playground. The playground is outdoors but has a tent to shade from the sun. We stayed in a studio room which was enough for my husband, myself and a toddler. The only thing we didn't like was the small kitchenette. it has a microwave, sink and mini fridge but no conterspace. On the counter is a coffee maker and a basket with coffee and tea and some kitchen towels. but there is no other space so it got kind of cramped. But that wouldn't stop us from staying here again. There are free laundry facilities in certain buildings in each floor. We were able to find machines not in use and each building is within walking distance. Studio rooms do not have balconies (if that is important to you)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, well located, well kept.”
Reviews.Author: bkindtoall2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to Orlando this year over spring break. Of our many Florida trips that we've visited Disney World, this was the first time we stayed outside the DW properties. Being part of Club Intrawest, we were able to use our points. This seemed like a very family oriented place. I can't speak too much other than the rooms themselves, as we spent most of our time out and about. We did spend Easter here, and the kids enjoyed the Easter hunt for candy and the bunny. The rooms were nice. The 2nd bedroom had a sink which suddenly developed a bad leak. They came by to fix it asap. Nice folks. The kitchen was roomy, plenty of room for all you need. Bathrooms clean. Beds comfy. Parking lots were almost full, but always had enough spots to accomodate. The only complaint I would have, and I'm being picky here, is that the screen tv in the living room was dated and the picture quality was just ok. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dcnut
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are going to Sea World. Very spacious and clean. Staff is very friendly & willing to help. Lots of things for kids to do.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, CLEAN HOTEL BUT CUSTOMER SERVICE MIXED”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler37114
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2-nite stay on 10/25/10-10/26/10 on the 'tail end' of our 1st trip to Florida ever.....the hotel/room was beautiful and just as pictured. We stayed in Pagent, and found the room very clean. Our view was not as picturesque as hoped, but I do not fault the hotel as we arrived several hours earlier than anticipated and staff kindly offered us that room to accomodate us on an early check-in. While all front desk staff & bellmen, from the greeter on, were very friendly and helpful, one bellman was truly exceptional--Arthur! Upon learning we had missed the last hotel shuttle to Seaworld for that day, Arthur, after escorting us and our luggage to our room, offered to drive us to Seaworld himself. Given our limited time there, that 'extra touch' and his friendly, accomodating manner, was the epitamy of what good customer service is all about. We also experienced very good service from the Pizza Hut/Market manager, and the desk staff got cabs to our building almost immediately when needed. Unfortunately, that was where our good service ended. Upon learning our room safe was broken that night, initially we were told someone would be right up to fix it, later were called back and said they could not come and to call back the next morning. We called the next morning, advised we had to leave in 1/2 hr; staff advised they would send someone right up but 40 min. later they still had not arrived so we had no option but to take valuables with us--very inconvenient. Upon our return that evening from our day at Discovery Cove (you MUST go!), a request for fresh towels was made with the manager, Adam, who apologized over the safe issue, and assured us housekeeping would bring towels right up, but 2 1/2 hrs. later we still hadn't received them. By then, we'd already bathed and it was too late so we updated Adam that the towels were no longer needed. He again expressed a verbal apology; while we don't certainly don't believe he is responsible for either of these occurrences, the inconsistency of these services issues is troubling given the pricepoint and reputation of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too good for Orlando. Wanted to stay put but were there for Disney”
Reviews.Author: waterbabe16
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our 2 bed apartment through RCI. Arrived at midday and although check-in stated 4pm we decided to try our luck. No problem. Very obliging. Offered a newly refurbished room but we would have had to wait a while so accepted a different room near the parish pool. Not refurbished but still very good. Being Orlando the pools were fairly quiet during the daytime and got busier around 5pm. They were cold when you first got in but many pools in the Medi are the same and are called 'acclimatisation' pools. Only criticism I have is the lack of a restaurant on site. There was a bar/grill which was not very good quality or service and after a day out you really did not want to get back in the car and travel to find food. Deli on site did Pizza and one family pasta dish reasonably priced. One other thing I did not like but accept that it is probably standard in the Florida area. The balcony was enclosed with mesh to stop the bugs. Yes, probably a good idea for certain times of the year but we felt like prisoners when sat out on the balcony and it distorted the view we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family getaway specially with children”
Reviews.Author: PRP1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, lots of activities for children and the whole family. My only complaint is that it doesn't have a full restaurant for dinner, only a restaurant next to the pool which is good for lunch and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed with 2 small children”
Reviews.Author: FightOnUSCTrojans
Reviews.Content: I used rci to book a two bedroom unit. I really loved it. The grounds were very clean, and they had a covered playground for the kids. The pools were great but the one with the big waterfall was too cold to go into, and it was around 85 degrees. Apparently the waterfall makes the water colder. I called before getting there and requested a renovated unit. We stayed in the summerset building. I recommend staying there. The building is closest to the main lobby and pool area...the place is literally across the street from sea world and about a 7 minute drive to the other parks. There is a super wal mart about 2 miles away and a whole foods about 2 miles away. Every room has a flat screen tv with DVD player. Overall excellent resort and we travel quite a bit...I would recommend this place without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay and very comvenient for all Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: derrick12
Reviews.Content: Excellent vacation club with friendly and helpful staff. Our 3 bedroom apartment was very large and comfortable, and easily accommodated 8 people. The pools were good, and the hotel provided a full entertainment programme for the kids. Free pool, shuffle board, chess board and table tennis added to the enjoyment and kept the kids amused for hours. On-site shop had most of the basics neceesary, as well as a pizza and coffee shop. other facilities included a fitness centre and cinema, but I did not personally use or experience these. Located within walking distance to Seaworld, and next to I-4, making it very easy to get to Disney and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “TOP TOP TOP HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ian123456
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 8 times and it is good quality let me list some of the things what makes it a top hotel. 1, security is very good 2, eveything is top notch clean 3, the service is very good, always go out of there way to help 4, 4 hot tubs 2 swimming pool and no over crowding 5, washing machine and dryer in all suites (very very useful) 6,pizza hut on site always very fresh 7, you can get away from all the noise of the parks 8, loads of trees around the resort make it very peaceful surroundings 9,if you have a problem it will be fixed 10,pool is cleaned every morning if you have questions just email me

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great deal.”
Reviews.Author: ryannosaurus_rexx
Reviews.Content: I spent a good while searching hotels for a business trip to Orlando. After stumbling across this HGVC here on tripdavisor.com, and seeing the reviews and the great rates, I decided to take the plunge. My wife, daughter, and I booked for two nights, but decided to drive down a day early and they adjusted our accommodations easily. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the property. The grounds were fairly lush and well maintained. A manned guard booth at the entrance was a nice touch, although they just lifted the gate and flagged everyone through so it seemed more for show than actual security. The lobby was very clean and modern and the desk staff was very friendly and helpful and got me checked in in less than 5 minutes. Map and key in hand, I drove us to our room. The buildings (or "houses" as they call them) were not your standard boring, square buildings. Ours had a nice quasi-courtyard that the rooms surrounded. (see photo) The room was clean and decently appointed. The door opened to a 10 foot hallway that angled back toward the room. The room had a small granite-topped kitchenette (sink, microwave, mini fridge) that was a must with a young child. The furnishings were pretty new and modern, and not at all dated as in many hotels. The room had central heat and air, which worked well (stayed at 71) but was slightly noisy. Luckily the unit was near the door at the far end of the hallway, so it wasn't a big issue. The bathroom was... interesting. It was very large, but had no tub - just a walk-in shower that was only separated by a shower curtain. The bathroom floor wound up splashed with water and a little tricky, but keeping a bath mat just outside the curtain caught most of it. I thought it was a little odd, but the kiddo loved it. After visiting a second room I booked for a coworker and seeing his regular (smaller) bathroom and shower, I cleverly deduced that we were booked in an ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) room. Obviously just an oversight, since the desk claimed there were plenty of vacancies. I notified them, but it was not enough reason to swap rooms unless they needed an ADA room for a worthy guest. Apparently there were several other open ADA rooms. The bed slept fairly well - a little firm for my taste but not at all uncomfortable. They gave five pillows on a "king" size bed which was good. I hate being short on pillows, and so many hotels often only give two or three. Note the "king" in quotation marks - I put the "king" in these quotation marks because the "king" size bed we booked and the desk claimed was in the room did not seem like a "king" size bed. It was noticeably smaller than ours at home, and was narrower than the headboard. I just chalked it up to the ADA room and the need to provide space for maneuverability. The LCD TV was a nice feature, although becoming pretty common nowadays. The channels were s...l...o...w... to change and were annoying, coupled with the fact that the onscreen channel guide was wrong to the point of showing the entirely wrong channels. With no printed channel listing in the room, and going mad trying to explore the channels with each taking about 2-3 seconds to change to the next, we would up having to call the front desk for channel listings. A very small gripe, and one of the only ones we had. The lobby was adjoined by a nice reading/sitting room with a full grand piano tucked in one corner. On the opposite side of the lobby was the deli/sundries/gift shop with Pizza Hut Express pizzas (a'la Target) and Starbucks beverages. The breakfast was a small selection of pre-prepped items to be loaded into plastic carryout containers and eaten on the balcony outside. The balcony was nice, and overlooked a big, interesting pool with fountain in the middle. (see photo) Not pictured is an extension off of the pool area with a waterfall. A couple of shuffleboards were nearby. Talking to my coworker, I found out that he had stayed here years prior on a borrowed timeshare, and other relatives had a cheap stay scheduled with a requisite timeshare sales presentation. The location was convenient, not far from touristy International Drive with oodles of dining and shopping, the Orange County Convention Center, and several of the theme parks. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and nice property with only a couple of minor complaints. Couple it with only $79/night ($88 after taxes), and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: rudeman
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the OCCC while my wife, her sister and her husband stayed for pleasure. I had stayed at the hotels near the OCCC in the past by myself and didn't find them much fun if you were there for pleasure. So my sister-in-law found this hotel. It's really a resort comparable to Disney's Vacation Club. There are 11 different buildings along with multiple pools. There is a bar/restaurant right in the pool area which we found to be very good. We also availed ourselves of the massage therapy offered at the hotel and were very pleased with it. There are movies offered, I think, every night and we attended one show. Popcorn, beer and soda were available for a nominal fee. There are also numerous activities during the day and my wife was very pleased with the water aerobics. The accommodations were literally condos so they were very comfortable multi-room suites including full kitchens, etc. This was probably one of the better off-Disney places we've ever stayed at in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Beware of timeshare!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loumack
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the HGVC at Seaworld and overall we were quite inpressed with the hotel. The main lobby has a lovely fountain and a small lounge off to the right. When we checked in we were dealt with very politely and courtiuosly. We requested a room on a high floor and close to the main building - Which we got. We had also requested a king bed but when we arrived, we were told we could have a queen bed with a balcony, or a King bed with no balcony. We opted for the queen bed with balcony. Really we should have taken the king as we never used the balcony (as it was tiny!!!) First impressions of the room was good. We were on the 5th floor in the St. George building and the lift was very very slow! We had a nice view over the golf course. Walls are very thin so sometimes it was noisy, but quiet more often than not. Swimming pool area is lovely. It is beside the bar and resorts restaurant. There is also a pool table, ping pong and giant chess. Generally, lots of the family entertainment took place by the pool too. There are 2 hot tubs.....one is boiling so just ba careful of that!!! We only ate twice in the hotels restaurant. Once the food was mediocre and cod, the 2nd time it was much better. Maybe it was just the chef, I dont know! Some small issues that we would have are: - We were out all day and arrived back at our room and it had not been serviced. - We tried to buy some tickets from the Ticket desk, and were pounced on by the timeshare guy. Completely lost the sale because of this. - Buy a LYNX ticket for the duration of your stay as this is more frequent than the I Trolley - The restaurant does not sell breakfast. You have to get this in the deli onsite if need be. Overall we enjoyed our stay here, but felt the resort was definately more for families. The bar/restaurant closes at 11pm. This was not ideal for us, as most nights we were only heading out for dinner at 9.30.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation for fussy travellers”
Reviews.Author: Pippadee
Reviews.Content: We were a party of seven 4 adults and three children and booked with our Hilton timeshare points. We booked well in advance and booked the 3 bedroom plus (the penthouse as they call it.) Well it certainly lives up to that name - The accommodation was fantastic - huge, newly refurbished and did I say Huge!! Everything was spot on and I have to say worth every extra point that we spent for the "plus" or penthouse. Kitchen was very well equipped, Tvs and bathrooms everywhere and the bedrooms were a fabulous size. The common area facilities were also extensive... being Orlando you don't trully appreciate them as there is too much else to do but there is chess board, ping pong, playground..pools etc.. PLenty to keep the children busy on a late afternoon chill session. One of things that impressed us the most was the level of service. On the second night my hubbie slipped when entering the code for the safe - so when he went to open it he could not get it to open. It was totally our fault. At 7am we called reception because our wallets and theme park tickets were inside and by 7.10am there were two men there to open it for us. We also had an a?c problem in the lockoff third bedroom on day 4 which when they could not get fixed by the end of the day, they removed a window and installed a portable unit, no quibble - which although noisey did the job. They did offer to move us but we refused so they swiftly installed the portable A/C unit - amazing. I have to say we have rarely used Hilton points at Hilton before because the locations are not always confenient so we excahnge for RCI, but I have to say I can now see why the hilton is more expensive. It is a fabulous product.... for an apartment. I say this because people write these reviews for timeshare as if expecting a hotel!! These are not hotels they are apartament buildings with add ons!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: TinaM01
Reviews.Content: Lots of things to do for everyone! The trolley stops right in front which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarnes09
Reviews.Content: I sometimes wonder how I manage to see things so differently to other reviewers.. on returning and looking at the review from beginning of August (when we stayed), I can't believe people have such a different opinion. Maybe we were just very lucky with rooms etc? Yes it was slightly noisy but its a big site and obviously has activities etc for kids so is going to get families. Anyway, we stayed here 4 nights at the beginning of August 2010. We arrived early and were able to check in (about 1pm, check-in is at 4). We were given a room in Paget. Had requested to not face the pool due to noise and had a room overlooking a golf course, very nice. Close to the private pool as well which we used a lot during our stay. We had a 1 bedroom suite. Lovely! Didn't notice any problems with decor/appliances. Sometimes wifi signal dropped out, usually fine. Though the suite was really big, bed lovely and comfortable, jacuzzi bath fantastic! Balcony a great size and everything we could have needed. Didn't get woken from noise at all, couldn't hear kids or pool or anything. We read we wouldn't get maid service, which was fine, and then found we did. Maid had been in every day and put dishwasher on/replaced towels etc. Bonus! It was a short walk to the main centre but nothing awful and you could cut through past the small pool etc. We ate at the bar/grill one night which was nice. Didn't really use any other services apart from the smaller pool - lovely - and the shop - expensive but useful to have. And pizza takeaway service - good. We didn't even have any of the timeshare calls we were expecting. Overall very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with this hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: metalliam
Reviews.Content: Overall, my girlfriend and I were very happy with this hotel. Our room came with a fridge, toaster, bowls, sink, bed, balcony and sofa. We got a good rate throuugh Expedia, and due to the recommendation from this site (always use it) we went for it. We were not disappointed. It was clean, quiet and all our needs (not that we're fussy) were catered for. We stayed for 8 nights, on a bit of a theme park mission. It's excellently located for getting to Seaworld - leave the car at the hotel. They have regular people patrolling from what I saw, and it's gated. Not that it really needs to be, the area is great. If you're expecting to be able to walk to a load of restaurants and bars, this probably isn't the place for you, though - not that it bothered us, there are much cheaper places for English people to go for a drink/sun holiday! It's also about a 2 minute drive from Discovery Cove, depending on the one or two lights you'll encounter. Parking there is free, so don't even think about walking it - especially if it's hot! Save your energy! As for general amenities, the hotel has a gym that I used a few times with a few running machines, 2 weights benches (dumbells), an exercise bike and a few other general machines. Good enough to keep you in check on vacation.This is open until 11pm - perhaps it would have been nice to be open a little later, as you'd probably still be out in Orlando at that time, especially if the theme parks close late as they do in high season. The hotel also has two decent pools and lots of loungers, a shop that's open until 11, featuring a pizza hut takeout desk (they also deliver, quite handy on your first night), a restaurant by the pool (we ate there once, food was decent), a couple of shuffleboard courts, an outdoor table tennis table and a pool table, free to use. They also have some sort of track surrounding the hotel lake for running, but as I had just broken my foot a month beforehand I didn't get to use this. You park for free at the hotel, no matter what room you buy. Some websites don't list it as free for all rooms, but it is. We stayed in the Turner building and had no trouble whatsoever finding a space, even when we returned late. One word of warning - the Expedia concierge desk added a charge on to our Disney tickets. We couldn't buy them direct from Disney online (redirected to a site wanting you to buy £220 ticket valid for 14 days - no thanks!) so we were going to wait and buy them at the park. Conscious that the lines may be long, we decided to get them early. We ended up paying about $20 over the odds for two tickets.
