Would have been better had the guy just told us we would be better off buying them at the park, but you live and learn. They did seem to help other people, for example they got the couple in front of us into a pretty booked up show with cheaper tickets. I guess it just depends what you want to use the desk for. Sometimes, there's also a bit of a wait...seemed like each of the two people at this desk could only book certain tickets for certain things. In all, it's decent that they have this facility, and that you can pick tickets up before getting to the parks, but it'd have been nice if they were honest and just told us to wait. As far as getting to the other parks goes, it's easy. We used a combination of Sat Nav on my Nokia phone and the directions sheet they give out at the front desk to find them. It couldn't be much easier to get to the parks if you're driving, the freeway entrance is about 2 mins from the hotel and hard to go wrong. For Disney, you just head up the ramp for Tampa, and follow the signs. It's easy as pie. For Universal, it's a different route but no more challenging. Florida is usually the first place many English people go in America, but it's one of the last touristy places we've hit, mainly due to the cost of motoring if you're under 25. You really DO need a car here, I wouldn't consider using public transport. With all the hassle of theme parks, the last thing you want to do is add to it by waiting around for buses, especially with the humidity. They did have an activity center, but we were never around to use it. All in all, this place is a fantastic base for exploring Orlando, and if you want to just spend a day chilling by the pool, this place will cater for you. Probably wouldn't recommend it if that's all you wanted to do (there are better places to go if you just want to chill - Marco Island for one), but for hitting the parks, I give this place two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Again next time”
Reviews.Author: mountainnew
Reviews.Content: We had an appartment with two bedrooms and a jacuzzi, two balcons and lot of space in the rooms, this was fine. Also the kitchen and the posibility for washing and drying the clothes in room was an advantage. In 10 days we say one bug at all in the area, be clear this is florida and not the sibiria. Only bad thing was the pool, not really clean, lots of hairs inside and it looks likefilterf working. Hotel is very cloth to sea world and central for the other parks and not really as big as some other hotel "towers", where you get lost. In summary we will be sure to choice this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: johnnwi
Reviews.Content: Had to move rooms 2 times because of bugs, in 2 different buildings.It was such fun going through our luggage and clothes at 1 am to make sure we didn't have any hitchhikers. The third room was okay, in a more updated building, but still not something you would expect from a Hilton brand. Housekeeping was hit or miss. One day they were there at 8 am the next day it was 5pm. Front desk staff was about as friendly as a bad rash. BEWARE they put a $100 hold on your credit card the minute they get it in their hand for "incidentals". The manager did adjust our bill for the inconvenience of moving twice, but still does not make up for a ruined vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -ask for Renovated Room -near front and Hilton Honors”
Reviews.Author: cdmjax
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews - it will tell you the hints - we had a perfect stay - the renovated room was great! Kitchen had what we needed - Publix(grocery) a few miles away...the hotel has an air compressor to fill floats - Publix will also do that for you. We had no problem getting more towels/toilet paper/laundry soap etc. Just asked hosekeeping. Events during the day by the pool - Sat night -DIVE in -movie at the pool - pools were just what we needed - (maybe if you have older kids they might want a slide etc - but for our kids - age 4-9) it was just what we needed. I joined Hilton Honors right before booking room - and I think that helped - also AAA discount. Passed on sales pitch-no problem(time share) We asked for a late ck out - got noon - then swam all afternoon - then drove home 2 hrs away. The staff was great - and everything was clean. Towels provided at the pool too.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: NicoleMorris21
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hilton. The only thing that didnt make me feel at home is the housekeeping. They dont do housekeeping unless your there for six days or more . Overall, lovely place. :)

Reviews.Title: “Expected a lot better from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Enkai
Reviews.Content: After a 5 night stay the hotel was sufficient for the low rate ($75/night), but at the same time disappointing from what I expected from a HIlton. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted at the gate, given a parking pass and directed to the lobby. The woman at the front desk was friendly but almost to a condescending degree as she told us she thought we'd enjoy our updated room next to the pool. Entering the room it had a very strong chlorine smell and the linens felt damp. As we prepared to go to dinner loud squeals and children's voices were heard right outside our window next to our bed. To the left of our window was a jacuzzi was filled with young children and one adult. I fully understand the family friendly atmosphere, however, the jacuzzi should be regulated to certain ages especially if situated right outside guest windows and at 8pm at night. After dinner I stopped by the lobby to inquire about changing rooms. The same woman who checked us in told us we would have to check back in the morning before 10am to see if there were any rooms to transfer to as they "had to keep open rooms ready incase other potential guests came in throughout the evening." It was 11:30pm! Apparently to the Hilton the potential of other guests coming in the middle of the night was more valued than an existing customer with 5 nights already purchased. I even went online that night and could've booked the same room for the same rate that night, it wasn't about the availability of changing rooms, it was about having one less room to give to a new customer without a reservation. Our comfort was sacrificed for the Hilton's unlikely potential profit, thanks. The next morning we received 2 phone calls to our room before 10am, neither of which had anything to with changing rooms but 1) to inform us about activities that would be happening that day and 2) to invite us to the sales presentation as mentioned in other reviews. Silly me for thinking either of those calls would have anything to do with my complaint the evening before. I voiced my situation when asked how our stay was going and may have well got the answer, "That's not my job, that's just my intro line, try dialing 0." As far as I'm concerned the hotel should not make promotional calls to your room, let alone twice a day each day. Luckily we spent very very little time in the room for the rest of our stay and avoided the noise (a woman gets on a megaphone for a few hours in the early afternoon in the pool area, note: this will cause a headache), and avoided the rude employees racing around on golf carts throughout the parking lots. Overall if you're looking for a reasonable rate near Sea World, Aquatica, and Discovery Cove the hotel will suffice if you get a cheap rate, but avoid rooms in the Hamilton building next to the pool if you want to have any silence during pool hours (7am-11pm). Also, maybe mention during check in that you do not wish to receive promotional calls as we had 2 messages each night we got back to our room. Otherwise the hotel is very clean (when housekeeping doesn't forget you, we did not receive housekeeping our 2nd day) and feels safe. If one receives enough tips ahead of time I believe it could be a good stay but unfortunately I do not believe one should have to obtain a guidebook to be able to enjoy their stay, especially at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Relaxing Beautiful Resort. Terrible housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: plishyploshy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of relaxation IF you have a renovated room close to the main clubhouse. Our original room was on the far end of the property where we were awoken by construction. The room was nice but a little outdated and somewhat noisy. However, once we were moved to a renovated room by the clubhouse I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Many nice activities for kids/teenagers by the pool. GREAT POOL! Nice bar/restaurant on lower level and convenient cafe/sundries on upper level of clubhouse. Nice views of Sea world and fireworks from our window and balcony. You can easily walk to Sea world and skip the $12 parking fee. Gated resort with large jacuzzi tub and full kitchen. Sofa sleeper was even a nice thick mattress. Maid service was less-than-good. We were left without any towels/toilet paper several times and 2 out of 7 days we received no maid service at all. Had to call housekeeping to get fresh toiletries (which they delivered promptly) but kind of annoyed that we even had to ask.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfy and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mof5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 recently spent 3 nights here. It was a marketing package special and we agreed to attend a 2 hour sales presentation. We were going to be in FL at that time anyway visiting with family. Check-in was quick. Our condo was very nice. Clean, spacious enough. There was a master bedroom with king and second bedroom with queen and queen sleep sofa. Also a sleep sofa in the living room. The sleep sofas are very high quality ( I know because I have the same brand in my basement, expensive and comfortable.) The kitchen is very well stocked. Housekeeping came daily and was not put out when I requested extra coffee. Our kids (16, 14, 10, 7 & 2) liked the pools and covered play area. We were really just using this resort as a place to get together with friends that are local. We spent a lot of time lounging and eating and drinking. The Coral Reef by the pools is good and very convenient. Our servers, Zack and Gavin, were very friendly. We spent an afternoon at Seaworld (right across the street) and the big kids could walk back on their own. Seaworld has a $39 after 3pm ticket which was perfect because we weren't there for the hottest, busiest time of day. (My 2-year-old loved the Pets Ahoy! show) I digress... back to the resort... So we had to go to a nearby property (Parc Soleil) for the sales pitch and we were led to a table and told to help ourselves to coffee and muffins. About 15 minutes later someone came over to us and said that they were running behind so she was going to take us to the gift desk. So we got a voucher for $200 off a Homewood Suites Stay and 20,000 HHonors points and they showed us the door, no pitch required. I guess they don't want our money. The rest of our stay was very pleasant. All staff that we dealt with were friendly and helpful. One of the valets (can't remember his name, sorry) gave us a lift over to Seaworld to meet the rest of our party even though they didn't have shuttle service at that time and told me I could call over and he'd come to pick us up later. Also the business center staff was very pleasant and helped our teenage daughter with some copying of photos for her and her friend. Very nice staff and they are not up your butt every second and we appreciate that!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Katigurl32
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the resort we were pleasantly surprised to see that the grounds were nicely kept. The building we stayed in was older and did have some minor cosmetic issues, but nothing terrible. For what we payed for the room, I could overlook a few blemishes. The activities offered at the resort made for a good time with children. Two larger pools had many things to do daily. The 1 bedroom unit we stayed in had plenty of room for a family of 4. We had plenty of room to spread out, and the nice 6 person dining table made it easy to feed the kids without being crammed in a traditional hotel room. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Wood return in the future. Very close to Seaworld, Aquatica and Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool - otherwise not impressed - Recommend Hilton Conv instead”
Reviews.Author: Sw0rdf1sh
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond member I typically stay in varied Hilton properties across the Country and as so I feel I'm rather understanding on how service should be handled, especially at a property that has the word "Grand" in it's title. This property did not live up to my expectations. Pro's - Nice big pool area with waterfall, childrens pool, enclosed splash zone and hot tubs - Pool bar service and food was good - Provided a "childrens buffet" one night with great fare and good price point (at pool bar) - Nice little "market" where Starbucks coffee, breakfast sandwiches, groceries could be purchased - Great market staff Con's - Expansive property could be difficult for some to walk (we had a building close to pool) - Less than stellar maid service - Agressive calls from Hilton Staff wanting time for a sales pitch during your stay - Less than accomodating front desk staff I stayed at this property for 2 nights with my wife, 6 year old and 18 month old. We were staying in Orlando before a family reunion in Siesta Key and planned attending Discovery Cove on our first full day. We arrived around 4pm and I waited a few minutes for an available front desk agent. I was not greeted as a Diamond member (which doesn't really matter, just knowing typically this is a Hilton process) and the clerk quickly started to check me in. I mentioned that I had called last week and again that morning to inquire about an upgrade from the room that we booked. I was told that the property did not provide free upgrades as he was running my keys. I quickly mentioned that was not a problem, if an upgrade was available for pay let's discuss it. Reluctantly the clerk tossed the keys aside and went back to the terminal to see what was available. Needless to say, in this huge complex, there was nothing available. Strange, I was told on the phone earlier that they were no at capacity and it shouldn't be a problem once I arrived. We arrived at our Queen Studio and the room was nice although a little bit tight and the bathroom was tiny as well. It did have a little fridge, microwave and a safe to lock valuables in. The rooms have pack-n-plays so for parents with little ones this is nice, although you will have a tough time finding a place to put it. When it came time to pull out the couch for my son to sleep we had to put the coffee table on the balcony. I liked the market as we could run down in the morning and grab a cup of coffee, although if you were in some of the buildings further away this would be a nice walk. We left the next morning at 8AM for discovery cove, returning around 5:30 and to our shock the room had not been touched. After a long day our youngest had to take a nap so we put him down. 20 minutes later the maid knocks at the door wanting to perform service. A little frustrated we explained the baby was now sleeping and we attempted to just exchange towels. No washcloths but was told she would bring some back. Wash cloths never came but we did get a recorded voicemail at 7:59pm saying our room was not serviced due to OUR request for privacy. I'm sorry, you don't come at dinner time to make up a room and then not follow through on the only request. The next morning was our check out and we had considered hanging out by the pool. I called to request an extended check out (it's 10:00AM currently) and was flatly denied. At 9AM a maid (gasp) knocks on our door to ask us if we are checking out today. Funny, that speedy service wasn't available during our stay just helping us have that feeling of kicking us out the door as soon as possible. Check out was fairly quick although I had to go to the front desk instead of the typical bill brought tot he door. Was never asked how my stay was once and I really didn't feel like offering. One of the best things that happened to me was while I was checking in was mentioning that I was coming back in one week for two more nights in Orlando. A front desk staffer actually recommended the Hilton Convention Center hotel which is newer and in my opinion so much nicer. On our return trip we stayed at that location and were much more pleased...even saw the fireworks at Seaworld from our room. Last thing - before we even departed to Orlando, I'm in a business meeting in DC. I get a call on my cell phone from a telemarketer from Hilton wanting to know if in my short trip would I be willing to attend a 1 hour presentation. I explained that I had my kids and was continuously prodded that they had people to watch them. I explained that I would need to speak with my wife about this and the lady wanted me to give her my wife's cell phone so she could call her. I'm sorry, not only is this unprofessional, it's just wrong. I'm not spending 1 hour of a very short stay listening to a sales presentation. I would never stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: anthony1michigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 5-10th. The room was great. Loved having a washer/dryer in the suite. We have always stayed at Disney moderate resorts. This was much better w/more room at a very reasonable price. The pools were great. Room was clean and staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place”
Reviews.Author: esha_1975
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club as I was attending a Congress in Orlando. Overall, this was a very nice, clean and visually very attractive resort that overall provided good value for money. Pros: My room was BEAUTIFUL, spacious and clean...and well priced The resort is visually quite pretty, with plenty to do (pool, walking trail, "quiet area" pool, activities centre, gym) Fairly close to major attractions (congress centre, Disney, Sea World) by car Food was decent and very well priced. Cons: Not within walking distance to much...Orlando is not a walkable city! The main restaurant is not open for breakfast...you basically have a convenience store/deli for takeout only Food is rather greasy/heavy...ie. fried fish/chicken/french fries and lots of it... No room service!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: bbvbmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Warwick house in a 2 bedroom suite. Really enjoyed the private pool area behind Warwick. Our suite was on the first floor, so there was no view - but the patios were still nice. Service staff was very friendly. My 6 yr old girl loved the activity center - and thought it was so cool to play Skittles Bingo. Hotel provides golf cart rides to the main lobby pool area which was a plus and you did'nt have to walk in the hot sun. I will say that I think the room was a little pricey for the area - but it met all of our needs!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and entertaining”
Reviews.Author: sunnysky024
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Hilton Grand Vacation and we enjoyed it! We had a 1Brd suite that was spacious, well equipped, clean and quiet. We enjoyed all 3 pools with a preference to the more private pool located behind the warwick house. Two days a week, movie is played by the main pool, which is charming (if you don't mind the heat!!). Fitness center is ok, activities are entertaining. Seaworld is 2 steps away, don't take a cab!! By the way, avoid the cabs that are called by the hotel, their prices are outrageous! Any ride seems to be at least $15!! Fortunately, there are regular taxi-cabs that offer you a much more reasonable price!! Now, the down sides of this hotel: the restaurant is very disappointing. Waiters are friendly and competent but the choice is limited... It is ok for one or two nights, after that you need to move on! Also, the hotel offers complementary pick-up and drop off to your building but you must be extremely patient... or call them well in advance!!! And... everywhere we went, there was some kind of funny smell, in the lobby and also in our shower... there is definitively some issues with the water in this hotel! But overall, an excellent time in an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Place - room "TIDY" policy STINKS”
Reviews.Author: Sonman69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with a great pool and reasonable rooms. However, one expects a room service even in the lesser hotel chains that was not touched here. Our room (2 adults, 2 teenagers) remained UNTOUCHED by maid service for two full days. On returning the second day I went to the front desk to complain. I was told there is only a TIDY POLICY at this hotel since it is a time share. That meant that you can expect new towels and bed making (obviously not on the days I am talking about) only. There is NO VACUUM service or other cleaning!!! I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND this hotel again as better room services and comparable facilities are easily available in this area.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Place to Stay in Orlando"”
Reviews.Author: ericraheemsmith
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this "resort". Was greeted at all times by a smile and hello. The pool area is huge and plenty of room for everyone. My two year old daughter never wanted to leave. We stayed 5 days in the studio room with a king bed. It was a perfect size with a nice view. The "kitchen" is really just a small pantry (small fridge, microwave and sink) but was just enough and came with plates, cups, towels, dishwashing detergent, toaster and coffee maker. The bathroom was a bit small for the size of the room but no big problem. The bed was very comfortable and room was very clean. This resort is a great find and very convenient to Sea World (a 10 minute walk to the main entrance..but we opted to take the free shuttle) and to the other attractions. Very close to International Drive too. What a great value for the cost. Tip: ask to stay in a building close to the clubhouse. The complex is huge. If you are at the far end, it is quite a walk to the main clubhouse but the staff will pick you up in a cart and there is also another small pool that is quiet and relaxing. Yes, since this is also a time share place, you will get a sales pitch or two but I told them once that I was not interested and they politely stopped (never felt pressured). Totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Super cheap and very nice”
Reviews.Author: cpagia
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on Hotwire and it was extremely cheap. Our "basic" room came with a view of some grass, a kitchenette and was clean, spacious and tidy. For the price we paid it was phenomenal. And Seaworld is a moderate walk away. Free parking was plentiful. Pool and tennis courts looked good, but we didn't use them. Not much else apart from Seaworld is in the vicinity, so you will need a car to get anywhere else. One of the nicer places we stayed on the whole 3 month trip, and also one of the cheapest :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip with a 1st class hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Wokkoone
Reviews.Content: Well done to all the staff at the HGV for continuing to keep this resort that little bit special.... This was the 2nd time we have stayed at the Sea World HGV ~ the actual Hilton photos dont do it justice... We were lucky enough to have our request for a high floor in a corner room overlooking the pool granted ~ the rooms in the Hamilton building have been renovated and the upholstery and furniture modernised since our 1st stay in 2005. The rooms are slightly dated and kind of old fashioned compared to the I-Drive HGV and the Parc Soleil but that said they are still very good. Every staff member we met was really helpfull and polite ~ they evn offer to take you to your building on a golf cart at night when you leave the bar area... A really good family feel with loads of facilities with good standards and reasonable prices. The activity centre was very good for the times when the kid`s need to escape from the sun for a cool off... Will definatley be going back.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but prepare for persistent Time sharing agent”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: The first day we arrived at the resort , we were so fascinated by the view. The pool are huge and very inviting. They even got several heated spa pools. The room we had was the two bedroom suite. Rooms are really big and very well equipped. A functional and complete kitchen. A washer and a dryer with soap, We had 3 flat screen televisions. Our room got a jacuzzi . We were really impressed. The hotel staffs are very helpful and very courteous. You could also buy some deli and other supplies from their mini market near the reception area. Booking your Theme park tickets won't be a problem which they can get it at the concierge area. In short all about the resort was great except for one thing...... We received a call from Hilton asking you about your stay and if there any assistance you would be needing. Initially we thought it was so kind of them to check on their guest. Then it was followed that they would like to invite you to join a mini presentation of their another new Hilton resort in Orlando. The lady says that it will only be less than 2 hours presentation and after the presentation they will give you some incentives. Somebody will pick us up from where we are staying then will drive us to their new resort and breakfast will be serve. Since we would like to see the new resort , we did agree to attend the presentation. Next day we were picked up by a van and when we reach the new Hilton (which some part is still on construction); we were escorted to a room where there are also a lot of guest from various Hilton resort in Orlando. Each family is assisted by a representative. Then the presentation was started. You will be asked about your lifestyle, dream vacation, also about your stay. At first the representative was very accommodating and friendly and courteous. Then after he talked for an hour then he try to convince you to get a time share at Hilton and make it appear that it would be on the guest advantage in the future. He presented to us, that it will be base on points so in the future whenever you plan to go for a vacation you can book at any Hilton in the world anytime. An amount was presented ranging from $7,000 to $14,000. We try to inform him that we do go on vacation very often and we already got other timeshare with RCI. We inform him that getting another timeshare is not our priority as of this time. In short we are not interested. But he kept on going that we are not planning our money well and that we will regret paying hotels rather than getting a timeshare with Hilton. Very persistent, a person that doesn't want to take "NO" for an answers. Sensing that we are really not interested, he told us that he could lower the price, and initial cash out would be $3,000+ and the balance will be thru financing. But he fail to convince us. Logically, we are on a vacation, why will we shell out $3,000 at that instance. He was really upset that we don't want it. His attitude suddenly changed. He left then another person approached us, this time telling us that the incentive was they are offering us resort stay for free in Hawaii, etc. but we have to give $1,000+ . with a condition it must be used in 15 months time. Then if you still don't want to get a timeshare they will refund your money after the 15 months period. But still we don't want it. After that more than 2 hours session, we were shown our way out, this time no one will assist you where the elevator was nor assist you who will bring you back to your respective hotel. When we went down the lobby area, we met the other guests that attended the same presentation. Some of them really got so angry. Not surprising, cause you are having a great vacation then all of the sudden you will feel so annoyed and intimidated by a timeshare representative. So when somebody called you room regarding a presentation, be prepared. Rated this hotel " Very Good" but not for the Hilton Time Share Representative.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cordy3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at this gorgeous location. We stayed on 5th floor of Warwick building and the 2 bed lock off villa was beautiful. The staff were the most professional and helpful we have encountered with our Florida vacations. Nothing was too much trouble, there was non-stop activities and the dive in movie is fantastic. Staff were friendly and helpful, they had print outs for directions to local attractions and shops etc. Five star luxury all round. This hotel made our holiday, we were so chilled and relaxed. On site shop which was reasonable, Pizza Hut and take-away. We had a car, but had we not had hired one, the Hilton had vast amounts of golf-carts ferrying people around the site...nothing negative to say, only we may be disappointed in other hotels now!.....

Reviews.Title: “Fun,Fun,Fun!”
Reviews.Author: olives_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The pools are beautiful and the room accommadations -great. We many meals in our kitchen which the kids loved(more time in the parks and at the pools instead of Restaurants). The food store, many beautiful restaurants, and the outlets are all right there. The Disney Parks were approximately 15 min. Sea World is directly across the street. Last but not last-the staff was excellent. All were pleasant and professional. The bartenders were equally pleasant. If you decide to stay here, Enrique makes delicious Martinis and is informative as well. Infact, if you have a question about anything or anywhere, he can guide you in the right direction. He always greeted all of us with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: poodsuk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a week here and we loved it. We stayed here in 2006 and decided to return again and I'm so glad we did. Check in was great, we asked to be near the pool and exercise room and we were right next door but our balcony faced the lake so we had no pool noise. This block has been redecorated and it was very nice. Plasma tv's in all the rooms etc. The fitness room was really good and the pool was lovely. There were about 5 or 6 spas which are great after a long day in the parks! The shop which sold coffee etc was really nice and well stocked. We never ate in the restaurant but it seemed to be very busy. Sea World is about 5 minutes walk from here with sidewalks and everything which is rare in America :o) Excellent location as in the middle for Disney/Universal. 1 minute from the hotel is the I4 to Disney. All in all I've stayed in a few timeshares in orlando and this one is the best and will probably always try and go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Really depends what building you get”
Reviews.Author: overnighttraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a studio unit for two nights when I decided to add a couple days on to a trip. When I made my online reservation, there were different choices for King Studio or Queen Studio with Sleeper and I chose the King option. I also requested a renovated building and no connecting door if possible. Upon arriving at my assigned unit in the Warwick building, I realized I was 0 for 3 on my requests. The bed definitely was not a King, looked like a Full to me, but may have been a Queen. Decor was very dated and there was a large rip in the couch cushion fabric and connecting door to the next unit was directly across from the bed. As a light sleeper, basically my worst nightmare. When I called to voice my concerns the front desk initially tried to blow me off and said studio rooms could have either King or Quenn beds and most have connecting doors. After some arguing on my part, including telling them I had specifically reserved a King which was listed as a separate option from Queen, they agreed to move me. The new unit in Hamilton House was a major improvement. Obviously recently renovated with modern decor and at least the connecting door was right near the front door which is a lot better than right by the bed. Could definitely hear next door neighbors right through the connecting door and could also hear when they were being loud in their kitchen area so I'd rate the sound proofing at about a C, but luckily they were not early risers. Bathrrom was very small and awkward and single elevator serving the entire building was painfully slow and often crowded. Overall I was definitley not impressed. I have also stayed in the two other HGV properties in Orlando, although I stayed in one bedroom units there so can't give an apples to apples comparison. I definitely thought the other two properties were vastly superior to this one. HGV on International Drive has really nice decor and views and Parc Soleil is new with good pools. I would recommend either of those properties over this one if prices are not vastly different.

Reviews.Title: “Nice swimming pool and great service”
Reviews.Author: Dragon26
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Sea World and I was quite impressed by the overall facilities of this Hilton. First of all, as the name indicates, this Hilton is very close to Sea World (10 minute walk) which makes it great for those who think they may be visiting Sea World at least once. As Sea World sells a "Fun Pass" (which is pretty much the same price as an ordinary one day ticket) which can be used to enter Sea World for an entire year, my family and I went to Sea World on consecutive days. Another thing that was great was the pool and other facilities. The pool was heated which was nice and my family spent many hours just relaxing by the pool. The prices of drinks was very reasonable and the food was above average. Like most hotels, there was always the problem of people who "reserve" a pool chair by leaving a towel, but it did appear that management was trying to keep this under control. The room was large and spacious but unfortunately I was on the 1st floor so I did not have much of a view. All in all, no complaints and I had a great time with my family. I would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 'Getaway' Haven”
Reviews.Author: JNJJ
Reviews.Content: Hilton has great places to stay in the Orlando area. We stayed here back in 2008, from a recommendation from a friend, and it was amazing. We booked again the following year, because we decided to visit Seaworld again. When you stay here, this is basically a self contained community in itself. We stayed both times in the complex closest to Seaworld, where we could sit on the patio and watch the fireworks at Seaworld. There is a restaurant that is close to the main pool area (there are two pool areas, but I will refer to the pool with the waterfall and that is close to the clockhouse). The pool area has two pools, along with a kiddy pool and a playground that is covered so it doesn't get too hot. Around the complex is a walk way that has stations that can be used as exercise equipment and it's a nice walk to take. The path actually follows the lake that is inside the complex, and we did see a gator in the lake - YIKES... but this is Florida and where there is water, there is potential alligators. Inside the check-in building is a large lounge area, with a movie theatre. There is a movie rental box that is in the lounge area as well so that you can watch movies in your room. The rooms are spacious with a full kitchen, that is open to the living room and access to bathroom and bedroom. There are washers and dryers in the room which came in handy. Overall, this is a great place to stay - especially if you have children, since there is lots to do at this place. They do have a Kids Center where there are plenty of activities for them to do. Since this is close to Seaworld, you can walk to the park, or just stay at the hotel. It is secure since there is a gate you have to go through to get into the complex. Definitely a place to consider if visiting Orlando / Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Wemorwell
Reviews.Content: We decided this was at a great central point as we didn't want to drive while in Orlando. Whilst the green Itrolley only runs every 30 minutes this wasn't a problem, you could travel down to the Premier outlets or North past Seaworld up to International drive and switch if you wanted to reach the Prime outlets. Florida Mall was a taxi ride away. We chose a 2 bedroom option, this was overkill for 2 but gave us a ton of room. The hotel rooms are very well appointed with Hotplates and oven, Fridge/freezer, dishwasher, washer & a dryer, toaster, coffee maker and our favourite the Jaccuzi, very welcome after a day of shopping or stamping round the parks. The desk organised buses to all the parks for $6 each, it was a bit of a game of sardines a couple of times but if you don't like that a taxi is around $26 to Epcot. Probably worth booking it for Universal as well ($6) but we got the Itrolley to Crossover stop 7 on International drive and a 20 minute walk. We didn't make use of the pool and the onsite Bar/Restaurant was sadly disappointing. There is a Hilton hotel 10 minute walk away which had a much nicer atmosphere in the Bar and restaurant, worth the walk and you can pick up any bits and pieces you need from the CVS store opposite. All of the staff were very friendly and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, but recommend you get a room away from the pools if you want to relax on your balcony of an evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tripsp
Reviews.Content: Great value. I recommend. Good service, big room. It was a great surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations and want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: pitterpat7
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 night stay at the club. We were never asked to listen to a timeshare pitch the entire time. The club is centrally located and we could easily travel north or south to our destinations. We stayed in a queen studio in the Pembrook building, and it looked exactly like the one on the website, except with a flat screen TV. The queen bed is basically a double bed, but it didn't bother us. It was still pretty comfortable. There were plenty of pool chairs everyday no matter what time you went down to the pools, and they refreshed the towel supply all day long. We stayed by the two main heated pools, which had daily fun activities for the kids starting at 1pm. The grounds are well kept around the hotel. There's also a big covered playground with rubber flooring, ping pong table, and pool table by the pool for entertainment. I went to check out the third pool further away from the main lobby, and it was a motel sized rectangular pool, with a jacuzzi tub. The fitness facility is nice and well kept. There is a bike, treadmills, and ellipticals all with individual TV screens. Headphones, towels, and water are provided. There's also a quarter mile path around the hotel that's nice for a walk or run. We ordered lunch one day from the grill by the pool, and the food was good and the prices were not inflated. Overall, I was very impressed with the level of security and knowing my belongings were safe by my pool chair when I'd go for a dip in the pool. I went back to the hotel room to get something and the cleaning lady was in our room. She asked me if this was my room and for my key. She closed the door and tested the key to ensure it was in fact my room. I was very impressed she took the extra minute to do this because frankly anyone could claim a room is theirs. Housekeeping came daily around 2:30pm. I'd highly recommend this resort to anyone, especially those with families. We definitely plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this resort!”
Reviews.Author: cbrylinsky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful resort and wish we were still there! The rooms were beautiful, clean, spacious and had everything we could need. The two main pools were both large and very clean with plenty of lounge chairs. Our 15 year old daughter loved the huge jacuzzi tub and totally enjoyed everything about the resort. I was also impressed with all the extra activities available, such as karaoke, movies, black jack night and many others for a variety of ages. There is a basketball court, tennis court, ping pong and pool tables and another pool. I am very picky about cleanliness and was very impressed with how spotless everything was. The maid came daily and cleaned everything. What a treat. Every employee we had any contact with was helpful and polite. The concierge provided advice about area attractions and obtained tickets for a dinner show we wished to attend. I know that this is a time share but we were never pressured to buy into it. The first morning we received a polite call about attending a seminar breakfast which we declined and were simply given a number to call if we changed our mind. We did not have a rental car but the shuttle service to Universal and Sea World was good. We used the I-ride trolley, a little slow, or taxis for other excursions. We are all very excited to return but we will rent a car next time so that we can venture a little further and will definitely stay longer. We have in the past stayed on property at Disney, which we love, and Universal but I have to say that this is the best vacation we have ever had in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Surer value. Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gooman
Reviews.Content: WE got there a little early. No problem. I asked for a room away from the center "quiet" and also asked if we could have an recently updated room. No problem. We got a second story room overlooking a huge heated lap pool and a hot tub. It seemed almost everyybody was over at the more central pools. The people ,the room, and the grounds were excellant. We booked this hotel because of what we learned at Tripadvisor. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with housekeeping problems”
Reviews.Author: Koppit
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a peaceful location. Staff were very friendly and we stayed for 2 weeks in a King 1 Bed- Suite with a 2 and 4 year old who slept on the sofa bed. The room was very spacious and much bigger than anything we'd find in Europe of equivalent price. We used this hotel as a base for visiting the Disney parks and would highly recommend it as a means of doing this with a hire car and small children Pros: - All 3 swimming pools were heated. Lovely pool area and plenty of sunbeds. - Free parking and wireless in-room internet - very child friendly with covered outdoor play area, daily activities, and movies - more of a holiday resort feel than just a hotel - very clean and spacious rooms Cons: - housekeeping was very mixed. We bought a box of 50 nappies which went missing from our room, and our door was left open on one occasion. - water poured through our ceiling on one night from the jacuzzi bath above us. If not for these factors I would happily give the hotel 5 stars, but housekeeping issues seem to be a recurring theme. However, I would happily return here again and would recommend it to others with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: lovevacationOH
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was ideal for traveling with children. We had a king bedroom suite and it was clean, well appointed and spacious. The pools are fantastic, kids activity center great and the restaurant decent and reasonably priced. This place really makes you feel as though you are on vacation! We arrived on a Friday night and what fun down at the pool area! The service could be better in the restaurant but it wasnt a big deal. We loved our suite and having a bit of space with the kids. The whirlpool tub was nice. We definately will be back or would like to try another HGVC.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericajannini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week stay at this hotel and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is really clean, the staff is very helpfull and the service is excellent! They helped us a lot and very fast with everything we needed. The location is very good: right outside sea world. The room was pretty big: room enough for us and our large suitcases! There was no breakfast, but we had a small kitchen with toaster, a refrigerator,coffee maker and microwave oven, which was enough for us to cook our own breakfast and eat before going to the parks. Also they had free wireless internet in our rooms with very good signal! We would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time.. Walkable to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: JoeJUsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 2 children (ages 2 and 4). Had a great 2bdr suite for a VERY good price. The kids activities were fantastic. Great play area and pool area was perfect. Ate dinner at the pool side bar/grill and had great service and good food. The suite is large and having a washer and dryer is always nice with little kids. Dollar for dollar this is a fantastic bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Studio Queen Suite”
Reviews.Author: Cindy-Milford
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at this resort. Previously I have stayed in the 2 bedroom units which are roomy and nicely decorated. This review is for a 1 room studio queen. The room was comfortable. Basic amenities are provided: coffee maker, mini refrigerator, microwave, sink and suficient plates, glasses etc... for 2 persons. There is a queen bed, and a pull out sofa an armoire w tv and a table and 2 chairs that furnish the studios, it is a tight squeeze as rooms go. Additionally there is a screened patio with a table and chairs on it. I traveled for business this trip: the resort room was inexpensive (under $100) in comparison with many resorts and hotels around the convention center, as it was the week between the Daytona 500 and "Bikers Week" and most hotels jack up prices (Hiltons did not). Overall the staff was friendly and helpful. Common areas are well maitained and clean. However, housekeeping left much to be desired. I assumed since I booked it as a "hotel" and not a "time share condo" I would recieve daily maid service, and supposedly I was to get it... however, on 2 of the 5 days, the maid conveniently didn't show until 5PM as we were getting back from our conference and needing to change to have dinner meetings. When the maid finally did show up I told her we only needed her to place fresh towels and TP in the bathroom and coffee for the kitchenette, we got the towels and coffee, but discovered at 10PM no TP, so I had to call down to front desk for it to be brought up (they brought up enough for a family of 10). The floors of the studio looked as thought they had not been mopped in months. However, overall the place appeared generally clean. Our TV did not work properly so it was replaced w/ another that had "ghosts" or double picture due to age, but we were here on business so we did not make a big deal out of it. On my "free" day I decided to lie around the pool, which is great for a resort, one pool has a waterfall in it and both are heated. Plenty of activities for children (face painting, T-shirt painting), a great place for families to take a day off from the "parks". To my very pleasant surprise there was Live music to enjoy around the pool area throughout the day. For exercise enthusiasts like myself, there is a 1/4 mile running/jogging trail around the little lake and a decent exercise room w/ a few treadmills bikes, free weights and some pilates and yoga equipment (which I used as often as I could). Overall I would recommend this resort for business travelers and families (if you can deal with the minor inconveniences of the housekeeping issues). I am sure i will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at motel rates”
Reviews.Author: SteveS1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights while visiting Disney World in a studio with kitchenette. The resort is a Hilton timeshare and has all the usual family amenities. Pools,grills,activities, etc. The room was very comfortable and quiet. I was concerned about noise after reading the TA reviews. We were in the newest building farthest from the entrance and maybe better insulated for noise. The building was full but we never heard a sound. A great value for $89 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: manwaring7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our visit to Hilton Grand Vacations Club at SeaWorld. Our suite was beautiful, with a king size bed, a whirlpool tub, a fully equipped, kitchen, a screened-in porch and a washer and dryer. Hilton thought of all the details. Our kitchen was stocked with paper towels, detergent, liquid soap, sponges, etc. They even provided laundry detergent for the washer/dryer. There was plenty of room for the kids and we all slept comfortably. We loved being right across the street from SeaWorld and only a couple minutes away from Disney, restaurants, grocery stores, etc. We did have a rental car, which I'd recommend with young children, and we found the HGVC a great home base for our trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gill2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days after coming back from a cruise. Wife got a good price on Expedia (about $75 a night) Upgraded to a full suite (we were on a honeymoon after getting married on the boat) with LCD' TV's, DVD player, full kitchen, and spa tub. Loved the room and the privacy. Access to the grounds is via gate and there's security that goes around 24/7 in the parking lot. Amenities are plenty with free wi-fi, fitness centre, a movie theatre in the lobby, grocery store downstairs (that even sells liquor), pool table, playground for kids, and the pools and the view to the small lake they have in the back is just something you should experience. Distance to Theme Parks is decent. It's literally right at the entrance at Seaworld but they also have a free shuttle to the other parks. We normally stay at Doubletree in Orlando but after such a good experience here (especially in the pools), I think we found a new favorite place in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen items from room”
Reviews.Author: sadbuttrue_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel and had personal property stolen from my room. I made a formal complaint and spoke with housekeeping. Later to find out that they will not be reimbursing me for my stolen items and were not able to locate. I have always stayed in Disney hotels and never had a problem, even when pillows were left behind I came back and housekeeping had them in a bag and ready to return to me. I'm very disappointed in this hotel and how they treat their customers and not feeling any remorse for what happened on thier property. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: susiet81
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Sea World and were very pleased with our accomodations. The unit was a 1 bedroom king with a huge garden tub and very large bathroom with shower. We also had a full kitchen, dining area and living room. The kitchen was well equipped with most everything that we needed. There was also a washer/dryer in the unit. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dschuch
Reviews.Content: We loved the room....the huge banana tree leaves outside our screened in balcony overlooking the pool. Very comfortable beds and close to everything. A two BR unit gives everyone their own space and it really felt like a vacation. Such nice decor and 3 TVs make downtime a pleasure. Close to everything....right across from Sea World and bus stops right out the door if you want to take the shuttle. Great Pool! Convenience store on premises and having a washer and dryer in your unit is an added plus!

Reviews.Title: “Restful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HGVC Seaworld for three nights in December 2009 as a last minute trip to see the St. Petersburg Bowl. (We flew into Orlando which was much cheaper than flying into Tampa, and rented a car and drove...took us less than 2 hours to drive to St. Petersburg!) We never stayed at this HGVC resort yet, but love the HGVC on International Drive. Despite concerns that the resort amenities were 'outdated', but on short notice, this was the only resort that could accomodate us. However, after my stay, I think I like this resort more than the other one! We were put in the Villa group closest to the clubhouse/check in building, in a studio suite. It may have been renovated already...the color scheme was contemporary with neutrals. The view outside the window was of the lovely walking path that winds around th facility. The TV was a LCD flat screen. Free high speed internet was good. Bed was king sized, and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but that may have been due to the location/layout of the room...it was sort of wedged into a corner. The studio was able to be connected to the adjoining suite to form a 2 or 3 bedroom unit. Because of this, we felt like we could hear more noise from the unit over, (a family with a small child)which was pretty unfortunate when we wanted to sleep in late after checking into the resort at 3AM. Around the common areas, we loved the convenience store. The prices didn't seem to be too expensive either. There was a mini Pizza Hut and a deli for prepared meals. What we really loved was the bar and the tarped area over looking the pool. We had a night cap one night and it was lovely. This area also served as the resort's restaurant, and the menu (lunch/dinner) seemed very well rounded. We had the buffet breakfast on Sunday, which was convenient but a bit on the expensive side (at least the food was good and and freshly prepared/restocked). Because of our short stay and even shorter time spent at the resort (mainly for sleeping), I didn't get to see more of what was on offer. I would definitely like to go back again! Too bad that it was too chilly to sunbathe by the pool...when we were there, it barely cracked 70, but at least it was better than being at home in the midst of a big snow storm!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon vacation”
Reviews.Author: proudmother06
Reviews.Content: they had great customer service....close to all attractions, scheduled shuttle bus for busch gardens, and pools, jacuzzis in the rooms, screened off porches. all in all it was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: baronflier
Reviews.Content: There are several buildings to this property. We must have stayed in the bad building. As a Diamond member, I expected more. The bathroom was in great disrepair, the small queen (really a twin) bed very hard, and the room smelled funny. We checked out and went to the Doubletree, which was very nice and highly recommended - the doubletree used to be the Sheraton world resort at Sea world and was very nice (we stayed in the tower).

Reviews.Title: “Great for a get-away”
Reviews.Author: Ellen20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend get-away to Orlando. We spent a lot of time searching for a hotel - looking for the right combination of price, location and quality. Based on the overall rating on TripAdvisor, this felt like a bit of a gamble but we were totally satisfied with our experience at the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites. Our "room" was a large suite with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, balcony, large bedroom and a bathroom with both a standing shower and huge 2-person soaking tub. Everything was clean and the room furnishings were attractive and of an adequate quality. Orlando had record cold temperatures while we were there so we did not get to enjoy the many outdoor pools, but they looked great! The hotel is located right on the trolley route so we were able to easily make our way around Orlando without a rental car (there is an outlet mall and a nice Publix less than 10 minutes away via the trolley). Taxis to Downtown Disney were about $20 each way and Sea World is literally just around the corner - a very easy walk. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a visit to Orlando! As a tip, they might try to convince you to attend a "pitch" on Hilton's time share program. Two tickets to Sea World for <$50 was definitely worth sitting through a 1.5 hour presentation. And, while their program isn't for us, it sounds like a good idea for some people!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: JayceP
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay we were treated like we were special. From the initial checkin all the way to checkout, at every turn we were greeted with a smile and a hello. This was a quick trip and we knew we were not going to be in the hotel much, so I booked a smaller room ($100) full well knowing I was going into a cheaper room in a resort like this, but to my surprise the room was great and all the other actitivies were there for me as well. Without a doubt, I would stay there again and as a matter of fact we are already looking at spring of 2011 for our next trip down!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MarciaCM
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and my 24 year old son stayed at the HGVC Sea World last december. We were amazed with the hotel. We arrived early and they already had an apartment for us. We stayed at a king size 1 bedroom suite. My son slept on the queen sofa bed and was very happy. The kitchen was spotless with a full refrigerator, full oven, microwave and all the appliances you might need to cook. Although in vacation, I cooked some days....specially pasta. I loved everything on the room.....and the jacuzzy was fantastic. We also hada a beautiful balcony. the room is nicely decorated and the furniture looked new. We stayed at the Smith's building, which was good because it was away from the pool area....it was really quiet during the day and night. I would return again of course!!!!!!! And will tell my friends about it.

Reviews.Title: “Condo was more than expected”
Reviews.Author: peedlej
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for adult relaxation so we booked our vacation after school started. Was amazed at how many children don't attend school anymore...LOL. The condo was more than accomodating for 5 people. The large living room and dining area combined with outdoor screened balcony allowed the group of us to do our own thing if needed. The kitchen was furnished with all the needs of a cook (which I did) and enjoyed it. The close proximity to the attractions was great. The rental car was handy for grocery shopping and the beer runs! The pools were warm and cool so you had choices. The staff poolside were fantastic as well as staff throughout the resort. Before you book do find a way to see a map of the grounds. It is a large resort and security gate (pizza delivery issue) so it is safe. You can choose to be close to the action or removed from the noise. We spent a lot of time at the small quiet pool because it was warm water and the general sun bather's there were in the adult category without children. Reading a book there was relaxing but no bar service so we BYOB and had a great time. Our unit was on the 3rd floor faving the Golf Course next door so our evenings were spent out on the screened patio. Construstion was going on but they did not start until 8am so we were ready to go anyway. They are refurbishing all the units there in phases from what i could tell but not a problem at all. So enjoy your stay if you book. One last thing... spend the money for the whole day at Dolphin Adventure just down the road. Great sandy beach, lazy river, free Budweiser product as well as soda and water, all food included, and the snorkeling, DO IT! Buy and reserve in advance form home before you go and there are discounts. With the purchase of the Dolphin Adventure we received 3 day unlimited access to Sea World which is within walking or shuttle from the resort. Have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaAvenue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I The staff members were great. The room was spotless and the amenities can't be beat. This is a great place for families and is within walking distance of Sea World. I paid for a queen studio and asked for an upgraded room if possible. I was upgraded to a huge one-bedroom unit and I will definintely go back! My friend was staying at a nearby Rennaisance for $269 a night and it was a typical hotel room. This place is a vaction resort. Big Difference.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Home and close to the action”
Reviews.Author: AndyWirral
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 bedroomed 3 bathroomed apartment, in the Devonshire Block. It could not of been better, son, daughter in law had the room with the Jacuzzi, the 2 girls had a bedroom with double bed each and self and wife had a more or less self contained Granny flat. TV in lounge and all bedrooms. The 3 pools were excellent, with towels provided, the grounds were well laid out and spotless, the cinema was ideal for the girls. The staff were helpfull and very friendly The location was ideal all Disney parks within 15 minutes drive, Walmart and I Drive within 15 mins. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mollysaidso
Reviews.Content: Amazing, beautiful location with excellent service! Across the street from Seaworld and minutes away from Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STAR PROPERTY IN ALL RESPECTS!”
Reviews.Author: mungi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks at this incredible property and I can't say enough good things about it. The staff is wonderful, the place is as clean as can be and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC continues to exceed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jeffpags
Reviews.Content: There's nothing better then returning to the same hotel, year after year, and experiencing it getting better with each visit. Currently the pool area is being repainted and the rooms are being redone in some of the buildings. Last year, the deli/marketplace was renovated, and the year before the pool bar was expanded/improved. Great place for the kids, with the daily activities and movie theater on-site. Couldnt have asked for a more enjoyable hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Kids had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: buffy6
Reviews.Content: While the reviews previous to mine said the hotel was looking tired, I'm sitting here right now watching all the refurbishments they are doing. The whole main building just got a brand new coat of paint and it looks great! The lobby is in the midst of rennovation at the moment and they tell me it will be done in mid-Dec. Our room is on the ground floor in the Padget House (one of the further buildings away from the main area) however it is beautiful. The kitchen area is great because we went out to Publix down the road and went grocery shopping so we didn't have to eat out every day. The main pool area is very nice. One pool is heated and one is not. There is also shuffleboard, ping-pong, a pool table, kids play area, and kids pools as well as numerous hot tubs. On our first day here, we spent the entire day at the pool and the kids (ages 3 and 8) had a fabulous time. There are many organized activities to keep the kids busy in or out of the pool. The outdoor restaurant is right on the pool deck so it was nice to grab something to eat. We are not vacation club owners. We got a good deal on the hotel over Thanksgiving in exchange for sitting through a 2-hr. vacation club presentation. They stuck to the 2hr. timeframe and when we realized the vacation club membership wasn't for us, they shook our hands, sent us on our way and there was no pressure what-so-ever. This resort is directly across the street from Sea World and about a 15 min. drive from all the Disney theme parks. We went and saw the other Hilton Grand Vacation property today, Parc Soleil, and while it is much, much nicer, it's also brand new compared to this property that is 15 yrs. old. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, starting to look tired”
Reviews.Author: CanvasTraveller
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in November in a studio on an RCI exchange week. The location is great, 5 minutes walk to Seaworld (you can get a shuttle to acquatica from seaworld entrance). An I Tram stop and a Lynx bus stop just outside the entry gate whoch will take you up and down International drive and to other locations in the area. Resort has shuttles to key attractions but they don't run very often so we did not use them. Studio was a good size but starting to show its age, noted that other buildings had been recently refurbished with flat screen TV's etc, suppose you can't do them all at once, but the block we were in (Somerset) needs to have its turn soon as its starting to show its age. Very limited central services, tiny bar and small restaurant for size of resort, guess people either self cater or eat out. Restaurant food was very mediocre and I would not reccommend it other than for a quick drink. Basic grocery store on site and Pizza take away but you would be better of stocking up at Publix or Wal Mart before you arrive if you have a car. Resort offers a lot of entertainement (very Hi de HI, Brits will understand), we did not participate but events seemed to draw reasonable crowds which suggests they were well run. Staff were always friendly and courteous when seen but we did not need them for anything. Fine for a November exchange week

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-average stay”
Reviews.Author: RoamingGnomette
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times over the past several years and have had a good experience. Sadly, I can't say that our recent stay fell in that category. We are owners in HGVC time share and are use to the HGVC level of service. That being said, our stay was good until Friday evening when our one bedroom unit was overwhelmed with cigarette smoke. Upon investigation, it was coming in through the A/C unit. We turned off the A/C and closed the vents (good thing it was Nov.). We called the front desk and told them about our issue. They listened but didn't seem overly concerned. We then looked out on our screened porch to see that the only occupied unit was the one above us (our unit was a ground floor, corner unit). We called the desk again, since the smell had not dissapated, and this time the staff said that they would send security to check it out but sounded a little put out. We didn't hear anything about any resolution to the issue. This happened again on Saturday night, prior to our departure on Sunday. I called ,checking on check-out time, and again mentioned that the cigarette smell was back. The staff member said that security didn't find anything the night before. They were more understanding but the issue was not resolved. I have no issues with people who want or need to smoke. They have just as much right to smoke as I do to have a smoke less room when on vacation. But I do have an issue with people who do not follow rules just because it doesn't suit them. Overall the stay was ok but I can't help but wonder, as does another reviewer, if there are other properties that would better suit our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure that we would return.”
Reviews.Author: cody2222
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, read many reviews before deciding on a hotel and for the most part, I feel like the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Sea World Intl., was an ok choice. Let's start with the good things first: we were able to get an early check-in (11am); the one bedroom suite with whirlpool tub was great - very clean (which is one of the most important details I look for in hotel reviews); all of the rooms were very spacious and furnished nicely; the kitchen and bathroom were well stocked with supplies (dish detergent, paper towels, laundry detergent, Crabtree and Evelyn soaps, lotions and shampoos); the screened in porch was great, especially since it was unusually hot and humid for the end of October and the bugs were still out in full force; the pool that was next to our building was beautiful and not crowded (I guess that most guests head to the main two pools near the clubhouse) and finally, the location of the hotel is great (across the road from Sea World, a couple of minutes from International Drive - where there are many restaurants to pick from and an easy drive to all of the Disney parks). Now, for the not so good comments: I specifically asked for a room that was in a quiet building (we were put in building #9, which is at the far end of the complex and we were told, is the most quiet) and our room was a corner unit on the third floor (there are six floors). I don't know if it's our bad luck or not - but, whenever we travel, we always manage to be placed next to noisy, rowdy travelers - hence, the specific request for a quiet location. But, bad luck followed us once more because our first night, we were awakened at 3am by a young, Jamaican couple having a nasty, very loud argument (I lost count of the number of F-bombs that were dropped). Remember, we're on a corner unit with only one other guest room next to us and it figures, we get the obnoxious neighbors. I attributed the argument to a long night of partying - so, I closed the bedroom and bathroom doors, turned on the AC and the noise was somewhat blocked out. On our second day - they were at it again (at 7am) - only much louder and more obscene. We called the front desk to ask for security to handle the problem - which they did eventually send someone - just as the neighbors were getting ready to check out. My advice, if you want a quiet location, request a corner room on the sixth floor of building 9 or 10 and if you do get rowdy neighbors, call security right away. We waited too long. A few other negative comments: the housekeepers never showed up at our room the second day of our stay. We had been at one of the parks all day and on returning to the hotel at 5:30pm, our bed was still not made and our wet towels, from the morning, were still hanging in the bathroom. We called the front desk and were told that the housekeeping staff was at the hotel until 6pm and that someone would take care of our room. About ten minutes later there was a knock on the door and a young man simply handed me fresh towels and walked away. Advice - verify on check-in what your housekeeping arrangements are - whether it's a full cleaning or just fresh towels, trash emptied and bed made each day. If they don't follow through - call. Regardless of the two mentioned negative comments - we still had a great time - I'm just not sure if I would come back to the Hilton. I think that there are better places to try the next time that we're in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mackjoe1
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay , very clean , great for kids , me and my girlfriend stayed here for # nights and it was close to everything you could want. big pools very big rooms . i just dont have a bad thing to say about this place .

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: LevFamNJ
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, husband and 2 daughters - ages 3.5 and 9 months) as well as my sister and parents all went to the Hilton Sea World. The vacation was perfect from start to finish. The rooms were spacious (we had the 2 bedroom suite) and clean. All the amenities you could ask for! There was always something going on for the kids and yet if you didn't want to participate it was not overwhelming in any way. It was minutes away from Sea World and International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Resort Hotel - We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AreWeHavingFunYet
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI Exchange for us and we couldn't have been more pleased! We spent a week in the Orlando area. We had two adjoining units that had a total of 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, two kitchens, a dining room, and huge living room. Plenty of room for the 6 of us to spread out. There were 4 TVs altogether. The larger unit has a washer and dryer (super convenient when travelling with kids!). The master bedroom had a large bathroom, as well as a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. Each unit had a fully-screened deck with table and chairs which we enjoyed each morning as we drank our coffee and had breakfast. The screen provided safety from the kids climbing over the railing, and prevented tropical bugs and mosquitos from getting in. We travelled with 4 adults (2 grandparents and 2 parents), and 2 children ages 5 and 1 1/2. The hotel provided a Pak and Play for the baby to sleep in. Everything was luxurious and super clean. Comfy, comfy beds with tons of pillows. The resort is right across from Sea World and a close drive away to the other parks. They had printed clear driving directions to the parks, grocery store, etc. The resort has beautiful pools and children's activities, as well as a fully-stocked grocery/deli and pool-side restaurant. Really, everything was just perfect in this resort. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the price”
Reviews.Author: mommy22girlz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Grand Resort at Seaworld. We stayed in the 2 room suite, which was huge. The pools were extremely nice and clean. The hotel is right across from Seaworld and only 10 - 15 minutes from the Disney parks. The only negative thing about the hotel is that they only bring bath linens once a week, so our family of four quickly ran out of washcloths. However, a call to the front desk was all it took for them to bring some to our room. Overall, we had a nice stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JH56003
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct 10 through Oct 17 in a 3 bedroom 3 bath unit and had a great experience. We were in the Devonshire building. The unit was quite clean and in very good shape. If you look very closely, there is some normal wear and tear but that is to be expected. We especially enjoyed the layout - plenty of space for people to retreat to their own area of the unit for some quiet time at the end of the day. The grounds are beautiful with a wide variety of tropical plants and trees - very well maintained. We were very pleases with the pools and spas. Note - the pool attendant told us they try to keep the 4 spas at the main pool area at different temperatures so find the one you like most. The main pool is fairly lively throughout the day and into the evening. The best kept secret is the Parrish pool, complete with spa, kid's pool, and nice seating. This pool was quiet every evening with light music playing. This pool was also very warm. You should note the resort is gated with an attendant for an added level of security. Overall, the staff was pleasant and helpful. Great location that is super convenient to all Disney parks and an easy 10-15 minute drive to the parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “And this is why I always stay at the Hilton...”
Reviews.Author: tampaman34
Reviews.Content: First time member staying at a Hilton Grand Vacations club, but not to the Hilton overall. Checked in on Friday and left on Sunday and had a WONDERFUL time. I have nothing but positives from the hotel from the staff, pool, spas, the spacious rooms with the Jacuzzi in the master bedroom, and the enormous kitchen to cook in. There are 2 other HGV in Orlando and I look forward to staying there as well…and of course I would be more than happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed.....”
Reviews.Author: WashPA0214
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 from 84 to 20 years old all enjoyed our week at this resort! We visited Disney, Universal, and Sea World. Each night we came back to a clean, relaxing, place to stay and enjoy. Movies, pools, and just a beautiful setting. Any time we had a question there was an imediate reponse. A light globe was cracked. We called to report it and they offered to replace it. It was not an issue, but an example of the service. What was really great were the golf carts that would transport you from one building to another, the pool, etc. Just a call away or flag one down! The only thing I wish they would improve is the wireless internet - it was lousy. Go and Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt one of the best hotels I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Ulinha
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, we spent 9 days in this fantastic hotel in September. We are usually very picky as far as hotels are concerns and I always take a lot of time looking for the right place to stay. Hilton at Sea World Orlando turned out to be one the best hotels we have ever stayed and we will return there for sure!!! Rooms were very nice, with a good size bed and really nice bathroom. Hotel area was absolutely wonderful, and swimming pools were just what we were looking for after a long day in the parks, or on those lazy days when you just want to stay by the pool all day long! There was always something to do there. In the evenings they played movies on the big screen by the main pool! Absolutely fantastic!!! Security is a very important factor for me, and I was happy to see that security staff was there 24/7. Although the restaurant did not serve the most fantastic food, on the last day we had burgers and they were just delicious!!! Staff of the hotel are the nicest people I've met there, and they were always happy to help! It seems like for them impossible was nothing... I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone: couples and families. We will definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: stmalo67
Reviews.Content: Traveled on a gift of a timeshare week from the boss, and this was a beautiful resort. Pools (3) were never over crowded, staff was delightful and very helpful. The little things mean a lot to us, and the concierge service and welcome were great. We didn't like our first room for the distance from the pool and were switched to another within minutes. All rooms are suites - two bedrooms, two baths, with full kitchens, dining area and screened balconies. Whirpool tub, two sinks, and shower in the master bath- I loved the whirlpool tub! No experience with the restaurant- such easy access to other areas like International Drive area made it fun to get "off campus" and explore.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: phoebekitty6
Reviews.Content: My year old daughter and I accompanied my husband to Orlando during a recent business trip. We stayed a week - several days after his conference ended. I would highly recommend this property. I really have no complaints other than the location of the some of the builidings. Upon check-in we were placed in a building quite far from the pool. I asked and received a different room. There are many buildings at this resort - some require much walking to the main pool/restaurant/activities area. The only down side to being near the pool was the noise. The building we were moved to was next to Int'l Blvd. We heard lots of sirens through the night and basically had a view of Sea World's parking lot. Oh well, can't have everything! For us, the noise was an okay trade to be closer to everything. The unit itself was extremely nice, immaculate with modern decor and appliances. Bathroom was lovely as was the jacuzzi tub.
