Room service came very late in the day - like 5ish - but they did a good job. The property is also near everything. You can get to downtown, Whole Foods, and a host of other places very easily Pools were awesome and plentiful! The toddler pool was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service - Loud Construction”
Reviews.Author: Vacaydoc
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel offering full ammenities and easy parking. The time I was there was during a major renovation/addition and I was not told this was to be taking place. Usually, construction stops on the weekends. This did not! If you can make sure it will be quet....Great place to stay. If not, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: mrmonkfish65
Reviews.Content: wow,what a great place to stay,the staff are one big happy family and you can tell,nothing is too much trouble as they want your stay to be stress free.From booking in at the reception we had a great time,the suite we were given was fantastic it had 2 bedrooms a kitchen with washer dryer and dishwasher,The jacuzzi was so big we could both get in..it was so clean and well maintained we were so pleased. Entertainment on sit was low key but enough for the location with poolside quizzes and karaoke in the evening, although we didnt take part it looked like everyone had fun.also a film was shown every night either in the cinema or at the pool under the stars,and if that wasnt your thing there was always the dvd boothe in the lounge hiring upto date dvds for your room where a dvd player is provided also. The location is also great as you can walk to seaworld/Aquatica in 15 mins or get the free shuttle , another shuttle will take you to universal for a $6 fee pp.There is a walmart or publix store within a 5 min drive and int drive is very close too. overall i would advise anyone who is thinking of booking this resort to do it,because we couldnt fault any of it.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: dnehmad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near every park in Orlando. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a 2 bedroom with 6 people and we were all very comfortable. The resort had activities if you wanted and the pool area was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with Hilton and got a good AAA rate during the low season. Secured property with guard gate. Not Fort Knox but one more obstacle for someone trying to get on property that should not be there. Several condo style buildings with exterior entrances to the rooms. I usually prefer interior room entrances but the guard gate did make me feel a little more secure - that and being on the top floor. Front desk very personable and upon checking in at the guard gate there was a greeter that met you as you got out of your car. Nice touch Hilton! Nice suite style room with mini microwave and refrigerator. Literally next door to Sea World - but still a walk given the size of the theme park. About 15 minutes from Universal. Good central locations for all of the theme parks. Would stay again if I can get the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabeReading
Reviews.Content: 10 out of 10. Echo previous reviews. There was nothing I could critic about this resort, it had it all and with so much to do out and about the week flew by. The highlight of the week was the 'dive in' movie and the resort aligator. A movie projected onto a canvas on the edge of the pool - watching while you swam at night was amazing. There were no rules but everything was nice and looked after all the staff were great but not intrusive. We rarely consider going back to resorts - but I have to say I think we may be back to HGVC! This was a good week as US schools went back on 24th Aug - no queues in the parks meant we had shorter days there whilst still seeing everything.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a refurbished room!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart_J_T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights late in August and overall enjoyed our stay. There are 11 blocks of accommodation, we were initially allocated to one of the older ones (St Georges). After initially being impressed with the layout and size of the room (a 1 bed apartment), we soon noticed that the room was old, tired and in serious need of a re-furb. There was a huge TV in the living room, but it also had a huge crack in it and the picture was poor. So, we were now feeling a bit disappointed and the final straw came when we were just about to go to bed at night, and the toilet wouldn't flush. An engineer came to fix but couldn't, still he was helpful and showed me how to get round the issue and said someone would fix properly in the morning. Next morning, I asked to move to a newer or refurbished room. I am under the impression that only three blocks had been refurbed so far (5, 8 & 11 I think). We were moved to block 8 (Warwick), the new room was much better and everything appeared newer. The hotel facilities and pools are overall quite nice, but it gets very busy by the main pools and quite loud! I would really recommend the ice creams from the hotel shop, my kids really enjoyed those - quite a treat! I believe most of the other old blocks are also going to be re-furbished soon, but until they are I don't believe this hotel deserves a high rating!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jovanlp
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in their jacuzzi suite after military training and my God it was awesome and well priced. No detail was left out! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great Girlfriends Getaway”
Reviews.Author: houseofpayne14
Reviews.Content: So close to Sea World! Could walk it...Did Discovery COVE also - AWESOME! And hotel easily arranged transport to Ritz for our Spa day...SAVED A LOAD OF $$ as we never ended up renting a car...got in late and took cab to hotel...never ended up needing to go and get car AT ALL...Either quick cab or free shuttles available as we were keeping to this area of Orlando for our stay...Poolside bar and restaurant was not only great food and service but so reasonably priced we never felt the neeed to eat elsewhere...just lounged by pool in pm after doing our morning outing to Sea World, etc... Also had a great mini-store there so you could stock up on things for room or get sandwich/snack...Seriously can't say enough about this place...went on a girls getaway but there is NO DOUBT this will be the only place of choice when we go as a family to FLA next time...JUST GO!

Reviews.Title: “Wow ....great location.....great place!”
Reviews.Author: pieforfive
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, 14yr,9yr, and 7yr) stayed here in one of the two bedroom units. This provided us plenty of space and the accomadations were clean. I would recommend staying in one of the buildings (Hamilton) closest to the main pools as all the rest are a long hike. The pool area is beautiful....one heated pool one not and several hot tubs. There are daily activities for everyone and given the location nightly fireworks by Sea World which you can see at 10pm by the pool. This complex is located right across the street from Sea World and 6mi from DisneyWorld. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Also one night we ordered dinner at the poolside restraunt and it was very good and not over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice Definitely a Keeper”
Reviews.Author: beanobob
Reviews.Content: We booked this 2 bedroom in January, 2009 through RCI. This hotel was one of the best we have been at. The service from every single employee was better then I would have expected. There were so many activities at the hotel you never had to leave the hotel grounds. They provided an activities list when we checked in, advertised them on the TV and sent out a global voicemail for daily activities. Plus the activities were reasonable. It was a short walk to Sea World which would hlep save the parking fee. They also sold tickets there through Expedia. My family agreed we would all go back there if we had the chance. Food in the restaurant was very good and reasonably priced, however there is a Publix about 2 miles away and a Super Wal-Mart about 3 miles away. They had ping pong, pool and chess at the pool (along with the 4 hot tubs) and activities for children and adults. Would definitely recommend to anyone going. If your room was away from the Main Building you could get a ride in a golf cart so you didn't have to walk that was great for hot days.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowborn
Reviews.Content: Spent the second week of our holiday at Hilton GVC. Not disappointed. 2 bed was large, roomy and had a massive jacuzzi in the master room. Only negative point I would make is the TV, a 40 inch rear projection, come on Hilton get a grip, HD LCD and Plasma nothing less, picture was useless. Grounds are lovely with adequate security. Small shop had starbucks coffee, pizza hut and salads. Bar/Grille was nice with usual meals on offer - competitively priced. Happy hour(s) from 4pm until 7pm with house beer at $2 and house cocktails at $4. Two pools with several jacuzzis, a jetty where you can feed the numerous turtles and the 3 alligators, they love bread - buy it in the shop, the kids will love feeding them. The Hilton Grand Vacations Club at International drive is better situated for the Orlando premium outlets (right on the door step) but this one was opposite Sea World and near to Aquatica, the new water park. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great staff”
Reviews.Author: phinz
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the HGVC Seaworld and it won't be our last. We took just a quick trip to Orlando just to relax for five days and chose this resort because of the beautiful pools and nice surroundings. We got an excellent price on the studio unit which is fine for two people. Our first unit did not have a balcony, so we requested to be moved to another unit that did. The staff was so helpful, even helped us to chose a room with a nice view. The first two buildings that were built do not have balconies in the studio units--the rest do. We were in the Warwick Building which is where the Parrish Pool (smaller pool) is located. We ended up loving this pool because we could find shade and there was a small concession stand with excellent smoothies. The pool temperature was just right, warm. The hot tub was not too hot, just right. All staff members greet you with a smile and make you feel welcome. We had a late flight out of Orlando, so we requested a late check out and they were able to accomodate us, even offering to print our boarding passes. Now I know why I became a Hilton Honors member. We got a price here that was less expensive than a regular hotel room and the surroundings and room were beautiful. We did not travel with children, but there seemed to be a lot going on for children. I don't think I will ever want to stay anywhere but this resort on my return trips to Orlando, which hopefully, will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Vacations Club is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IMA81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC at Seaworld from the 8th - 18th July as part of our honeymoon and found the place to be absolutely fantastic. You are met as you come into the resort when you arrive and are made to feel very welcome. The pool area and club house are absolutely gorgeous, with plenty of loungers for sunbathing. We had a few drinks in the pool bar and really enjoyed this as well. The resort is located just off the Florida Parkway which is very handy for Seaworld, Universal, Discovery Cove and everything on International Drive. We drove to the Magic Kingdom 1 day and this took about 20 minutes. There are loads of restaurants nearly, approx 5 minute drive up onto International. The complex has a number of buildings and we found ourself in Paget house which is about 600 yards from the main pool. The resort put on a complementary golf cart which you can phone to pick u up and take you to the pool. There was a second pool right next to our building but we preferred going down to the main pool. The room we had was a 1 bedroom which was absolutely gorgeous with a hot tub in the bedroom and a massive living room. All in all, we had a cracking time at the HGVC at Seaworld and have already recommended it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suggie2
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend stay in a 3 bed 3 bath unit. Everything was in good working order. The beds and pillows where very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: Carollyk
Reviews.Content: We came to Orlando for just a few days of rest and relaxation and this resort was terrific! Large property with many amenities. We had a one bedroom with an enclosed balcony and whirlpool tub which was perfect for us. Two large pools; one with a fountain, the other with a waterfall. Bar and restaurant in close proximity to the pool. This is definitely a family friendly place. We did not want that atmosphere yet didn't feel overwhelmed by 'family fun' as the pool area and property are large enough to accommodate all peacefully. We will stay here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean, we will be back....”
Reviews.Author: Hamimomof3
Reviews.Content: Located right across the street from Sea World and Aquatica, exactly what we were looking for. All units had screened in balconies which is what set this resort apart from nearby hotels. The only complaint that we had was the pool was murky and had alot of leaves and twigs floating in it and because of that I would not swim in it. I was very turned off by the appearance. Also, there were no towels to be found. I saw a bin for dirty towels but no clean towels. TGI Fridays and Dennys right down the street, also a Wendys and McDonalds, Publix supermarket. Price was great and unit was perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent-just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: gillvegas
Reviews.Content: We loved it! The space was much bigger than our last HGV visit in Vegas. Pool area is fab, with dive in movie at night or the hotels own free movie screenings once or twice a day. Clean, spacious-perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for visit to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: OnTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort convenient to all of the theme parks, but especially to Sea World and Aquatica, which is right across the street (Central Florida Pkwy). We walked to Sea World, but drove to Aquatica (still walkable, but a little far for kids). Tip: We bought combination Sea World and Aquatica tickets that allow you to come and go at both parks for 14 days from time of first use (we only used 4 days). These were a pretty good deal. Sunday check in was busy, but efficient. We were in and out in about 15 minutes. Check out was via phone, so was even faster. The units were very well laid out. We stayed in a 2 bedroom in the Sandy's building. It was clean upon arrival and tidied up mid week. One of my kids used a sofabed and it was surprisingly comfortable. The resort supplied so much soap, dishwasher detergent, dish soap, shampoo, and conditioner in the unit that we barely needed to touch our own. They also had a generous starter supply of coffee. The Jacuzzi in the master bedroom was huge. Our only need for maintenance was to have a kettle with peeling paint inside replaced, which they had done by the time we returned that day. One of our kids threw up in bed one night and we stripped the bed and offered to clean the sheets, but they said no problem and sent someone who remade the bed for us. I think the buildings are all concrete because my cell phone wouldn't work in the unit at all and only got a weak signal on the balcony. The benefit of this, however, was no discernable noise from other units. There wasn't much of a view from our second floor balcony (there were two balconies in our unit, one off each bedroom), but the plus side of a lower floor was that we didn't have to wait for the slow elevator and could take the stairs. I'd prefer a lower floor for that reason. Free wired and wireless internet access was available in the unit and it seemed pretty fast to me. The grounds were well maintained and there was a jogging path around the lake that I used a couple of mornings. The fitness center had very nice equipment (treadmills with built-in TVs), although the one weight machine created a bottleneck that left people waiting. They could use another. I used dumbbells, which are also available, rather than wait for the weight machine. They could probably use another treadmill as well (all three were in use at two points during my 7 AM visit). The resort seemed to have a good activities schedule, but we were so busy off the resort that we weren't around to take advantage of the activities. They had movies in their theatre, ice cream by the pool, etc. We were RCI exchangers, but we were not solicited for a timeshare presentation at all, not even by phone message. The only reference to vacation ownership we saw was a booklet on our coffee table. The resort has three very nice pools, with the waterfall pool being our kids' favourite. While nice, the pools were also the source of our only significant concern about the resort. The water at all three was milky. We wore swimming masks and still couldn't make out a person clearly from 6 feet away underwater. Granted, the pools had a continuously high bather load in the hot July Orlando weather, but other hotel and theme park pools we swam in this month (including nearby Aquatica) managed to have clear water. This issue prevents me from rating the resort higher, as pools are very important to families and kids. I am sure they could easily fix this. The staff we met were all very friendly. In summary, this is a great resort and we'd be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience. Great location”
Reviews.Author: LVworldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Can walk across the street to Sea World. 10 minutes to Disney. Most rooms with refigerator, ovens, and microwaves. Many stores and restaurants nearby. Property restaurant was reasonably priced with good selection for lunch/dinner. Pool/Bar food. The have a breakfast buffet on sunday mornings. Rooms were clean, modern and well appointed. Only issues: Elevators are VERY slow. Housekeeping is only done for weekly stays (not shorter stays) and only on the 4th day.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull , nice, and clean I will go back again”
Reviews.Author: miamiaprilhoneymoon
Reviews.Content: MY husband and I stay at HGVC for one week. it was really great. the staff was really really nice. we had a beautiful master bedroom with jet tub hmm hmm. the pool was great . I definetely recommend this hotel and I will go back again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, utterly utterly outstanding”
Reviews.Author: chrisjones92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the finest hotels in Orlando. I have stayed in many luxury resorts including Orange Lake Couontry CLub etc. but this was far superior. We stayed in a two-bedroom suite and the apartment was outstanding. Kept perfectly clean and even had a large 4 person whirlpool tub and 50 inch TV!! The pool area is outstanding with a choice of heated or non-heated pool with a waterfall and a jacuzzi with a waterfall. If you're looking for luxury, a two-bedroom suite in HGV Sea World is the way to go! Utterly outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: air72
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the Hilton at Orlando because our prior experiences at Orlando Hotels have been excellent (we usually stay at Disney Hotels). However, this time it wasn't so. We arrived to the hotel on Friday at noon and there were no rooms available at that time. They told us they would call us in a couple of hours to give us the room number. Nobody called us all day. When we got to the hotel at 8 pm they gave us a room. Next to the room there was a small baby who did nothing but cry. We called the front desk and after going to the front desk again, they sent us to another room. Our room key would not open. We waited outside for over 20 min to have security come and open the door for us. When security showed, his key would not open. After waiting outside with two small children in the humidity and the heat for someone else for another 20 minutes, his key would also not open. They did not know what to do with us at that point. It is now 10 pm and we have no place to sleep. My children are exhausted and so are we, and we are still waiting outside in the heat and the humidity. They finally sent us to another room, and guess what? the key would not open. After waiting for another 30 min, finally, someone else came and opened the door at almost 11 pm. The worst part of it all is that no one called to apologize for what had happened. Although any good hotel would have had the manager at least send a note apologizing, my husband had to approach the hotel manager and all he had to say was that things like that happen. Overall very disappointing. We would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and High Quality Grounds and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: kckorville
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hilton Grand Vacations Sea World on several occasions going back nearly 10 years. There are many good reviews so I will attempt to provide highlights of the resort and new developments or changes we observed. We traveled with our two children ages 5 and 9. Overall we had an excellent stay at the resort and were impressed with the service and quality. The resort is fantastic for families. There is a full complement of activities for kids and adults and the activity staff at the resort does an excellent job. The activities are centered in and around the main pool but do include evening events and field trips for the kids. Some activities are free and others have a fee. The resort does a good job of posting the full activity list for the month on the www.hgvc.com website. You should see a link on the resort page to a pdf of the activity listing. Our kids participated in many of the activites from water baseball to the pirate pool party. My oldest son and I competed in a contest called “The Amazing Race” – quite fun. There are dive in movies two times a week. We have done this before and it is great but this trip rain caused the movies to be moved to the theater near the lobby. There have been recent extensive upgrades and refurbishments at the resort and there is more to come. The Provisions deli, store and Pizza Hut outlet has been completely redone. It is very nice and a definite upgrade from the previous store. Prices for groceries are on the high range but the deli and pizza prices are reasonable for a resort outlet. There is a covered patio area just outside the store. The coral reef bar and grill by the main pool has also been renovated, expanded and improved. It is much nicer than the previous version, food is good, cost reasonable, and service was very good for us. There is a happy hour every day from 4 pm to 7 pm with drink specials. The main pool deck has also recently been completely replaced and in my opinion the new surface is much better than the original one. All of the deck chairs have also been replaced and the new ones are steps above the old style chairs that were previously on the deck. The fitness center also was completely redone with new Hilton Precor equipment ... very nice. We learned that the lobby and owners lounge will be completely remodeled before the end of the year and this will include an expanded business center and improvements to the theater. The grounds of the resort continue to be very well maintained. Among other things the resort includes: shuffle board, a covered playground near the main pool, a kiddie pool, a spray feature, a basketball court and tennis court. All of these amenities are in good condition. Others have noted that the resort has 3 pools. Two adjacent to the main club house and a smaller pool in another location at the resort. The main pool (water fountain feature) was heated and warm. The waterfall pool next to it was not heated and much cooler. We swam in and enjoyed both. There are numerous hot tubs at the resort. We stayed in a two bedroom unit in the Tucker Townhouse building. This is the newest building at the resort and is nearest Seaworld (We had a direct view of Seaworld and the fireworks). The building is also near the main pool and all of the activities. Our room was in great shape with granite counters, newer appliances and comfortable beds. The room did not have LCD TVs but the living room TV was a newer nice flat tube TV with a Bose DVD/audio unit. We experienced just one issue. On our last day the elevator in our building went out of service. We checked out before it was repaired but the resort was prompt in addressing the issue. Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend this resort for families and its close proximity to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: elliemrocks
Reviews.Content: Booked HVG at Sea World through RCI for our recent honeymoon. Had a fantastic stay for lots of reasons. The location is perfect for non drivers such as me and my husband as it was on the I-Drive trolley route (in fact the stop is right outside the resort). Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Free shuttle buses to Sea World as well and a small charge for Universal and EPCOT ($6 per person). We had a studio apartment which was great - very clean, with maid service twice a week. We were not even bothered by people trying to sell us more time shares. Our only (minor gripes) would be: the buildings do need a bit of maintenance work, particularly after the recent rain storms but such work seemed to be starting as we were leaving. The Deli on site is good, but it is not cheap (even though we fell in love with their wraps and sandwiches). The bar is also rather expensive - $7 for 2 beers on our first night. We then brought our own from Walgreens and Publix rather than pay such a charge again. Also not all buildings have laundry facilities - we had to go to the building next to us to use the complementary laundry. Overall a fantastic place to stay - would highly recommend it and would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place. More family friendly than Int'l Drive”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2travelco
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went down for a long weekend without the kids. We're HGVC members, and stayed with the kids at the HGVC at Int'l Drive resort last August. That was very nice, and probably would have been better for just the two of us. But we had a good time here, and think it will be the better choice when we go down with the kids. We had a room in a building all the way near the back. We asked for that, to try to be away from main pool, and there is a smaller pool right next door, and we were told it had a bar, so we were all set. Turns out that the bar was not open the entire time we were there. Other than one afternoon when we brought our own margaritas to the smaller pool, we spent the rest of our pool time at the main pool. The main pool has a great layout, and we were able, each time, to get a little landscaped block facing the big lake. It was VERY relaxing and very nice. We just turned around for a quick jump in the pool whenver we wanted. The towel situation was a wreck - they were terrible about re-filling the towel station. Every time we went, we had to wait at least 15 minutes for towels to show up (and then they would go quickly). The room was nice. We had a one bedroom. It had a screened in porch. A nice jacuzzi tub. The shower stall was small, and had cheap fixtures, which just didn't really match the rest of the place. No noise issues from other rooms. They could use more than one elevator in the building, but it didn't seem that crowded and it didn't ever delay us. Parking was decent. We didn't eat there. It is very conveniently located - you are close to all of the big parks. We're taking the kids down in November.

Reviews.Title: “Wide variation”
Reviews.Author: iamdidi
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights. Grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. Fitness center small but nicely equipped. Free parking. Buildings/rooms were widely variable with the upgraded suites (e.g., with whirlpool tub) far exceeding the basic units (despite having been recently remodeled). Experienced trouble with locking device (deadbolt) on door -- deadbolt locked itself -- and had to walk across parking lost to main lobby to request maintenance (no phone on outside of building to call). Could not get high speed internet to work (signal too low).

Reviews.Title: “HGV Club at Sea World Int'l Drive”
Reviews.Author: rdoubek
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. My husband, 10-year old son and I went for Spring Break and had a fantastic time. The hotel staff are very friendly, the pools are fantastic & clean and there are a lot of activities to do during the day. This is a perfect family resort, but they also have private areas for couples. The only negative thing we experienced during our trip was that we were told they had a shuttle service to the Disney parks that went at all times. This is not the case. They do have a fantastic shuttle service (Sterling Shuttle), however, they only go 3 times per day to Epcot Center and then you need to take the Disney buses to the other parks and Disney District. In addition, they only have 3 returns back to the hotel and the last one leaves Epcot at 10:00 PM. If you want to stay at the Magic Kingdom until midnight or later, you'll have to take a cab back which will run you about $30 for one way. Sterling Shuttle will also schedule a private pick up for you and it will be about $28. The daily shuttle to Epcot is only $6 for a round trip fare so it's a pretty good deal if you do not mind the time restrictions. For the most part , we were able to get around fine without a car during our week long stay. However, it is a good idea to rent a car if you do not want to be restricted by shuttle times. Plus there is so much to do in Orlando that having a car enables you to get around more and see what's there. HGV does not run the Concierge desk, it is run by Expedia. The Expedia folks are VERY busy and almost never answer the telephone. The best thing to do is wait in line and purchase all of your shuttle tickets in advance so you do not have to deal with them on a daily basis. You can get discounted park tickets way cheaper online so do not buy them at the hotel. There is a grocery store onsite that carries basic necessities but you may want to stop at a store before you check in. HGV also will stock your refrigerator with some basic necessities such as; eggs, milk, pop, butter, coffee, pancake mix and syrup, chips and salsa etc. You can order this weekender package online at their website and it will be ready for you when you check in. There is also a pizza hut onsite and one restaurant and bar. The restaurant and bar close early around 11:00 PM. HGV will also do some special events such as making freeze dried ice cream which is REALLY good! and special non-alcoholic drinks. I can't say enough good things about this place. The rooms are spacious, clean, in good shape, screened balconies, everything you need in the room pretty much. FYI - no maid service unless you ask for it, so you can leave all your things out without worrying that you have to clean up for housekeeping. You won't be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we ever stayed at..”
Reviews.Author: Jezzebel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from 2 nights stay at this resort. We are very surprised to see how great the resort was. The room is superb, very clean, and it has everything that you need.. We wished we could stay longer.. The jet tub works really well, we can't wait to get in every night.. the kitchen utensils are clean, the bed was very clean and comfy. We don't have kids and found that this kid-friendly hotel is also perfect for couple. Location was very close to SeaWorld, but as long as you have a car it would only take about 5 minutes to the Orlando Premium Outlet, 15 minutes to Disney World and Universal Studios.. We paid $50 less to stay at this resort, compared to the other Hilton grandvacation property which is in Lake Vista. It's an extra 10 minutes driving to disney so I think not bad at all! We will definitely go back to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues but overall nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EKDDSDNH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged our timeshare for a stay at the Hilton Grand in order to take our kids (17 & 7 yrs old) on spring vacation to the theme parks. It is a very quick trip from the airport to the hotel, just be prepared for several tolls along the way. We got there late at night and enjoyed a quick check in. We had booked a 2 bedroom condo with sleep sofa and was a bit surprised at the layout when we got to our room. It was really two separate hotel rooms, but you could connect them by a common doorway. The bedrooms were really far apart so we were not comfortable with our 7 year old daughter sleeping in the 2nd bedroom so we gave that to our 17 year old son who thought it was 'cool'. The first night my husband slept on the pullout couch (uncomfortable) and my daughter and I in the other bedroom. It wasn't working out well so we called the front desk and they promptly brought up a spare twin bed that we set up in our room so our daughter could sleep with us in the same room. The rooms are very big and the master has a huge jacuzzi tub that nobody used (other than the kids to store stuff). The master bath has a double sink which was nice for my husband and I getting ready in the morning. We also had a large shower. Our sons room had a smaller bathroom with Tub/Shower. We spent the day at the pool and enjoyed all the ammenities the hotel has to offer, especially for kids. They schedule activities throught the day that keep everyone busy and happy. The have several pools (heated, unheated, shallow, hot tubs) so none of them seemed crowded which was nice. That night I went to cook dinner and noticed what i thought was a cockroach in the electronic panel of the stove. My husband took a look and we agreed. We called the front desk and they sent someone up right away. When he opened the panel SEVERAL cockroaches came scurrying out. He let the front desk know and within an hour they had us moved to a new room no questions asked. We were told they were not going to rent out that room until it was fumagated. The new room was the same set up and very clean. No more issues with cockroaches. That night we went out to play mini golf and when we got back the staff had sent up a big gift basket of goodies and an apology card signed by all the staff members. We thought that was very nice and professional. The hotel is actually very quiet at night which we were surprised at since it is family oriented. Our room was right outside the pools/shuffleboard court and playground but we had no issues with sound. We only ate at the outdoor restaurant once for breakfast but it was very good. The store has a lot of items you could need and we visited it often. Everything we wanted to go to was very close by which was convenient. It was short drives to International Drive, Disney, Golf, Super Walmart, etc. We walked over to SeaWorld which was nice to save in parking. Activities were great, they had movies every night (some outside by the pool), ice cream sundaes, rootbeer floats, hair braiding, airbrushed tattoos, etc. The kids loved it! Overall we really enjoyed the hotel. They do try to get you to look at their timeshares and offer you a gift card for going, but we told them we were already RCI members and they were fine with that and left us alone the rest of the week. The staff was exceptional and we all seemed to enjoy the hotel. Even though we had issues with the room set up, the cockroaches and for some reason the water smells really bad we would definitely recommend the hotel as a good deal for staying in Orlando with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - very impressive property”
Reviews.Author: Pooky29
Reviews.Content: We booked through timeshare and had a 1-bedroom condo in Smith building. This was during Spring Break so we were expecting to see lots of crowds, but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was pretty quiet and the pool area was not too crowded either. The exception is when we went to the main fountain pool in late afternoon one day, all the lounge chairs were taken and they ran out of towels. The pool itself was not too crowded since it was sooooo huge and there were a few pools and hot tubs for everyone. Since we ended up going to amusement parks most of the days, we used the pool in the evenings mostly. One of the main pools was kept quite warm, making it really enjoyable. We were a bit disappointed that they turn off the big waterfall into the pool in the evening. They have a nice casual restaurant pool side, and also a take-out store with pizza and pre-made sandwiches. We bought take-out sandwiches on our last day and the service was really quick and friendly. They also have Starbucks coffee in this store. The property is very large with a wonderful children's playground (covered). There's a fitness centre and a nice jogging trail around the property. With so much vegetation and lagoons, we were surprised we didn't see a single mosquito around. Inside our unit, there was no sign of any insects that are typical of tropical climate. My whole family loved it. It was good that we had a rental car. Parking was close by and we went to Publix for groceries.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: canuck_02
Reviews.Content: My husband, son(6) and I stayed 4 nights at the HGV Seaworld. We had a king suite with a whirlpool tub. We loved it. The kitchen was bright, clean and well appointed. The whirlpool tub was great after a day walking around Seaworld. The whole suite was spacious and bright. We loved the pool(S), and the food at the poolside bar was very good for the price. The kid's meal came in a frisbee, a souvenir we'll use over and over. We walked to Seaworld 2 days in a row, most people were parking almost as far out in the parking lot as a 5 min walk from the hotel. If I had to change one thing; I would request to not have a ground-floor condo. The sprinklers came on every night, and people were walking by all the time. Next time we'll go for a more private choice. If we go to Orlando again, we'll definitely stay here. The price beat every other hotel in the area, and we really felt like we were at a resort. The other guests were all over 35 with small children, or seniors. We felt safe and comfortable. The staff was amazing, except for one grumpy bartender, but perhaps she won't be there for long. Pizza Hut with room delivery cost about the same as at home, but we got 5 times the breadsticks and cinnamon sticks for the price. We had cinnamon bread for breakfast every morning (yum) PS the store is deathly expensive. Go the few blocks to Publix for amazing grocery deals.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: gabriella611
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayted here for new years! We loved it! The room wasn'y huge but perfect size for us. It was clean, up to date and had a nice screened in balcony. We were located in the very last building near the more so privatepool. It was a nice quite area and not a far walk from the main pool maybe 5-10 minuites. If you didn't want to walk they had a service that if you called they would pick you up on golf carts! the staff was awesome and wiling to help! We were only ten to 15 minuites from epcot and universal, seaworld was right down the road, about a 3 minuites drive. It was a perfect location for us. you only paid 800$ for a week!! We would deffinetly go back. The pools were beautiful as well as the landscape!

Reviews.Title: “Didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: sessagirl
Reviews.Content: This resort has to be one of the finest resorts in Orlando. The staff is very professional. They were always smiling. The rooms were fantastic with great views. The pools are very clean and up kept. The pools are also so large that you didn't feel like you were sharing it with anyone. I didn't want to leave and i wish I had more time to take a timeshare tour. I would by at this resort if I had the chance. The parking at night was a SMALL issue, but the staff was always right there to give you a ride to your room!

Reviews.Title: “It was a Grand Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LindaMoncton
Reviews.Content: Just like the name of the hotel, I could describe our stay as a grand vacation. The grounds are lovely. The pools are beautiful and the hotel was not overly crowded so we had lots of space. The rooms are absolutely as the pictures on the website. They are very spacious and clean. Our room had a full kitchen with dish washer and even washer,dryer. We enjoyed the whirl pool bath in the room. The staff is very friendly and service is great. This hotel is not close to restaurants or shopping but you can walk to Seaworld as it is across the road. I would recommend that if you stay here, you have to rent a vehicle to do your shopping. If not, you are limited to use the I-Ride which is $1.25 each time you hop on or you can buy a pass for one week which is $10.00 per person. This trolley goes up and down International Drive. The taxis are very expensive. They wanted $28.00 US round trip to bring us to Walmart which apparently is right down the road. You will not be disappointed if you rent a car. It's worth it and avoids the waiting for the trolley which only goes by the hotel every 30 minutes. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told to pick up a gift at the desk. Do not get caught. This gift is a free brunch but you have to attend one of their time sharing sales pitch to sell you a condo. Luckily, for us, we had read other comments on the internet before going so we did not get lured into this and waste a morning of our vacation. Other than that, the property is excellent for the price. I would recommend to anyone staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent very close to sea world”
Reviews.Author: cruisinUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super cheap if you pay in advance. Excellent service and the pool is gorgeous. The one bedroom suite is the way to go, but if you have to get a basic room they are also nice. Sea world is right across the street and Discovery Cove is next door. The room was awesome, very spacious. The pool had a beautiful waterfall.

Reviews.Title: “Your own private paradise!”
Reviews.Author: OhioJewels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel/resort before, MANY years ago and loved it! Just got back from staying there a few days ago and I love it even more now! I don't know where to start, there is so much to write about. The property and rooms are gorgeous (and very clean)! Its nicely set up so that you feel like you're in your own paradise, but still close to shopping and restaurants. One of the main reasons we stayed here is because we wanted to be close to Sea World and it is within walking distance, perfect location! You can see the park from the hotel. From our room (which was on the side farthest from Sea World) it was about a 15 minute walk to the main gate, seemed way shorter though. It’s a really nice walk to the park and if you don't want to walk there is an I Trolley stop right in front of the hotel and you can take that. Having an I Trolley stop right in front of the hotel is also another reason we chose to stay here. The rooms are so pretty and spacious! We stayed in a 1 bedroom Villa. Having a separate living area and bedroom is always an added plus, and a full kitchen, with utensils, dish washer, microwave, stove, blender, mixer and so on is fantastic! The in room whirl pool was more than amazing to come back to after those long days of walking. Another really nice thing about the rooms are the balconies. Every morning I would go out on the balcony to relax and enjoy the view. There is a separate “vanity” area, right near the whirl pool, which was really nice to have that space so the bathroom sink area was not all cluttered with stuff. Having a washer and dryer in the room is really great too, and they do supply the detergent which is very nice. The grounds are beautifully landscaped. There is a basket ball court, tennis court, shuffle board court as well as several pools and hot tubs. There is a mini movie theater, which is really cool and they play movies nightly. The on site store/deli has everything you could need! Microwaveable food, beverages, toiletries, cereals, post cards, souvenirs, as well as some ready to eat items, a little ice cream sundae area and Pizza Hut Express is located here too. The pools and hot tubs are so nice! The main pool area is gorgeous. They have daily activities in this area. Some of the activities were hair braiding/wraps, ice cream sundaes, ice cream floats and live entertainment to name a few. The one night they had a “Dive Inn” movie. The pool side entertainment was great! They had live music with steel drums and singing, definitely added to the whole tropical paradise setting. Aside from the pool area activities the hotel also offers various other activities and outings (some for additional fees.) You'll get a schedule of activities at check in, as well as the movie theater schedule too. There is also a restaurant located at the main pool area, serving beverages, appetizers, sandwiches and so on. We had seen someone with the nachos earlier during our trip and they looked too good to pass up. Had the grilled chicken nachos and they were very tasty. The staff REALLY impressed me! I have stayed at places where everyone is nice, but here I really felt welcomed and everyone was more than willing to help you. Every employee we passed always smiled and said hello. From the moment we arrived until we left everyone we encountered was so friendly. One of the girls at the front desk was really helpful. She checked us in and then at the end of our trip we went to the computer area to print our boarding passes and one of the computers was in use and the other one was having technical issues so we went to the desk to see if we could print them anywhere else and she said they could do them right there at the counter and she had our boarding passes booked and printed in a matter of minutes, that was REALLY helpful to us. Definitely something to remember if you have to check into a flight/print your boarding passes. Another great highlight is that all of the rooms have free internet connection. I had concerns that we might be pressured into attending a timeshare presentation, but this was no problem at all! They asked us at check in if we would like to attend a presentation about a new resort they are building, and we were not sure if we would be bale to so we said we would call them if we decided to attend and they didn't "bother" us anymore. I REALLY hope to stay at this property again! It added so much to the whole trip experience and I can't wait to go back! (I have a lot more photos of the Hotel if you would like to see them feel free to ask!)

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again.”
Reviews.Author: miamitogeorgia
Reviews.Content: Went to HGVC @ Sea World the week before Christmas with 2 Children and my spouse. We booked a studio for our week stay but were upgraded to a larger unit since we are Hilton Diamond members.The staff was very friendly and helpful.Upon check in they noticed I had a broken foot and placed us in a building near the main pool. Our room was very spacious and appeared to have been updated within the past year.Granite countertops in the kitchen along with a smooth top stove,and all the other appliances you would expect in a timeshare.The kitchen was very clean and orderly I did not feel like the unit needed a good scrubbing before allowing my toddler to crawl around. The pool area is very nice and relaxing.My kids loved the candy toss activity and ice cream.Also, the playground was a hit with my kiddies.The best part of the trip for my kids was spotting a baby gator in the lake near the playground. We will be returning to HGVC in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Viva_la_Spartans
Reviews.Content: For a price around $100 cheaper per night than other similar properties in the area, the Hilton GVC at Sea World was a good deal. As others have mentioned, the staff are universally helpful and cheery. The large property is well kept and features several pools and hot tubs. Rooms are basic and perhaps getting a little outdated, but were clean and comfortable. The only slight drawback I noticed was the location. While near International Drive and Sea World, there is nothing within walking distance of this hotel (restaurants, shopping, etc.). That being said, Orlando is a driving town, so this is hardly out of the ordinary. The central location makes the hotel convenient to Disney, Universal and downtown (we were in town for a football game). All of these sites are about 10-15 minutes from the hotel at the most. While we did not visit Sea World, it is no more than 3 minutes from the hotel. Again, for the price this is a good deal in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best RCI exchange we've done yet.”
Reviews.Author: trajanc
Reviews.Content: Even after reading all the positive reviews the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Sea World was still better than we expected. From the extremely friendly and helpful staff to the beautiful grounds and pool area this resort is defeinitely the best of the many RCI exchanges we've experienced. We did 1 week in a two bedroom and one day added on for us in a studio. The two bedroom units are awesome; big, spacious, 2 bathrooms, 5 sinks, 1 and a 1/2 kitchens, massive jacuzzi tub, two outdoor screened patios, 3 tv's including a big screen in the main living room, in suite washer/dryer and more. Extremely clean and well maintained. This resort offers an impressive daily full roster of family activities. This complements the already numerous facilities based activities on site from tennis to basketball to ping pong and billiards. The pool areas especially the main area are great, expansive, well situated and maintained and open till 11pm every night. Only downsides were lack of variety in onsite dining (tho a really good Publix supermarket is just down the road) and an expensive and small business center. From watching Monday Night Football in their movie theater to enjoying the excellent freshly made ice cream at the poolside vendor we had a fantastic time. Sea World is a short walk away and is one of the best parks in Florida. I think we went there 3 times in 8 days. This Hilton is a fantastic place. We are considering buying here.

Reviews.Title: “decent enough”
Reviews.Author: ardley
Reviews.Content: stayed here for week in nov. we stayed in a studio room which was clean and tidy enough. these are not fantastic rooms but decent enough for the price you pay. there are 3 pools which are all decent and several hot tubs dotted around.gym is also not too bad. have just opened their new restaurant which is just OK as had a fairly limited menu.now re-furbishing the shop. there are no places to eat in the area which can be a pain. we did not hire a car,so used the i trolley all the time.there is a green stop right out side entrance and a red stop about 200m down towards seaworld.only prob is last one leaves top of i drive little before 10pm, which was a little early. very easy and fairly quick to get to restaurants up i drive and to wet and wild. their is a shuttle service to Disney and universal studios which each cost $6 return.can use i trolley stop g4 and walk across to universal if you prefer. lynx bus goes to Disney which is 50m from hotel. seaworld is only a 5 to 10 min walk, no need for car or bus. went on a time share presentation to get half price Disney tickets. was worth doing for amount of money saved and it was not to bad and no high pressure sales techniques. overall the hotel is decent and for money prob quite hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience for our family”
Reviews.Author: harmansgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the area and we could not have wished for a better experience. The resort was just amazing, our kids 2 and 4 had so much fun in the many pools and there was loads for them to do. Next to the many pools is a climbing and sliding park that is lit up at night. There was a movie theatre and some nights outside pool movie. The rooms were clean and were very well maintained, the beds were really comfortable. The Staff were especially very friendly. Conveniently located next to Seaworld (we walked and saved $10 on daily parking). We stayed at another resort for our final 2 days in Orlando and were do dissapointed because we had, had such a good experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Family Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: castle512
Reviews.Content: Exchanged into this resort with RCI. This is the first Orlando area timeshare that I would consider buying into. The rooms were pretty, clean and had plenty of room. PULL OUT SOFA BEDS ARE NOT YOUR AVERAGE SOFA BED!!!! Instead of a thin matress with a bar in the middle of your back, there are 3 thick but comfortable foam pads. Would look to get something similar if I had to get one for home. We were with our 3 children ages 6 to 10 and inbetween going to the parks we planned 2 days of just staying at the resort by the pool. The kids got involved in the activities with the recreation people doing arts, crafts and pool games. Gave us a little break to enjoy a nice cold drink by the pool. The pools were great. Nice and clean. Most maintenance was done during hours that the pools were closed. Hot tubs (several) were very welcoming. Jordan who was the food and beverage manager earns serious points for stopping by after anything was delivered pool side. Plan time to spend at the resort. It is worth it. Poolside bar and restaurant is under construction but the Pizza Hut Express has plenty to offer for dinner and a snack. WE WILL DEFINATELY BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great for families”
Reviews.Author: Filby007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom appartment, which was extremely spacious; a very large living area, which had a sofa bed(as wellas a massive TV!); fully equipted kitchen; large bedroom, with a giant whirlpool bath (in the room!), as well as en-suite to a very large bathroom. The balcony area gave the accommodation an additional room as it was so big with a large table & 4 chairs. Several pools around the complex, with a choice of a small secluded & quiet swim, with the main central pool area providing a great place for the kids, with plenty of activities & greats kids clubs. Bar by the pool was excellent, with a good selection of food in the well equipt shop on site. We had a great short stay here, and would denfinitely return to stay here for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: erock92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at SeaWorld International Center the week of September 20th to 27th, 2008 (RCI timeshare trade). We had a two bedroom condo in building two (Hamilton House) on the 5th floor overlooking the pools, lake and golf course. The condo was very nice, clean, quiet, modern and roomy (two bedrooms with king beds and central living room with kitchen, dining and washer/dryer). I can not rate the staff because we did not need them during our stay. We had a great time using the many pools, fitness center and other activities on the grounds. The resort seems to brim with “High Class”. SeaWorld is a short walk across the street. All other theme parks and attractions were a short drive in our rental car. My wife, daughter and I had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Lvanroek
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Got a deal through the military to stay here..it was just my boyfriend and I. We had a King Suite in the Paget (newly remodeled) building!! It was absolutely beautiful, and probably a bit more than we needed; I actually wish we had spent more time in the room!! Everyone was very friendly and good to us, and the kitchen is fully furnished!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great for big families”
Reviews.Author: amberma
Reviews.Content: We booked our family vacations through the univeral studios website and this hotel was an option to stay in. We chose it beacause it was one of the few that could accomadate such a large family (6 of us). When we checked in she wrote down our room number on our informational pamplet. Building 3 room 410 and 411 (two rooms joined to make one large suite). We were dropped off at building three (took a cab from airport to hotel, being out of state we flew and did not rent a car) started to look for room 410 and 411. It didnt exist. we thought maybe she left off a zero and went to building 4. Not there either. Figured out that it was implied 3 410 and 3 411 and went to our rooms. Our keys didnt work. We walked back up to the desk and was told we were doing it wrong, that they do work. My husband was very shocked they would insult our intelligence like that. I had tried the room cards, he had tried the room cards... they werent activated. But, by some miracle they did work by the time he had walked back to the building. Did i mention we did all this walking in the heat of the florida day with humidity around 90 percent, with our four kids? Not fun. Finally got into our room and was very impressed with how spacious it was. It easily fit us and our four children. Can with a fully equipped kitchen, a nice outside screened balcony, a mini kitchen in the kids room. Wonderful. We wanted to go to the grocery store and stock our fridge since food is so expensive (4 dollars for a bag of chips) but since we are without vehicle, we went to the on-site retail/grocery/deli place. Expensive, of course, but on that day it was raining and the trolley/bus that runs is every 20 min, so standing in the rain wasnt an option. Oh- and they can never give you a time for the stops, just "every 20-30 min". Also, ask up front when the shuttle runs to to universal. We didnt, thinking it was as needed, it's not. We missed it the first day and paid 20+ for a taxi... ask about times for activities and ammenities because they dont offer this either. When we called for a taxi, we told them for 6 people... a car showed up, with not enough seats/ seatbelts for my kids. I wonder if that had something to do wtih the driver slipping the bellhop cash when they thought no one was looking? The restaurant on site was closed for renovations, so either go to the grocery, or be prepared to spend a lot of money at the convience store/deli.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Sea World-Orlando Lovers”
Reviews.Author: westcoastwaiting
Reviews.Content: Great timeshare. We exchanged our unit through RCI. The Main pool area is AWESOME. Two pools, one with a waterfall, ping pong table, pool table, giant chess board (yes really), 3 jacuzzis, restaurant, dock overlooking lake (no swimming), It was just great. The rooms were as expected, clean, spacious, included all untensils. It also had coffee with the coffee maker. Yippee! We had an in-room jaccuzzi. Housekeeping was amazing. Trent went out of his way to be friendly and welcoming. As we walked out for our first time to explore, we had mentioned to Trent that we did not have a resort directory. He told us he would take care of it. Not only did he do that but he left us a bowl of fruit in the fridge. Having used timeshares before this floored me, he made the BEST first impression. ***The first thing to do when you arrive BUY A WEEK LONG iRIDE SHUTTLE PASS. This is very important. The resort has a shuttle to Sea World and Aquatica, but only at limited times and no where else. The iRIDE shows up every half hour. It is a $1 each ride. The week long pass is $10. Worth every penny. Even though the resort is close to Sea World the walk is just a bit too long. Additionally there are not any options for dining, shopping and other activities within walking distance. iRIDE goes up and down International Dr. It hits both outlet malls, and passes Wet and Wild. It does not go to Disney parks, but does go to Sea World and Aquatica. I spent many a dollar because we just wanted to go to our unit after hoofin it to shows/rides...you name it at Sea World. Also we happend to be in Orlando when Tropical Storm FAY was visiting, so we used it to go shopping and the movies. I only found out about the week long pass at the end of the stay. DRATS! Typical top of the line timeshare resort. Great Pool. Great staff! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare for families”
Reviews.Author: HiltonGoldRegular
Reviews.Content: I had two consecutive bookings, the first 3 nights in a studio (solo traveler on business) and the second 3 nights in a one-bedroom once my family joined me. Rather than making me move in the middle of the week, the front desk kindly put me up in a one-bedroom for the whole week and my first 3 nights were still at my original studio rate. This is a nice timeshare resort, but definitely not new. There are a number of buildings in close proximity to the main building, each about 5 floors. Since it's a timeshare each unit has a washer/dryer and kitchen facilities to make it like apartment living. This certainly cuts on costs since you don't have to dine out all the time. The rooms were decent, seemed clean and service very good. I was traveling with a baby and 4 year old. The "crib" they gave was metal and creaked every time she turned over. Needless to say we didn't use it. I liked the screened in balcony as I could let my kids go out there without fear of them climbing over the railings. The pool area and kids activiites were excellent. There is a handy "convenience store" complete with deli and hot pizza. The community is gated which is great for security. It's literally a 5 minute walk to the Sea World entrance. It was overall a good value for the price and I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: pilotguy3
Reviews.Content: The resort was wonderful! We were in a two bedroom condo and loved everything. We have been to Orlando about 14 times and this was one of our best resort experiences. The unit had a great kitchen, plently of room, free internet. The resort had a nice walking path around an elegant lake, a wonderful pool, a great staff, a movie theater with a new release movie playing every night, and it was within walking distance to Sea World. Everything was great. Liked- Pretty much everything! Disliked- Bathroom sink was leaking a bit, but they came to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Condo in Orlando Area!”
Reviews.Author: maui_pineapple
Reviews.Content: My two children, ages 3 1/2 and 10 months, my parents, my husband and I all stayed in two two-bedroom units and were beyond satisfied with the Hilton Grand Vacations Club. It is truly a first class operation. The units are pristine, the staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating, and the amenities are superb. The rooms offer ample space, nice bathrooms, a great layout, are nicely decorated, and are very family and kid-friendly (especially when traveling with an almost one-year-old who is like a monkey and gets into EVERYTHING). The kitchen and the screened-in balcony provided great opportunities for eating in and even in preparing meals to bring to the amusement parks (which I highly recommend - they charge an arm and a leg to eat there because you're a captive audience. There's plenty of shopping around to stock your refrigerator). Yes, the view from the balcony could have been nicer but we weren't staying in Orlando for the view! The washer/dryer were so convenient and really a necessity - especially when travelling with kids. We were there at Easter and the resort even arranged for a mere $30 charge to have the Easter bunny come to our unit and hand deliver an Easter basket to our children! You cannot top that! The complex is well manicured and sprawling so be prepared to walk or drive to the pool or the main center depending upon where your unit is located - no big deal, really: exercise is good for you anyway. The pool area is simply gorgeous with three large pools - one of them a 1' kiddie pool. There is a great, casual restaurant at the pool area where we frequently ordered take-out - fresh, healthy, grilled choices are plentiful. The location is great - right near major interstates and literally across the street from Sea World! Don't stay here without a rental car - I don't know what one reviewer was doing here without one! Also - get a good map or navigation system because Orlando road signs leave a great deal to be desired. We plan on returning in the next year and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Everyone in our party loved it and felt so at home at the HGVC - we were so sad to leave! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SCNONE
Reviews.Content: We returned last night. I just wanted to thank all the employees,we travel several times a year. Everyone there goes the extra mile to make the best vacation ever. David checked us in and he and all employees are so nice. THANKS

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Rashpal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom appartment for 12 nights and it was perfect. We had our 10 month old daughter with us and the kitchen and washer/dryer are so handy. The appartment was spotless when we arrived and was cleaned everyday by housekeeping. It was more spacious that we expected which was ideal with a crawling baby. The staff are very friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. There is a large pool which during our stay was very busy and noisy but we found the smaller but much quieter Parrish pool which was perfect for our baby. There is a small convenience store on site which has pretty much anything you might need or want - from milk to toiletries. There is also a pizza hut which you can order for delivery to the room but we only used this once. The whole place felt safe and secure especially arriving back late at night. We have stayed in Hilton's before and i would recommend them every time. This apparment made a change from a hotel room. More space, choice to stay in and cook and i thought better value for money than a hotel. Highly recommended. One word of advice - Beware Alamo for your car hire. We had a nightmare time with unhelpful staff and an unsafe car seat which they do not fit in or help to guide you to fit in. It took us 2 hours just to pick the car up.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area but poor rooms and a lot of noise....”
Reviews.Author: mmckmwb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic pool area and nice bar and good food. The hotel is located next to seaworld and is a 5 min walk from the carpark. There is an itrolly stop g13 right outside the front gate and a main line itrolly stop at the carpark in seaworld. Also within 100yrds of the front gate are the lynx stops (42 to florida mall) (8 thar runs the length of international drive) and (50 to the magic kingdom) and also a 43 but no idea where that goes. So no need for a car if you are concerned about driving. The main problem we encountered was the noise from other rooms and the noise from the cleaners area each morning from 8.30am. Every morning i would be woken up at 8.30am with the noise of all the cleaners waiting to start their shift. They all had walkie talkies turned up at the highest volume and this noise continued every day from 8.30-9.30. I once left the room but could not get outside for everyone outside our room. We did complain to the manager and the noise stopped for 2 days but soon returned. We didnt save up all year to be woken or disturbed at 8.30am every day so for this reason we will not ever return to this hotel. We have stayed at 5 diffrent hotels on int drive over the years and this hotel was the most expensive by far had the poorest standard of rooms. If you are put in the st george block on the 5th floor near the housekeepers area then asked to be moved...... A nice pool scene, nice bar and entertainment and in a decent location next to seaworld ( walk it - its only 5 mins) but poor standard of rooms and the noise was shocking....

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: musfir
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay with hilton resort and enjoyed it very much. We stayed in 2 bedroom apt. very spacious clean have everything need for stay of 7 days. nice wirlpool bath tub. nicely decorated rooms. private for 4 adults as both the room have different access area. would highly recomend it. have nice pool and kids friendly. come wish to go their again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: jjuliannaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a two-bedroom, two-bathroom condo with a kitchen and two balconies. The kitchen was nice. The view from the balconies was terrible. Our room overlooked the maintenance area for a golf course. The layout of the master bathroom could have been better. The sinks, shower and toilet were all in the same room. The whirlpool tub was inside the master bedroom, but the jets would not work. Neither would the wi-fi Internet access. We called maintenance before we left for the evening. They arrived while we were gone and left a note that the tub & wi-fi were repaired. It was late when we returned. We didn't check the tub jets, but the bathroom lights didn't work. We had to call maintenance about the lights the next morning. They repaired them while we were out during the day. There were televisions and dvd players in each of the bedrooms and the living room. The dishwasher was VERY noisy, and the clothes dryer took a long time to get clothes dry. I had to send them through 2 - 3 drying cycles. The pool area was nice, but most of the rooms were a long walk from the pool. There were also two tennis courts and two adjustable-height basketball goals. There was a ping-pong table in the pool area. The location of the hotel is only good if you plan to spend your time at Sea World. My daughter and I had breakfast reservations at Disney's Polynesian hotel one morning. I called the front desk to ask about the shuttle. I was told it was $15 per person one way, and didn't run until 9am so she offered to call a taxi. I asked about what it would cost, and was told it would only cost around $15 total. She said she would arrange the taxi for me. She called back to tell me the taxi would be there at 7am. At 7:15 a shuttle van came to pick us up. We were charged $35 for a one-way trip. The driver told us it was $35 one way, or $50 round trip. When we left Walt Disney World we took a taxi for $22. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. There are much nicer rooms elsewhere in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “I Love It”
Reviews.Author: wgw_ssw
Reviews.Content: HGVC--Seaworld is a great place to take the family. The Pool and Childrens activities are fantastic. The rooms, are spacious & bright. This is a time share resort so you have all the benefits of a 1/2 bedroom apartment. Great location---Close to Disney, Seaworld , Outlet malls, Costco, Public Grocery Store and restaurants. We have stayed in this location multiple times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Great Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: hwilke01
Reviews.Content: Hilton has it right. This resort is an example of how things should be done. We had a 40 member family reunion here this summer (2008), and we couldn't have asked for a better location or venue. From the moment you walk into the lobby, you are treated like royalty- the freshly brewed lemonade, the spacious lobby, the expansive pool, the courteous employees. From top to bottom, I was impressed with this place. Arrival- we had no issues with the check-in process. It's fairly easy to find and is close to all the Sea-World attractions as well as the Convention Center on International Drive. Our check-in clerk at the front desk was courteous and efficient, but could have used a little polishing. Especially as it relates to familiarizing us with the property. Nothing that a little walking around can't do, but it would have been nice to have a little more. No big deal. We were playing golf, so we spoke with the Concierge in the lobby... she didn't know much about golf, other than she could get us discounts on a couple of local courses. By the way, if you are going to play golf at the Marriot's Grande Pines, next door, plan on losing lots of balls, and scoring really high. I'm no scratch golfer, but we played here as well as the 'Palm' at Disney, and the Grande Pines was MUCH more difficult. Lots of water, sand and weeds. Probably too much for a recreational golfer looking for some escape from the mouse-ears during the week. But I digress- Getting moved in- we were here as Timeshare customers and weren't expecting much in the way of assistance in getting set up in our room, but we were pleasantly surprised to be assisted by a well-meaning, genuine gentleman who was working the laundry closet in our building. He helped us get an additional cart for moving stuff in. Pros: Great service at the pool-side bar, although the waiters/waitresses don't venture out very often or very far from the tables around the bar. The bartender Diane was especially helpful and kind, as well as Andre, I think his name was- they were always quick to acknowledge me even if they were busy. I was even given 2 complimentary fountain drinks by one of the floor waitresses when I came in with my niece in the heat of the day for some refreshments, while dripping wet. Incredible Pool- two large pools- the one with the waterfalls was about 5-10 degrees cooler than the other, and there are Jaccuzzi's seemingly everywhere you look. Also a small childrens pool area as well as mini-water playground type getup- shooting water from mats into the air, etc. I believe there is a 3rd pool, but we never ventured to it. The main pool area had everything we needed. Free Wireless Internet- This in and of itself should be standard at all resorts. Not having to deal with paying for the Internet is worth so much. Even better is that it's available in the pool area as well. Great 'other' entertainment options- Ping-Pong, Billiards, Shuffleboard, a sizeable playground with a canopy to protect the little ones from getting too much sun, daily activities for children (Belly-Dancing class or something, Deal or No-Deal game, Puppet Show, Bean-Bag Toss, are just a few things that I saw going on around the expansive pool area) They also show a movie nightly in a Theatre area off the main lobby. Spacious rooms- we stayed in a 3 bedroom villa, that had ample space for 5 adults and 3 little ones. 2 Lanais. Cons/Little stuff- Concierge didn't know the difference between 'walking and carting' for our golf game. The pool has a great sound-system that generally played non-invasive modern pop music. One afternoon it was replaced with a live duet of fat men singing 'oldies' way too loud, way too intrusive and way too much. It cleared the pool area around the stage pretty quickly. It's tough to find a live act that everyone can tolerate. But these guys were just a bit too much. Elevators are slow. We were on the 2nd floor so we just used the stairs, most times, but if we were on the 5th or 6th floor, they would have gotten cumbersome. The buildings have a strange horseshoe shape that required all guests to exit out of a single corridor. This is understandable for security purposes, but it was kind of annoying when you were just looking to go to the pool, but you had to go the opposite direction and then all the way around the building. I did get a few comments from the ladies in the group doing food prep that they were a little light on utensils and pots and pans, but being that our group had multiple rooms reserved, it was no problem for us to share. Overall, a great resort. Hilton has gotten it right with this one. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fussy and I loved it”
Reviews.Author: AsiaRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I'm a very frequent traveller and so am quite demanding in what I expect. I spent days reading reviews and wondering which Hotel to select. There were 4 or us, 2 adults a 9 and 7 yr old. Absolutely no complaints. It was modern, very well equipped, comfortable and had every modern convenience you could want. The 1 bedroom suite/apartment was just fine for us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 15minsfame
Reviews.Content: We booked this property on an RCI exchange. When we got there, the room was not available as they said they had had quite a few checkouts. However, they did offer to give us a $100 food and beverage credit which more than made up for the inconvenience. They also have daily movies, so we took the kids to that. By the time the movie was finished, we werre able to check in. We had a two bedroom unit. It was furnished very nicely, clean, and had a very well equipped kitchen. The master bedroom and bath were both very spacious, with very comfortable beds and a large (big enough for two) whirlpool. The second bedroom had two double beds, which the kids just loved (most timeshare properties have two twins). Each bedroom had a DVD player. The grounds were great, with several whirlpools, two large pools, an on premises bar and restaurant (more bar than restaurant) and daily activities for the kids. There is also an on site store, but you'd be better to go off premises as the prices are high as you might expect. Great in a pinch, though. You would not have to leave the resort to be thoroughly entertained. The resort is very centrally located, literally across the street from Sea World and only a few minutes from all of the attractions of Disney. We enjoyed the resort and would recommend this to anyone. Great alternative to hotels, certainly, and an excellent property.

Reviews.Title: “Meet expectations almost exceeded”
Reviews.Author: matttristan
Reviews.Content: stayed at the resort from june 8 to june 12 with myself, wife, a 2 and 4yr old. building 10 in a two bedroom suite. very large room, very clean, beds are comfortable, had a fridge, washer, and dryer. patio was nice and large. only real issue was the location building ten is a 15min walk to the main pool unless you call for a golf cart ride which we did almost ever time. the view from our room was a major highway which was very loud. could of done without that but we were only in our room from 10pm to 8am. they do have a very large spreadout resort, only one restaurant and bar. i would of liked to see a bar some how attached to the pool. waterfalls and pools are very pretty and clean. lots of actvities to do such as the playground, shuffle board, feed the turtles/fish/ and baby alligator in the lake. (son loved seeing them) transportation is the biggest issue here, as we did not have a car. i expected shuttles to be more often and cheaper. however would not go back without having a car. we have stayed at the disney yacht club, disney beach resort before this hotel. the disney rooms were much smaller and not as clean however the location of the disney resorts and transportation buses avaiable at them probaly will make me go back to a disney resort but it is very comparable. my rate was $269 plus tax. 2 bedroom suite. (two bedrooms and large living area.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Muriel12
