Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for only one night and wanted to stay somewhere that would provide everything needed to avoid wasting time in the car. I used to live in Florida and spent much time in Orlando. I had recalled this resort, where I had stayed for a few nights about 5 years ago. The rate was a bargain ($81 AAA) for a queen junior suite. These rooms are configured as an open studio, with a dorm-sized fridge, microwave, sink, and basic kitchen utensils. The queen bed is nearby with either a loveseat or large chaise lounge. A table-for-two is located in a nook. Some of the junior suites include a screened-in balcony, but not all include this feature so ask when booking if it's important to you. The resort is rather expansive and enjoyed by families. Pools include waterfalls. A small store is on site, as are a few dining options. While I didn't travel with a child, it was clear that this resort would be appealing to folks with kids. The resort has an extensive offering of daily activities for kids. Staff were very friendly and gracious. I dined at the outdoor restaurant located near one of the pools. My group ordered burgers, turkey wraps, and ribs. Everything was tasty and not exorbitantly priced. My room was clean and adequately maintained. The carpet had several stains, the bathroom was due for an update, and some baseboards were in need of replacement. The bed, however, was comfy. Internet access was reputed to be complimentary, but I was never able to get it to work. My biggest complaint--which is a deal-breaker for me--was the lack of noise insulation between rooms. The noise was absolutely ridiculous. I had enjoyed my room for several hours, but around 10:30 pm my neighbors returned from their apparent day out. I was so startled when I heard whistling that I jumped up expecting someone to be standing in my foyer. I then looked out the security eyehole to see if the whistling person was standing at my door, but saw no one. It was then crystal clear that the person was on the other side of the "wall" separating our rooms. After the whistling stopped, I could then smell the families just microwaved popcorn as though I had microwaved it. And then the real fun began: "Dad" proceeded to share, in pronounced and crude detail, with his family how bad his jock itch was that day. This went on for about 5 minutes before "Dad" and "son" began a screaming match about bath time. I called the front desk and asked to be moved due to the noise. I was told no rooms were available. I persisted, knowing how large the resort was. I was still told nothing could be done. I got a little nasty at that point and the staff member consulted a manager. Miraculously, a room appeared for me. I had to pack, walk to the reception area, retrieve new keys, and then move to a building in a different part of the resort. When I arrived, my new room was wonderfully silent. (No internet access here either, though.) I was able to go to sleep immediately, but the noise issue returned at 6:30 am when my neighbors' infant began wailing at 6:30 am. I laid in bed, listening to the normally-toned conversations of a family. By 8:00 am, I had checked out. Until the resort invests some money in insulating the rooms for noise, you will stay at your own risk. I was miserable! I reflected upon my previous stay and realized that the room I was assigned then did not have a door that connected to an adjoining room. Both of the rooms I stayed in during this last visit shared that feature. It could be that the connecting door is the real issue.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great, No Qualms”
Reviews.Author: UncleBucky47
Reviews.Content: The resort was booked through Armed Forces vacation club, and was the best resort I have stayed at in 5-8 week long trips I have taken to orlando. Very huge open resort with gated entry and sprawling complex. Like most with kids I stayed only a few days in the actually resort as I was at theme parks most morn-noon-night. From this location you could throw a stone and hit sea world, which is so cool during the x-mas holiday season. We travelled between thanksgiving and x-mas is great since it is a slow season. We stayed in a 2 bedroom and it was great. Very clean, nice tv, patio, kitchen, washer/dryer. It was very slow this time of the season and the staff was slightly bored and funny. They had time for guest and questions and comments. The pools, hot tub and chairs area is well maintaned. The resturant, pub, mini-pizza hut and store also have lots of little things at low prices. When I go back this year, the HGVC sea world will be on top of my places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room was fine but a curious place and not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Tony_No
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights here at end of a tour of Florida. Had never been to a Hilton vacation club before though plenty of Hilton hotels so was expecting it to be "hotel like" which it absolutely isn't. It is an enormous property and we were in abuilding 15 minutes walk from pool/restaurant area. We had a 1 bed suite which was enormous, equipped with everything (including washer and dryer) though slightly odd touches (eg jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom!). It was in good condition and clean. No help available for getting bags to room. Housekeeping was hit and miss and they didn't do much more than load the dishwasher and make the beds... certainly they didnt try to tidy our stuff. We had booked a package online that included continental breakfast. What I expected was a buffet in a restaurant; what I got were vouchers for the on site store entitling me to coffee, orange juice and muffins (they weren't even valid for cornflakes!) which I took back to my room. I told the duty manager who was very nice and indeed refunded what I paid for my cornflakes (even though I didnt ask him too!) The sole restaurant on site is poolside was quite limited in scope and focused on casual food (burgers, sandwiches etc.) . I kept getting prerecorded messages on the phone voicemail telling me to have a nice day; would have been a nice touch if done personally, but a pre-recorded message just annoyed me. The pool area was very nice; large and well maintained. So if you are expecting a great "hotel "with lots of great service, you may like me bit a disappointed. But if all you are after is a large, modern bedroom and a decent pool area I think it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: bonanddave
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two wonderful weeks for our 2nd stay at the HGV at seaworld. Fabulous as usual, even though there was maintenance going on in other buildings, there was no noise, mess or workmen to be seen. We stayed in building 2 this year, as Smith's house, building number 10 had been fully refurbished and was now non-smoking. The top 3 floors of Hamilton house (building 2) were given over to smokers as Somerset house (smoking) was another property being refurbed. The Managers couldnt have been more accomodating or helpful, in fact the staff were simply wonderful, and we all grew very fond of the young lady in the shop and Frank the doorman. We had a 2 bedroom suite, and the suite itself was massive, with a round jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom, it was clean and tidy and well decorated. The kitchen was fully stocked with utensils, washing powder for the washing machine/tumble drier, washing up liquid and kitchen towels provided. Beds were very comfortable with firm but nice matresses, and the beds made daily and changed a few times a week. Our room overlooked the pools and lake, whilst some might deem it noisy it didn't trouble us at all unless we sat on the balcony, apart from the children trying to sing on karaoke the music was nice and the entertainment good. We are looking forward to a return trip (3rd in 3 years) to the HGV at seaworld next May.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromIA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay at a nice resort without having to go to another country. This was a great find! First off, the property is gated which deters others from 'traveling through' the property. The entire hotel staff was friendly and personalble. We arrived late on a Friday night. The concierge recommended a great "NY Style" pizza joint that delivered. The property was very well kept and clean. The main pool area was georgous with plenty of lounge chairs, even on the busiest day. One surprise was the amount of planned activities that the property offers each day. The activities are suitable for adult and children. For example, there is a daily movie shown in their movie theatrie. One night a week the movie is shown at the main pool grounds. They also had 'behind the scenes' trips to Sea World for the kids.... the list goes on and on. For adults, they had a wine and cheese social, beer tasting, 'vegas night' and dance instructer. We stayed in a one bedroom villa which was fully equipped with a full kitchen, dining, living, bed and bathroom. The kitchen had all the necessary equiptment including dish soap and StarBucks coffee. Not to mention the washer and dryer and hotel provided Tide. A big benefit to this location is DAILY housekeeping. They clean the villa, will put dirty dishes into the dishwasher and restock the provided amentities such as shampoo (Crabtree & Evelyn), Tide, Starbucks coffee, etc. I normally do not like to stay at the same place twice when going on vacation. I will make an exception for this place. We had an excellent 10 day stay at the resort and have recommended it to several of our friends. I almost forgot to mention the location which is also key. The property is centrally located to I-Drive, Walt Disney, SeaWorld (less than .5 mile), grocery ..... need I say more???

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2goSomeplace
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a HGVC. We were very pleased. The staff was gracious and helpful, the pools were very nice and the location was perfect for any Orlando attraction, especially Sea World. We stayed in a 1 bdrm w/ a jacuzzi tub. The room was large enough to sleep 4 easily (King bed and pull out sofa). The bed was comfortable and the availability of the washer and dryer was a plus. The only negative we found was the size of the shower. The bathrooms are very large, but the shower was a small corner shower. We ate at the restaurant down by the pool. The food and service were good (save room for dessert, the brownie w/ ice cream was delicious). We liked the little shop that offered items from pastries, beverages and frozen meals to swim suits. The same shop also sold pizza, sandwiches, fruit and ice cream. There are lots of activities available (make sure to pick up a schedule), basketball and tennis courts and poolside movies. This is a great place to stay for just about anyone wanting to be near Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Princess210
Reviews.Content: My son and I went here for our Spring Break getaway in April of 2008 and we absolutely loved it. We booked our vacation through Universal Studios Vacations. Upon our arrival I found that the hotel did not have our reservations. I called Universal Vacations and they straightened everything out pretty quickly. The hotel manager even upgraded our studio room to a one bedroom. It was very nice. The room had a full kitchen, living room, dining room, and a jucuzzi. My son loved the pool the best. They had three pools but one was closed. I didn't even notice that because the other pools were great. They also had several hot tubs and even a wading pool for the babies. We ordered from the onsite Pizza Hut and the service was pretty good. We also ate at the little Coral Reef bar and the food there was good also. On the last day my son joined the kid's club for a morning at SeaWorld. There was a small charge but it was worth it. He loved every second. I have stayed at several hotels in the Orlando area but this by far was the best. We didn't want to come home and almost didn't. Great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KateinWarks
Reviews.Content: I requested an exact building with a room away from the Highway - I didn't realise that there are not many rooms in this particular block that are away from the road. This is probably why we were given a room in the requested block, but by the highway. I telephoned Reception straight away and asked to be moved even if it meant another block, as it was late at night they asked if we could stay 1 night and move in the morning - we did this and ended up in a lovely room that met all my requests! In actual fact this highway seems less busy than International Drive itself. While sitting by the lovely pools you cannot see another hotel, (golf course next door) so it feels secluded. There is a fire station near by, but I'm sure all of central Orlando will hear this at some time during most days! It was only noticeable to us one morning at 7 am, which we didn't mind considering the tough job they were probably off too! I think this hotel is the most perfectly situated in Orlando. Walking distance to Sea World, but be careful crossing the road and drive the short distance if you plan to stay after dark. Easy access to International Drive, Interstate, Universal Studios and the huge Walmart on Turkey Lake Road and Disney. The Hotel offered a free shuttle to Sea World, Aquatica, Universal and a chargeable shuttle to Disney, but we preferred the flexibility of taking the car. Reception were always very friendly and helpful. Our son decided to change the safe number but couldn't remember what to...after a slight panic and 20 attempts we contacted Reception who sent security within 10 minutes. Problem soon solved and only a little embaressment on our behalf! We liked the huge rooms (1 bedroom ) with all the useful facilities, it was ideal. We stayed for 14 nights and found our apartment cleaned daily, with our sons new teddies displayed in a cute way! Toiletries, washing powder etc re-stocked with new each day too. Spa tub and private patio area were also an added benefit to us! There is a small restaurant, we found this adequate for the odd meal as we like to go to different places anyway. The staff here were the friendliest in the whole of Orlando! They will also do take-outs for you to eat in the privacy of your room. We stayed over Easter and our son really enjoyed the activities on Easter Day. The easter egg hunt of course being the favourite! We all enjoyed seeing the easter bunny too! There was a big programme of daily childrens activities and screened films, we caught one film by the pool, but generally we were too busy to do anymore than swim and chill in the hotel! Sorry to read that a few reviewers have had bad experiences, but I read reviews on many hotels for the best part of 6 months before choosing this one and I'm thrilled to say it was better than my expectations. I hope one day we have the opportunity to come back, but its a long way from the UK! We are not time share owners, so this was a one off for us! PS We didn't get any time share hassle!!

Reviews.Title: “dont go”
Reviews.Author: NewyorkTravlinman
Reviews.Content: will never go again my wife and i checked in and maintenance or housekeeping wher in my unit watching tv they jumped up when we walk in its a shame nice place but i wont feel safe

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - surprising apartment like”
Reviews.Author: PK_in_KC
Reviews.Content: I planned a hotel for business and randomly chose this Hilton .. and it had a good price (around $170). I ended up with a room that was more like an apartment than a hotel room -- full living room, bedroom and kitchen. Washer and dryer. Screened in balcony / porch. Free Internet. Whirlpool tub. The property is really, really big, and I had to walk a long ways to the office / club house, which would have been a pain if it had been raining. There is no real restaurant on site, instead they have a small deli and snack shop. Overall this was a fantastic property, and I never got a sales job about investing in a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: enzfrnz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property. Clean and spacious two bedroom unit. Good beds and litte noise. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The only hitch is the front desk clerk could not explain why a $22 charge was placed on our bill from our time share company. We were told it would not be billed to our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hilton vacation club”
Reviews.Author: phukdesign
Reviews.Content: there is a lovely atmosphere here, the 2 bed apartments are lovely and big and you can split them up into two seperate flats which suited me and my girlfiend. it meant we had our own mini lounge,bathroom and kitchen seperate from my parents. It is a brilliant location as well, top end of international drive.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, but Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: psnyder97
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I booked two rooms to attend a conference in Orlando. We arriving prior to 2:00 p.m. at the hotel desk and was immediately checked in to the Smith's house, the last building (about a 5 minute walk). The hotel grounds were very nice and the staff we encountered were very friendly. We used the I-trolley a couple of times, and that worked out well. The major problem was the noise at night time. We both stayed in a studio room, 1st floor. The walls of these adjoining rooms were so think--I could practically hear the conversations going on next door. Unfortunately, the room next to me contained a family with several screaming and crying kids that went on past 11:00 p.m. The smell of their food also made its way over into my room. My colleague also was wakened several times from the noise of people yelling outside (she was near the elevator). While the grounds were nice and staff was friendly, I would personally not return to this resort just due to the loud noise. The hotel is also renovating their main pool, so the entire area is closed off. They had no mention of this on their website, so you may want to check first.

Reviews.Title: “a family delight”
Reviews.Author: mr jacksonville
Reviews.Content: Im a frequent Orlando traveler, and accustomed to lodging at Marriott Cypress Harbour. Due to timing issues after Christmas, me and my family needed a place to stay prior to our arrival so we chose Hilton Grand Vacations at Seaworld. The property is very well situated just off of Central Florida parkway on Grand Vacations Way. If you are one who loves serenity of beautiful grounds ad landscaping, you will not be disappointed. The check in was smooth and effortless. My advice to anyone checking in is, try and get there as early as possible. Obviously travel arrangements and kids for that matter will not always allow this but i've learned generally if you arrive while others are checking out, you can find units already available. I stayed in the 'Smiths,' which is building 10 and the furthest from the clubhouse and main pool. Me and my family enjoyed a Kingsuite, which was an upgrade as I am a Hilton honors member. Its absolutely free to join, and worthwhile to do so. The suite itself had a very large comfortable bed with duvet, and the softest pillows one could lay upon. Accompanied is a jacuzzi and a lock-off bathroom with his and her sinks, shower and there is a very large vanity mirror across from the jacuzzi. The living room was spacious, and included a sleeper sofa with another matching chair. Dining room table held 6 chairs with placemats readily available. Granite countertops highlight the kitchen as does the flat surface stove. (very nice touch) Standard size fridge with ice maker, dishwasher and not to be forgotten is the spacious screened alcony, which is accessible through the living room and Master bedroom. Due to our singular night, I did not get to research the various childrens activities, but they are rampant throughout the day and early evening. The waterfall pool is a sight to see in itself, with gallons of water in a constant downpour and plenty of space to interact and swim. There are 2 outdoor jacuzzis, one of which is situated right under the waterfall itself. There is also a kiddie pool which lil fishes decorating the bottom. In actuality there is another pool right next to the main jacuzzi and kiddie pool, which technically is the 'main' pool. It is very large with plenty of outdair chairs for those who enoy their sun, and each night they show various movies on an inflatable screen at the base of the pool. At check in, you should receive a copy for the movie schedule for the entire month, as well as the various childrens activities. In summation if you are a family with children particulrly toddlers and adolescents this is definitely a nice place to stay and relax. Im not sure how much teenagers would enjoy the experience, depending on what your Orlando itenerary is. The pools, countless activities, and customer service is very much noted and appreciated. It is a nice place for couples maybe looking for a getaway, not overly romantic but still a relaxed, chill environment. There arent any true restaurants, just a sandwich shop and pizza hut express, so please be advised you will need a car if you dont like simple or home cooked meals. There is a Publix grocery store off of international dr across from the Orlando premium outlets. If that doesnt suit you, you can take International Dr south to World Center Dr and make a right. Take World center and stay in the far left lane and make the first left on SR 535 (apopka vineland rd) and you will run into a Super Walmart about another mile on your right side. Of course for those who like the simpler way, there is a I-Ride trolley stop in front of one of the Hilton buildings.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cish39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Vacation Club for 5 days while attending a conference. I was extremely pleased with the accomodations. Unfortunately, the weather was a little cool so we could not take advantage of the pool and hot tub. We had a beautiful king bedroom suite. It had a nice kitchen and dining/living room with a big screen TV. The bathroom was huge with a whirlpool tub. Everything in the room was clean. The grounds were beautiful. I felt very safe in and around the property. It was easy to get around Orlando in the I-ride trolley system. They picked you up right in front of the resort. It was a short trolley ride to Sea World, the convention center, and the Prime Outlets. The trolley system is inexpensive. $1 for adults, a quarter for senior citizens, and free for kids. I have to remark that the manager Bill was very nice and accomodating. I was impressed that even though I was not a timeshare owner, he treated me like I was. He addressed some minor concerns that I had quickly and with a smile. All of the employees were very nice. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: librahi
Reviews.Content: Used a timeshare with the in-laws after Christmas. My wife and I met at Disney World working. This is a great location, right next to everything. Great pool area, very nice suites for rooms, great service. Had some problems with internet, but it starting working after a while. Staff was amazingly nice. We drove through the night and they let us check in at 4 am (we thought we would try instead of stopping in Gainsville). Very happy overall. Would highly recommend. P.S. Boma is the Animal Kingdom was unreal. My wife and I are vegan and TJ hooked us up with an amazing meal, I mean amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Rough start to stay at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: luckytimer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton G.V.C from Dec 30 to Jan 5th, 2008. Our check-in was, well, frustrating to say the least. We arrived one hour prior to our 4 o'clock check-in time and were told there was nothing available. They asked for our cell phone number and would call us when our villa was ready. Well, 40 minutes later and no call. Meanwhile, we decided to sit at the hotel bar and order beer and wings. The wings were stone cold in the middle and we sent them back. By 3:45 I decided to mosey on up to the check-in desk and ask. I think they absolutely forgot we were ever there. We were given a villa number in the next building to the main reception building. As we approached the villa two cleaning guys were just pulling out the steam cleaning machine from the villa. The door hadn't even closed behind them. My husband and I looked at each other and knew, this was not good. The carpet was soaked in every room. One could not even take off their shoes and walk around. And try walking from the soaked carpet to the ceramic tiles and you took your life in your hands. Never knew I could do splits like that! As well, there was a very large wet spot approx 1.5 foot in diameter on the sofa bed cushion that our son was to sleep on. Obviously, the people prior to us were slobs. I went down to check-in and expained the situation. We were not prepared to stay in that villa. We were given another key to a building on the complete other side of the property. Upon arriving there, bags in tow, again, the key did not work. Again, down to the main building and they sent security who let us in. After we got all our bags in (I do not pack light unfortunately) we were just about to settle in and there was a knock at the door. It was security informing us that we were in the wrong room. He said this room was occupied already even though there was nothing in the room, fridge was empty, no sign that anyone had been in that room. Again, we get all our baggage and were moved to the villa next door. This was now our third villa and we were not impressed. I never saw a single soul in the room next to us all week. We had the one bedroom lock-off unit. It was nonsmoking, as we requested. Apparently, the two lock-off units share the same ventilation system and the people in the adjoining studio ignored the no smoking signage on the villa doors. Needless to say, each morning we a shower and a smoke. Our villa smelled foul of second hand smoke. I called the front desk and was told they would send security. Nothing happened. They continued to smoke. As for the villas, we stayed in the Warwick building which was much newer than the first unit we were in. I think they tried to pawn off an old unit because we were not "paying customers" as such. It is not prudent for the HIlton to treat RCI members this way because they are part of RCI and their own owners benefit from being able to exchange to other properties as well. We were never offered an apology or any compensation for this very unprofessional check-in experience or "customer service." I would choose another place to stay in future. We are experienced travellers who know that you need to take care of your guests or they will not return or, worse yet, write a bad review. D in Muskoka.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: viksSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful, we got a huge 2 bed 2 bath room, large jacuzzi in the main bedroom. Kitchen fitted with washer, dryer, diswasher, massive fridge, massive oven, microwave, coffee machine and other small appliances. The cleaning lady came 2 times a week and you could ask for towels, toilet paper, soaps etc anytime. We stayed there for 20 days and the cleaning service was very regular. We hardly used the hotels facilities because we had so many theme park ticket days to use up. Next time I will book less theme park tickets - because we couldnt do it all! But the facilities looked good - pools were clean with pool towels supplied to guests as a complimentary service. We only used the activity center for the children on the last day, which I would change next time - the staff was friendly and even let my kids do the onsite build-a-bear outside of the designated hours (note: its much cheaper to do Build-a-Bear here $25 animal and clothing!!) We hired a car and did a lot of shopping, they give you a little book when you arrive with directions to everything. Grocery stores were everywhere, cheapest was Walmart Superstore which was open 24 hours a day. If you arent American - its true on the 26 Dec - everything goes on sale ... so save you shopping for after Christmas! The Pizza Hut onsite was GREAT, Deli was full and had a lot of basics (milk, bread, coffee, chocolate, magazines etc) we also saw they offered a cup of coffee/soda that you purchased and you could refil free of charge for the entire length of your stay - but we only saw it in our last week. Next time we will buy a few of those. We found the staff friendly and holiday program was designed around children with activities planned daily from morning to night. Our room was on the ground floor and right next to the swimming pools so we didnt experience lift problems or have far to walk to the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Ok resot, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Chukcha
Reviews.Content: The resort is OK, the room where we stayed was clean, with well-equipped kitchen, washing and drying machine. The sofa in the living room and the mattress where somewhat uncomfortable, so I looked forward to go back home, because I could not sleep well on their mattress :) The pool and children play area were nice. I would agree with one of other review: "Disappointing aspect was terrible customer service. Without going into all the boring details, the staff repeatedly said all the things they'd been trained to say (empathizing with customer etc ...) but repeatedly failed to deliver the actions we'd agreed. " The service was terrible, I had an impression, that they just do not care. If you are staying in the building not near the WaterFall pull, you have to take a little walk (depending on where your building is located) we stayed at Smith building and it took us 5 minutes walk to get to the main lobby. They do have a golf carts picking up people, but you have to call to the hotel front desk and even so they tell you the guy is on its way, usually you wait for them minimum 10 minutes, so might as well just walk to the main lobby. It is not a problem to get to the building from the main lobby there was always somebody available to pick us up. Perhaps they have only one guy riding and picking up people. The shuttle service to attractions is limited and I think that the drivers do not care so as the hotel employees, the drivers were late all the time at the first point of destination . Usually when you take the shuttle the bus driver is giving you a little tour of the city (from my experience staying at other Orlando hotels), nothing like that here, but the huge sign on the front window "re tips" is there :) I would not recommend use the taxi service from the hotel, I got impression that they use some transportation for hire, which is more expensive that local taxi service. For example, the driver gave us the rate to Arabian Nights show one way as $45 v local taxi service $17.00. The deli shop was terrible, and very small for such a big resort. Go to the grocery store and fill out your fridge because the food quality and selection at the deli shop is very poor. If you forgot a swimming suite you will not be able to buy it in the hotel, there is no gift shop, but the deli shop sells some t-shirts. There is no food room service, you can order pizza only, but at the extension numbers provided nobody answers the phone (I guess they are too busy) Not a big deal, we ordered pizza online, this is only the one good thing that they provide wireless connection at the hotel free, you just need to have your laptop with you. There is only one restaurant, the breakfast buffet at the restaurant was ok, the dinner I did not like. I will not come back again to this place and would not recommend it to my friends. It did not worse the money we paid for it. I would rate this hotel as 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 stars property”
Reviews.Author: Frenchss
Reviews.Content: We spend a couple of days in florida to celebrate christmas in Florida. Whilst we were keen on chosing a hotel based on the reputation of the brand, the Hilton Grand Vacation does not live by the standard of its parents company. We enjoyed the studio style room with kitchen and bathroom, and the exterior aspect of the building make it pleasant. However the size of the double bed is quite small and not in line with other similar class hotels in Florida. Quite unconveniently we were provided with a connecting room, which despite having no knowledge or contact with the neighbours , allowed us to share their leaving , cooking and sleepong experience. Saddly enough, the neighbours also had a small child quite eager to get up from 07h00 each morning whereas his parents were not disposed to leave the bed until 08h00.... we heared and learned a great deal about child cryings.. The balconny with the anti mosquito net spread all along the lenghtgh of the 2 square meter balconny with no possibility to open it would not be quite suitable for people in search of a freedom experience, this rather gave a feeling of clostrophobia, or sharing a prison inmate stay. Let's not talk about the cleaning of the room which was left to a minimum during our 5 days experience, Only after we complained to the reception were the sheets changed and the bathroom's floor properly clean after the 4th days whilst as per the reception guidelines the room are supposed to be 100% serviced every day. The location of the hotel also seems to be closed to a fire station, which from a safety point of view could be a good thing if it was not for the fire service to use the vehicle alarm on at every time of the night and days... I conceed that is a necessary chaos in term of security, however when you spend your holidays in a so called 5 stars property you would not expect this kind of noise nuisance. A good point on the swimming pool facilities, and the grocery shop being opened late in the evening. An average hotel, offering clean building outdoor appearance but with a rotten indoor's facilties. Not to be recommended for the price paid

Reviews.Title: “Great value rooms in good location”
Reviews.Author: T-SGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 days at HGV near to Sea World. Only booked last minute and secured a 1 bedroom studio for $80 a night. Stayed in St George's House which I think is one of the older units. Good sized room which is well equipped with Queen size bed, TV, DVD player, CD player/alarm clock, ceiling fan. Room also houses a small kitchen with microvave, fridge, sink, coffee maker and toaster but no cooker/grill. Hilton also provides washing up liquid and cloths/kitchen towels are replaced daily. There is a small balcony with table chairs. Rooms are cleaned/beds made daily. Room has air conditioning which was our only real complaint. The studio room was linked to a larger apartment whose air conditioning dial controlled both rooms! This was fixed once early in the holiday only to get back to Arctic conditions a few days later when new guests moved in next door. A change of room was then offered and no issues seen after this. Didn't use the pools much but here is plenty of space/sun beds. We had meals twice in the pool side bar in the evening. OK and prices are reasonable but not a great range of food. Note the hotel doesn't have a separate restaurant and while we were there it was cool in the evening. They have plastic covers that they bring down around the edge of the restaurant with gas heaters on for cool December evenings. The hotel has a well stocked shop with prices competative. As we arrived back late several evenings we used the Pizza Hut Express outlet which you access though the shop. Again very good. Although ok with information on theme parks/malls, didn't feel hotel guest services were helpful with public transportation. We didn't have a car but they had no information on getting around by bus and so had to do our own research which is detailed below. Unlike other comments, I think this hotel is well placed for Disney/Universal if you don't have a car. The hotel run a free courtesy bus to Universal at 8.20 that gets you there just before opening calling at Sea World on route returning at 7.00, 8.00 and 9.00 from the bus depot at Universal. The hotel do run a shuttle to Disney at $12 pp return but this gets you there well after opening. A better option for Disney is to catch the Lynx 50 bus that goes directly to Magic Kingdom. Take a right outside the main hotel entrance walk across the road before you get to the lights. Cross the main junction staying on the same side of the road. Bus stop is marked and is 200 yards from the main hotel entrance. Costs $1.50 pp each way (need exact change) and buses are every 30 minutes. The 8.10 am bus gets you the main Disney transportation hub for around 8.40. This links into Magic Kindom and Epcot by monorail and Disney MGM/Animal Kingdom by Disney bus (all free). Buses are every 30 minutes (01 & 31) in the evening with last bus 11 pm. There is also a Lynx 8 bus get gets you to International Drive/shopping malls. Go onto the Lynx web site and you can get schedules. One other thing about buses not generally known is that is if you want to get to a destination on Lynx that needs a change of bus you can ask for a transfer ticket so you don't pay your $1.50 on the second bus. I trolley also picks up directly outside the hotel (stop 34) and this is another convenient option for shops/restaurants on International Drive. Buses run every 20 minutes. $1 pp exact change needed. There is nothing around the hotel that is walking distance. Overall a great value holiday base.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in a 2 bedroom located in the South Hampton building on the 2nd floor. From the moment of arrival until check out, the experience was very good and we have no complaints about anything. When we arrived at the guard gate, the young man greeted us by name and said everything was all ready for our check-in. The desk staff was very friendly and welcomed us and we were checked-in in less than 2 minutes. There were certificates for 2 complimentary bottled waters (Hilton Honors benefit) good at the convenience store. The room was what we expected - spacious and well equiped. The first night there was a light bulb out in the bedroom, but it had been replaced on the 2nd day without us reporting anything. We were not expecting housekeeping services, except for one time, but we had service every day of our stay. Extra laundry soap, coffee, and bath products were left daily. We made our own beds, but the housekeeper smoothed and straightened them out daily. We did not receive one call to listen to a time share presentation. The phone was ringing when we first arrived at the room, but the caller had hung up before we could answer. Maybe that was the time share call. There were two large screened balconies with ceiling fans . We looked out at the corner of the tennis court, so everything was very quiet. The beds were comfortable and the tub was a welcome sight after so much walking throughout Disney World. There were TVs and DVD players in each bedroom and a large rear projection TV in the living room, along with a stereo and DVD player. The housekeeper ran the dishwasher for us daily, even though it wasn't full and probably could have waited another day. The bar and pool-side restaurant were reasonably priced and had friendly staff. We used the Pizza Hut twice. There is a delivery charge plus gratuity added for delivery to the room, so it's better to order it from the store and carry it back to your room. The small convenience store was well stocked and reasonably priced. We did not have trouble parking, even when coming back late at night. The location of the Hilton was very convenient to the I-4 and 528 Expressway. It was an easy 10 minute drive to Disney World and about 15-20 to the airport. Remember to bring lots of quarters for the 528 Expressway toll. It was 75 cents several times each way between the hotel and the airport. There is a Publix grocery store south of the hotel on International Drive near the other Hilton Grand Vacation Villa. There were also many restaurants near the Convention Center north of the hotel on International Drive. This was one of our best lodging experiences and we highly recommed this facility to anyone visiting the area. It lived up to all the praise by previous Trip Advisor reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !”
Reviews.Author: TexasHappyFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in August during our Disney trip in summer '07. We booked through RCI time share exchange. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well. I don't know the difference between the timeshare rooms and regular rooms, but we had two joint rooms, fully equiped. One room had a full kitchen including washer and drier, large fridge, stove and microwave. One bedroom with a King size and sofa beds on the living room. The other bedroom had another King size. We also had a balcony with a small table and a great view! The hotel has a couple of large pools and a bar, but given that our main destination was Disney we only went there once. We had a great time. A great feature of this hotel is definitely the location. We had rented a car and this hotel is right next to sea world. It's easy to get from anywhere, just following the seaworld signs. Disney was about 10 minutes away, Universal as well. And lots of places to eat nearby. I highly recommend it. The only detail I would improve is that cleaning services only come once a week, probably because of the time share. But still it was a great experience and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “So near yet so far from Sea World”
Reviews.Author: mmmNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Stayed in queen suite. Very small room, clean. Nice swimming pools, table tennis, shuffle board, on site groceries. SeaWorld entrance is about 1 mile away, and park requires much walking between attractions. Hotel offered very limited shuttle service - 8:20 AM and 10:20 AM. SeaWorld opens at 9 with shows starting at 10 AM. Also, return shuttle was limited. Thus, we drove to SeaWorld, parking for $10, obviating the benefit of the Hilton "SeaWorld" location. Concierge desk marginally helpful for tickets and arrangements. When I asked about purchasing SeaWorld tickets, I was directed to a second person at the desk who turned out to be selling Hilton real estate in exchange for free tickets. Once he found out my spouse was not available, the offer of free tickets was withdrawn. Wasted my time, I was not interested in sales pitches, just a SeaWorld vacation. For now, best to show Southwest Airline Rapid Rewards card (can be printed on from internet) at SeaWorld entrance for a 20% discount, and validate tickets on exit for a free second day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: travelhustler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 BR suite with the studio as a 3rd BR. Very clean and well kept. Comfortable beds and spacious living areas with a large screen tv. There are also screened in balconies to enjoy. For the internet junkies like myself, there is wireless internet provided. Very convenient to all the Disney attractions with Seaworld right across the street. Parking is plentiful and security and staff are very friendly. There are 2 large pools, one with a waterfall and many hot tubs scattered around. Pool is open until 11pm so it makes for great night swimming or relaxing in the hot tub. Towels are provided and plenty of lounge chairs to relax in. There is a pool table, ping pong table, basketball courts, video games and an activity center for kids. There is also a deli where you can get coffee, sandwiches and snacks. Also be sure to check out the gazebo by the pond, there are many turtles swimming around, we fed them some left over lunch meat and they came in to feed in masses. Overall, this was a very nice place to visit, no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton by Sea World and overall found the stay quite pleasant. Overall a very nice hotel: Very clean & comfortable rooms; beds especially comfortable. I found the staff to be very helpful and promptly responded to any requests we had. The deli on site was handy, but we rarely ate at the hotel so only used this once. We stayed in the studio room. All these room types are interconnecting and it is quite easy to hear the neighbor’s. For a few days of our stay we had a screaming child to send us to sleep each night and I have to admit it was a bit of a nightmare, but we survived. We found no issues with parking and were regularly in and out of the hotel. We had a small pool at the back of our block and it was very nice, small but always plenty of loungers and towels. Bigger pool at main hotel looked very nice, but lots and lots of children (who all seemed to be having a great time), but we prefer the quite life. Good location. I have stayed on International drive twice before (Crown Plaza & Embassy Suites). The Hilton is right in the middle of Disney, Universal & Premium Outlet’s. There is not much located within easy reach of the hotel (Shops, restaurants etc..), but if you have a car, this will not matter at all. If you don’t have a car, I would not recommend this location. I would not hesitate to go back again, however would probable prefer to be more centrally located on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, amazing one bedroom suite!”
Reviews.Author: chic_mamma
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite for a portion of our trip to Orlando. Wow, I would have thought it was a timeshare. So roomy, and not your basic hotel room. Lots of onsite activities for kids - two pools, shuffleboard, playgrounds.....and close to everything. I would stay here again. Definately worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, skip the sales talks”
Reviews.Author: Shmohan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business last year, and enjoyed the experience so much that I decided to stay here again while on vacation (I'm usually a loyal SW member) Good: Room: We stayed in a one room suite with whirlpool hot tub. The suites are very well done with comfortable furniture, nice enclosed patio, two TVs (large one in the living room, smaller one in the bedroom), and washer/dryer. Front desk staff & concierge: Very helpful with check in; even booked us a dinner reservation for later that night. OK: Location: Great if you're going to seaworld or the International Drive strip. Not an ideal location if you're visiting the Disney parks (~20-30 min drive). Bad: Timeshare sales pitch: When we checked in, we were asked to vist the concierge desk where a nice gentleman presented us with a 'bonus 10,000 hilton points' certificate. The catch? We had to show up at 8am the next morning for a time share sales pitch. We didn't enjoy this sales pitch at all; this rubbed us both the wrong way. Overall, a very nice hotel resort with a great tropical theme. Opt for the one bedroom suite with whirlpool if you can; that was the key differentiator for us when we decided to stay here during vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMMiller
Reviews.Content: A big fan of Hilton Hotels. This property is in a great location, close to attractions. Wonderful onsight pools. Incredible value, it has in room fridge and microwave. It has limited room service and onsight store with deli. The staff is EXTREMELY helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A+, Beautiful & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: marcene
Reviews.Content: This property and room was EXCELLENT and a great value. The room (1 BR) was extremely spacious, the bed and linens were quality and so comfortable. Even the sofa bed was comfy for the kids. Very clean, no sightings of bugs in the room nor on the screened in ground level patio. One small downfall was the internet connection in the room was not working during our 3 day stay and even though my husband spent some time talking on phone to tech support, it did not get fixed. Front desk staff made attempts to help, unsuccessfully, but were sincere in wanting to help. Kids (11 & 14) liked the pools and movie screen at the pool. But this is a huge SAFETY HAZARD as during the movie lighting in pool is very dim (could barely see them) and parents could be distracted with the movie. Good concept, but low lighting, distraction, and kids in a pool do not mix. A bit of a walk to the pool area, but lovely grounds. A large golf cart shuttle is available. Overall, this was the best property we stayed at during our trip and we would return!

Reviews.Title: “Second 1st Impressions Are Possible!”
Reviews.Author: pinklady08
Reviews.Content: I actually visited this resort twice....once in July 2007 and then in September 2007. I must say that I was quite disappointed with the resort in July, as my family and I had to contend with ants. Pest technicians were dispatched to our room (a two-bedroom apartment), but, unfortunately, they were unable to resolve the problem. This made our stay at the otherwise beautiful resort, very uncomfortable, as my family and I were afraid to freely use the bathroom, closet, and kitchen because of the ants. Although I wrote the resort manager and received a sincere response from him, I had vowed to never return to the resort. In September, I received an offer, through the HiltonHHonors program, to revisit HGVC. The offer was too good to turn down, so I reluctantly booked our stay. I notified the resort manager that my family and I would be returning to again to celebrate my daughter's 6th birthday at the Magic Kingdom. When I arrived the staff was wonderful, just as they were the first time. My daughter was eager to revisit the waterfalls and beautiful landscape of the resort. Our check-in was breeze, and the clerk even wished my daughter a happy birthday. This made my daughter beam with joy! Upon entering our room, we were greeted by birthday balloons and goodies that Mr. Hancock, the resort manager, and his staff had left for our daughter. This unexpected surprise truly made my daughter's day. This time, our room was clean, free of dust and ants. Everything seemed to be in working order. The location of the room was wonderful, as we had a corner room that I allowed us to leave our curtains open without staring at anyone else's patio. The room, like the other one in which we stayed, had a full kitchen (with all kitchen necessities from a toaster to dishwashing liquid), a spa tub, and a bathroom with a comfortably-sized shower, a large and nicely decorated living area, and a private screened patio. At the end of the evening of the day of our arrival, a staff member called to ensure that we had enjoyed the balloons and were pleased with our room. On the second day of our visit, we spent most of the day at Disney. When we returned to our room, we discovered the room to have been cleaned by the housekeeper and everything had been replenished nicely. I did not get a chance to revisit the pool in September, but I did visit it in July. The pools are wonderful! The largest pool has a large rock extending over it to create something almost like a cove and a waterfall. My family enjoyed the pool very much. There is a little stand that sells flip flops, water toys, etc., and we purchased a floating toy for my daughter to use at the pool. (The woman at this stand was very nice.)There are hot tubs surrounding the pool, and we enjoyed these, too. The landscaping is beautiful around the pool, and in certain areas, even provides a sense of privacy. All pools and hot tubs appeared to be well-maintained. The lounge chairs were in excellent condition and showed no signs of mildew. The tennis courts were well lit at night and appeared to be well-maintained, as well. I felt very secure as this resort, as it is gated, and the friendly security guards stopped anyone who did not have a resort guest tag around their rear-view mirror. Other positives I noted about this apartment included a washer/dryer combo the apartment (very convenient); clean, unworn carpets in the room, Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries, and internet access. Other positives about the resort include a store with Starbucks coffee, snacks, etc. The woman who assisted in the store was friendly and efficient. The decor of the resort is beautiful, with true island feel and beautiful wedding arch. I was truly satisfied with my second stay, and it reminded me of the Hilton hospitality that I have experienced over and over again. I will definitely return to the HGVC, and may consider purchasing an apartme

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: FloridabobCorkCity
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I spent two weeks in the H.G.V in Nov 2005. Everything was perfect, staff, room, amenities & even the guests. I was 21 at the time & worried about it being slightly old fashioned. I've never been so wrong. We stayed in a 2-Bed room for the first week & it was so big, we moved to a 1-Bed for the second, due to all the unnecessary space. The second room was slightly more updated than the first, but both were as good as you could imagine. the staff were more than friendly & went to great lengths to assist us. They were incredibly honest. I had lost my wallet with over $400 in it & in less than 15 minutes of panicking, a member of staff had found it & returned it to me. Getting around was easy, the hotel was in a great area with Sea World across the road, Point Orlando, Disney, Universal & the Outlets just a quick bus ride away. it was perfect for families with kids also. The pools were beautiful & at night, they set up a cinema screen at the end of the pool for the kids to watch while everyone is at the resteraunt. It was the best holiday i ever had, & the Hilton contributed immensely to that. We plan on going back there again next November & would advise anyone who can, to go around that time. Its after "hurricane season" the weather is beautiful & there are hardly any queues or crowds at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights with my wife and a three years old daughter. Was in the Paget building in a 1 bedroom suite on the top floor facing the golf course and the pool. Check-in was very prompt, professional staff. Security at the entrance gate was always very courteous, and I had to use the card to open the gates only once, as every other time, the security guard would walk out as we were approaching, see the parking tag on the rear view mirror and just open the gate and always wave and say hello. The suite was very clean with all the necessary amenities, full kitchen with a dishwasger, washer/dryer. All silverware, plates, pots, pans, etc were provided, so was the dishwasher soap and the detergent. We had daily housekeeping, who made the bed, cleaned a little, restocked the towels, and dumped the trash. The suite has a huge jacuzzi with many mirrors right in the bedroom which was a very nice touch as my wife loved it. The balcony is big, we had breakfast every morning there. The pool was excellent, never many people, there were times when we were the only ones there. Closes at 10PM. Kiddie pool right next to it, and a hot tub on the opposite side. Pool towels provided. Water clean and warm. We did not go to the main pool as the one next to us was more than sufficient. Driving distance to Disney - about 10 min, and Seaworld is right next to the hotel. One phone call regarding timeshares. Overall - excellent stay, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: HavingFunInTheSun07
Reviews.Content: Being this was a first trip to Orlando for several of the Girl Scouts we traveled with. We wanted a hotel that would offer several amenties for extra activities. WE GOT IT!!!!! The proerty was amazing. The theater inside of the lobby was on time. The 2 day hopper passes we had for Disney the girls didnt want to go a 2nd time, they chose to stay at the pool and enjoy. The fireworks from the hotel and Seaworld were beautiful at night. Great rooms(at the Smiths) just georgous. We cant wait to return and with several additonal guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: PurePearl
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this property for four nights and absolutely loved it. We had a two-bedroom suite and it was gigantic. The rooms are on opposite sides of the living area so plenty of privacy. Housekeeping did a great job; grounds were immaculate. Our sons loved the waterfall pool and the video game room; we didn't really do any of the planned activities for children -- either too busy at the parks or too tired from visiting them! All employees were very professional, friendly and helpful except... Our one tiny complaint was that the concierge desk was not terribly helpful if you just needed directions. Before answering questions, they asked for your room number so that they could see if you were already a timeshare owner and if you weren't, they tried to get you to sign up for a sales pitch. No big deal -- we just stopped going to the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationNikki
Reviews.Content: The HGVC was very nice!! We stayed there from the 5th-9th of Aug. We stayen in the South Hampton Building on the 4th floor, and our room was spotless. The appliances were all clean and in working order. The bathroom shower, and the the tub was spotless. We just loved the inclosed balcony since you could sit out there, and not have to worry about any bugs. The only problem we had was that we returned to our room one day from out trip to seaworld, and couldn't get into the room. It seems that the privacy latch was somehow put on the door. I went to the front desk to alert them of the problem, and was told they would send over security. When I got back to the room, my hubby had the idea to use the key card to push over the latch, so he put it between the door and panel, closed the door, and voila, it opened. However, security never showed to see if we had gotten into the room, nor did the front desk call to verify that we had gotten into the room. Other than the lockout incident, everything was excellent, and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: IowaDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property for a week for our annual Orlando vacation. We are fortunate to have parents who don't use all of their timeshare weeks and use one of their weeks for our Orlando vacations at different Hilton and Marriott hotels in the area. Our family of 5 in a 3 bedroom unit (a 2 bedroom attached to a studio) stayed in the Pembroke Building. The location was very convenient to the pool, deli and parking. The only downfall I have about this resort (I'm assuming all the buildings share this downfall) is the elevator. There is only 1 for the entire building and it runs slowly! We were on the 5th floor and we usually opted for the stairs going down. Our unit overlooked the pool area and faced Sea World. We could watch the fireworks at night from our windows and balcony. The pool area was great. Kids activities were plentiful as were adults through the recreation department. Pizza Hut on-site was good. We had a mere 5 minute drive to Sea World and about 10-15 minute to Universal. Disney was about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE FOR KIDS”
Reviews.Author: kenw1
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 15 year old and myself stayed 5 nights over the 4th of July. The place is nice and clean but there is not much to do for a 15 year old and or us, the pools are full of small kids and they just run every where. The place is way to big for 3 small pools and no indoor place to eat but your room. Dont get me wrong the place is best for a family with younger kids, will we stay there again, no, I like smaller places I think you feel better and the places are more freindly, but over all if you have small kids and are looking for the park thing please do stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JNOR17
Reviews.Content: My family of five (kids aged 17, 13 and 11) stayed at HGVC June 14-20, 2007. We were all pleased with the accomodations. We were in the Devonshire building in a 2 bedroom unit. The room was more than large enough for my family and was extremely clean....we are very picky when it comes to cleanliness, and this unit surpassed our expectations. It was very quiet as well, we didn't know anybody else was in the building! The only complaint was on our first night, we did not have any hot water. The staff was very responsive, but at 11:00, there was really nothing they could do. We had hot water the next morning. After a minimal complaint to the front desk, they immediately offered compensation that we felt was more than fair. Elevators weren't great, but we were only on the third floor, so we just used the stairs. The pool areas were great, and we all enjoyed them. It was about a 5 min walk to the main pool from our building, but it gave you a chance to get hot and enjoy the pool even more. The store and the restaurant at the hotel was adequate, and there was another market less than a mile away. It's about a 10-15 minute ride to either Disney or Universal, not far at all. We did endure the timeshare sales pitch for discounted tickets to Disney. It was pretty painless, took less than two hours. Hilton does have a unique timeshare plan, would definately consider it when my kids are done with college. Overall, a wonderful experience. We would all highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: momofall
Reviews.Content: The HGVC is a great place for families. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 1st floor. The room was clean and there wasn't any outside noise from other guests. The kids were comfortable because they had their own TV and DVD player and we had the same in our room. The enclosed terrace was great because it eliminated bug issues. The kids got to see a few lizards which was great for them. The full kitchen was great because it allowed us to buy food and make breakfast before heading out for a day at the park. We also had snack foods for the late night cravings. My husband was so impressed that there was a washer and dryer in the room, he did laundry 2 days in a row and we all came home with clean clothes. :). I will definitely stay here again if it gets my husband to do laundry. LOL!!! My only complaint was the deli area. There were way too many flies in there for me so I did not eat anything that didn't come a sealed package. This is a really great place for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Price & Location but Large Unhealthy Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Jopoloco
Reviews.Content: The complex is pretty large and although the photos show the pool with the waterfall and fountain - those are directly behind the main building which houses no rooms. Each separate building has a pool as well, although smaller and without the waterfall. We chose this hotel because we were doing two days at Seaworld and it was conveniently located and reasonable @ $139 thru Travelocity. When we first got to our room we tried to call the front desk and switch to a building closer to the main pool with the waterfall. Our room was clean and new and proximity to the other pool was our only reason to switch but after three calls to the front desk with no one picking up, we decided to skip it and make the 1/4 walk to the waterfall pool. I'll try not to offend anyone here but - when we got to the main building pool, it looked like a place where people were coming to gain weight. Ninety-five percent of the guests at the pool area were huge, overfed people, walking around with pizza boxes, to-go containers, and frozen drinks. All ages too! I found it a little stomach turning to see this gluttonous crowd of over indulgers with seemingly no regard for their appearance or health and it was a real appetite suppressant. so I had no desire for the on-site Pizza Hut or restaurant food. At around 5pm we headed back to our own building and pool, promising our kids one last quick swim before we changed clothes and headed to Seaworld for the nighttime show. Unfortunately, THE POOL AT OUR BUILDING WAS CLOSED FOR A PRIVATE PARTY AND WE WERE NOT ALLOWED TO ENTER - despite our room overlooking the pool and so close to the party music. I thought that was pretty lame on the resorts part to rent out the pool - so you might make sure the pool in whatever building you're staying in isn't booked for a private party during your stay. In summary, a clean, nice hotel, that was overrun by overeaters during our stay. More a complaint about Americans than the property.

Reviews.Title: “We Recommend”
Reviews.Author: vcooper
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here the week of 06-19-07 and we stayed for 5days. I had research tripadvisor before reserving this resort, my husband and i loved this resort, malls, outlets were withing 5minutes, the swimming pool was great, the only setback was the elevator, only 1 was working, and it made the other elevator slower...other than that ,this is a great resort, with great customer service. we are going back in december.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Resort off Disney Property!”
Reviews.Author: OnMedic
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite property outside of Disney's Resorts. It has a very friendly feel and was perfect for our younger kids. We have stayed at the newer "International Drive" location, and much preferred the decor, but it just didn;t have the welcoming family appeal. We were here in December and the christmas decorations were very nice! OK, the Bermudan decor doesn;t really do it for me, but the units were well cleaned and well stocked. Activities for the kids throughout the day each day and fairly close to many off property activites. We love it her and will split every stay to Orlando between DVC and this HGVC property.

Reviews.Title: “Kid-friendly place with a few minor glitches”
Reviews.Author: lozaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in late June with my wife, stepkids and in-laws as they are time-share owners. I have two minor gripes. Although the weather has nothing to do with the hotel, being from California the Summer humidity was unbearable to me. And the hotel elevator literally felt like a sauna. We were on the top floor with a very slow elevator, so right after a shower and on our way out for the day, I would already have a somewhat soaked t-shirt by the end of the elevator ride. They need to install a/c in the elevators for sure. This would seem a no-brainer in a place as humid as Florida. In fact, if humidity bothers you, I would recommend a visit during the cooler months. I personally got headaches every day waiting in line for hours in the humidity to ride the rides at all the parks, but I may be more sensitive than some. Secondly, as you walk the grounds from your building to the main pool area, the tranquil setting is disturbed by the occasional foul smell of raw trash. Not sure why or where it came from, but it was strong and in several locations. Other than that, the rooms are nice and spacious and have the feel of an apartment. Lots of nice pools. Kids everywhere since school is out. Nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable accomodations for a family on vacation in Orlando. We did all the Disney parks which were about 15-20 minutes away by car. The outdoor restaurant by the pool is decent but was very slow. There is a little mini-mart/deli/Pizza hut combo store on-site as well which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young family”
Reviews.Author: Kitija
Reviews.Content: The unit and grounds are beautiful. The balconies are screened in and secure for children. Our young kids enjoyed the shaded playground with unique equipment, it appears from Europe. Plenty of pools and free pool toys. We found the service throughout the resort to be excellent, except for the activity staff, which could have been more involved with the kids.The welcome party was good though. While the place is walking distance from Seaworld, that it not possible in extreme heat or with young kids as you have to cross a massive black asphalt parking lot to get there. We drove and paid $10 parking daily. There is a shuttle but it has very limited departure and return times and requires pre-booking. We took advantage of a ticket at Seaworld where we paid for one day and were able to return all week. That worked out perfectly for our little ones who were only good for about 4 hours before melting down. We didn't try to do Disney from here, we were having too much fun at Seaworld. The resort supplied paper towel, coffee and toiletries which is not the norm for timeshares. The elevator at Southampton was sluggish and in fact was out of order for 24 hours, just after we got our bags to the 6th floor, thankfully. We were not hassled by sales people, perhaps because we are owners already elsewhere. Overall, very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nomoresnowNEOhio
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! We stayed in February and again in June. In February we were in a building (Paget) pretty far away from the pool but since it was not too hot the walk was not bad. On both stays we had a one bedroom apartment. The reason I say apartment is because the room is just like one. Full kitchen with every gadget you could want, a big table to eat at, a good size living room, screened in porch with table and chairs. The bedroom was also a good size. DVD player in the living room and bedroom. The hotel is very clean and our rooms were spotless! In June we were lucky enough to be in the Somerset building which was a 2 minute walk to the pool. The two main pools were great and our 3 year old loved the kiddie pool and had fun playing with the other kids in it. There were alot of activities for children to participate in, some had a fee, some did not. A few nights there are dive in movies at the pool. The bar and grill by the pool has good food and a good children's menu. There is also a good shop for food with a Pizza Hut inside. At the beginning of our stay the hotel was not too crowded but the day before we left the summer crowds arrived and I was glad we left when we did. Too many young teens at the pool with nobody watching them, though we did see security walking around the pool area many times. Every staff member we encountered were friendly and smiling especially the staff at the activity center! I cannot say enough good things about this resort, you need to see for yourself! It is a place I would return to over & over!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: shaina_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Grand Vacation Club from May 13 to May 31, 2007. I was a little worried because of some older posts I read on here (since it was a Gold Crown through RCI I figured it could not be that bad) but upon arrival my fears quickly diminished. When we got there some tickets we ordered over the internet were not there, so I was freaking out because we needed them for that night! Roni from customer relations got on the phone with the people and fought with them to try and work it out. Finally I cancelled with the outside company and Hilton got me the tickets CHEAPER! Most resorts would just give you the number to the place and send you on your way, HGVC made sure we were covered. Thank you Roni and Jose! We had a two bedroom lockoff very close to the pools which was great. It was beautiful, clean and very spacious. One thing some people may not like is that they do not clean your room everyday, actually they only clean it half-way through your stay. To me I loved it because nobody was bothering me, waking me up in the am and moving my things. I did not mind having to wash the towels and dishes once in awhile, we just turned on the dish washer and the clothes washer before we left in the am. My only complaint about the resort was our elevator in Pembroke House. It was slower than the turtles out back, but we made it through so it's all good hahaha. Plus on the top floor I was not all about lugging stuff up the stairs! We got food from the Pizza Hut on site as well as the deli there. The food and everything else available was good but it was also pretty expensive. I would recommend going just outside the resort to Publix to buy food and if you want to order in call Orlando Pizza. All of the service at the hotel was great, everything there was beautiful and clean. The pools and hot tubs were immaculate. The location, literally at the front gate of Sea World and right off on International Drive was GREAT! We had a really good time here and I would definitely stay at HGVC at SeaWorld again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business”
Reviews.Author: madera99
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Orlando on Business, I would be careful about staying at this property. It is very family friendly but does not offer some amenities that you might expect from a Hilton property on a business trip. This includes good internet connection, room service, a business center, etc. The internet service is TERRIBLE. Probably the worst I have seen in a hotel in a long time. I believe the management knows this but it is outsourced and they seem not to be able to fix it. I was there 7 days and had so many problems, as did all of my co-workers staying there. They kept telling me that it was my computer. The business center is horrible and there is no room service. The rooms are comfortable and very big. The pools looked very nice. Also- one thing that was annoying was the parking. It was inconvenient coming back into the hotel as you had to enter your hotel key into a slot in order to enter even though the guard could clearly see the Hilton parking tag hanging in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality place”
Reviews.Author: Trebor1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week and was not disappointed. Room was perfect. The place must be very new as all furnishings were in excellent condition. Plenty of space in the rooms. Toilets, bathrooms and jaccuzzi were very clean and good size. Staff were very friendly, probably the best I have experienced at a location in Florida (been quite a few times). Very easy to access all the parks and International drive which is becoming less "tacky" now. It lacked free internet access. Lifts were a bit slow but OK. Plenty of parking and easy to get in and out. Tennis court for those who want it. Swimming pool area with some shade to get out of the midday heat. Also an on site shop with enough supplies but they are always a touch more expensive than local shops.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: WellsGT
Reviews.Content: We just loved this resort. It was very clean and comfortable. The room was great. Big kitchen and washer/dryer was very convenient. The grounds were well maintained. Lots to do for everyone. We stayed at the resort for 2 solid days just doing the activities. It was great. Pool, ping pong, shuffleboard, movies, activities, grocery story, starbucks, the list goes on. Our son has severe allergies and every precaution was taken to ensure he was comfortable in the room. All it took was a quick call to a Manager prior to our checking in the week before. Gated resort was comforting as well. We were very impressed. Would stay here again. Tip: If you are a light sleeper stay away from the rooms facing the highway and Sea World. The traffic was so loud that you couldn't sit on your beautiful screened in balcony :( Traffic started at about 6 AM right into the night. It did wake us up. Also, fire station right next door. Try to stay in the inner room to the resort and it will be great. Regards, L & M Wells

Reviews.Title: “HGVC during spring break”
Reviews.Author: ktownchica
Reviews.Content: We just completed a five day trip at hgvc @ Sea World. We read reviews on this site and we were prepared for the timeshare presentation. We did attend so that we could learn about HGVC. The sales presentation did not make sense, since one can stay at the club without being a timeshare owner. My husband and I both agree this is a nice club but it has a few problems. The crowd was really decent. The grounds of the resort are immaculate and the staff is always friendly. The accomodations are excellent! We did have a few problems though. It took two dys to resolve the internet connection, the safe was locked with a password upon our arrival. A request to correct the problem was redmediated immediately. However, something happened with the safe's mechanics that it opened and closed contiously until its battery ran out. We were not able to use it thereafter. We used the Parish pool ,which we we were told by the person who booked the accomodations , was for adults only and it is printed on the hotel brochure as the adult pool. Well it is not. However, it is less noisy and less busy than the other two pools. One draw back is that on both days that we visited the restrooms at the Parish pool they were in need of servicing. Just digusting!!! We were at the pool for 2 hrs on one occassion and three on another. We called guest relations to inform them and they were apologetic to no avail. Then on our last full day our room had not been cleaned as of 5pm when we returned after being out since 9am. We called and it was done immediately, but supplies were not replenished. This was really frustrating since we called to have it serviced to begin with. Our teenager loved the accomodations. He had a friend with him. However, most of the acitivities are geared towards younger children. Loved the room, location and the 6th floor view of seaworld fireworks. Too bad for those problems. annette

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - only one item for improvement....”
Reviews.Author: Martini 425
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 4 nights during a trade show at the Orlando Convention Center. Location: Around the corner from the entrance to Sea World. Did not go myself but saw lots of families walking to it so very convenient. The Convention Center is about 2 miles away, however there is a trolley stop right in front of this hotel which will take you there - takes about 10 minutes. Trolley also will take you anywhere up/down International Drive - no fee involved so very nice for families. Property: Very nice property. Very well kept up and manicured well. Two nice large pools, several hot tubs, two childrens play areas, many shaded areas, lots of loungers in the sun. Work out room was very nice - good equipment. Excellent running trail around the lake which is behind the pool area. Restaurants: Can't recall the name but awesome restaurant nicely located by the pools. Very, very reasonably priced - was shocked actually. Had lunch two days for under 10$ each day. Unheard of in the land of Disney. Wonderful huge grilled mahi mahi with a salad for $8? WOW! Also, GREAT place for breakfast in the deli - starbucks coffee for $2 and an awesome huge grilled breakfasts burrito with egg, cheese and bacon/sausge for $2.99. Again unheard of. Deli is much like a small grocery store so you could pick up items for your suite if your staying for vaca. Rooms: Again very nice. Clean, well appointed. Awesome screened in patio. Nice efficiency kitchens. Comfy beds. Only complaint is internet / cell phone access is limited. Seems like hotel is in a dead zone.
