Internet air card only worked when I sat out on the balcony and cell phone rings right through to voice mail. May be different in other buildings - I was in building 10. I am very glad I stayed here on this business trip. I would most definately stay here on vacation or business again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility! Great People! Fun time!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzypoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this through RCI the timeshare company, We had a fantastic time... The room was great! The only downside was in the kitchen there was a limited selection on utencils. They come with plates, silverware, cups, a few untensils, and some pots. So you may need to pack your most used utencils. We had a balcony which over looked the tennis courts and gardens. We were a little far from the pool (not bad i'm young so I need all the excersice I can get, I'd say about three minutes). There was also an adult only pool which was quiet but there were no lavish waterfalls and things like that. Bathrooms were always clean! The main pool area was very nice, I loved the way it was set up. The pools were a little cool for my liking but my boyfriend and his brother enjoyed them. We had the chance to watch the Patriots VS Chargers game at the pool bar, that was awsome we met a lot of great people, and the atmosphere was great! They werent plasma TV's but you still saw the game! The food at the pool bar was very good, I had the chicken ceaser salad. There were tons of things to do at the resort, fitness classes, arts and crafts, hair braiding, pool games, trivia contests. We didnt have time to do any of them (we did the disney parks) but there were SO many options. There is also a theatre which plays newer movies. We didnt travel with children but there was a really nice children's activity center and a game room, As well as many children activities. They also had a trip to disneyquest for kids 8-14 which seemed reasonable. There was a pizzahut on the grounds as well as the deli/convienance store (which really wasnt overpriced). The location is great, your not in the middle of the strip but your definatly not out in the boonies. Theres a walmart supercenter about 15 mins away where you can get all your groceries as well as souvenirs for much less money than at the local disney/universal parks. There is a ton of things around to do and see. One thing you cannot miss is the Arabian Nights Dinner Show (go to ticketmama.com for discount tickets...Normally 56 but on sale for 25). It was EXCELLENT! Doors open an hour before the show (get there early its first come first serve, you wont be bored theres a magic show!) Downtown disney is a good time too, lots of clubs and shopping as well as cirque de sole and planet hollywood. Getting back to the resort, the staff was very friendly! Always willing to give directions, or tell you a great place to eat. We had a lightbulb blow and called in about 10 mins later it was recplaced. In January there are tons of little black flies which get annoying but definatly not the resorts fault. BTW you have to try golden coral great food great price. We ate at wild flames lobster feast also, cheapest we could find but had plenty of food.Definatly not the same as the maine lobster we get up here but it was ok. I really had no complaints about the resort! I would definatly stay at this resort again, and would definatly reccomend it to people!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased”
Reviews.Author: dianneon2
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, we were looking forward to staying here, and i can only concur with the previous reviewers that this is a fabulous resort to stay at. We exchanged our timeshare through RCI for a week at HGVC Seaworld and we were in a 2 bedroom lock-off unit so our 2 teenage girls basically had a unit to themselves-their own bathroom, fridge,microwave and most importantly a TV. The units are comfortable with everything you could ask for. Our only small complaint was that there were not enough dresser drawers available (only 6) but then again we were travelling with 2 teenage girls. Parents with young children will be very pleased by the kid's playground. It is completely covered by a canopy, has safe flooring, and lots of innovative and fun activities for the kids,not the usual swings and teeter-totters. The dive-in movie is a great concept-a huge inflatable screen by the heated pool and recent family movies are shown. We saw "Cars" while my one daughter floated in the pool. Being a time-share there are inevitable calls about "joining for breakfast" but they only called once and were very polite when we indicated we weren't interested right now. Staff were very friendly and available. Free hi-speed internet is complimentary. Seaworld is within walking disatance but be prepared for a slow walk home after exploring the park-it covers a large area. Hardest part as usual was leaving but we can look forward to returning there our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at the Hilton 2/23-2/27/07”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Love
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the HGVC Seaworld at around 11:30am. Check in is supposed to be at 4:00pm but we were able to check in at 11:30 with no problems. We had a studio room in the Pembrook Tower. Beautiful room with screened in balcony. We had a view of the tennis courts. Pool area was nice also. I was kind of surprised to find out that there was only one restaraunt on the property. They had a gift shop with a pizza hut express and sandwiches/salads but only one main restaraunt. The only negative experience I had was people calling me to attend a time share presentation. I expected one call but not 3!! It seems like the people I talked to would not take "NO" for an answer! I did not appreciate calls at 7:30am when I was still sleeping. I had to be somewhat firm with the last person I talked to and then the calls stopped. Overall I would stay here again but for our next trip to Orlando I would like to stay at the HGVC International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Great place”
Reviews.Author: SCJoer
Reviews.Content: Our family, (8 in all) 5 adults and 3 children stayed here the first week of January 07. Could not have asked for a better place. We did the Disney parks so we had about a 20 minute drive on the I-4, but truly was no trouble. Staff was friendly, helpful, and very knowledgable of the area. Kudos to the whole staff! Note: American Express membership rewards members, check the catalog for a 4 night vacation here, also Hilton Points, I booked our vacation through all points.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: YBM
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be within walking distance of SeaWorld. I had always seen the Renaissance Orlando Resort from SeaWorld's parking lot, but they were completely booked for the dates we were going to be in Orlando. So I did a hotel search by distance and I am SO HAPPY that I found the Hilton Grand Vacations Club! The whole resort tastefully replicates a Bermuda township - beautiful tropical landscaping - pleasing architecture. The one bedroom king suite was more than adequate for the two of us. It was spotlessly clean, very spacious, and very comfortable. It was very handy to have laundry facilities right in our suite. Two of the days we stayed were rainy and cold by Florida standards. So if we had to be stuck inside for any extended period, it was nice to be in such a spacious comfortable place, instead of cramped in a standard hotel room. The rate was very reasonable. The location was perfect - an easy walk to SeaWorld - an easy drive to other theme parks, shopping, and a great variety of restaurants north of the Convention Center on International Drive. We were very pleased and will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was so good, we bought a Hilton time share!”
Reviews.Author: queeng10
Reviews.Content: We picked this locaton by default of not getting a reservation with another time share community friends were staying at. Well, God works in mysterious ways because HGVCSea World was the place for us! We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and everything was clean and very comfortable! All the amenities of a hotel room and more, definitely Hilton. We knew we were getting a rain day so we decided to go to the Time Share presentation for discounted Disney tickets. We were never approached, we approached the concierge about the tour. It was suppose to be a 1 and 1/2 hour presentation with lunch, we got breakfast and lunch as we were there about 4 and 1/2 hours, but we purchased! We went in with no plans on doing so, but after thinking about the accomodations and how much we were enjoying our vacation we decided to do it! There are alot of perks, these you need to study and get use too, but it is fun and we are going back Feb. 15th. It's definitely for families, everyone can do what they want and the pool bar was fun too! The only down fall is there was no place for a nice meal on premises, but we made the best of what they had and found some really good restuarants(Charley's Steakhouse!) We are glad we finally took the plunge and it's a great deal to stay as just a hotel, their rates were great! Also drinks and food poolside were all priced well!

Reviews.Title: “HGVC was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: yoyo001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo a week before Christmas on an RCI exchange and we loved it!! I was nervous about the exchange, but I could not have been more pleased with our accomodations. The condo was huge, with more than enough room for our family of six. With two kids 7 and 9, and two teenage boys, it was the perfect size for us. We had so much space that no one got in anyone's way. The unit was very clean, with all the amenities and comforts of home. The kitchen was fully stocked, the master bathtub was awesome, great to relax in after a day at the theme parks. I especially like the extra large shower in the master bath. We had so many tvs that no one was fighting over what to watch. There was even a big screen in the living room. We had two screened patios. The washer and dryer also came in handy, with complimentary Tide. Our room was close to the main entrance and lobby. The grounds were immaculate. We found the staff to be friendly also. The resort was conveniently located to all the major theme parks. Seaworld was right across the street and served as our marker to get back to the resort at night. It was close to all the action on International Drive, without all the traffic and congestion. Renting a car here is a must to get around and enjoy all the area has to offer. There is a grocery store and outlet mall about 10 minutes from the resort. My only recommendation is more parking, b/c we returned late to the resort most nights and parking was pretty scarce. I also like the security at the gate every night. Although we didn't participate in any of the scheduled activities, we were at Disneyworld and Universal Studios, there seemed to be plenty to do at the resort each day. I will definitely stay here again. I was even a little disappointed that no one asked me to do a timeshare presentation, b/c I would be very interested in ownership at this resort. We saw the other HGVC near the outlet mall, and it looked even more beautiful than the one we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: thegreshamhotel
Reviews.Content: WOW, WOW, WOW, i challenge anybody not to like this hotel we really did not want to leave and we have stayed all over the world. This was the first 2 weeks of 3 week holiday in florida and we loved it. Our apartment was huge and of a very high standard the main complex is beautiful and the staff were fantastic. It is also idealy placed for everthing you want to do and you feel very secure while your here.... FANTASTIC....

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jimmithing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGVC Sea World property the week between Xmas and New Years. The resort was wonderful and well maintained. Our room was a one bedroom suite, which comfortably slept 4 adults. The rooms have an adequate kitchen & bath and a patio that we enjoyed overlooking the pool. The 2 friends of ours who stayed with us for a night used the pull out couch and said it was very comfortable. This was a very family friendly resort. We do not have kids and still enjoyed how family friendly it was. The pool area was fun, and not as crowded as we expected being the hotel was sold out during our stay. The activities area for kids was always having pool side games and activities going on and the pools and fitness center were very nice. They have a great masseuse on the property as well. We were a bit disappointed that we did not have pool side servers from the hotel bar/restaurant. However, you the bar/restaurant was right on the pool deck and easy to access. The hotel is across the street from Sea World, although I don't think it would be a fun walk. We actually took the complimentary shuttle, since the traffic was crazy around the resort. The location is friendly to Disney and Universal, about a 15 minute drive to both. We went up International Drive to eat and shop each day, and other than the traffic, it was easy to get to/from the resort. I would definitely stay here again - however, we also toured the new Tuscany HGVC, which is further south on International Drive near the Outlet Mall. That HGVC property was even more beautiful than the Sea World one, so depending on availability I would also recommend that!

Reviews.Title: “Solid value, good for families”
Reviews.Author: Michas
Reviews.Content: This property was attractive and clean, with friendly service, good amenities and a convenient location. We had a studio and a one-bedroom handicapped suite. The studio was basically a regular hotel room with a queen-size bed and a sofabed, not huge, with the addition of a small fridge and sink. The one bedroom suite was very nice, with an equipped kitchen, table for six, a sofabed and two arm chairs, and a big screen TV with DVD in the living room. The bedroom was comfortable, with a huge jetted bathtub and sink area, and sliding door access to the full bathroom with the walk-in shower .The shower had built-in seating and a hand-shower that my dad found very convenient. There was also a stacked washer/dryer with detergent provided. There is a Publix market and CVS pharmacy in easy driving distance, and access to Highway 4 was close by: Disney World is four short exits west. I would definitely stay at this resort again. The only reasons I didn't give it five stars are: the connecting doors to adjacent rooms are not flush to the floor, thus you can hear other guests quite clearly; the check out time of 10 am is too early and the check in time of 4 pm is too late for a town that has a zillion rooms to let; and beware of the flashing telephone in your room: pick up your welcome message and very soon, someone could call to offer you a delicious breakfast and timeshare presentation opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Rekon
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Hilton's Grand Vacation Club in Sep. 2006. The property grounds and maintanance is great. The 2 bedroom apartment which we stayed in was loaded with all kinds of luxury. We did not have to go out if we did not wanted to. The main living room had a dinning table, sofa, couch big screen TV, stereo, dvd player. Full kitchen. The main bedroom had a jacussi-spa with its own private balcony and bathroom with its own TV and dvd player. Safe deposit box and plenty of room to walk around. The second room which my brother stayed it had its own balcany, bathroom, TV with DVD player, same fridge, microwave, sofabed, and queen size bed. The grounds Iike I mention before were well kept. They an awesome swimming pool and shops on site. It was awesome and if in the Orlando area, I will not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, we'll be back again!”
Reviews.Author: kb111570
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from 10/5 - 10/10 in a 1- bedroom suite. The first night we were in building 10. This is the furthest from the main pool area. On the second day we asked to be moved closer to the main area. We were moved to building 11 which we were told was the newest building. Both rooms were very nice. They were nicely decorated and were very clean. The washer/dryer came in very handy. Kitchens were stocked with dishes, etc. The kids aged 9 and 5 loved the huge jetted tub. We did notice the room in building 10 was a bit humid. We didn't notice any humidity in building 11. Although the square footage was noticebly smaller than in building 11 it wasn't a problem. I wouldn't remark on the size if we hadn't experienced the larger suite in building 10. A bulb was out in our bathroom and when we came back that evening it had been changed. This is a little thing that makes you feel like the staff are taking care of you and the property. TIP - The pool with the fountain is warmer than the waterfall pool. Hilton granted us a late check out of noon. Staff was always very nice. We hired baby sitters from a company called Babysitters, Inc. The Hilton suggested this company. They worked out very well. They are CPR certified and are able to take the kids swimming if you wish, some sitting companies will not do this. It took about 10 minutes to get to Universal and 15 to Disney (lot to lot). We will be back in May and will be sure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: DVC_Family
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal on a 3 BR villa so we decided to jump on it instead of staying at Disney's Old Key West where we are DVC members. We stayed from Sept. 10 - 17, 2006 and had a great time. We have 2 daughters, age 4 and 7 months, and we also took our mothers, so there were 6 of us total. The accomodations were great for our group. There was a studio suite attached to our 2 BR unit, so it was perfect for my mother in law. That room had wonderful decorating, a mini kitchen, dinette and balcony. It would be perfect for a couple and also had a sofa with tv, etc. I preferred the decorating in the studio suite to the decorating in our 2BR. The 2BR villa was very spacious and had a nice layout. We love having a washer/dryer and full kitchen which we always utilize for breakfasts and snacks. With 2 small kids the washer/dryer is a necessity for week long trips for us. We stayed in the Pembroke building which was a short walk to the main pool. I would ask to be near the main pool since our walk was far enough and I don't think I would have enjoyed the outer buildings even though they have a second, smaller pool area closer to those. The grounds of the property were pretty but were in need of maintenance. The buildings were in pretty good shape on the outside and inside apart from a general feeling of "grime" in some areas like greasy dirt on the walls in some places, door handles, doors, etc. I am a clean freak and it really wasn't horrible, but I not accustomed to this at DVC properties. The location of the resort is decent, but it does take a while to reach Disney parks. This was kind of frustrating to our family, but we felt the same about the Marriott Grande Vista when we stayed there last year, and it's just a function of location. We would prefer to stay in Lake Buena Vista near the Downtown Disney entrance. It was a convenient location for Universal Studios however. The staff at the HGVC were wonderful. From the nice woman who checked us in from S. Africa, to the activities director, to the guy who brought our missing cookie sheet - everyone was friendly and nice. There are loads of activities on site and we only took part in a few. The dive-in movie was a lot of fun at night. It is probably the type of place you could stay for several days and never leave, but we never are able to just relax where we stay. The main pool was beautiful and clean, and there is a covered kids playground, a kids pool, a waterfall pool, and another kids playground all in the main area. The grill was slow and the food just ok, but it was also nice having a little convenience store on site with a deli. We would consider staying at the HGVC again if we found another great deal, but realized how much we miss staying on site at Disney and the trade-offs would only be worth it to us if we needed a 3BR villa if traveling with family again. Otherwise, it's Old Key West for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: lsted
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with a lot of great amenities. Really a resort plopped right down next to Sea World. We had the queen-bed studio room, which had a small refrigerator, microwave and sink in it. It also had a screened-in patio with a table and chairs overlooking very lush landscaping. The room was great, except the air conditioner really failed to take any moisture out of the room. The temp was cool but the room remained muggy. This was really our only complaint. The place is beautifully landscaped and the rooms are divided into separate buildings. The main building has the lobby, small theater with movies, lounge, restaurant, and store where you can buy snacks, toiletries and other items. Outside the main building are two beautiful pools with a large waterfall and fountain. There are three hot tubs, one with a waterfall, as well as shuffle board courts, ping pong tables and a small playground. Also there's a little gazebo overlooking a small lake that has a trail around it. The hotel provides all the pool towels you need. There is a bar and restaurant at the pool, which serves good drinks and decent food at fairly reasonable prices. There was a third pool in another location that we never visited. The hotel is in a great location, right next to Sea World and a short drive from Disney. It offers a free shuttle to Sea World and one for $10 each way to Disney (parking at Disney is $10 so I'm not sure of the advantage there). Service was good. The concierge tried to talk us into going to a presentation for Hilton Grand Vacations in exchange for discounted Disney tickets or cash. We declined and there was absolutely no pressure. We loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. We found the accomodations to be quite luxurious at the $85/night rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “From West Coast to East Coast Awsome Stay”
Reviews.Author: TomDodsworth
Reviews.Content: We booked a three bedroom unit through RCI timeshare. Myself my wife and 4 kids aged 8 - 14. Our unit had three bathrooms, full kitchen with washer and dryer. Two screened balconies, 4 TVs. One of the bedrooms had a small kitchenett. The resort was beautiful and the staff was very helpfull. Shopping for groceries was 10 minutes away. Publix was a nice store which was close. Walmart was further away and much buisier. Everything was easy to drive to, including all of the parks. The highways are well signed. We were there for eight days which was not long enough. We did not get a chance to just hang out at the resort pool which was fantastic. We usually came home from our activities and had a late night swim. We ate in the restaurant for lunch on the day we arrived. The burgers were huge. One will feed two kids. Can't say enough about the Resort and the Orlando Resort Area. It was Awsome and we would go back soon if we didn't live on the West Coast of Canada. I was apprehensive about our accommodations before we arrived but was thrilled once we walked through the door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Judy1949
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the HGVC at Sea World. The first time we had a two bedroom unit, this time it was only two of us so we had the queen studio unit. The resort is top notch. Our studio room had a small sofa and queen size bed as well as very small efficiency kitchen. We had a balcony, unfortunately this time we did not have a view of the Sea World fireworks. The resort is very clean and the staff is friendly. The pools are wonderful, however, we were in Paget House this time and had a very long walk to the main pool area. There is a smaller pool closer to our building, but we wanted to be at the main pool with the music and activities. There is also a restaurant and bar at the main pool as well as a Pizza Hut in the convenience store which is also at the main pool area. We found a very good price on the studio unit on the Hilton web site. I found it to be the same price as some standard hotel rooms which did not offer all that this resort has to offer. I would definitely return to the HGVC. It is very beautiful with its pastel colors, turrets, and beautiful landscaping. This is probably one of the nicest resorts we have stayed at in Orlando and we have stayed at many including Vistanta, Vistana Village, Westgate, Cypress Harbour, and Floridays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: A&M2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the first week of August and we had a fantastic time! There were 8 of us, 2 seniors, couple in their 40's, couple in their twenties and teenagers 14 and 16 - So as you can imagine we were trying to cater for lots of different tastes but we had no problems at all. The resort was lovely, we stayed in 2 - 2 bed suites which were very spacious and clean. They changed the bed linen and towels every day. A fully equipped kitchen with cutlery and a big fridge which made ice automatically which was a bonus in the heat! There were 2 big swimming pools whirpools and a heated pool. Perfect for the weather we had! The only thing we would say is if you go to the pool between 2-3pm sometimes there are no towels left and it took them over half an hour to bring more out! But in general the hotel was excellent. Very big and spacious to walk around and well landscaped. You can buy park tickets through the conceirge which was v. convenient. We were quite nervous about the hol in terms of hiring a car but we bit the bullet and and hired a 8 seater van! We were very pleasantly surprised... it was really easy to drive out there, the roads are wider than the Uk and there are no roundabouts... just traffic lights, we adapted really well. It was very convenient to have a car as we could go shopping and to all the parks really easily! The high point has to be.....Shamu at Sea World!!! We won't forget that in a hurry.... such a great show... we went to see it 3 times!! All the parks were excellent, we bought the 4 park flex ticket . universal and islands are more for teenagers and adults - wet n wild and seaworld more for the family... and disney magic kingdom fun for all!! All in all a fantastic holiday - we were very sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: paulc2521
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8 jul to 22 jul and frankly did not want to leave.This was our 7th holiday to Florida and this was the best accomodation we have stayed at by far. If you are looking for claenliness (no 1 priority for wife) , comfortable and spacious rooms then look no further. You could stay on this site and not have to leave it for anything - rooms are fully equiped - laundry facillity too- pizza hut express on site which was delicious a deli/conveniance store which has almost everything you would need and we found the poolside bar excellent too- $3 for bud - paid $6 last year in clearwater We had no children with us however we have never come across a hotel with so many different activities for children of all ages that last through out the day and evening - even supervised trips of site to cinema etc! They even leave a voicemail on your room phone daily to let you know whats happening each day Love seaworld? - this hotel is on your right if you come I-4 eastbound jct 71 central florida parkway and opposite on your left is seaworld, you can sit by the pool and watch the fireworks and WALK to the gate in less than 10 mins - enjoy the free bud a little more knowing you dont have to drive!! How much did we like it? after experiancing lots of hotels in europe usa and uk we have bought into the timeshare programme in thr hgvc on international drive.We now know we will not have to worry about hotel rooms any more!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bronzeindian
Reviews.Content: This vacation club was wonderful!!!!! Anyone who didn't enjoy their stay here must be very picky!!!!! The staff was great, anytime we needed any extras, they we right there. All of the pools were great, and the walkking distance to the pools isnt that much of a big deal. We stayed in a 2 bdrm suite. It was enough room for eight people!!!! The master bdrm had a king size bed w/a jacuzzi tv w/dvd player,bathroom and balcony. The 2nd bdrm had a queen size bed, kitchen, full size bathroom, tv & dvd player, a queen size pull out sofa and balcony. And the living room had the queen size pull out sofa, balcony, and all the full kitchen amenities, you couldn't ask for anymore!!! We shopped at a local 24hr Wal-Mart which was very close by to stock up on things to eat. The deli @ the vacation club was a little overpriced so shop out if you can. We didn't do a timeshare presentation nor were we asked or hassled to do one while we were there, however since this place was so wonderful, I would have considered signing up for one. We really loved this place and we would absoluetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: karenGraniteBay_Ca
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weeks stay here. It was really wonderful. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite (there were 6 of us, 4 adults and 2 kids). It worked out well having the 2 bedrooms and baths and the kids slept on the 2 hideabeds. The hilton is beautiful. The pools were wonderful, just like the pictures. There was plenty of places to sit or layout around the pool and plenty of towels that were provided by the hilton. The rooms were clean and we loved having the kitchen and laundry. The dryer was not very efficient, it took about 3 times to dry and load. Sometimes we would just take stuff out and hang it to dry. The kitchen has the basic necessities. The coffee they provide for the coffee maker is really weak and tasteless. Buy coffee in the gift shop or bring your own. The hilton at sea world was in a perfect location for us. It is only about 3/4 mile from highway 4 that you use to get to disneyworld. It only took us around 10-15 minutes to get wherever we wanted to go. I do think you need a car to stay at this resort. There are no restaurants nearby and the grocery store is around 4-5 miles away. The first night we arrived we drove the publix grocery store and stocked up on groceries. We fixed breakfast in the room and then packed up sandwiches, and snacks for day trips. We took an insulated backpack with us to disneyworld and put our sandwiches and some extra drinks in the pack and then stored them in a locker there. We would get to the park when it opened, ride the most popular rides and then take a lunch break and head to the locker. In this way we saved a ton of money and didn't waste time standing in line to buy lunch. Bring a water bottle that you can refill at the park. We would buy some treats at the park later in the day. Disney tells you that you can't bring in food from outside of the park but they only inspect it (like they do all bags) and let you take it in. We ate dinner out each night, which was nice. Try Bahama Breeze it's wonderful (call ahead and put your name on the list so you don't have to wait long). The only complaint I had about this resort is the elevators! They only have 1 elevator per building and there around 500 rooms per building. You end up waiting a lot, since it is incredibly slow and there is no air conditioning in it. If you decide to stay here, I would request a room on the upper floors (inspite of the elevator). We stayed on the 5th floor towards the end or the building and it was very quiet. Make sure your room is not near the elevator since people come back sometimes late in the evening and they can be noisey. Staying on a upper floor also eliminates noise from the parking area. Also make sure that your room is in a building that is relatively close to the pool. It looks like some of the buildings are pretty far away and you will spend a lot of time walking to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation for Family!”
Reviews.Author: lala4646
Reviews.Content: We had a Fabulous vacation at the HGVC Sea World! We had a 2 Bedroom Suite. The master bedroom had a Full Jacuzzi, King Size Bed, and TV, then in addtion to that it had a bathroom attached with a shower. The second bedroom had a Queen size bed with a bathroom, TV and seperate Balcony, and kitchen. The seperate family room had a Full Kitchen, Pull out Queen Sofa Bed, and TV. We had a family of six and we had more than enough room. Anytime you asked for extra linen, detergent they were quick to respond. We did not require housekeeping service, that was not important to me since my family cleans up after themselves. The pools and outdoor hot tubs were great. What a great family resort. The staff were great and were able to store our luggage until checkin. Beautiful Resort in a Fabulous Location at the South End of International Drive, not even 5 minutes from Sea World. Just a word of caution the resort doesn't tell you about. Make sure that if you take a taxi, it has a meter, otherwise they can and will rip you off. The resort doesn't give you this information unless you ask. Everyone needs to be familiar with the "I Ride". It provides transportation from the South End of International Drive all the way up to the North End of International Drive. All for only $1.00 per person (Children 12 and under are free), you can purchase 1 day, 3 day, 5 day and 7 day passes and ride as much as you want for one price. Trust me it is worth it to do the research, especially on hot days (it has AC). There is a website that gives you all of the information, just look up "I Ride Orlando Florida" Also be careful who you get to transport you from the Airport to the Hotel, one of the Shuttle companies charged us $190.00 roundtrip (What a ripoff) You can get a taxi for about $40-$50.00 one way. Don't let anyone tell you different. And once you get to the Hotel you can use the "I Ride". Hope this info helps. Would definitely stay at this Resort Again!

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice and pleasant except for the sand fleas”
Reviews.Author: roderules
Reviews.Content: I lucked out and wound up staying here for 4 days while attending a conference at the Orange County Convention Center. I was give a 1 bedroom villa with separate bedroom with a jacuzzi tub, full kitchen, living/dining area and washer and dryer. The place was spotless and kept clean daily but(dropping shoe for effect!) there was a problem with flea infestation in the unit I was in. I'm not sure where the little beasts were hiding but each morning I woke up with more itchy bites that I had the evening before. Not a pleasant way to greet the day. The beds could be firmer also, a bit too spongy for my taste. I didn't get too much of a chance to explore the porperty, but the pool areas were nice. The poolside restaurant offered breakfast that was just average. I suppose with so many kitchens in units, many poeple don't avail themselves of this. In any case it could use some more variety. From my unit you could see the fireworks nightly at SeaWorld; a extra treat. I'd stay here again, especially if the company is paying, but I'd apply some insect repellant!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one-bedroom suite for 5 nights when my wife attends a conference. We enjoyed our stay very much. Seaworld is closeby (free shuttle or a 15-minute walk), so I and my 4-year-old daughter spent two days there. If you want to stay there, make sure you have a car to go around.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was in Bermuda!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to Bermuda a few times and loved it. So as we drove through the gate and looked around, the grounds and buildings made us feel like we were in Bermuda, not Florida. Beautiful. We stayed here April school vacation - 3 adults, 2 children - in a 2 bedroom lock-out in the Somerset bldg on the 6th floor. We loved it! Every night we were home, we watched the SeaWorld fireworks from out beautiful screened balcony. The kids loved the pools and we adults loved the convenience to shopping, parks, International Dr, etc. You do need a car if you want to venture off the hotel grounds, but it is a short drive to everything. We were always able to find lounge chairs at the pool for all of us, although the kids rarely came out of the pool(s) while we were there. Bedrooms were spacious, everything was clean, the view was nice (SeaWorld to the left, pond with fountain to the right). The only complaint I have is that the elevator in our building was the slowest elevator I have ever ridden in. Great fun for the kids though...they raced the adults in the elevator by taking the stairs, and the kids won every time! Plenty of activities for kids at the pool, every day, all day. We are already making plans to return next April vacation we loved it so much. Good value, beautiful surroundings, bright and spacious rooms, friendly staff, convenience to everything...what more can you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Safe, Relaxing and Multi-Oriented - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can you say? Hilton is Hiton right? .... WRONG! This is a Hilton Resort of a different sort....one of a few in the world. Grand Vacations Sea World is one of those rare places where you can make our stay what you want it to be as opposed to "Ho Hum, Led like Cattle" hotel scene. We decided to stay over for Mother's Day weekend. Booking a two bedroom suite for the Mrs., myself and the two teenage daughters. The unit was very spacious with a kitchen, family room, 2 bedrooms and seperate baths. Each room had a seperate screened balcony that afforded a million dollar view. The master bedroom contained a private (and VERY romantic) Jaccuzi tub...dont forget your bubbles and candles! :-) The family room sported a wide screen TV, and the others had 32 inch CRT units, each with a DVD player... the girls room had its own microwave and sink...how appropriate. We found that one can rent DVDs in the on site store at the Bermuda Clubhouse. This store has ample supplies and even a Pizza Hut so you don't have to leave the premises after a hard day of playing " theme park warrior". The accomodations are truly CLEAN which is important to us modern Germ Freaks! in fact close inspection with a portable black light revealed on of the cleanest, dust free, organism free sites we have ever tested! (Yeah, I know its extreme...but thats us!) As a previous poster mentioned, you can walk to Sea World, and International Drive is just a stones throw. There are many wonderful places to eat there. We highly reccomend Ming Garden for the Oriental cuisine. Ming met our standards in all aspects and is one culinary destination that will be revisted by this clan. I must say that we are picky about where we stay and what we eat, and I could find no fault with HGVC. The staff was wonderful too. The only issue I had was trying the express check out (just to see if it worked)...... it did not. However, Mr. Vince Bourque, the Guest Ops Manager was right there on the spot asking what he could do for anyone. He quickly had us on our way to Mothers Day Brunch with no worries. (kept me out of big trouble... thanks Vince!) Hilton Grand Vacations can be anything you want it to be... family time... time for you.. time with the spouse....reflection, relaxation. It has all of the necessary core elements to support whichever one you want at the moment. Thanks to Hilton... we will be back very soon. :-) Brian The Hunter Clan

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfy beds; noisy workers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the pool area is very nice. But that's about the only good thing about this hotel! We stayed in a single room with what was supposed to be a Queen sized bed. It was NOT a full, and our feet were actually hanging off the bed (neither of us is a large person, either). The so-called Queen and the pillows were as hard as rocks, and the blankets actually had holes in them where they had been worn through. The other annoying thing about this hotel was the noise. We were in a room next to the "Trash" room (the room where housekeeping stashes their cart), and every morning at 7 AM we were awakened by several LOUD housekeepers yelling at each other in Spanish. It was so loud, I actually opened my door to see what all the commotion was about, and I noticed that several other perturbed guests were doing the same. Since I figured complaining to the front desk would have only made it worse the next day, we decided just to cover our ears with our rock-hard pillows. The 2nd to last day, we were awakened (again at 7 AM) by a maintenance guy using a leaf blower on the hallway outside our room. If you have ever used a leaf blower, you know that they are LOUD! Since we were leaving the next day, we found no use in complaining. All in all, this was NOT a good experience. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone unless you are hard of hearing or noise and hard beds don't bother you!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: Seabird55
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Hilton from April 20 to 27 and overall had a great time. It was our first trip to Orlando with a young family i.e. 2 adults and two kids aged 1 and 4. We arrived on an early flight and knew we would likely have to wait for our room to be ready at the 4pm check in time. While we waited we changed into our swim suits and enjoyed the pool and had a bite to eat at the poolside pub. We were offered earlier check in at 3pm but it was in Building 8, quite a distance from the main pools, so we opted to wait and ended up in Building 3 which was very convenient. The first two days we were there were very busy, which didn't bother us, but our last 5 days the resort was only 1/2 full which made it that much nicer. A list of the pros/cons as follows Pros - Great Room - 1 bedroom suite with king size bed, double pull out in living area, jacuzzi tub, dining room table, full kitchen, washer/dryer - having 2 small kids having the kitchen was perfect. We bought our supplies at the Publix supermarket and ate quite a few meals in our apt. Family atmosphere - lots of families with small kids which was great for our 4 yr old to play with other kids in the pool and in hindsight we are glad we did not rent a house. They had activities throughout the day but we did take advantage of many. One night they showed a movie out by the pool on a big screen which was kinda fun. Location - I liked the location of the resort as it was within walking distance of Seaworld. To get to any restaurants and shopping you did need to use transit (which we did and made out fine) but for 4 days we rented a van which was that much better. If we went again I would rent a vehicle for the whole time. Disney was about a 15 min drive and easy to find. Parking - free parking and lots of it Cons - Eating - it would have been nice to have another choice of restaurant at the resort. We ate at the pub on the first day when we arrived and the food was just average. Put a good restaurant on site and it would be a gold mine as there are no places to eat within walking distance of the resort other than the one pub. Service - just average. We had to chase down a housekeeper to clean our room, but overall not bad enough for us not to go again. The Conceirge wasn't the best. We asked a different staff for suggestions on where to eat, but there recommendations were limited ie. the one girl suggested the Outback as a "nice" place to go which I'm sure is fine but we can go there anytime. We went to a place called Salt Island which I would recommend and also Olive Garden (chain) which had good service and the food was also good. I have no problem recommending this resort and if we were to go to Orlando again, I probably would stay there again. The rooms with kitchen made our stay very easy with kids and enjoyable. Please note this was our first stay in Orlando so we do not have anything else to compare it to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatoin”
Reviews.Author: dblosole
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at HGVC Sea World Orlando at the end of April. We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. Everyone was friendly, and the location was great. It was within walking distance to Sea World and short driving distance to other major attractions. Disney, Universal, Inernational Drive. We had a one bedroom suite with large jacuzzi tub, full kitchen, living room, two T.V's, washer/dryer, vacuum, iron and ironing board, large bathroom with shower and double sinks and a screened in porch with table and chairs. Room was very well maintainted and the decor was typical Florida. Although we were in a building that was the furthest away from the main building, we were a short walk to the adults only pool which was very nice and relaxing. It also had two larger jacuzzi's. There are two other pools by the restaurant and lobby, as well as a small lake. We ate lunch at the restaurant on property one day. Having the kitchen we were able to have breakfast before leaving on our adventures for the day. We had pizza hut delivery one evening from the on site restaurant. Housekeeping service is only once every few days, however they provide you with enough extra's if needed (sheets, blankets, towels). Read up on some information about Discovery Cove while there which is just down the street from HGVC. It is operated by Sea World/Bush Gardens. It sounds very nice for a full day adventure that includes swimming with the dolphins, lunch and a 7 day pass for Sea World and Bush Gardens. The concierge at HGVC advised that it is booked up in advance as much as 5 months, and quoted approximately $300.00 per person. If interested read up about it and book prior to your trip. I would recommend this property to others and would definetely stay here again. It's location was very convenient to major highways and airport with limited traffic. They do have some shuttles, but because we had a car I'm not too familiar with what properties they go to and the time schedules.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but noisy”
Reviews.Author: KR2008
Reviews.Content: Firstly the positives... hotel is in an excellent location. Right next to Seaworld and Discovery Cove, and Disney is only 15-20mins drive away, and Universal 10-15mins. The room had a queen bed and was spacious and comfortable. Having a fridge was also a plus point. I also liked the fact that it had an adult pool, free of kids. There's also a deli on site. It's a big site so didn't really see many of the staff, but our room was always clean and the staff we did see where always helpful. The negatives... we were in Smith building, which was next to the main road and it was possible to hear the traffic noise. Also, on the first night we could hear the bed in the room up above sqieaking (they stopped when we knocked on the ceiling though), and also on our last night we got woken up by the people in the room next door. There's a connecting door for when there are families staying next to each other, but it carries sound. We had to sleep with our earplugs in. Couldn't be bothered to ask to move as it meant packing and unpacking again. We also got a call re: timeshares, but like the other reviews, they didn't bother us after the first call. I wanted Comfort Inn, International Drive, due to the strength of the reviews on this site and is a bit cheaper but was booked for the dates I wanted, so I'd probably give that a go next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 3 stars - Poor Service and Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: jennybeanie
Reviews.Content: Upon late check-in at 12:00 a.m. we asked if we could get late check out when we leave. The woman helping us said "I can do better than that, I can upgrade you from your 1 bedroom to 2 bedroom for no extra charge. That way your son & daughter can have their own room and beds." Of course we were very gracious and thankful for the upgrade. My son who is 14 also thanked her as he was happy that he wouldn't be sleeping on the sofa bed now. She accepted our thanks and then directed us to our room. We had requested to be near the pools, instead we were two buildings away, a nice healthy walk to the pools. When we got to our room we were surprised to see it was only the one bedroom we had booked. There was a door that was locked and attached to our living room that was the second bedroom so we called the woman who checked us in and asked her if they wer going to be opening the second bedroom and she said that we only booked a one-bedroom. I said, I know that but you offered us a second bedroom as an upgrade and as you stated "for not additional charge." She denied ever offering that like we had made the whole the thing up and it was only 10 minutes after our conversation. I said to her that if she made a mistake she and offered something that wasn't available she should just admit it rather than treat us like we are crazy and didn't have the conversation. The next day we were contacted and asked if everything was okay when we explained the above situation we were told our complaints would be forwarded and were we intersted in a time share presentation. We never received an apology for the above situation. The carpeting, upholstery and bed spreads seemed dirty and unsanitary. One day no one showed up to clean when we got in at 10 pm. and inquired they sent someone from housekeeping with towels when I asked if she was going to clean she said "You clean tonight we clean tomorrow." Then she acted like she couldn't understand me when I said you mean, you aren't going to clean tonight? She just kept repeating herself - You clean tonight - we clean tomorrow. No apology - just you clean tonight we clean tomorrow. Last but not least, the water smelled disgusting. This could be a Florida thing, but it smelled like sewage when your ran the bath, took a shower or brushed your teeth. My 2 year old drank some water when brushing her teeth, tasted it spit it out and started to gag. It was really gross but maybe I am just used to Chicago non-smelling water. The pool area was awesome and it was definitely kid friendly. They only heated one of the two pools so it was quite crowded in the one pool in the evening. It is unlikely that we would return to this resort though.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but the elevator...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great ammenities, pools, and recreation. It is really a bustling resort and while you won't get the place to yourself everyone is friendly. Rooms are spacious and the suites were great for our small family. Sea world is across the street. Cons: We're given a different, more expensive, price than what we had booked on [-------]. The rooms are loud due to tile floors and the six story hotel towers are served by out of date slow elevators. They seem to put the hotel guests up high and leave the time share folks within stair distance. Overall: They are one notch away from being a top quality place. It is a family place but the front desk staff was offish, at best. I will stay there again but make sure I firm up the rate (48 dollar price difference per night). They need to use their golf carts, which were everywhere, to ferry guests to Sea World (there is a fee and a shoddy van service) so we don't have to pay the 10 bucks to go 1/4 mile. That said, there is no reason to leave this place. It has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on international drive!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for families. The pools are lovely and the accomodations are spacious. (However, we visited the grand vacation club on international drive and felt it was much nicer. It had more family conveniiences close by.) Our two bedroom villa was close to the highway so next time I would request a room closer to the main lobby and pool. I would stay at their other location though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night, prior to catching our flight home but can really recommend it. We stayed in a one bedroomed room and it was very well maintained and furnished. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and couldnt do enough for us. The pool area was lovely and also the deli was very handy to stock our room. Would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “going again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel style get away kids loved it and that made us happy. Pools are fab so much to do on site the movie theatre was a big plus and staff were Great. So we going again. Rooms were lovely and everything we needed from Fridge to microwave. A nice place to go with kids or not, old or young you will really feel relaxed. Thanks Hilton A1

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good, I would recommend. Mr Hilton your door staff and front desk were not the best though. Would not hesitate in staying again though.

Reviews.Title: “What a Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: cresil
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hilton Grand Vacation Club, we had a timeshare exchange and booked 2 bedroom suites through RCI & it was a great help. Our room was very spacious we even even have our very own Jacuzzi in the master's bedroom! We stayed at a 2 bedroom family room with a laudromat , a a living room that even has a sofa bed & a spacious complete kitchen. The pools are great since they are all heated pools. Shuttle going to Sea World & Universal Studios are FREE! but the you have to pay $7/person for the roundtrip shuttle going to Disney World. Its a one of a kind experience the you should not miss when you are in Orlando! People at the hotel are very accommodating the place is really great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for large families.”
Reviews.Author: minnieandmickey55555
Reviews.Content: We were there from 3/9-3/12 and rented our own car at the airport. Took a while to find the hotel. We went to the one on international drive by mistake and the security there gave us the exact directions right away. The hotel is very spacious and clean. We had a one bedroom for 2 adults & 3 children (1, 5 and 7). It was more than enough room for us. The washer and dryer was very convenient. The kitchen was awsome. We cooked there one night. The hotel is very close to WDW and other amenities. The hotel offers daily activities which includes movie nights, karaoke, pool side bingo etc.. They will give you the weekly activity schedule when you check in. Overall, this hotel is great (especially for large families). Will definite go back. By the way, we booked it thru Hilton's direct website and got a great deal! Try there first.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest resort in Orlando for teenagers!”
Reviews.Author: AmishLou
Reviews.Content: This place is just awesome! There is so much to do that you could have an fun-filled, relaxing week never leaving the resort! We stayed for two nights and next year will book a whole week there. There is SO much to do...all day long there are fun activities to get the whole family involved. This is not a property I would recommend for families with young children -- it is definitely geared towards older kids. Karaoke, bingo, "dive-in movies" by the pool, shuffleboard, ping pong, pool volleyball tournaments, etc. etc. etc. Our kids had the time of their lives in a fun and safe environment. Next year we will only buy a day or two's worth of attraction tickets and spend the rest of our week hanging out at this HGVC resort. The best of the best! Only downside is that we didn't have high speed internet access in the rooms, but that will probably happen before long. Also, I would make sure you get a place near the pool so you don't have a long walk from your condo to the pool. An awesome place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best family place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: PCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HGVC at Sea World 2/17-2/24. Went with four adults and four kids (ages 15, 15, 14 and 12). This resort remains the best family resort in Orlando. Tons of stuff to do (even for teens). Our kids played basketball, tennis, shuffleboard, pingpong, billiards, swam, participated in afternoon activities and went to the free movie theatre. Resort is safe and we never had a worry about the kids walking around by themselves. Best new thing -- the Pizza Hut Express in the little store. Condos are exceptional -- spotless and wonderfully decorated. Had a three bedroom condo that was spacious and comfy enough for all of us. Publix grocery store and Walgreens drug store are about a mile away. Nice quiet location, yet close to all the insanity on International Drive. We have stayed here a total of five times and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: munci98
Reviews.Content: Many months later we still can't believe we stayed at such a wonderful resort. The room was amazing. So much room. The tub, awesome. I think four baths a day were had in my family!! We had some issues at check in (late at night, computers were down). The restaurant is HORRIBLE. Do not eat there. So not worth the money. Delivery is half the price and much much better. We were not bothered to go see other properties. One two second phone call with a polite no was all. Everything about the room was wonderful. The layout, the screened in porch. Everything. Next time I'd definitely get a room closer to the action/pool/main building. Even so, the pools were wonderful, the amenties fantastic. Location perfect. Excellent place for the a decent Orlando price. Highly recommended (and we're picky).

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend. Very convenient to Sea World and Discovery Cove. Rooms were nice--nothing special. One night we found a silverfish on our blanket. Checking out, we saw a pest control vehicle in the front drive. Pool and facilities were pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MG2006
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th trip to Orlando but the first with a lot of people (7 in total including parents and parents in law) so I decide to stay in a resort, I had the experiences 2 times before in other ones but with less people. My vision of a trip to Orlando is to been all day long in the Theme Parks and making some shopping, no to staying in the swimming pool a lot, so this is my opinion for my 15 days stay PROS 1) Excellent Location: 2 minutes from Sea World, and 15 minutes to Magic and Universal Parks 2) Rooms are big and clean. 3) Guest Services excellent, especially from the girl who is the manager and another girl from Bahamas (sorry I don't remember the names) 4) I went 1 day to the pool and was just comfortable 5) The hotel offers lots of activities, they leave a message the day before, I didn't use it but it seems a good option for people who like it. 6) There is a Publix and a Walgreens 10 minutes from the hotel (in front of Premium Outlet) 7) I drive all the days but they have shuttles, my father and mother in law used it one day and they have no complaints 8) Also the I ride trolley has a stop in front of the hotel. BADS 1) As some other people wrote, the day that you are going to left they began knocking the door and calling 1 hour before the hour. I understand that there are a lot of rooms and they need to clean it but calling before the hour is not good The hotel is excellent and if it wasn’t for what I just mentioned they will have the best evaluation. No doubt I'll stay in the future in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got switched into the Hilton from the Vistana resort (horrible accomodations there). We loved it here! The rooms were nice and well kept, and the staff were all very pleasant. The pools and hot tubs were great. All amenities were kept looking new. Stayed in the Pembroke building on the 4th floor in a 2 BR lockoff unit. I don't think we could have asked for a better stay. We definatly plan on returning. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ccb9801
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hilton Grand Vacations Club Sea World was very good! I was glad to read that the majority of the recent reviewers rated it above average before I booked it. As we are HGVC members, we truly could not go wrong with the price, so we decided to give it a try. The staff is very helpful, the location to Disney World is very convenient, and the pools are very nice as well. There were lots of things to do for people of all ages, but, we only took advantage of the pool, since it was my traveling companion's first trip to Disney. The studio we stayed in could accommodate four, however, 2-3 is probably more realistic. The only slight downsides were the room could have been a bit cleaner and a rental car is probably advisable for families doing the Disney thing, as the shuttle is costly and only runs a couple of times a day.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat from all that is Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: johnstoj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HGVC Seaworld international Centre from Dec 24 to 31, 2005. We arrived quite late in the evening, which we had warned them about, to a seamless check-in. When we got to our 2 bedroom suite we were hungry and tired. We deposited our belongings and promptly tripped a breaker! A call to the front desk had a repairman at our door within 10 min who cheerfully reset the breaker and went to get us a new light bulb. Not bad for late on Christmas Eve. He was even able to direct us to a local grocery store that was open so we could get fixings for a quick dinner. The next mornimg we had to figure out how to activate some Disney park passes we had and the reception desk was very helpful, directing us to the correct kiosk at the park gates. We didn't have much more need of help from the staff after that but everyone was very friendly with cheery hellos, Merry Christmas's etc. The grounds are beautiful with a very nice fitness/walking path around the lake. The pools look very nice. My husband and son went for a dip one afternoon but said it was a bit too cool for lounging in. After hectic days visiting the Disney and Universal parks it was nice to come back to a lovely retreat to recharge our batteries for another day of fun and adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: safa_in_England
Reviews.Content: We booked two joining rooms during the December 2005 Christmas holidays. Great rooms, and very nice facilities. Location is also convenient. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with small children”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very happy with HGV @ Sea World. Stayed in a two-BR suite 12/18-12/20 for about $200/nt. Hotel supplied bed rails for my 3-year old, crib and high-chair for my 18mo old. We slept in MBR with great jacuzzi bath. Room was tastefully appointed, clean, spacious. Grounds were well maintained. Did not use pool or other amenities. Staff was friendly, helpful, got us early check in so that kids could nap. Restaurant was OK-- I would think better for poolside grill type food than considered for a nice dinner. For dinner, there are plenty of options down the road. I'd post a picture, but the room we stayed in looked EXACTLY like the picture on the Hilton website.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Blaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Grand from November 13th to the 20th. We arrived at the hotel at 11:00am and were very pleased that we could check into our room right away. Our group consisted of 4 adults and 2 children ages 12 and 9. We rented a 2 bedroom unit and were given the ground floor of building 7000. All buildings do have elevator access. You enter the unit from the kitchen in an open concept idea that then leads you to the dining area and then living room area which has a large flat screen tv, dvd player and pull out couch. To the left was the queen size bed and pull out couch (new mattress on pull out couch) bedroom. This bedroom also had a tv and dvd player. It also had a small kitchen area with a fridge, sink, cupboards...the bathroom was a shower/bath combo. The water took a while to warm up but in reality it really did not matter. We also had patio doors that led to an outdoor porch. To the right of the kitchen was the master bedroom again with tv and dvd player. This bedroom had a king size bed with a 2 person jacuzzi tub and make up area. The shower area which was seperate from the jacuzzi area had a nice large stand up shower and 2 sink area. This bedroom also had patio doors leading to an outdoor porch area. The unit came with a washer, dryer, dishwasher, ice making machine in the fridge, iron, ironing board. There was also a free safe in the master bedroom closet which you entered your own code. There are three closets in the whole unit and dressers in both bedrooms. We found more or bigger drawers in the dressers would of been better for all the clothing we had. They did supply extra linens, pillows, travelling size shampoo, conditioner, soaps, dishsoap, tide, papertowels, toilet paper, garbage bags and sml coffee pouches. The chambermaids did come to our unit once to replenish and clean. There is a tennis court and basketball court (which unfortunately is not lit at night). By unit 7000 and 8000 you will find the adults only pool that has a hot tub, bathroom/changeroom and towel area. The other pools (2) are near the front desk area. They are heated and you will find many toddler pools and hot tubs which are also heated. Towels are also supplied here (as many as you want all day). In this area you will also find the outdoor restaurant (good food), shuffleboard, play area for children that has a rubber flooring, childrens sand playing area with sand toys, hair braiding ($), tattoos ($), pool table, ping pong tables (balls are .25$ each), a little variety hut/store (suntan lotion, sunglasses...), they also rent air mattress's for the pool at $5.00 an hr. Upstairs there is a souvenir/deli/grocery shop. During our stay we did see a croc or alligator in their pond area. The kids just loved this!!! The children did do some activities in the kids club and enjoyed them. They do different activities by the pool everyday. One of our favorites was the ice cream sundays at $3.00 each. This resort is near the major attractions and international drive which is very convenient. On our last day we were able to check out later then the scheduled check out of 10am. We flew Southwest which was very pleasant. The only downfall of Southwest was that we were always category "B" to fly being that people who went on the internet received all the "A" boarding. On this flight they served peanuts, trail mix, juices, tea or coffee, pop and mixed drinks (at an additional cost). Remember your luggage cannot exceed 50pds each. This is really reenforced. Very nice trip, very clean, very courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cheleNJ
Reviews.Content: We went for the NJ teacher convention break. It was an absolutely beautiful place! We had an adjoining one bedroom and studio - so two bed two bath with two pull out couches. full kitchen. Maid service everyday (they were excellent). The rooms were well sized - we had four kids (three 13 year olds and a ten year old) and 2 moms. The pools were big, warm and gorgeous, one has a huge waterfall that the kids loved playing under and another had a huge fountain in the middle. Two hot tubs and tons of stuff for the kids to do at the pool if they wanted to. They even have a movie theater and show dvds. The front desk was excellent as our plane was delayed three hours. The gym was adequate. They have 24 hour security who will give you a ride in their golf carts. The only small issue was the food. there is only one restaurant with good enough but not great food for dinner and lunch (the kids had breakfast once there and it was not very good). because it is at the pool all drinks, including wine are served in plastic cups. after a long day out, we found ourselves wanting to stay in. we had a car but no one felt like driving any where and the hotel is not within walking distance of any other restaurant. But this was not enough of a reason not to stay here. They have a provisions store which has starbucks,wine, sandwiches, snacks and everything you could have forgotten - this was excellent! I have been to Orlando at least 8 times and this was THE BEST place i have stayed (I don't stay at the parks). The price was extremely reasonable. No one tried to sell us anything and we were treated excellently. We spent most of our time at Universal but it was an easy, no traffic, ride up a side road to the park from this hotel (although coming out of Universal we couldn't always find the short cut back because of the way the parking deck sends you). To stay in this hotel you need a car and it is not exactly next to the restaurants on International Drive. I used the reviews on this site to pick this hotel and it was better than i expected.(I spent hours pouring over the reviews and all the travel sites) I give it an excellent because it is better than a 4. It may not be a full 5 becasue of the food, but with a little better planning for dinner the food would not have been an issue. This is a great place i'd say a 4.5++. This is the place to stay if you like to stay outside the parks. I will absolutely stay here next time. Glad I don't have to do any more research.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Highly Recommended by 3rd Time Guest”
Reviews.Author: jenaye
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the HGVC at Sea World. This is the 3rd time I've been a guest at this resort in the past 6 years. This was my first time with my son (3 yrs) We were in a 3 bedroom unit as timeshare guests trading out through RCI. Our room was in the Sandy building. I was unsure of the layout of the 3 bedroom prior to our arrival because the resort doesn't feature room layouts on their website and on our previous stays we had been in a 2 bedroom unit. I was very pleased to find that it was not a 2 bedroom unit with a 1 bedroom lock off. It was a fully contained 3 bedroom unit with 3 baths. 2 master bedrooms, one with a king, one with a queen and the 3rd had 2 double beds and a full hall bath. The unit was in great shape. Very clean. I wasn't present at check-in but I didn't hear any complaints and the unit was ready a half-hour early. Very comfortable... 2 small sofas and 2 chairs. Large dining table that could seat 8. The previous 2 bedrooms units had a big screen tv, this one had just a tube tv, but I don't consider that an inconvenience. We didn't ask for a mid-week cleaning but we were offered clean towels, toilet paper, paper towels and such by the staff mid-week. The grounds are perfect, there was always someone working on the landscaping, they scrubbed the hallway floors, scrubbed the hall railings and removed and cleaned all the exterior lights in our building during the week we were there. We used both childrens playgrounds. One for older kids and one tot lot with sand for the little guys. The slide was "out of order" in the tot lot, a crack in the fiberglass. We used both pools. Clean, lots of activities going on for the kids. Plenty of seating. We had lunch at the grill by the pool twice. Both meals were good. Better than your average hotel cuisine. The deli and convience store was nicely stocked and the food was good. We were in the end unit closest to the road and I was a little bit aware of the road noise. I don't recall that in our previous stays so I think it was the location of this room. I wouln't consider it a distraction. Lots of activities for children, we didn't end up taking advantage of them because of the age of our child, but for kids a little bit older I think there were a lot of options. I would consider it an excellent property with a great location. We stayed 2 days following the week at HGVC at Star Island and there was no comparison. I can't think of any negatives... the water pressure was kind of low in the shower... the dishwasher was pretty noisy so run it when you plan to be out... that's the worst I can come up with. As a repeat guest I've been happy every time, with and without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in the Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Sea World. I am perplexed with some of the negative reviews as we have nothing but praise for this hotel. My husband and I travel often for business and have stayed in all kinds of accomodation. Sure its not the Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong or the Park Hyatt Tokyo, but it is a wonderful family oriented hotel with lovely pools, good service, and wonderful rooms. My sister and her two children (6 and 7 yrs old) and my husband and I with our two children (12 and 14 years old) each had a one bedroom accomodation in the Devonshire building. The rooms were lovely - full kitchens, nice seperate bedroom for the adults, more than acceptable pull out sofa bed for the kids, large bathroom, seperate jacuzzi and screened-in balcony. It was clean and nicely decorated. The rooms had a DVD player with DVDs to rent at the grocery store which was a nice touch. The staff were friendly, always saying hello when you passed them. The pools were clean with plenty of towels. The pool side restaurant was fine, with friendly service. The grocery store also served Starbucks coffee which more than adequately addressed our daily required caffeine fix. The reception staff accomodated our request for the two rooms in the same building. Grounds staff passing in golf carts always stopped to ask if we needed a ride to our building which was a pleasant relief after walking back one evening from Sea World with tired children. I would have absolutely no hesitation to recommend this hotel to families with children looking for a Orlando theme park vacation/holiday. My 7 yr old niece summed it up when she said "best vacation she ever had".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was given the name of the Hilton Grand Vacations SeaWorld as I was attending a conference and all the other hotels were booked. I have to say that this was a great experience. It was quiet, not on a busy street with traffic and noise. It had gated security which I truly liked because I was traveling alone. The studio I stayed in was excellent. It was right next to the pool. I liked the fact that I had a screened outdoor patio attached to my room. The room was a nice size with fridge, microwave, couch, table and 2 chairs. I had a double door closet which enclosed a vacuum, broom, iron and ironing board, extra linens and even a laundry basket. Housekeeping cleaned everyday. They even cleaned the coffee pot and even though I made my bed every morning, they still replaced the sheets. This was the best get away from home and kids ever. I liked the fact that the hotel always had activities going on. They had activities for kids as well as adults. I had the luxury of taking the free Casino Cruise which was really nice. I had planned to attend the wine tasting the next night but was too exhausted from the overnight cruise. All in all I will definitely return back to this hotel. It was great. It was like having my own apartment not an enclosed smelly hotel with mildewy carpet. The floors were tile in the entry and bathroom. With as much rain as Orlando gets I thought that was very wise. I often visited places in Orlando where the mildew smell would hit you as soon as you walk in. This was great. I can't understand why it wasn't rated a 5 star. And at $98 dollars per night it was definitely a 5 star in my book! Great job Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: sfjenleigh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were forced to stay here to meet his family that we had not seen in 3 years. His sister and her husband belong to this vacation club, so they were able to get us, their parents, and their own family (3 kids 0 6, 7, and 13 years old) all separate rooms. We did not have to pay for the room, since it's part of their vacation club expenditure. We both prefer independent "mom & pop" type places, but no such thing exists in the Orlando/Theme Park metropolis anyway, and we decided to just go with the flow. The rooms were very nice over all, clean, good size. However, my sister-in-law requested a room change after the 1st night, when she realized she should have been in a better room due to her "premium" status as a vacation club member. She also had some maintenance concerns - front door would not unlock and open easily, microwave door would not shut, etc... The 1st room was a suite in which we all had our own bedrooms and bathrooms (and we even had our own kitchenentte), but she had to share a bed, bathroom, and closet with her kids (her husband was out of town for this vacation). The nice thing about this 3 bedroom suite, is we all had our own private rooms, but they adjoined to a common living room, dining room, kitchen. After the room change, she got into her own suite with her own bathroom, bedroom, closet and her kids got their own bed, bathroom, closet - both rooms adjoined to a common living area again. Then we got our own separate room on another floor and her parents got one down the hall from us. So we had more privacy and a king size bed in the new room, but we all had to take an elevator and walk to meet each other - good, if you want more privacy from the family stuff. We had daily house cleaning service, but for some reason, they skipped my sister-in-law's room most days. She had to call several times to remind them. The pools and hot tubs were really nice. However, one evening we went down there after a typical daily summer Orlando rain storm to swim, and there were no clean towels available for 2 hours. The restaurant was OK and the deli/store was decent. They serve a good breakfast platter that is big enough for 2-3 people. This hotel has complimentary shuttles to Sea World and Univeral, but to get to all the Disney stuff they charge $10 for a round-trip shuttle, which only leave 3 times a day. We had rented a car anyway, but it came in handy when we wanted to separate. In the new room, there was no darkening curtains so it was very bright in the morning and hard to sleep in past sunrise, if you're a light sleeper. There was also young kids next to us who would shout early in the morning as they all got ready to leave. After they would leave, then we got to hear the house cleaners yelling, vacuuming, and /or even ringing our doorbell (there was no "do not disturb" sign on our door). I found it difficult to sleep in and relax. While the pools were nice, they were filled with tons of kids of all ages playing, yelling, running, etc.... This is a great place for families, but not relaxing at all for couples/people without children and/or people who want it quiet. The hotel also has scheduled activities throughout the day for the kids, which they seemed to really enjoy. If you go in the summer, start your days early.
