It rains every day some time between 3-6pm for at least an hour or longer. It usually clears up again, but not always. We won't feel the need to go to a theme park for at least another 10 years, if not the rest of our lives (we're 36 & 38). Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “From Penthouse to Outhouse”
Reviews.Author: one4gatr
Reviews.Content: Wow. Where do I start? We booked our stay online on the Hilton site which we were required to prepay to get the special pricing which was non refundable. We had requested an early check in (10am). When we arrived to the hotel I was told they had no rooms available yet which I expected but I asked if they could get a room ready for me soon and they said to check back at 12pm. Well needless to say when I came back at 12pm they still didn’t have a room for me which surprised me as there was only one other person waiting for a room at that point. My daughter had a soccer clinic in Winter Park that started at 1:00pm so I gave them my number and told them to call me when the room was ready. I received my call at 2:30 that my room was ready. When I arrived back to the hotel around 5:00pm and checked in I was given the key to a room in the Sandy unit. I had requested to not be placed by the elevator and guess where my room was. We were extremely tired and hungry at that point so I wasn’t going to complain about the location and I was just happy to get a room. When we got to the room we noticed the door was propped open. Upon entering the unit I immediately noticed the refrigerator had been removed. No fridge just a hole. I was extremely pleased with the room, we booked a one bedroom. It was extremely clean, well appointed, newly painted, new tile, clean rug, etc. The layout is great and well designed. Being as we had groceries that required refrigeration I called the front desk to advise them of my situation. They told me they would have maintenance "check into it". After 30 minutes and no call back or maintenance man I called the front desk again for an update. They put me on hold to check and came back on the line to tell me they were not sure where they would get a refrigerator from. I told them to just move me to another room with a fridge. After a bit of looking they found us a room in another building I can’t remember the name but it was unit 8601. As we were preparing to move to the new room the porta crib we requested showed at the old room and we advised him of the new unit number and expected him to deliver it to the new room. When we got to the new unit boy were we shocked by the difference. This unit was well worn. Scuffed walls, missing base boards, blown light bulbs, dirty carpet, and damaged blinds. Additionally the tiles floors were horrendously dirty and had some sort of sticky syrup or beverage in various areas. The bathroom wall next to the toilet had what appeared to be feces smeared on the wall. I now see why there have been so many varying opinions on this place. As we didn’t feel like moving again we accepted the room. After another 1/2 hour passed and we still didn’t have the porta crib I called again and they finally got it to us. After dinner my wife and I had a couple of drinks before bed and we placed the partly empty bottles on the nightstand. When I was cleaning up the next morning I went to empty the remaining contents and was disgusted to find a cockroach had crawled into one of the bottles. On the Saturday night before check out the front desk called at 10:00pm (too late to call in my opinion) to ask if they met all of our expectations. I advised them that they had not and went into a brief elaboration and all they said was "oh I'm sorry". The next morning we were harassed twice to check out. The check out time is 10:00am. At 8:30am housekeeping harassed my wife drilling her on when we planned to leave to which she responded that check out was at 10am and we would be gone by then. Around 9:30am another person who appeared to be from the front desk came to the door to ask the same question and we again answered by the 10am check out time. I found it strange that for a facility as large as this one who couldn't get us checked in before noon because they had no clean rooms would harass you to leave before the posted check out time. Hilton should be ashamed to have their name associated with this place. If you decide to stay here you apparently have a 50/50 chance at getting a nice room. I should have heeded the advice of some of the other travellers and avoided this place. But having seen two totally different rooms I can see where some of the people have had good experiences also.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: A2asia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a business trip in Orlando. I must say I was very pleasantly surprised. I had a 1 bedroom suite and it was awesome! The suite had a full size kitchen (fully equipped) and was bigger than my first apartment! It was very nicely decorated and clean. The enclosed balcony was also an additional plus. I did see some of the things others complained about, like water splashing on the floor after you open the shower door. Dah, that happens with any shower door. I really think people just like to complain for the sake of complaining. Only thing I would change is that there was only one restaurant/bar onsite. Would of liked to have at least one other choice but other than that, this place was great. I'd give is 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “We ENJOYED the HGVC.. at Sea World”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four (includes two toddlers) went to FL and stayed at the HGVC at Sea World this past April. It was better than NICE! I read the previous reviews and had my doubts. I'm pleased to say we had NO problems. The front desk staff was friendly. The 1BR condo was light, clean and comfy. I'd ask for a bigger unit my next time around - but for the price it was more than sufficient. A friend owns a TS there and we got on a "friends/family" referral program. We were subjected to the 90 min tour but even that wasn't too bad. I would definetly head back to the HGVC at Sea World! It was soo close to Sea World. My kids LOVED Sea World and the resort. We plan on making Sea World an annual part of our vacation(s) from now on. Again, the resort has LOTS of amens & the grounds are BEAUTIFUL!!! We went before the FL heat and while kids were still in school. You can't ask for more than that.........

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: joannepl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a studio room at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club at Sea World Internation Center in Orlando. We had a wonderful experience! The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was everything that we hoped it would be. It was spacious and clean, and had a nice balconly. The resort itself had many pools, a decent restaurant, and plenty of planned activities. I would not hesitate to book this resort for our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more.....”
Reviews.Author: tlfinokc
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5* hotel, but it is VERY, VERY nice. Stayed 6 nights at this hotel and it was perfect for us, 2 adults, 2 kids. We had a one bedroom villa. It had a full size kitchen and washer and dryer in the condo. The table had room for six. Kids slept on the sleeper sofa. Also, the patio is enclosed so no bugs and mosquitoes!!! The pools were not too crowded and very clean. Also, the activities department can keep your kids very, very busy if you choose to enjoy the different things to do. The staff was very helpful...I will say that the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is across the street from Sea World and right in between Disney and Universal. I would highly suggest to rent a car as there are shuttles to Sea World and Universal, not Disney. Magic Kingdom is the farthest and it is only about a 15 minute drive.....

Reviews.Title: “Grand time had by all.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great, great time ! After reading some rewiews I was worried that this may not be the right choice. Boy was I wrong and very glad we came here. Keep in mind that we had the 3-bdroom suite and the weather was perfect but this in no way swayed our feelings for the look and feel for this resort. It is a must go for families with plenty to do. Don't miss the Saturday nite movie in the pool. Rooms were clean, resort well maintained and centrally located to all attractions. I found the food at the pool side grill accetptable for lunch or dinner "grill" fare. With a million places to eat in Orlando you have plenty of choices. Could spend all day pool side with many different activities to keep the kids busy. Only negative is that they are now starting construction on a new building next the the "SOMERSET" building. Although this will not effect most of the resort, it may cause problems if you are in that location. See you in November!

Reviews.Title: “Loved HGV SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaAngie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGV Club - Sea World in May 2005. We were very pleased with our stay and even the time share sales pitch. Our room was very clean and spacious - we were impressed. I can't remember what "house" we were in, but I believe it was the second from the end of the resort. The only complaint I have is the restaurant in the resort. The food was terrible and overpriced. It would have been nice to have one decent restaurant to eat at instead of going out every night. There are many grocery stores close by, so it was easy to stock up on food and eat in our room for breakfast and snacks. The location was close to the freeway and about 10 minutes from DisneyWorld, which was nice. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: yangbness
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 1 week stay in a 2BR unit in the Hamilton House of this resort. Everything went went. We were on the ground floor, closest to the main facilities. Housekeeping came 1x per week on the 3rd day as agreed upon. There was 1 timeshare sales call which we declined and were never called upon again. The A/C was good, the cooking facilities were adequate, the washer/dryer were fine, etc. The pool area was great for kids - it's not really a romantic place for adults or anything. The toddler wading pool was ideal for our 2 yr old. The outdoor restaurant was a bit slow on the service front but you could tell they were trying b/c it's obvious that many guests end up eating in/cooking or eating out offsite, but rarely repeating at the restaurant. The location is great for all the major theme parks and easy access on/off the highway, shopping, etc. Can't say anything really negative about this place - plus it was cost effective.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DALY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice but average resort. The two bedroom apartment we had was very spacious. If you go, like another previous review, ask for something closer to the lobby because that is where the nice pools and activities are. We had a 5-10 minute walk to go to the nice pools, services. Also, they DO NOT have a DVD in every room. You have to ask for it. We waited 2 days before we got one. We had great housekeeping services until the day after our friends went to the timeshare spiel and decided not to buy. After that, we had NO housekeeping services and had to call for fresh towels. We also had ill-fitting sheets on our bed. Every morning, my husband and I woke up with the fitted sheet bunched up between us. The restaurant was a disaster! We ate there the first night because we were too tired from traveling to drive anywhere. Our waitress, Lisa from Tulsa, did not know the first thing about waitressing. First, we did not get menus. After waiting for 10 minutes for menus, I got up and asked her for them. She apologized then threw some menus at me that were dripping with beer. It took her another 20 minutes to get our order. We had been there almost 45 minutes before we even had anything to drink. Our kids (there were 4 of them, including our friends' kids), all under the age of 6 were going nuts waiting for food. We noticed that another table with an even larger party that arrived after us, were taken care of much quicker. Lastly, when the bill arrived, a 16% gratuity had been automatically tacked on (because she said that even with half of us being toddlers/small children we were a party of 8). My friend was terribly put out by this and complained. So she took off the gratuity with barely an apology. That being said, we were happy with the service we received at the deli and with the childrens activities that our kids got to participate in.

Reviews.Title: “HGV Sea World Orlando”
Reviews.Author: offthewindow
Reviews.Content: No real complaints about Hilton Grand Vacations Sea World. Property is great. Location and staff also excellent. Our specific suite was on the verge of becoming a little on the worn side. Appreciated the room of the two bedroom apartment. Pools were very acceptable. What wasn't, were calls from Sales staff trying to sell us on other Hilton timeshare properties. Would check out other properties in Orlando but would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Studio-style units are really tiny”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a 4-day/3-night, $99 "special" (Please Buy The Timeshare) package and tacked it on to our already-planned Florida vacation visiting my folks. When we invited my parents over to see the hotel and check out the accomodations, my Dad could not stop goofing on the size of the room. The "kitchen" consisted of a mini-fridge, microwave, and sink. Everything else was just like a standard hotel room. Other than some blood stains on the bedding provided for the pull-out, the room was clean. The bathtub's faucet was extremely difficult to turn off fully and was the only glaring evidence that this was an "older" hotel with some miles on it. Check-in time isn't until 4pm and check-out time is 10am. We were leaving the room at 10 minutes after 10 and got a phone call "reminding" us to get out. (I don't think the fact that we didn't cave to the enormously pressured time-share sales pitch helped!) We stayed in the Warwick building where there is a pool behind it. The walk around the building was kind of a pain, but at least we were in a convenient unit! The pool was the best part of our stay. The kids actually also had a really good time in the day care facility while we were being hammered by the salesperson during our timeshare presentation. All-in-all, it was an average stay. I can definitely say that we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself, my two teenage kids and each of their friends spent part of our spring break here in March. One word can describe this resort...AWESOME. Our two bedroom condo was very nice and clean. Plenty of room for everyone. The grounds were immaculant and enjoyable. One nice feature was the I-trolly pick up at the resort, made it nice for the kids to jump on it and go up International drive and spend a few hours there while my wife and I enjoyed the sun and pool area. Will definately spend more time here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property”
Reviews.Author: travelwith5
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Grand Vacations Club is a terrific property for leisure travelers, SeaWorld visitors*, and Disney vacationers. I am always leary of these type of properties(in-laws timeshare). I usually prefer staying right on Disney property, but this one was great! The grounds were pretty, the pools were fun, and the rooms were nice, clean, and huge. We had a two bedroom unit, and it was enormous. It had two King beds, two full baths, the main unit had a huge Jacuzzi, a big living area, large dining area, a clean updated kitchen, and washer/dryer. It's location is top notch. It is a stones throw to Seaworld, but set well away from the busy street area. We could see Kraken(rollercoaster) from our patio. It is also only a 5 minute ride to Disney. It is a quick on and off the highway and suprisingly close. I think it was only one exit down from the Disney Buena Vista exit on Rte 4. It also has a great little market/deli inside that had everything we needed. They cooked up eggs, bacon, waffles every morning, but also sold milk, juice, poptarts, donuts, etc. for quick bites to get out quick to the parks. Everyone is very friendly. We had a bit of a problem at check in and to be honest, it took way too long to correct, but we still will give this property five stars.

Reviews.Title: “great location, well thought out units, we all had fun”
Reviews.Author: mom1960
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here with a 15 and 19 year old and had a great time. The location couldn't be better with great access to the Convention Center (where my husband was attending a trade show), the theme parks, (where we all relived our childhoods) and the shopping (a necessity with teenaged daughters in tow). Great weather permitted us lots of pool time and the well equipped, well thought out unit provided us with enough space and privacy that we didn't get on each other's nerves! With special dietary needs, I particularly appreciated the kitchen and access to a well supplied on-site general store where prices weren't as high as I had anticipated. Several grocery stores nearby fulfilled most of our grocery needs. The on-site pool side cafe provided us with one mediocre meal - I would't recommend it for another. All in all, we were pleased and would defintitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back tonight and I have to say that I was shocked at how nice the resort was -and I do not stay in anything less than four stars. We usually stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress, but my friend had the Hilton for a week and invited us to visit her while she was there. It was VERY clean and seemed new even though the woman at the front desk told me the units were 12 years old. The pool area is beautiful and the staff is very polite. I will definitely be going back. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Don't fall for the scam!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyUS
Reviews.Content: "Won" a three night/four day stay here for me and wife and felt like a real loser. Don't fall for their scam! The place was awful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe what they say... It could cost you.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and a couple of friends stayed at the HGVC @ Sea World in October 2004. As a club member I booked 2 separate reservations in a 2 bedroom villa with my remaining 2004 club points for 4 days and used open season for 3 additional days. Due to the fact that I had two reservations, I asked the customer service manger if we could remain in the same villa for all seven days of our trip. He said it was no problem. On the day my first reservation ended and my new one started, the front desk told me that I had to change villas. Even though we were told we did not have to move, they couldn’t accomodate us and we ended up having to pack up and move. With all the confusion of packing, moving and trying to make it to a park, I left my wife’s $1000 watch in the safe. I figured housekeeping would’ve found it and report it to the front desk or security. After a full blown investigation, the watch was never recovered. Somewhere a housekeeper or security personnel for Hilton is sporting my wife's $1000 watch. Due to this incident I have thought about selling my timeshare but I wouldn’t get as much as I paid. I'm hoping for a better experience at another HGVC resort. Stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: JanetWanet
Reviews.Content: Because of two hurricanes in 3 weeks, we had to rebook our trip three times. This was where we finally ended up. We were very happy with the room. We had a one bedroom villa with a whirlpool tub, washer/dryer and full kitchen. The decor was very nice. Everything looked to be in very good condition, practically new. The bathroom was large with a glass-doored shower, and the whirlpool tub was set apart in an alcove off of the bedroom. It was absolutely huge. We did have an issue with the TV in the bedroom, but the management brought a new TV right away, although we still had a problem with the new one. But we didn't feel like bothering to have someone else up. We didn't pay for housekeeping, but someone came everyday and straightened up and did our dishes and gave us new coffee and laundry supplies. So, on an otherwise hectic schedule, that little bit of housekeeping was much appreciated. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. The pools were beautiful, however they are doing a bit of work on the cabanas. Lots of ammenities, like a theatre, children's activities and tennis/basketball courts. There is also a spa. We weren't at the resort a lot, but would never be bored if we were unfortunate enough to have had a rainy week. The only real downer of the room was that it was in the very last building on the property. The view out our window wasn't the nicest -- we were looking at the trucks and gravel and maintenance equipment. But one neat thing was that you could see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom way in the distance. We booked last minute. Any other building has much more beautiful views and plantings around it. This is considered a time-share property and we did get a sales call, but they were very nice and not pushy. Just tell them you aren't interested and they will leave you alone. I was very happy with our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: patior
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Orlando. Rooms were clean and roomy. We had a 2 bedroom and had plenty of space for everyone. Pools were good, plenty of activities going on for kids. Also had a nice bar and restaurant, food was good and prices were good too. Happy Hour was 4-6 every night. Good location as well, right near Seaword and Discovery Cove, both wonderful places to visit. We had a great week there and would stay again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids and adults!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at HGVC Sea World. Our room was great and right next to the pools. We slept great everynight. The activities they have for the kids are wonderful and my children loved them. Would recommend very highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Steven58Princeton_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in 2002, twice. I had found a great deal on a rental. The place is beautiful. I don't understand the other reviews, but as for me, I can say that it was definitely a well run upscale, 5 star resort. You can try it without reservation (no pun intended!)

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Grand Vacations at SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 6924 Grand Vacations Way, Orlando, FL 32821
